translation.en: We want to encourage a world  of creators, of inventors, of contributors,  because this world that we live in,  this interactive world, is ours.
translation.zh: 我们想鼓励一个 人人都是创造者、发明家、贡献者的世界。 因为我们所生活的这个世界， 这个交互的世界，属于我们每个人。

translation.en: So go ahead and start inventing.
translation.zh: 不要犹豫，开始你的发明吧。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家。

translation.en: Today I'm going to talk  about unexpected discoveries.
translation.zh: 今天，我要谈一谈 一些出人意料的发现

translation.en: Now I work in the solar technology industry.
translation.zh: 现在我在太阳能技术产业工作

translation.en: And my small startup  is looking to force ourselves  into the environment  by paying attention to ...
translation.zh: 我那间小小的公司刚刚创办 正在寻求迫使我们 融入自然的方法 这要通过关注...

translation.en: ... paying attention to crowd-sourcing.
translation.zh: 关注众包来实现

translation.en: It's just a quick video  of what we do.
translation.zh: 这段小视频 展示了我们所做的工作

translation.en: Huh. Hang on a moment.
translation.zh: 哈，等一下

translation.en: It might take a moment to load.
translation.zh: 加载视频需要点时间

translation.en: We'll just -- we can just skip --  I'll just skip through the video instead ...
translation.zh: 也许我们可以跳过-- 我会跳过视频...

translation.en: No.
translation.zh: 不要啊

translation.en: This is not ...
translation.zh: 这不是...

translation.en: Okay.
translation.zh: 好吧

translation.en: Solar technology is ...
translation.zh: 太阳能技术是...

translation.en: Oh, that's all my time?
translation.zh: 不会吧，我的时间已经到了？

translation.en: Okay. Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 好吧，非常感谢

translation.en: So a couple of years ago I started a program  to try to get the rockstar tech and design people  and work in the one environment  that represents pretty much everything they're supposed to hate;  we have them work in government.
translation.zh: 几年前，我启动了一个 让一些厉害的搞技术和设计的人员们 在一个应该代表 他们所憎恨的一切的环境 - 政府部门 - 内工作一年的项目。

translation.en: The program is called Code for America,  and it's a little bit like a Peace Corps for geeks.
translation.zh: 这个项目叫做 “美国代码”， 有点像怪杰的和平队。

translation.en: We select a few fellows every year  and we have them work with city governments.
translation.zh: 我们每年筛选几个人， 然后让他们为政府工作。

translation.en: Instead of sending them off into the Third World,  we send them into the wilds of City Hall.
translation.zh: 不将他们送入第三世界， 但将他们送入市政府厅。

translation.en: And there they make great apps, they work with city staffers.
translation.zh: 在那里，他们创造很好的应用程序，并与市政府人员一起工作。

translation.en: But really what they're doing is they're showing what's possible  with technology today.
translation.zh: 但他们真正的目的是展现今天科技 可以创造的可能性。

translation.en: So meet Al.
translation.zh: 这是Al。

translation.en: Al is a fire hydrant in the city of Boston.
translation.zh: Al是一个伯斯顿市内的消防栓。

translation.en: Here it kind of looks like he's looking for a date,  but what he's really looking for is for someone to shovel him out when he gets snowed in,  because he knows he's not very good at fighting fires  when he's covered in four feet of snow.
translation.zh: 这里看起来它似乎是在等它的约会， 但它真正等待的是一个可以将它被深埋在雪下的时候可以将它挖出来的人， 因为它知道当它被四英尺的雪埋入时， 它救火的能力就会下降。

translation.en: Now how did he come to be looking for help  in this very unique manner?
translation.zh: 它是如何用这样一种特殊的方式 来寻求帮助的呢？

translation.en: We had a team of fellows in Boston last year  through the Code for America program.
translation.zh: 去年我们“美国代码” 有个在伯斯顿工作的团队。

translation.en: They were there in February, and it snowed a lot in February last year.
translation.zh: 他们在的时候正值二月，而去年二月雪下得很多很大。

translation.en: And they noticed that the city never gets  to digging out these fire hydrants.
translation.zh: 他们注意到这个城市的 消防栓很少会被挖出。

translation.en: But one fellow in particular,  a guy named Erik Michaels-Ober,  noticed something else,  and that's that citizens are shoveling out sidewalks  right in front of these things.
translation.zh: 那个团队的其中一个人， 叫Erik Michaels-Ober， 留意到了另外一个现象： 市民们会将这些消防栓 前面的走道上的雪铲除。

translation.en: So he did what any good developer would do,  he wrote an app.
translation.zh: 所以他做了任何一个优秀的程序员都会做的事情， 他写了一个应用程序。

translation.en: It's a cute little app where you can adopt a fire hydrant.
translation.zh: 这是一个可以让你领养一个消防栓的可爱简易的程序。

translation.en: So you agree to dig it out when it snows.
translation.zh: 然后你同意会在下雪后将它挖出。

translation.en: If you do, you get to name it,  and he called the first one Al.
translation.zh: 如果你这么做了，你可以为它取个名字； 他叫了这第一个Al。

translation.en: And if you don't, someone can steal it from you.
translation.zh: 但如果你不将它挖出，其他人可以将它从你那儿偷走。

translation.en: So it's got cute little game dynamics on it.
translation.zh: 所以它有一些小小的娱乐性质在里面。

translation.en: This is a modest little app.
translation.zh: 这是一个相对来说比较小的程序，

translation.en: It's probably the smallest  of the 21 apps that the fellows wrote last year.
translation.zh: 它或许是那个团队那年 所写的二十一个程序中最小的一个。

translation.en: But it's doing something  that no other government technology does.
translation.zh: 但它做到了 任何其他政府科技无法做到的事情；

translation.en: It's spreading virally.
translation.zh: 它像病毒一样传开了。

translation.en: There's a guy in the I.T. department of the City of Honolulu  who saw this app and realized  that he could use it, not for snow,  but to get citizens to adopt tsunami sirens.
translation.zh: 一个在夏威夷檀香山市的IT部门上班的人 看到了这个程序，然后意识到 它不一定要用它来铲雪， 也可以用它让市民领养海啸警报器。

translation.en: It's very important that these tsunami sirens work,  but people steal the batteries out of them.
translation.zh: 这些海啸警报器的功能很重要， 但往往有人会偷那里面的电池。

translation.en: So he's getting citizens to check on them.
translation.zh: 所以他让市民们主动去检查它们。

translation.en: And then Seattle decided to use it  to get citizens to clear out clogged storm drains.
translation.zh: 然后西雅图决定用它 让市民清理暴雨后杜塞的下水道口。

translation.en: And Chicago just rolled it out  to get people to sign up to shovel sidewalks when it snows.
translation.zh: 芝加哥才开始 用它让人们将走道上的雪铲除。

translation.en: So we now know of nine cities  that are planning to use this.
translation.zh: 我们现在知道还有九个城市 计划使用它。

translation.en: And this has spread just frictionlessly,  organically, naturally.
translation.zh: 它就这样平稳地，有机地，自然地， 散布了开来。

translation.en: If you know anything about government technology,  you know that this isn't how it normally goes.
translation.zh: 如果你对政府的科技有些了解， 你会知道这并不是普遍的结果。

translation.en: Procuring software usually takes a couple of years.
translation.zh: 开发完成一个软件往往需要几年。

translation.en: We had a team that worked on a project in Boston last year  that took three people about two and a half months.
translation.zh: 去年我们在伯斯顿有一个 三个人的团队花了两个半月完成了一个项目。

translation.en: It was a way that parents could figure out  which were the right public schools for their kids.
translation.zh: 它可以帮助家长决定 哪一个公立学校对他们的孩子最适合。

translation.en: We were told afterward that if that had gone through normal channels,  it would have taken at least two years  and it would have cost about two million dollars.
translation.zh: 之后，我们被告知，如果这个项目通过正常的渠道， 它将需要至少两年的时间， 并会花费将近两百万美元左右。

translation.en: And that's nothing.
translation.zh: 而这只是一个小数字。

translation.en: There is one project in the California court system right now  that so far cost taxpayers  two billion dollars,  and it doesn't work.
translation.zh: 加利福尼亚的法院系统正有一个 至今花费了纳税人 二十亿美元的一个项目， 而它还并不能正常运作。

translation.en: And there are projects like this  at every level of government.
translation.zh: 而在政府的每一个阶级 都有类似的种种项目。

translation.en: So an app that takes a couple of days to write  and then spreads virally, that's sort of a shot across the bow  to the institution of government.
translation.zh: 所以一个只需要几天来编程， 并像病毒般散布的程序， 对政府机构来说 是一个警钟。

translation.en: It suggests how government could work better --  not more like a private company,  as many people think it should.
translation.zh: 它见证了政府可以变得更有效率 - 但不是更像私有公司， 像很多人觉得的那样。

translation.en: And not even like a tech company,  but more like the Internet itself.
translation.zh: 甚至不像一个科技公司， 而更像网络本身。

translation.en: And that means permissionless,  it means open, it means generative.
translation.zh: 这意味着无须批准， 公开，多产。

translation.en: And that's important.
translation.zh: 而这非常重要。

translation.en: But what's more important about this app  is that it represents how a new generation  is tackling the problem of government --  not as the problem of an ossified institution,  but as a problem of collective action.
translation.zh: 但这种程序所代表的，更重要的， 是新一代的人 将政府的问题 当作团体行动的问题来寻求解决方式， 而并不是一个死板的机构。

translation.en: And that's great news,  because, it turns out, we're very good at collective action  with digital technology.
translation.zh: 而这是很好的信息， 因为，事实表明，我们在对于数码技术 的团体运行非常擅长。

translation.en: Now there's a very large community of people  that are building the tools that we need  to do things together effectively.
translation.zh: 现在已经有一个非常大的团体 在建造可以让我们做事 更加有效率的工具。

translation.en: It's not just Code for America fellows,  there are hundreds of people all over the country  that are standing and writing civic apps  every day in their own communities.
translation.zh: 它不仅仅是“美国代码”的员工们， 全国有几百个人 每天在自己的社区中编写程序 并将其致用在他们自己的社区。

translation.en: They haven't given up on government.
translation.zh: 他们没有放弃政府。

translation.en: They are frustrated as hell with it,  but they're not complaining about it,  they're fixing it.
translation.zh: 虽然他们对此非常失望， 但他们并没有抱怨， 而在尝试着改善它。

translation.en: And these folks know something  that we've lost sight of.
translation.zh: 这些人知道一些 我们已经失去的东西，

translation.en: And that's that when you strip away all your feelings  about politics and the line at the DMV  and all those other things  that we're really mad about,  government is, at its core,  in the words of Tim O'Reilly,  "What we do together that we can't do alone."
translation.zh: 那就是，当你剥开一切 让我们愤怒的外壳， 比如我们对政治的感觉， 和在车辆管理局外的长队， 政府，在其中心， 用提姆·奥莱理的话说， “政府能帮我们达成我们一个人无法达成的事情。”

translation.en: Now a lot of people have given up on government.
translation.zh: 现在有很多人都对政府完全灰了心。

translation.en: And if you're one of those people,  I would ask that you reconsider,  because things are changing.
translation.zh: 如果你是他们其中的一个， 我希望你能重新考虑下， 因为很多事情都在改变。

translation.en: Politics is not changing;  government is changing.
translation.zh: 政治没有改变， 但政府正在改变。

translation.en: And because government  ultimately derives its power from us --  remember "We the people?" --  how we think about it  is going to effect how that change happens.
translation.zh: 而因为政府的能量， 从最根本上 来自于我们人民， 我们如何看待它 将会影响到它的改变。

translation.en: Now I didn't know very much about government when I started this program.
translation.zh: 当我开始这个项目的时候我对政府所知不多。

translation.en: And like a lot of people,  I thought government was basically about getting people elected to office.
translation.zh: 就像很多人， 我以为政府仅仅是选举人员进入部门工作。

translation.en: Well after two years, I've come to the conclusion  that, especially local government,  is about opossums.
translation.zh: 两年后，我得到了一个结论。 政府，特别是地方政府， 是关于负鼠.

translation.en: This is the call center for the services and information line.
translation.zh: 这里是服务和信息的电话热线中心。

translation.en: It's generally where you will get  if you call 311 in your city.
translation.zh: 如果你在你的城市拨打311， 你将会被连接到这里。

translation.en: If you should ever have the chance  to staff your city's call center,  as our fellow Scott Silverman did as part of the program --  in fact, they all do that --  you will find that people call government  with a very wide range of issues,  including having an opossum stuck in your house.
translation.zh: 如果你会有机会 在你的市热线中心工作， 像我们项目的同事Scott Silverman就做这个 - 事实上，他们都需要做这项服务 - 你就会发现人们为了非常不同的问题 打电话给政府咨询， 包括家中困入了一个负鼠。

translation.en: So Scott gets this call.
translation.zh: Scott 接到了这通电话。

translation.en: He types "Opossum" into this official knowledge base.
translation.zh: 他将“负鼠”输入了官方的信息库。

translation.en: He doesn't really come up with anything. He starts with animal control.
translation.zh: 什么都没有。他从动物控制中心开始。

translation.en: And finally, he says, "Look, can you just open all the doors to your house  and play music really loud  and see if the thing leaves?"
translation.zh: 而最后，他说：“这样吧，你可以将你家的门全部打开， 然后放起很大声的音乐， 然后看看这东西会不会离开？”

translation.en: So that worked. So booya for Scott.
translation.zh: 而这起了作用。 Scott，好样的。

translation.en: But that wasn't the end of the opossums.
translation.zh: 但这并不是负鼠故事的结尾。

translation.en: Boston doesn't just have a call center.
translation.zh: 波斯顿没有热线中心。

translation.en: It has an app, a Web and mobile app,  called Citizens Connect.
translation.zh: 它有一个程序，一个网站和移动的程序， 叫做 “市民联通”。

translation.en: Now we didn't write this app.
translation.zh: 我们没有编写这个程序。

translation.en: This is the work of the very smart people  at the Office of New Urban Mechanics in Boston.
translation.zh: 它是一群在波斯顿的 新城市结构部门的很聪明的人编写的。

translation.en: So one day -- this is an actual report -- this came in:  "Opossum in my trashcan. Can't tell if it's dead.
translation.zh: 有一天 - 这是一个真实的报告 - 这个信息被贴了出来： “垃圾桶里有一个负鼠。看不出来它是否死了。

translation.en: How do I get this removed?"
translation.zh: 我怎样才能把它弄掉？”

translation.en: But what happens with Citizens Connect is different.
translation.zh: “市民联通”对这种问题有不同的处理方式。

translation.en: So Scott was speaking person-to-person.
translation.zh: Scott之前是人对人的交流。

translation.en: But on Citizens Connect everything is public,  so everybody can see this.
translation.zh: 但在“市民联通”上面一切都是公开的， 所以每个人都可以看见。

translation.en: And in this case, a neighbor saw it.
translation.zh: 这一次，一个邻居看到了。

translation.en: And the next report we got said,  "I walked over to this location,  found the trashcan behind the house.
translation.zh: 我们收到的下一份报告写着： “我路过了这个地点， 找到了房子后面的垃圾桶。

translation.en: Opossum? Check. Living? Yep.
translation.zh: 负鼠? 看到了。的确活着。

translation.en: Turned trashcan on its side. Walked home.
translation.zh: 将垃圾桶放倒，走回家。

translation.en: Goodnight sweet opossum."
translation.zh: 晚安，小负鼠。”

translation.en: Pretty simple.
translation.zh: 就这么简单。

translation.en: So this is great. This is the digital meeting the physical.
translation.zh: 所以这很好。这就是现实和数码世界的交汇。

translation.en: And it's also a great example  of government getting in on the crowd-sourcing game.
translation.zh: 这也是政府加入 众包游戏的一个很好的例子。

translation.en: But it's also a great example of government as a platform.
translation.zh: 但这也是一个由政府来做交流平台的很好的例子。

translation.en: And I don't mean necessarily  a technological definition of platform here.
translation.zh: 而在这里我并不是 在说平台的技术层面的定义。

translation.en: I'm just talking about a platform for people  to help themselves and to help others.
translation.zh: 我只是想提到一个可以让 人们互相帮助的平台。

translation.en: So one citizen helped another citizen,  but government played a key role here.
translation.zh: 一个公民帮助另外一个公民， 而政府在其中扮演重要的角色。

translation.en: It connected those two people.
translation.zh: 它将两个人连系了起来。

translation.en: And it could have connected them with government services if they'd been needed,  but a neighbor is a far better and cheaper alternative  to government services.
translation.zh: 它可以通过政府设施服务来帮助需要的人， 但一个邻居远比政府服务 简单和见效。

translation.en: When one neighbor helps another,  we strengthen our communities.
translation.zh: 当一个邻居帮助另外一个的时候， 我们的社会联系也会加强。

translation.en: We call animal control, it just costs a lot of money.
translation.zh: 我们打电话给动物控制中心的话，只会花很多的钱。

translation.en: Now one of the important things we need to think about government  is that it's not the same thing as politics.
translation.zh: 一个我们需要思考的很重要的事情 便是政府并不同于政治。

translation.en: And most people get that,  but they think that one is the input to the other.
translation.zh: 很多人明白这点， 但他们仍然认为政治是政府的输入口。

translation.en: That our input to the system of government  is voting.
translation.zh: 我们对政府系统的输入口是 通过选票。

translation.en: Now how many times have we elected a political leader --  and sometimes we spend a lot of energy  getting a new political leader elected --  and then we sit back and we expect government  to reflect our values and meet our needs,  and then not that much changes?
translation.zh: 至今为止，我们选了多少政治领袖 - 而有些时候我们会花大量的精力 来支持一个新的政治领袖的选举 - 然后我们期望着政府做一些 反映我们价值观和我们的需要的事情， 但最后没有多少改变发生？

translation.en: That's because government is like a vast ocean  and politics is the six-inch layer on top.
translation.zh: 那是因为政府就像一片巨大的海洋， 而政治只是最顶上的一层。

translation.en: And what's under that  is what we call bureaucracy.
translation.zh: 下面的便是 我们所谓的官僚机构。

translation.en: And we say that word with such contempt.
translation.zh: 我们用如此鄙夷的语气谈论这个词。

translation.en: But it's that contempt  that keeps this thing that we own  and we pay for  as something that's working against us, this other thing,  and then we're disempowering ourselves.
translation.zh: 但正是这种鄙夷 保持了这个我们拥有 并为其付钱维持的东西 一直与我们的愿望背道而驰， 而由此我们正失去我们自己的能量。

translation.en: People seem to think politics is sexy.
translation.zh: 人们似乎认为政治很性感。

translation.en: If we want this institution to work for us,  we're going to have to make bureaucracy sexy.
translation.zh: 如果我们希望这个部门来为我们服务， 我们必须要让官僚机构也变得性感。

translation.en: Because that's where the real work of government happens.
translation.zh: 因为政府的真正工作在那里发生。

translation.en: We have to engage with the machinery of government.
translation.zh: 我们必须参与政府的系统。

translation.en: So that's OccupytheSEC movement has done.
translation.zh: 而这正是占领美国证券交易委员会运动做的。

translation.en: Have you seen these guys?
translation.zh: 你见过这些人吗？

translation.en: It's a group of concerned citizens  that have written a very detailed  325-page report  that's a response to the SEC's request for comment  on the Financial Reform Bill.
translation.zh: 他们是一群忧心忡忡的公民 他们写了一份非常详细的， 325页的报告 来回应美国证券交易委员会SEC 对于金融改革法案的要求。

translation.en: That's not being politically active,  that's being bureaucratically active.
translation.zh: 这不是参与政治， 而是积极参与到官僚机构中。

translation.en: Now for those of us who've given up on government,  it's time that we asked ourselves  about the world that we want to leave for our children.
translation.zh: 现在，对于我们之间的已经放弃了政府的人， 是时候问我们自己 我们希望留下怎样的世界给我们的孩子。

translation.en: You have to see the enormous challenges  that they're going to face.
translation.zh: 大家必须意识到他们需要 面对巨大的挑战。

translation.en: Do we really think we're going to get where we need to go  without fixing the one institution  that can act on behalf of all of us?
translation.zh: 在我们没有改善好这个可以 代表我们行动的机构之前， 我们真的认为我们可以达到我们想要达到的目标吗？

translation.en: We can't do without government,  but we do need it  to be more effective.
translation.zh: 我们不能没有政府， 我们需要它 变得更有效率。

translation.en: The good news is that technology is making it possible  to fundamentally reframe  the function of government  in a way that can actually scale  by strengthening civil society.
translation.zh: 好的消息是，科技正使这变得可行 在本质上重新定义 政府的功能 而通过它我们可以 来加强我们的公民社会。

translation.en: And there's a generation out there that's grown up on the Internet,  and they know that it's not that hard  to do things together,  you just have to architect the systems the right way.
translation.zh: 现在的一代正在网络中长大， 而他们知道 同时做一件事情并不难， 只需要将系统建构好。

translation.en: Now the average age of our fellows is 28,  so I am, begrudgingly,  almost a generation older than most of them.
translation.zh: 我们的工作人员的平均年龄是28岁， 所以我，很不甘的， 几乎比他们大部分老了一代。

translation.en: This is a generation  that's grown up taking their voices pretty much for granted.
translation.zh: 这一代 在长大中已经习惯代言他们自身。

translation.en: They're not fighting that battle that we're all fighting  about who gets to speak;  they all get to speak.
translation.zh: 他们不再需要经历我们那一代关于 谁可以拥有言论自由的战斗； 他们都拥有言论自由。

translation.en: They can express their opinion  on any channel at any time,  and they do.
translation.zh: 他们可以通过任何渠道 在任何时间表达他们的意见， 他们也的确这么做。

translation.en: So when they're faced with the problem of government,  they don't care as much  about using their voices.
translation.zh: 所以当他们面对政府的瑕疵时， 他们不怎么关心 用他们的话语权来代言。

translation.en: They're using their hands.
translation.zh: 他们会使用他们的双手。

translation.en: They're using their hands  to write applications that make government work better.
translation.zh: 他们正在使用他们的双手 来编写可以让政府更好地运作的程序。

translation.en: And those applications let us use our hands  to make our communities better.
translation.zh: 而这些程序让我们用我们自己的双手 来完善我们的社会。

translation.en: That could be shoveling out a hydrant, pulling a weed,  turning over a garbage can with an opossum in it.
translation.zh: 它可以是将消防栓从雪中挖出，将杂草拔除， 或将有负鼠的垃圾桶放倒。

translation.en: And certainly, we could have been shoveling out those fire hydrants all along,  and many people do.
translation.zh: 当然，很多人早就开始将消防栓 从雪中挖出了。

translation.en: But these apps are like little digital reminders  that we're not just consumers,  and we're not just consumers of government,  putting in our taxes and getting back services.
translation.zh: 但这些程序就如同小数字闹钟，可以提醒 我们不光是作为消费者。 我们也不仅仅是政府的消费对象， 缴税而换回服务。

translation.en: We're more than that,  we're citizens.
translation.zh: 我们不光是这些， 我们还是公民。

translation.en: And we're not going to fix government  until we fix citizenship.
translation.zh: 在改善政府之前， 我们必须承担我们作为公民的责任。

translation.en: So the question I have for all of you here:  When it comes to the big, important things  that we need to do together,  all of us together,  are we just going to be a crowd of voices,  or are we also going to be  a crowd of hands?
translation.zh: 所以在这里我留给大家一个问题： 当我们面对一些很大的，很重要的， 并需要我们齐心协力一起做 事情的时候， 我们会只是有话语权的一群人， 还是我们 也会是众手协力而成事的一群人？

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: Well this is a really extraordinary honor for me.
translation.zh: 很荣幸来到这里

translation.en: I spend most of my time  in jails, in prisons, on death row.
translation.zh: 我大多数时候都 在管教所，在监狱里，在死囚室中

translation.en: I spend most of my time in very low-income communities  in the projects and places where there's a great deal of hopelessness.
translation.zh: 大部分时间我在低收入的社区里工作 在充满绝望的地区，做前途暗淡的项目

translation.en: And being here at TED  and seeing the stimulation, hearing it,  has been very, very energizing to me.
translation.zh: 今天来到TED 看到听到这些激动人心的演讲 给了我一针强心剂

translation.en: And one of the things that's emerged in my short time here  is that TED has an identity.
translation.zh: 在这短短的时间里，我注意到 TED有自己的定位

translation.en: And you can actually say things here  that have impacts around the world.
translation.zh: 你可以看到这里发生的事情 影响全世界

translation.en: And sometimes when it comes through TED,  it has meaning and power  that it doesn't have when it doesn't.
translation.zh: 有时当事情发生在TED的讲台上 比发生在别处 更有意义，更有影响

translation.en: And I mention that because I think identity is really important.
translation.zh: 我提起这个是因为我觉得自我定位很重要

translation.en: And we've had some fantastic presentations.
translation.zh: 我们已经听了一些精彩的演说

translation.en: And I think what we've learned  is that, if you're a teacher your words can be meaningful,  but if you're a compassionate teacher,  they can be especially meaningful.
translation.zh: 我们已经体会到 作为一个老师，你的话是有影响力的 如果你是个很慈善的老师 你的教导就格外意味深长

translation.en: If you're a doctor you can do some good things,  but if you're a caring doctor you can do some other things.
translation.zh: 作为一个医生，你能够帮助人 如果你是个体恤病人的医生，你能帮助更多

translation.en: And so I want to talk about the power of identity.
translation.zh: 所以我想讲讲定位的重要性

translation.en: And I didn't learn about this actually  practicing law and doing the work that I do.
translation.zh: 我不是从做律师 或者做其他项目学到怎样自我定位的

translation.en: I actually learned about this from my grandmother.
translation.zh: 我其实是从我外婆那里学到的

translation.en: I grew up in a house  that was the traditional African-American home  that was dominated by a matriarch,  and that matriarch was my grandmother.
translation.zh: 我的家庭 是一个传统的黑人家庭 只有一个女家长 就是我的外婆

translation.en: She was tough, she was strong,  she was powerful.
translation.zh: 她很坚韧， 也很强壮 威风凛凛

translation.en: She was the end of every argument in our family.
translation.zh: 家里有争执，她有决定权

translation.en: She was the beginning of a lot of arguments in our family.
translation.zh: 不过很多事儿也是她挑起来的

translation.en: She was the daughter of people who were actually enslaved.
translation.zh: 她的父母曾是真正的黑奴

translation.en: Her parents were born in slavery in Virginia in the 1840's.
translation.zh: 弗吉尼亚州19世纪40年代，她父母落草为奴

translation.en: She was born in the 1880's  and the experience of slavery  very much shaped the way she saw the world.
translation.zh: 我外婆是十九世纪八十年代生的 这段父母被奴役的经历 决定了她看世界的角度

translation.en: And my grandmother was tough, but she was also loving.
translation.zh: 我的外婆很强势，但她也很慈爱

translation.en: When I would see her as a little boy,  she'd come up to me and she'd give me these hugs.
translation.zh: 当我是个小男孩时 每次见到她都拥抱我

translation.en: And she'd squeeze me so tight I could barely breathe  and then she'd let me go.
translation.zh: 她抱得那么紧，我都透不过气来 然后她才会放开我

translation.en: And an hour or two later, if I saw her,  she'd come over to me and she'd say, "Bryan, do you still feel me hugging you?"
translation.zh: 一两个小时之后，当我再见她 她会过来问我：“还能感觉我的拥抱么？”

translation.en: And if I said, "No," she'd assault me again,  and if I said, "Yes," she'd leave me alone.
translation.zh: 如果我说“感觉不到了”，她就再度出击 直到我说“感觉得到”，她才放开我

translation.en: And she just had this quality  that you always wanted to be near her.
translation.zh: 她就是有这个能力 让你老是想亲近她

translation.en: And the only challenge was that she had 10 children.
translation.zh: 唯一的挑战是她有十个儿女

translation.en: My mom was the youngest of her 10 kids.
translation.zh: 我妈妈是十个里最年轻的

translation.en: And sometimes when I would go and spend time with her,  it would be difficult to get her time and attention.
translation.zh: 常常当我去和外婆亲近时 很难让她注意到我，有时间陪我

translation.en: My cousins would be running around everywhere.
translation.zh: 我的表兄妹们总是无处不在

translation.en: And I remember, when I was about eight or nine years old,  waking up one morning, going into the living room,  and all of my cousins were running around.
translation.zh: 我记得，当我八九岁时的一次 我早上醒来，跑到客厅 所有的表兄妹都在

translation.en: And my grandmother was sitting across the room  staring at me.
translation.zh: 我外婆坐在房间的另一端 盯着我看

translation.en: And at first I thought we were playing a game.
translation.zh: 一开始我以为我们在玩游戏

translation.en: And I would look at her and I'd smile,  but she was very serious.
translation.zh: 我就看回去，对她笑笑 但我外婆是很严肃的

translation.en: And after about 15 or 20 minutes of this,  she got up and she came across the room  and she took me by the hand  and she said, "Come on, Bryan. You and I are going to have a talk."
translation.zh: 大概十五还是二十分钟之后 她站起来，穿过房间 牵住我的手 对我说：“过来，布莱恩，我们得谈谈。”

translation.en: And I remember this just like it happened yesterday.
translation.zh: 这就像是昨天才发生的一样

translation.en: I never will forget it.
translation.zh: 我永远忘不掉

translation.en: She took me out back and she said, "Bryan, I'm going to tell you something,  but you don't tell anybody what I tell you."
translation.zh: 她把我带到一边说：“我想和你说些事， 你不许和任何人说。”

translation.en: I said, "Okay, Mama."
translation.zh: 我答应了：“好的，姥姥。”

translation.en: She said, "Now you make sure you don't do that." I said, "Sure."
translation.zh: 她说：“保证绝不说出去。”我回答：“保证。”

translation.en: Then she sat me down and she looked at me  and she said, "I want you to know  I've been watching you."
translation.zh: 然后我们坐下，她看着我 说：“我想让你知道 我观察你一段时间了。”

translation.en: And she said, "I think you're special."
translation.zh: 接着她说：“你是个特别的孩子。”

translation.en: She said, "I think you can do anything you want to do."
translation.zh: 她说：“我确信你是无所不能的。”

translation.en: I will never forget it.
translation.zh: 这我永远不会忘记

translation.en: And then she said, "I just need you to promise me three things, Bryan."
translation.zh: 接着她说：“我想让你向我保证三件事。”

translation.en: I said, "Okay, Mama."
translation.zh: 我说：“好的姥姥。”

translation.en: She said, "The first thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll always love your mom."
translation.zh: 她说：“第一，我想让你保证 你会永远爱你的妈妈。”

translation.en: She said, "That's my baby girl,  and you have to promise me now you'll always take care of her."
translation.zh: 她说：“你妈妈是我的心头肉， 你得向我保证你会永远爱护她。”

translation.en: Well I adored my mom, so I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
translation.zh: 我很爱我妈妈，我说：“好，姥姥，我会。”

translation.en: Then she said, "The second thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll always do the right thing  even when the right thing is the hard thing."
translation.zh: 接着她说：“第二件事，是你要答应我 你会永远走正路 即使走正路是很难的选择。”

translation.en: And I thought about it and I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
translation.zh: 我想了想回答：“好的姥姥，我会的。”

translation.en: Then finally she said, "The third thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll never drink alcohol."
translation.zh: 最后她说：“第三件事，我要你保证 你永不喝酒。”

translation.en: Well I was nine years old, so I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
translation.zh: 我才九岁，我答应：“好，姥姥，我保证。”

translation.en: I grew up in the country in the rural South,  and I have a brother a year older than me and a sister a year younger.
translation.zh: 我在南部的乡下长大 我有个哥哥大我一岁，还有个妹妹小我一岁

translation.en: When I was about 14 or 15,  one day my brother came home and he had this six-pack of beer --  I don't know where he got it --  and he grabbed me and my sister and we went out in the woods.
translation.zh: 当我十四五岁时 一天我哥哥带回到家半打啤酒—— 我都不知道他怎么弄到的—— 他带上我和我妹妹，跑到树林里

translation.en: And we were kind of just out there doing the stuff we crazily did.
translation.zh: 一通疯玩疯跑

translation.en: And he had a sip of this beer and he gave some to my sister and she had some,  and they offered it to me.
translation.zh: 他喝了一口啤酒，递给我妹妹，她也喝了 然后他们递给了我

translation.en: I said, "No, no, no. That's okay. You all go ahead. I'm not going to have any beer."
translation.zh: 我说：“我不要。没事，你们喝。我不喝。”

translation.en: My brother said, "Come on. We're doing this today; you always do what we do.
translation.zh: 我哥哥说：“来嘛，我们今个儿都喝。你老是和我们一条阵线的。

translation.en: I had some, your sister had some. Have some beer."
translation.zh: 我喝了点，妹妹也喝了点，你来些。”

translation.en: I said, "No, I don't feel right about that. Y'all go ahead. Y'all go ahead."
translation.zh: 我说：“不，我不想喝。你们喝你们喝。”

translation.en: And then my brother started staring at me.
translation.zh: 我哥哥盯住我

translation.en: He said, "What's wrong with you? Have some beer."
translation.zh: 问：“你有什么毛病？喝一点。”

translation.en: Then he looked at me real hard and he said,  "Oh, I hope you're not still hung up  on that conversation Mama had with you."
translation.zh: 接着他细细打量了我一会，问我： “噢，你不会还想着 姥姥要你保证的事吧。”

translation.en: I said, "Well, what are you talking about?"
translation.zh: 我说：“你在说什么呀？”

translation.en: He said, "Oh, Mama tells all the grandkids that they're special."
translation.zh: 他说：“姥姥和每个外孙都说他很特别。”

translation.en: I was devastated.
translation.zh: 我这个伤心呀

translation.en: And I'm going to admit something to you.
translation.zh: 现在我想向大家坦白一件事

translation.en: I'm going to tell you something I probably shouldn't.
translation.zh: 可能不该在这里说

translation.en: I know this might be broadcast broadly.
translation.zh: 因为这个演讲是会到处播的

translation.en: But I'm 52 years old,  and I'm going to admit to you  that I've never had a drop of alcohol.
translation.zh: 我今年五十二了 我要向大家承认 我从来没有喝过一滴酒

translation.en: I don't say that because I think that's virtuous;  I say that because there is power in identity.
translation.zh: 这不是为了显派我多有道德 是为了说明自我定位的威力

translation.en: When we create the right kind of identity,  we can say things to the world around us  that they don't actually believe makes sense.
translation.zh: 当我们决定了正确的定位 我们就可以让全世界接受 他们本来想不到的事情

translation.en: We can get them to do things  that they don't think they can do.
translation.zh: 我们能让世界做 他们本来觉得做不到的事情

translation.en: When I thought about my grandmother,  of course she would think all her grandkids were special.
translation.zh: 当我想到我的外婆 她当然觉得每个外孙都很特别

translation.en: My grandfather was in prison during prohibition.
translation.zh: 我的外公因为违了禁在蹲监狱

translation.en: My male uncles died of alcohol-related diseases.
translation.zh: 我不止一个舅舅死与和酗酒有关的疾病

translation.en: And these were the things she thought we needed to commit to.
translation.zh: 这些原则都是我外婆相信我们应该坚持的

translation.en: Well I've been trying to say something  about our criminal justice system.
translation.zh: 我想向大家介绍的 是我们刑事执法系统

translation.en: than it was 40 years ago.
translation.zh: 和四十年前比 这个国家变了很多

translation.en: In 1972, there were 300,000 people in jails and prisons.
translation.zh: 在1972年，监狱里只有三十万人

translation.en: Today, there are 2.3 million.
translation.zh: 今天，有两百三十万

translation.en: The United States now has the highest rate of incarceration  We have seven million people on probation and parole.
translation.zh: 今天美国是世界上 服刑人口比例最高的国家 我们有七百万人在缓刑期和假释期

translation.en: And mass incarceration, in my judgment,  has fundamentally changed our world.
translation.zh: 在我看来，这样的大量判刑 完全改变了我们的世界

translation.en: In poor communities, in communities of color  there is this despair,  there is this hopelessness,  that is being shaped by these outcomes.
translation.zh: 在贫穷的社区里，在有色人种社区里 充满了绝望 这样的绝望 是由这些改变带来的

translation.en: One out of three black men  between the ages of 18 and 30  is in jail, in prison, on probation or parole.
translation.zh: 三分之一的黑人男性 十八岁到三十岁之间的 不是在监狱里，就是在缓刑期或者假释期

translation.en: In urban communities across this country --  Los Angeles, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington --  50 to 60 percent of all young men of color are  in jail or prison or on probation or parole.
translation.zh: 在全国各处的城市社区里—— 洛杉矶，费城，巴尔的摩，华盛顿—— 百分之五十到六十的有色人种的年轻人 不是在监狱里，就是在缓刑期或者假释期

translation.en: Our system isn't just being shaped  in these ways that seem to be distorting around race,  they're also distorted by poverty.
translation.zh: 我们的司法系统不仅是改变了 而是围绕着种族问题扭曲了 也围绕着贫困扭曲了

translation.en: We have a system of justice in this country  that treats you much better  if you're rich and guilty than if you're poor and innocent.
translation.zh: 这个国家的司法系统 会对你特殊照顾 如果你是有罪的富人而不是无辜的穷人的话

translation.en: Wealth, not culpability,  shapes outcomes.
translation.zh: 财富，而不是过失本身 决定了最终结果

translation.en: And yet, we seem to be very comfortable.
translation.zh: 可是，我们还挺自在的呢

translation.en: The politics of fear and anger  have made us believe  that these are problems that are not our problems.
translation.zh: 玩弄恐惧和愤怒的政治手腕 说服了我们 事不关己

translation.en: We've been disconnected.
translation.zh: 高高挂起

translation.en: It's interesting to me.
translation.zh: 我对这个很感兴趣

translation.en: We're looking at some very interesting developments in our work.
translation.zh: 我们日常工作能看一些很有意思的变革

translation.en: My state of Alabama, like a number of states,  if you have a criminal conviction.
translation.zh: 我所在的阿拉巴马州，像很多其他州一样 如果你被判有罪 就终身剥夺你的政治权力

translation.en: Right now in Alabama  34 percent of the black male population  has permanently lost the right to vote.
translation.zh: 现在在阿拉巴马州 百分之三十四的黑人男性 永远失去了投票权

translation.en: We're actually projecting in another 10 years  will be as high as it's been  since prior to the passage of the Voting Rights Act.
translation.zh: 我们向前看十年 这个剥夺政治权利的比例 将和投票权法案通过之前 一样的高

translation.en: And there is this stunning silence.
translation.zh: 可是没人提半个字

translation.en: I represent children.
translation.zh: 我代表孩子们上庭

translation.en: A lot of my clients are very young.
translation.zh: 很多我的被告都很年轻

translation.en: The United States is the only country in the world  where we sentence 13-year-old children  to die in prison.
translation.zh: 美国是世界上唯一能将 十三岁的孩子 判成终身监禁的国家

translation.en: We have life imprisonment without parole for kids in this country.
translation.zh: 我国对孩子判终身监禁，还不得假释

translation.en: And we're actually doing some litigation.
translation.zh: 我们其实现在就在帮这些人上诉

translation.en: The only country in the world.
translation.zh: 世界上独一份

translation.en: I represent people on death row.
translation.zh: 我也代理死刑犯的官司

translation.en: It's interesting, this question of the death penalty.
translation.zh: 死刑这件事很发人深省

translation.en: In many ways, we've been taught to think  that the real question is,  do people deserve to die for the crimes they've committed?
translation.zh: 我们从各种渠道了解到 根本问题是 人该不该为他们犯的罪行偿命

translation.en: And that's a very sensible question.
translation.zh: 这是个非常合理的问题

translation.en: But there's another way of thinking  about where we are in our identity.
translation.zh: 但是另一方面 问题是我们的自我定位

translation.en: The other way of thinking about it  is not, do people deserve to die for the crimes they commit,  but do we deserve to kill?
translation.zh: 另一个想问题的方式 不是人们该不该为罪行偿命 而是我们配不配杀他们

translation.en: I mean, it's fascinating.
translation.zh: 我是说，这个问题非常震撼

translation.en: Death penalty in America is defined by error.
translation.zh: 死刑在美国是常有差错的

translation.en: For every nine people who have been executed,  we've actually identified one innocent person  who's been exonerated and released from death row.
translation.zh: 每九个被判死刑的人 有一个后来会被证明无罪 被免死刑

translation.en: A kind of astonishing error rate --  one out of nine people innocent.
translation.zh: 这种错误率—— 九分之一的人完全无辜

translation.en: I mean, it's fascinating.
translation.zh: 我得说，非常震撼

translation.en: In aviation, we would never let people fly on airplanes  if for every nine planes that took off  one would crash.
translation.zh: 学航空的人知道，如果每九架飞机里 会有一架出事故 我们肯定是不会让这玩意儿载人飞的

translation.en: But somehow we can insulate ourselves from this problem.
translation.zh: 但是莫名其妙地我们就能忽视死刑的问题

translation.en: It's not our problem.
translation.zh: 因为这不是我们自身的问题

translation.en: It's not our burden.
translation.zh: 这不是我们自身的麻烦

translation.en: It's not our struggle.
translation.zh: 这不是我们自身的挣扎

translation.en: I talk a lot about these issues.
translation.zh: 我谈了很多问题

translation.en: I talk about race and this question  of whether we deserve to kill.
translation.zh: 种族，还有 我们配不配执行死刑

translation.en: And it's interesting, when I teach my students about African-American history,  I tell them about slavery.
translation.zh: 这很发人深省。当我教美国黑人历史的时候 我和学生讲奴隶制

translation.en: I tell them about terrorism,  the era that began at the end of reconstruction  that went on to World War II.
translation.zh: 和他们讲恐怖主义 那个始于大复兴晚期 一直到二战时期的时代

translation.en: We don't really know very much about it.
translation.zh: 我们并不真的了解那段历史

translation.en: But for African-Americans in this country,  that was an era defined by terror.
translation.zh: 但是对于这个国家的黑人来说 那是个白色恐怖时代

translation.en: In many communities, people had to worry about being lynched.
translation.zh: 在很多社区，人们害怕随时会被私刑处死

translation.en: They had to worry about being bombed.
translation.zh: 人们担心随时会被炸弹袭击

translation.en: It was the threat of terror that shaped their lives.
translation.zh: 那个白色恐怖时代，改变了他们的生活

translation.en: And these older people come up to me now  and they say, "Mr. Stevenson, you give talks, you make speeches,  you tell people to stop saying  we're dealing with terrorism for the first time in our nation's history  after 9/11."
translation.zh: 那时的人现在上了年纪，来和我说 “史蒂文森先生，你到处演讲 你得告诉大家 别说什么911以后是我们美国有史以来 第一次对付恐怖主义。”

translation.en: They tell me to say, "No, tell them that we grew up with that."
translation.zh: 他们让我说：“我们就是在恐怖里长大的。”

translation.en: And that era of terrorism, of course,  was followed by segregation  and decades of racial subordination  and apartheid.
translation.zh: 那个恐怖主义的时代，当然了 最后演变成了无法逾越的鸿沟 数十年的种族歧视 和种族隔离

translation.en: And yet, we have in this country this dynamic  where we really don't like to talk about our problems.
translation.zh: 然而，我们这个国家 不喜欢讨论存在的问题

translation.en: We don't like to talk about our history.
translation.zh: 我们不喜欢讨论历史

translation.en: And because of that, we really haven't understood  what it's meant to do the things we've done historically.
translation.zh: 正因如此，我们不能真正理解 我们有史以来做了什么

translation.en: We're constantly running into each other.
translation.zh: 我们不停地产生冲突

translation.en: We're constantly creating tensions and conflicts.
translation.zh: 不停地制造紧张气氛

translation.en: We have a hard time talking about race,  and I believe it's because we are unwilling to commit ourselves  to a process of truth and reconciliation.
translation.zh: 我们没法讨论种族问题 我相信是因为我们不愿意正视 一系列的事实，不愿意达成和解

translation.en: In South Africa, people understood  that we couldn't overcome apartheid  without a commitment to truth and reconciliation.
translation.zh: 在南非，人们知道 我们不能忘记种族隔离 除非我们诚实面对，达成和解

translation.en: In Rwanda, even after the genocide, there was this commitment,  but in this country we haven't done that.
translation.zh: 在卢旺达，即使种族灭绝后，人们还是正视了 但是在美国我们不愿意这么干

translation.en: I was giving some lectures in Germany about the death penalty.
translation.zh: 我也在德国谈过死刑的问题

translation.en: It was fascinating  because one of the scholars stood up after the presentation  and said, "Well you know it's deeply troubling  to hear what you're talking about."
translation.zh: 结果很绝妙 因为在讲谈后有个学者站起来 说：“你要知道， 听你谈这个很痛心。”

translation.en: He said, "We don't have the death penalty in Germany.
translation.zh: 她说：“我们德国没有死刑。

translation.en: And of course, we can never have the death penalty in Germany."
translation.zh: 当然了，我们德国永远也不可能有死刑。”

translation.en: And the room got very quiet,  and this woman said,  "There's no way, with our history,  we could ever engage  in the systematic killing of human beings.
translation.zh: 全场肃静 这位女士说： “因为我们的历史， 我们永不可能决定 有系统地杀人。

translation.en: It would be unconscionable for us  to, in an intentional and deliberate way,  set about executing people."
translation.zh: 公开化且下意识地 执行死刑，对我们来说 是良心上无法接受的

translation.en: And I thought about that.
translation.zh: 我思考了这个问题

translation.en: What would it feel like  to be living in a world  where the nation state of Germany was executing people,  especially if they were disproportionately Jewish?
translation.zh: 如果我整天 都看着德国人杀人 毫无道理地屠杀犹太人 我会有什么感受？

translation.en: I couldn't bear it.
translation.zh: 我无法忍受

translation.en: It would be unconscionable.
translation.zh: 那真是太不合理了

translation.en: And yet, in this country,  in the states of the Old South,  we execute people --  where you're 11 times more likely to get the death penalty  if the victim is white than if the victim is black,  if the defendant is black and the victim is white --  in the very states where there are buried in the ground  the bodies of people who were lynched.
translation.zh: 但是，在我们这个国家 在南方各州 我们真的在屠杀—— 当仅仅因为受害人是白人而不是黑人 你被判死刑的机率上升十倍时 当仅仅因为被告是黑人而不是白人 你被判死刑的机率上升二十一倍时—— 在这些州，到处埋着 被私刑处死的人

translation.en: And yet, there is this disconnect.
translation.zh: 可是，我们还是漠不关心

translation.en: Well I believe that our identity is at risk.
translation.zh: 我相信这说明我们有定位危机

translation.en: That when we actually don't care  about these difficult things,  the positive and wonderful things  are nonetheless implicated.
translation.zh: 当我们对这些棘手的问题 置之不顾时 我们却仍旧对那些正面的好事儿 一如既往地关心

translation.en: We love innovation.
translation.zh: 我们爱极了革新

translation.en: We love technology. We love creativity.
translation.zh: 我们爱技术，我们爱创造

translation.en: We love entertainment.
translation.zh: 我们爱娱乐

translation.en: But ultimately,  those realities  are shadowed by suffering,  abuse, degradation,  marginalization.
translation.zh: 但是最终 这些好的现实 都被痛苦煎熬， 滥用职权，剥夺人权 边缘化，蒙上了阴影

translation.en: And for me, it becomes necessary  to integrate the two.
translation.zh: 对于我来说两者合一 是必要的

translation.en: Because ultimately we are talking  about a need to be more hopeful,  more committed, more dedicated  to the basic challenges of living in a complex world.
translation.zh: 因为最终我们谈的 是怎么更有希望 更有保障，更有贡献 来应付生活在这个复杂社会中的种种挑战

translation.en: And for me that means  spending time thinking and talking  about the poor, the disadvantaged,  those who will never get to TED.
translation.zh: 对于我来说那需要 花时间思考和讨论 穷人阶层，弱势群体 那些永远也没机会来TED的人

translation.en: But thinking about them in a way  that is integrated in our own lives.
translation.zh: 不过想着他们其实在某种意义上 是把他们融合进我们的生活里

translation.en: You know ultimately, we all have to believe things we haven't seen.
translation.zh: 要知道最终，我们得相信那些没亲眼见的事

translation.en: We do. As rational as we are, as committed to intellect as we are.
translation.zh: 我们不得不。作为理智的社会，这么聪明的社会

translation.en: Innovation, creativity,  development comes  not from the ideas in our mind alone.
translation.zh: 革新，创造 发展，并不仅仅 在我们脑子里空想出来的

translation.en: They come from the ideas in our mind  that are also fueled  by some conviction in our heart.
translation.zh: 它们是从我们脑子里的智慧 和我们心里的信念 相结合的产物

translation.en: And it's that mind-heart connection  that I believe compels us  to not just be attentive  to all the bright and dazzly things,  but also the dark and difficult things.
translation.zh: 这个灵智合一 我相信会驱使我们 不仅仅是对那些 光明的事情更上心 同时对那些黑暗面和棘手的事情也是一样

translation.en: Vaclav Havel, the great Czech leader, talked about this.
translation.zh: 韦克拉乌·哈韦尔，这位捷克的杰出领导人，谈过这个问题

translation.en: He said, "When we were in Eastern Europe and dealing with oppression,  we wanted all kinds of things,  but mostly what we needed was hope,  an orientation of the spirit,  a willingness to sometimes be in hopeless places  and be a witness."
translation.zh: 他说：“当我们在东欧解决强制压迫的问题时 我们希望能成就很多 但是最重要的，我们要一个希望 一个心灵的指向 一种不惮于体会绝望的态度 以及为史留证的意愿。”

translation.en: Well that orientation of the spirit  is very much at the core of what I believe  even TED communities  have to be engaged in.
translation.zh: 这个心灵的指向 就是我的核心信念 我们的TED社会 也要参与进来

translation.en: There is no disconnect  around technology and design  that will allow us to be fully human  until we pay attention to suffering,  to poverty, to exclusion, to unfairness, to injustice.
translation.zh: 这里不应有任何东西把 高新的科技和完美的设计 和我们的人性间隔开来 只要我们还能注意到痛苦 注意到贫穷，制约，不公，和冤屈

translation.en: Now I will warn you  that this kind of identity  is a much more challenging identity  than ones that don't pay attention to this.
translation.zh: 我想提醒大家 这样的定位 是很有挑战性的 比起那些漠不关心的定位来说

translation.en: It will get to you.
translation.zh: 它会影响你

translation.en: I had the great privilege, when I was a young lawyer, of meeting Rosa Parks.
translation.zh: 当我是个年轻律师，我有幸见到帕克斯夫人

translation.en: And Ms. Parks used to come back to Montgomery every now and then,  and she would get together with two of her dearest friends,  these older women,  Johnnie Carr who was the organizer  of the Montgomery bus boycott --  amazing African-American woman --  and Virginia Durr, a white woman,  whose husband, Clifford Durr, represented Dr. King.
translation.zh: 帕克斯夫人曾时不时会到蒙哥马利 每次她都会和两个好友会面 两位上了年纪的女性 姜妮·卡尔，她是蒙哥马利 公车抵制运动的组织者—— 非常出色的黑人女性—— 还有弗吉尼亚·杜尔，一位白人女性 她丈夫克利福德·杜尔是马丁·路德·金的律师

translation.en: And these women would get together and just talk.
translation.zh: 这些女士们经常聚在一起讨论问题

translation.en: And every now and then Ms. Carr would call me,  and she'd say, "Bryan, Ms. Parks is coming to town. We're going to get together and talk.
translation.zh: 有时卡尔夫人会给我打电话 问我：“帕克斯夫人回来了，我们要聚聚。

translation.en: Do you want to come over and listen?"
translation.zh: 你愿不愿意来听我们谈话？”

translation.en: And I'd say, "Yes, Ma'am, I do."
translation.zh: 我会说：“当然，夫人，我愿意。”

translation.en: And she'd say, "Well what are you going to do when you get here?"
translation.zh: 她会问：“你来这里具体干什么呀？”

translation.en: I said, "I'm going to listen."
translation.zh: 我会说：“我就想听听。”

translation.en: And I'd go over there and I would, I would just listen.
translation.zh: 然后我会过去，只是倾听

translation.en: It would be so energizing and so empowering.
translation.zh: 这些聚会总是非常激动和鼓舞人心的

translation.en: And one time I was over there listening to these women talk,  and after a couple of hours Ms. Parks turned to me  and she said, "Now Bryan, tell me what the Equal Justice Initiative is.
translation.zh: 有一次我在那里听她们谈话 几小时后帕克斯夫人问我 她问：“布莱恩，和我讲讲你的平等司法倡议。

translation.en: Tell me what you're trying to do."
translation.zh: 和我讲讲你打算做什么。”

translation.en: And I began giving her my rap.
translation.zh: 我就开始大讲特讲

translation.en: I said, "Well we're trying to challenge injustice.
translation.zh: 我说：“我们想向不公正的待遇提出挑战。

translation.en: We're trying to help people who have been wrongly convicted.
translation.zh: 我们想帮那些被误判了刑的人。

translation.en: We're trying to confront bias and discrimination  in the administration of criminal justice.
translation.zh: 我们想和在刑法制度里的 偏见和歧视做对抗。

translation.en: We're trying to end life without parole sentences for children.
translation.zh: 给孩子被判终身无法假释的制度给终结掉。

translation.en: We're trying to do something about the death penalty.
translation.zh: 我们想为死刑制度做些改变。

translation.en: We're trying to reduce the prison population.
translation.zh: 我们想减少监狱人口。

translation.en: We're trying to end mass incarceration."
translation.zh: 我们还想杜绝过度泛滥的监禁。”

translation.en: I gave her my whole rap, and when I finished she looked at me  and she said, "Mmm mmm mmm."
translation.zh: 我做了一个全本无删减的演讲，当我结束时，她盯着我 说：“别别别。”

translation.en: She said, "That's going to make you tired, tired, tired."
translation.zh: 她说：“这些会让你很累，很累，很累的。”

translation.en: And that's when Ms. Carr leaned forward, she put her finger in my face,  she said, "That's why you've got to be brave, brave, brave."
translation.zh: 这时卡尔夫人凑过来，她把手放在我脸边说： “这就是为什么你要很勇敢很勇敢很勇敢。”

translation.en: And I actually believe that the TED community  needs to be more courageous.
translation.zh: 我确信TED这个社会 需要更有胆量些

translation.en: We need to find ways  to embrace these challenges,  these problems, the suffering.
translation.zh: 我们需要找到出路 来面对这些挑战 这些问题，这些痛苦

translation.en: Because ultimately, our humanity depends  on everyone's humanity.
translation.zh: 因为最终，我们的整体的人性取决于 每个人的人性

translation.en: I've learned very simple things doing the work that I do.
translation.zh: 在我的工作中

translation.en: It's just taught me very simple things.
translation.zh: 我学到了非常简单的原则

translation.en: I've come to understand and to believe  that each of us  is more than the worst thing we've ever done.
translation.zh: 我开始理解，开始相信 我们每一个人 都不会被我们最坏的一面所定义

translation.en: I believe that for every person on the planet.
translation.zh: 我相信，对于这个星球上的每一个人

translation.en: I think if somebody tells a lie, they're not just a liar.
translation.zh: 如果他撒了个谎，并不说明他就是个骗子

translation.en: I think if somebody takes something that doesn't belong to them,  they're not just a thief.
translation.zh: 如果他拿了不属于他的东西 并不说明他就是个惯偷

translation.en: I think even if you kill someone, you're not just a killer.
translation.zh: 甚至你杀了人，并不说明你就是个冷血杀手

translation.en: And because of that there's this basic human dignity  that must be respected by law.
translation.zh: 因为我相信人类有基本的尊严 法律必须尊重它

translation.en: I also believe  that in many parts of this country,  and certainly in many parts of this globe,  that the opposite of poverty is not wealth.
translation.zh: 我也相信 在我们国家的很多地方 当然甚至这个世界的很多地方 贫穷的反面，不是富裕

translation.en: I don't believe that.
translation.zh: 我不相信这个

translation.en: I actually think, in too many places,  the opposite of poverty is justice.
translation.zh: 我认为，在很多很多地方 贫穷的反面，是公正

translation.en: And finally, I believe  that, despite the fact that it is so dramatic  and so beautiful and so inspiring  and so stimulating,  we will ultimately not be judged by our technology,  we won't be judged by our design,  we won't be judged by our intellect and reason.
translation.zh: 最后，我相信 尽管很有声色 很美妙，很鼓动人心 也很刺激 但我们本身最终不会被科技所评价 也不会被设计所衡量 我们也不会被智慧和哲学来打分

translation.en: Ultimately, you judge the character of a society,  not by how they treat their rich and the powerful and the privileged,  but by how they treat the poor,  the condemned, the incarcerated.
translation.zh: 最终，人们会评价我们这个社会 不是根据我们怎么款待富人，有特权的人 而是根据我们怎么对待穷人 被谴责的人，被囚禁的人

translation.en: Because it's in that nexus  that we actually begin to understand truly profound things  about who we are.
translation.zh: 因为正是在这个合流点 我们真正地开始对于我们是什么样的人 有了深入的理解

translation.en: I sometimes get out of balance. I'll end with this story.
translation.zh: 我常失去平衡。我想用个故事结束我的演讲

translation.en: I sometimes push too hard.
translation.zh: 我有时工作太多

translation.en: I do get tired, as we all do.
translation.zh: 很累，就像大家每个人一样

translation.en: Sometimes those ideas get ahead of our thinking  in ways that are important.
translation.zh: 有时这些想法太多而思考跟不上 结果是很严重的

translation.en: And I've been representing these kids  who have been sentenced to do these very harsh sentences.
translation.zh: 我曾经为这些孩子们辩护 他们被判了很重的刑

translation.en: And I go to the jail and I see my client who's 13 and 14,  and he's been certified to stand trial as an adult.
translation.zh: 我去管教所，看见我的被告都是十三四岁 他们被说成是成年人，作为成年人对待

translation.en: I start thinking, well, how did that happen?
translation.zh: 我开始想，到底是怎么一回事？

translation.en: How can a judge turn you into something  that you're not?
translation.zh: 一个法官，怎么能够把一个人 判定成一个不同的人？

translation.en: And the judge has certified him as an adult, but I see this kid.
translation.zh: 这个法官说他是成年人，但我只看见一个孩子

translation.en: And I was up too late one night and I starting thinking,  well gosh, if the judge can turn you into something that you're not,  the judge must have magic power.
translation.zh: 一天晚上我彻夜难眠，不止地想 天哪，如果法官能把你写成另一个人 这个法官肯定有魔法

translation.en: Yeah, Bryan, the judge has some magic power.
translation.zh: 对了，布莱恩，这个法官有魔法

translation.en: You should ask for some of that.
translation.zh: 你可得学着点

translation.en: And because I was up too late, wasn't thinking real straight,  I started working on a motion.
translation.zh: 因为我睡得太晚，脑子不清楚 我开始做一个议案

translation.en: And I had a client who was 14 years old, a young, poor black kid.
translation.zh: 我有个被告，十四岁，一个黑人小孩子

translation.en: And I started working on this motion,  and the head of the motion was: "Motion to try my poor,  14-year-old black male client  like a privileged, white 75-year-old  corporate executive."
translation.zh: 我开始做他的辩护 标题是：“提案：将我的 十四岁的穷黑孩子 想成一个七十五岁的特级 白人企业高管。”

translation.en: And I put in my motion  that there was prosecutorial misconduct and police misconduct and judicial misconduct.
translation.zh: 在这个提案里 我说检察院，警察局和法庭都处理不当

translation.en: There was a crazy line in there about how there's no conduct in this county,  it's all misconduct.
translation.zh: 说这个法院没有合情合法这一说之类的疯话 全是故意乱判

translation.en: And the next morning, I woke up and I thought, now did I dream that crazy motion,  or did I actually write it?
translation.zh: 第二天早上我醒来回想，我是做了个梦呢 还是真的写了这个提案？

translation.en: And to my horror, not only had I written it,  but I had sent it to court.
translation.zh: 恐怖的是，不光我真写了 我还寄给法院了

translation.en: A couple months went by,  and I had just forgotten all about it.
translation.zh: 几个月过去了 我全忘了有这么回事

translation.en: And I finally decided,  oh gosh, I've got to go to the court and do this crazy case.
translation.zh: 最后我决定 天哪，我得上庭去做这个案子

translation.en: And I got into my car  and I was feeling really overwhelmed -- overwhelmed.
translation.zh: 我跳上车 觉得很紧张——非常紧张

translation.en: And I got in my car and I went to this courthouse.
translation.zh: 我上车开到法庭

translation.en: And I was thinking, this is going to be so difficult, so painful.
translation.zh: 我在想，这将会是场硬仗，会很痛苦

translation.en: And I finally got out of the car and I started walking up to the courthouse.
translation.zh: 最后我终于钻出车子，开始往法庭走

translation.en: And as I was walking up the steps of this courthouse,  there was an older black man who was the janitor in this courthouse.
translation.zh: 当我上台阶时 有个上了年纪的黑人老伯，法院的清洁工

translation.en: When this man saw me, he came over to me  and he said, "Who are you?"
translation.zh: 他看见我，跑来说 他问：“你是谁？”

translation.en: I said, "I'm a lawyer." He said, "You're a lawyer?" I said, "Yes, sir."
translation.zh: 我说：“我是律师。”他说：“你，是律师？”我说：“是的。先生。”

translation.en: And this man came over to me  and he hugged me.
translation.zh: 这个老伯凑过来 给了我一个拥抱

translation.en: And he whispered in my ear.
translation.zh: 他悄悄在我耳边说

translation.en: He said, "I'm so proud of you."
translation.zh: 他说：“我真为你骄傲。”

translation.en: And I have to tell you,  it was energizing.
translation.zh: 我得和大家承认 这可给了我一针强心剂

translation.en: It connected deeply with something in me  about identity,  about the capacity of every person to contribute  to a community, to a perspective that is hopeful.
translation.zh: 他的话提醒了我心深处 我的自我定位 提醒了我每个人都应该 对社会，对更好的前景做出的贡献

translation.en: Well I went into the courtroom.
translation.zh: 所以我跑到法庭里

translation.en: And as soon as I walked inside, the judge saw me coming in.
translation.zh: 我一走进去，法官看见我就说：

translation.en: He said, "Mr. Stevenson, did you write this crazy motion?"
translation.zh: “史蒂文森先生，是你写了这个疯案么？”

translation.en: I said, "Yes, sir. I did." And we started arguing.
translation.zh: 我说：“是先生，是我写的。”我们开始争论

translation.en: And people started coming in because they were just outraged.
translation.zh: 人们陆续跑进来，因为大家都愤怒了

translation.en: I had written these crazy things.
translation.zh: 我的确写了不少挺够劲的事情

translation.en: And police officers were coming in  and assistant prosecutors and clerk workers.
translation.zh: 警察也进来了 助理检察官也进来了，书记员也进来了

translation.en: And before I knew it, the courtroom was filled with people  angry that we were talking about race,  that we were talking about poverty,  that we were talking about inequality.
translation.zh: 我还没回过神来，整个法庭站满了人 全很愤怒，因为我们在谈种族问题 我们在谈贫穷 我们在谈不平等待遇

translation.en: And out of the corner of my eye, I could see this janitor pacing back and forth.
translation.zh: 我眼角瞟到那个清洁工，在外面走来走去

translation.en: And he kept looking through the window, and he could hear all of this holler.
translation.zh: 不断向里张望，他也都能听到人们的抱怨

translation.en: He kept pacing back and forth.
translation.zh: 他就这样来回来去地走

translation.en: And finally, this older black man with this very worried look on his face  came into the courtroom and sat down behind me,  almost at counsel table.
translation.zh: 最后，这个黑人老伯进来了 一脸担心地坐在我后面 几乎顶到了辩护台

translation.en: About 10 minutes later the judge said we would take a break.
translation.zh: 十分钟后，法官提议休息一下

translation.en: And during the break there was a deputy sheriff who was offended  that the janitor had come into court.
translation.zh: 休息期间，一个副警长觉得清洁工进法庭 有失面子

translation.en: And this deputy jumped up and he ran over to this older black man.
translation.zh: 这个副警长跳起来，向这个老伯冲过去

translation.en: He said, "Jimmy, what are you doing in this courtroom?"
translation.zh: 说：“吉米，你来法庭里干什么？”

translation.en: And this older black man stood up  and he looked at that deputy and he looked at me  and he said, "I came into this courtroom  to tell this young man,  keep your eyes on the prize, hold on."
translation.zh: 这个老黑人站起来 看看这个副警长，看看我 他说：“我进来 是想告诉这个年轻人 往前看，往好了看，挺住。”

translation.en: I've come to TED  because I believe that many of you understand  that the moral arc of the universe is long,  but it bends toward justice.
translation.zh: 我今天来TED 是因为我相信这里很多人都明白 这个世界的道德的弧线尽管很长 但是永远向着公正的一边倾斜

translation.en: until we care about human rights and basic dignity.
translation.zh: 在我们开始关心人权和尊严之前 我们无法真正完成进化

translation.en: That all of our survival  is tied to the survival of everyone.
translation.zh: 我们的生存 和每一个人的生存都分不开

translation.en: That our visions of technology and design  and entertainment and creativity  have to be married with visions of humanity, compassion and justice.
translation.zh: 我们在科技和设计上的前景 在娱乐和创造力上的眼光 必须与人性，慈善，和公正的远见

translation.en: And more than anything,  for those of you who share that,  I've simply come to tell you  to keep your eyes on the prize, hold on.
translation.zh: 相结合 最重要的是 对于每个执着此见的人 我只想和你说 往前看，往好了看，挺住

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家

translation.en: Chris Anderson: So you heard and saw  an obvious desire by this audience, this community,  to help you on your way and to do something on this issue.
translation.zh: 克里斯·安德森：你应该听到看到 这些听众，这个群体 想帮你，想做贡献的意愿了

translation.en: Other than writing a check,  what could we do?
translation.zh: 除了给你写支票 我们还能做什么？

translation.en: BS: Well there are opportunities all around us.
translation.zh: 布莱恩：有很多机会

translation.en: If you live in the state of California, for example,  there's a referendum coming up this spring  where actually there's going to be an effort  to redirect some of the money we spend on the politics of punishment.
translation.zh: 比如，如果你在加州住 今年春天有个公投 将是个很大的工夫 关于重新分配我们在惩戒人上花的钱

translation.en: For example, here in California  we're going to spend one billion dollars  on the death penalty in the next five years --  one billion dollars.
translation.zh: 比如，在加州 在未来五年内 我们将花掉一亿美元—— 一亿呀

translation.en: And yet, 46 percent of all homicide cases  don't result in arrest.
translation.zh: 同时，百分之四十六的凶杀案 都没有下落

translation.en: 56 percent of all rape cases don't result.
translation.zh: 百分之五十六的强奸案，查不出来

translation.en: So there's an opportunity to change that.
translation.zh: 这个公投是个改变现状的机会

translation.en: And this referendum would propose having those dollars  go to law enforcement and safety.
translation.zh: 这个公投将提出把这些钱 花在执法和保安上

translation.en: And I think that opportunity exists all around us.
translation.zh: 我认为这个机会我们能帮忙

translation.en: CA: There's been this huge decline  in crime in America over the last three decades.
translation.zh: 克瑞斯：在近三十年 美国的犯罪率有个大下降

translation.en: And part of the narrative of that  is sometimes that it's about increased incarceration rates.
translation.zh: 有人说部分原因是 和大幅上升的监禁率有关

translation.en: What would you say to someone who believed that?
translation.zh: 你对持这个说法的人会怎么讲？

translation.en: BS: Well actually the violent crime rate  has remained relatively stable.
translation.zh: 布莱恩：其实犯罪率 几乎没怎么变

translation.en: The great increase in mass incarceration in this country  wasn't really in violent crime categories.
translation.zh: 这个国家上升的监禁率 并不是在暴力犯罪这一类里的

translation.en: It was this misguided war on drugs.
translation.zh: 而是由毒品的滥用所导致的

translation.en: in our prison population.
translation.zh: 这才是我们监狱人口

translation.en: And we got carried away with the rhetoric of punishment.
translation.zh: 上升的主要原因 我们在花哨的惩戒上走得有点太远了

translation.en: And so we have three strikes laws  that put people in prison forever  for stealing a bicycle, for low-level property crimes,  rather than making them give those resources back  to the people who they victimized.
translation.zh: 同时我们有三击出局的规定 能把一些人永久监禁起来 只是因为偷了辆自行车，或者一点点财物 我们并不给他们机会对受害人 作出补偿

translation.en: I believe we need to do more to help people who are victimized by crime,  not do less.
translation.zh: 我相信我们需要给犯罪的人更多帮助 而不是剥夺他们仅有的

translation.en: And I think our current punishment philosophy  does nothing for no one.
translation.zh: 我想现今的刑法哲学 对谁也没有利

translation.en: And I think that's the orientation that we have to change.
translation.zh: 我认为这个大方向应该改变

translation.en: CA: Bryan, you've struck a massive chord here.
translation.zh: 克里斯：布莱恩，你今天震了大家一把

translation.en: You're an inspiring person.
translation.zh: 你真是很个能鼓舞人心的家伙

translation.en: Thank you so much for coming to TED. Thank you.
translation.zh: 非常感谢你来TED。谢谢

translation.en: Announcer: Threats, in the wake of Bin Laden's death, have spiked.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 播音员：在本拉登被击毙后，恐怖威胁数量激增。

translation.en: Announcer Two: Famine in Somalia. Announcer Three: Police pepper spray.
translation.zh: 播音员2：索马里出现饥荒。播音员3：警察使用胡椒喷雾。

translation.en: Announcer Four: Vicious cartels. Announcer Five: Caustic cruise lines.
translation.zh: 播音员4：凶恶的毒枭。播音员5：破裂的游轮。

translation.en: Announcer Six: Societal decay. Announcer Seven: 65 dead.
translation.zh: 播音员6：社会风气败坏。播音员7：65人死亡。

translation.en: Announcer Eight: Tsunami warning. Announcer Nine: Cyberattacks.
translation.zh: 播音员8：海啸警告。播音员9：网络攻击。

translation.en: Multiple Announcers: Drug war. Mass destruction. Tornado.
translation.zh: 多位播音员：毒品战争、大规模破坏、飓风、

translation.en: Recession. Default. Doomsday. Egypt. Syria.
translation.zh: 经济衰退、违约、末日、埃及、叙利亚、

translation.en: Crisis. Death. Disaster.
translation.zh: 危机、死亡、灾难。

translation.en: Oh, my God.
translation.zh: 哦我的天哪！

translation.en: Peter Diamandis: So those are just a few of the clips  I collected over the last six months --  could have easily been the last six days  or the last six years.
translation.zh: 彼得迪曼蒂斯：这是我在过去6个月里 收集的一些视频。 如果是在6天，或者过去6年里 也可以轻易收集到类似的片段。

translation.en: The point is that the news media  preferentially feeds us negative stories  because that's what our minds pay attention to.
translation.zh: 重点是新闻媒体倾向于 向我们灌输负面信息。 因为我们的大脑特别容易关注这些。

translation.en: And there's a very good reason for that.
translation.zh: 当然大脑这样做是有很重要的理由。

translation.en: Every second of every day,  our senses bring in way too much data  than we can possibly process in our brains.
translation.zh: 每时每刻， 我们的“传感器”收集大量的信息 多到我们的大脑处理不过来。

translation.en: And because nothing is more important to us  than survival,  the first stop of all of that data  is an ancient sliver of the temporal lobe  called the amygdala.
translation.zh: 而其中没有比与生存相关的信息 更重要的。 所有信息输入的第一站就是 颞叶上一个叫做大脑扁桃体的 非常原始的部分。

translation.en: Now the amygdala is our early warning detector,  our danger detector.
translation.zh: 大脑扁桃体是我们的早期预警侦测器， 危险探测仪。

translation.en: It sorts and scours through all of the information  looking for anything in the environment that might harm us.
translation.zh: 它将所有信息分类并仔细查阅， 探测环境中任何可能的威胁。

translation.en: So given a dozen news stories,  we will preferentially look  at the negative news.
translation.zh: 所以每当我们打开报纸， 就会不自觉地阅读 各种负面信息。

translation.en: And that old newspaper saying,  "If it bleeds it leads,"  is very true.
translation.zh: 那个过去有关报纸的说法： ”流血事件必上头条。“ 其实是很有道理的。

translation.en: So given all of our digital devices  that are bringing all the negative news to us  it's no wonder that we're pessimistic.
translation.zh: 而现在我们有各种数字化设备， 无时无刻地向我们 输送各种负面新闻。 难怪大家这么容易悲观。

translation.en: It's no wonder that people think  that the world is getting worse.
translation.zh: 难怪人们觉得 世界在倒退。

translation.en: But perhaps that's not the case.
translation.zh: 但事实或许

translation.en: Perhaps instead,  it's the distortions brought to us  of what's really going on.
translation.zh: 并不是这样， 我们所接受的信息 是被扭曲的。

translation.en: Perhaps the tremendous progress we've made over the last century  by a series of forces  are, in fact, accelerating to a point  that we have the potential in the next three decades  to create a world of abundance.
translation.zh: 我们的社会在上世纪 一系列事件的影响下 所经历的巨大的进步 正在不断加速， 事实上，这样的速度令我们在未来三十年中， 拥有创造一个富足的世界的可能性。

translation.en: Now I'm not saying  we don't have our set of problems --  climate crisis, species extinction,  water and energy shortage -- we surely do.
translation.zh: 我并不是说 这些问题不存在－ 气候危机，物种灭绝， 水资源和能源短缺的情况都确实发生了。

translation.en: And as humans, we are far better  at seeing the problems way in advance,  but ultimately we knock them down.
translation.zh: 作为人类，我们太擅长对 危机做出各种预估， 但最终我们会消除它们。

translation.en: So let's look  at what this last century has been  to see where we're going.
translation.zh: 让我们来回顾下 上个世纪发生了什么， 来了解我们正向着什么方向在前进。

translation.en: Over the last hundred years,  the average human lifespan has more than doubled,  average per capita income adjusted for inflation  around the world has tripled.
translation.zh: 过去的几百年里， 人类的平均寿命增加了2倍以上， 经过通货膨胀调整计算，全世界的人均收入 增加了3倍。

translation.en: Childhood mortality  has come down a factor of 10.
translation.zh: 婴儿死亡率 下降了10倍。

translation.en: Add to that the cost of food, electricity,  transportation, communication  have dropped 10 to 1,000-fold.
translation.zh: 食品、用电、交通、 通信的成本 下降了10倍到1000倍不等。

translation.en: Steve Pinker has showed us  that, in fact, we're living during the most peaceful time ever  in human history.
translation.zh: 史蒂夫平克为我们指出, 我们正生活在人类历史上 最和平的时代。

translation.en: And Charles Kenny  that global literacy has gone from 25 percent to over 80 percent  in the last 130 years.
translation.zh: 还有查尔斯·肯尼提到 世界范围的识字率在过去的130年里从25％ 上升到了80％。

translation.en: We truly are living in an extraordinary time.
translation.zh: 我们确实生活在一个伟大的时代。

translation.en: And many people forget this.
translation.zh: 然而许多人忘记了这点。

translation.en: And we keep setting our expectations higher and higher.
translation.zh: 我们不断地把期望越定越高。

translation.en: In fact, we redefine what poverty means.
translation.zh: 事实上，我们已经更改了“贫穷”的涵义。

translation.en: Think of this, in America today,  the majority of people under the poverty line  still have electricity, water, toilets, refrigerators,  television, mobile phones,  air conditioning and cars.
translation.zh: 想一下，在今天的美国 大部分生活在贫困线下的人 仍然拥有电力，饮用水，厕所，冰箱， 电视，行动电话， 空调和汽车。

translation.en: The wealthiest robber barons of the last century, the emperors on this planet,  could have never dreamed of such luxuries.
translation.zh: 上世纪最富有的强盗大亨，这个星球上的帝王们， 永远都想象不到这样的奢侈生活。

translation.en: Underpinning much of this  is technology,  and of late,  exponentially growing technologies.
translation.zh: 而这一切的基础 是科技。 和近代 指数式增长的科技。

translation.en: My good friend Ray Kurzweil  showed that any tool that becomes an information technology  jumps on this curve, on Moore's Law,  and experiences price performance doubling  every 12 to 24 months.
translation.zh: 我的好朋友雷·库兹威尔 展示了任何信息科技的工具 都遵从这条曲线，即摩尔定律。 并经历每12到24个月 性价比翻一倍的增长。

translation.en: That's why the cellphone in your pocket  is literally a million times cheaper and a thousand times faster  than a supercomputer of the '70s.
translation.zh: 这就是为什么你口袋里的行动电话 相比70年代的超级电脑要便宜 100万倍，而且还要快上1000倍

translation.en: Now look at this curve.
translation.zh: 再看这个曲线。

translation.en: This is Moore's Law over the last hundred years.
translation.zh: 这是过去几百年里的摩尔定律。

translation.en: I want you to notice two things from this curve.
translation.zh: 我想要大家注意这曲线所体现的2件事

translation.en: Number one, how smooth it is --  through good time and bad time, war time and peace time,  recession, depression and boom time.
translation.zh: 第一，它非常的平滑－ 无论时代是好是坏，无论战争或和平， 经济衰退或增长。

translation.en: This is the result of faster computers  being used to build faster computers.
translation.zh: 这是因为更快的电脑被用来制造 更更快的电脑所产生的结果。

translation.en: It doesn't slow for any of our grand challenges.
translation.zh: 它不会因为我们面临的巨大挑战所延缓。

translation.en: And also, even though it's plotted  on a log curve on the left,  it's curving upwards.
translation.zh: 尽管在左边 呈现出对数曲线 它也是仍然是向上弯曲。

translation.en: The rate at which the technology is getting faster  is itself getting faster.
translation.zh: 科技前进加速的本身 也在不断变快。

translation.en: And on this curve, riding on Moore's Law,  are a set of extraordinarily powerful technologies  available to all of us.
translation.zh: 在这摩尔定律的曲线上， 是一系列对所有人都开放 的强大的科技。

translation.en: Cloud computing,  what my friends at Autodesk call infinite computing;  sensors and networks; robotics;  3D printing, which is the ability to democratize and distribute  personalized production around the planet;  synthetic biology;  fuels, vaccines and foods;  digital medicine; nanomaterials; and A.I.
translation.zh: 云计算， 我在Autodesk公司的朋友称之为无限计算； 传感器和网络，机器人； 3D打印，让我们获得在全世界范围普及和部署 个性化生产的能力； 人造生命； 带来新的燃料，疫苗和食物； 数字化医药；纳米材料和人工智能。

translation.en: I mean, how many of you saw the winning of Jeopardy  by IBM's Watson?
translation.zh: 观众中多少人看到了IBM的Watson超级电脑在 Jeopardy智力竞赛的获胜？

translation.en: I mean, that was epic.
translation.zh: 那真是太伟大了。

translation.en: In fact, I scoured the headlines  looking for the best headline in a newspaper I could.
translation.zh: 我查看各种报纸的新闻头条 找到我觉得最好的

translation.en: And I love this: "Watson Vanquishes Human Opponents."
translation.zh: 我喜欢这句：”Watson征服人类对手。“

translation.en: Jeopardy's not an easy game.
translation.zh: Jeopardy不是个容易的比赛。

translation.en: It's about the nuance of human language.
translation.zh: 获胜关键在于理解人类语言中的微妙细节。

translation.en: And imagine if you would  A.I.'s like this on the cloud  available to every person with a cellphone.
translation.zh: 你可以想象一下 像这样的人工智能存在于云计算中 所有拥有行动电话的人都可以使用的景象。

translation.en: Four years ago here at TED,  Ray Kurzweil and I started a new university  called Singularity University.
translation.zh: 四年前在TED, 雷·库兹威尔和我创立了一所新的大学 叫做“Singularity University”。

translation.en: And we teach our students all of these technologies,  and particularly how they can be used  to solve humanity's grand challenges.
translation.zh: 我们教给学生各种科技 特别是如何利用这些科技 来解决人类面临的巨大挑战。

translation.en: And every year we ask them  to start a company or a product or a service  that can affect positively the lives of a billion people  within a decade.
translation.zh: 每一年我们都要求学生 创立一件公司或制作一种产品或者提供一项服务 能在十年内对十亿人的生活产生 积极而实际的影响。

translation.en: Think about that, the fact that, literally, a group of students  can touch the lives of a billion people today.
translation.zh: 想象一下一群学生 今天可以影响到十亿人的生活。

translation.en: 30 years ago that would have sounded ludicrous.
translation.zh: 30年前这听起来非常可笑。

translation.en: Today we can point at dozens of companies  that have done just that.
translation.zh: 今天我们可以列举出几十间 有这样成就的公司。

translation.en: When I think about creating abundance,  it's not about creating a life of luxury for everybody on this planet;  it's about creating a life of possibility.
translation.zh: 当我想到创造富足社会， 并不是要为地球上的每一个人创造奢华的生活； 而是创造充满可能性的生活。

translation.en: It is about taking that which was scarce  and making it abundant.
translation.zh: 是把原先稀缺的资源 变得充沛

translation.en: You see, scarcity is contextual,  and technology is a resource-liberating force.
translation.zh: 稀缺性是相对的， 而科技是一股解放资源的力量。

translation.en: Let me give you an example.
translation.zh: 我来举一个例子。

translation.en: So this is a story of Napoleon III  in the mid-1800s.
translation.zh: 这是一个拿破仑三世的故事 在1800到1810年中期。

translation.en: He's the dude on the left.
translation.zh: 他是左边这位

translation.en: He invited over to dinner  the king of Siam.
translation.zh: 邀请了泰王 共进晚餐。

translation.en: All of Napoleon's troops  were fed with silver utensils,  Napoleon himself with gold utensils.
translation.zh: 所有拿破仑的士兵 使用银器用餐， 拿破仑自己则使用金器。

translation.en: But the King of Siam,  he was fed with aluminum utensils.
translation.zh: 但是泰国国王 使用铝制的餐具。

translation.en: You see, aluminum  was the most valuable metal on the planet,  worth more than gold and platinum.
translation.zh: 铝 曾经是世界上最贵重的金属， 比黄金和白金还要昂贵。

translation.en: It's the reason that the tip of the Washington Monument  is made of aluminum.
translation.zh: 这就是为什么华盛顿纪念碑的 顶端是铝制的。

translation.en: You see, even though aluminum  is 8.3 percent of the Earth by mass,  it doesn't come as a pure metal.
translation.zh: 即使铝占了地球 总重量的8.3%。 但它不是以纯金属的形态存在。

translation.en: It's all bound by oxygen and silicates.
translation.zh: 它都是和氧或者硅酸结合。

translation.en: But then the technology of electrolysis came along  and literally made aluminum so cheap  that we use it with throw-away mentality.
translation.zh: 但是随后出现了电解技术 使得铝的价格如此低廉 以致我们就把铝制品当一次性用品般看待。

translation.en: So let's project this analogy going forward.
translation.zh: 让我们把这个比喻应用到其他方面，

translation.en: We think about energy scarcity.
translation.zh: 让我们想一想能源短缺。

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen,  we are on a planet  that is bathed with 5,000 times more energy  than we use in a year.
translation.zh: 女士们先生们， 我们生活的这个星球上 接收着相当于我们年平均能源消耗 5000多倍的能量。

translation.en: 16 terawatts of energy hits the Earth's surface  every 88 minutes.
translation.zh: 每88分钟有16太瓦的能源 投向地球表面。

translation.en: It's not about being scarce,  it's about accessibility.
translation.zh: 问题并不是能源稀缺， 而是可及性。

translation.en: And there's good news here.
translation.zh: 现在有几个好消息，

translation.en: For the first time, this year  the cost of solar-generated electricity  is 50 percent that of diesel-generated electricity in India --  8.8 rupees versus 17 rupees.
translation.zh: 今年是有史以来第一次 在印度，太阳能发电的成本降低至 化石燃料发电成本的一半-- 8.8卢布相比较17卢布。

translation.en: The cost of solar dropped 50 percent last year.
translation.zh: 去年太阳能发电的成本降低了一半

translation.en: Last month, MIT put out a study  showing that by the end of this decade,  in the sunny parts of the United States,  solar electricity will be six cents a kilowatt hour  compared to 15 cents  as a national average.
translation.zh: 上个月，MIT发布了一个研究报告 显示到2020年 在美国阳光充足的地区， 太阳能电力费用会降至6美分一千瓦／小时 相比较全国平均 标准是15美分。

translation.en: And if we have abundant energy,  we also have abundant water.
translation.zh: 如果我们有充足的能源， 也就会有丰富的洁净水。

translation.en: Now we talk about water wars.
translation.zh: 下面我们来聊下水的战争。

translation.en: Do you remember  when Carl Sagan turned the Voyager spacecraft  back towards the Earth,  in 1990 after it just passed Saturn?
translation.zh: 还记得吗？ 1990年，Carl Saga在航海者太空飞船 经过土星的时候， 调转其方向面对地球。

translation.en: He took a famous photo. What was it called?
translation.zh: 拍下了一幅著名的照片，叫什么名字？

translation.en: "A Pale Blue Dot."
translation.zh: ”淡蓝色的小点。“

translation.en: Because we live on a water planet.
translation.zh: 因为我们生活在一颗"水行星"上

translation.en: We live on a planet 70 percent covered by water.
translation.zh: 地球表面70％被水覆盖

translation.en: Yes, 97.5 percent is saltwater,  two percent is ice,  and we fight over a half a percent of the water on this planet,  but here too there is hope.
translation.zh: 是的，97.5％是海水 2%是冰山， 我们则在争夺世界上1.5%的水资源， 但我们仍然有希望。

translation.en: And there is technology coming online,  not 10, 20 years from now,  right now.
translation.zh: 有一项科技正准备投入应用， 并不是未来的10年20年以后， 就是现在。

translation.en: There's nanotechnology coming on, nanomaterials.
translation.zh: 有一种纳米科技。

translation.en: And the conversation I had with Dean Kamen this morning,  one of the great DIY innovators,  I'd like to share with you -- he gave me permission to do so --  his technology called Slingshot  that many of you may have heard of,  it is the size of a small dorm room refrigerator.
translation.zh: 今天早上我和一个伟大的DIY 发明家Dean Kamen聊天。 我想要和大家分享－我得到了他的允许－ 他开发的技术叫做“弹弓” 在座的一些朋友可能听说过， 它是一个小房间一般大的冰箱，

translation.en: a thousand liters of clean drinking water a day  out of any source -- saltwater, polluted water, latrine --  at less than two cents a liter.
translation.zh: 每天可以从 任何水源中－海水，污染水，公共厕所－ 生产出一千公升的洁净饮用水。 每公升的成本低于2美分。

translation.en: The chairman of Coca-Cola has just agreed  to do a major test  of hundreds of units of this in the developing world.
translation.zh: 可口可乐的主席最近授意 在多个发展中国家对 数百台“弹弓”进行大规模测试。

translation.en: And if that pans out,  which I have every confidence it will,  Coca-Cola will deploy this globally  to 206 countries  around the planet.
translation.zh: 如果测试成功， 我很有信心它会成功， 可口可乐将会在全球206个国家 对该设备 进行部署。

translation.en: This is the kind of innovation, empowered by this technology,  that exists today.
translation.zh: 这就是当下已经存在的由科技 驱动的创新。

translation.en: And we've seen this in cellphones.
translation.zh: 我们在移动电话上看到这点。

translation.en: My goodness, we're going to hit 70 percent penetration  of cellphones in the developing world  by the end of 2013.
translation.zh: 我的天哪，在2013年底，发展中国家的 移动电话渗透率将 达到70％。

translation.en: Think about it,  that a Masai warrior on a cellphone in the middle of Kenya  than President Reagan did 25 years ago.
translation.zh: 想象一下。 在肯尼亚中部的一个马赛士兵 拥有的比25年前的里根总统 更好的移动通讯。

translation.en: And if they're on a smartphone on Google,  they've got access to more knowledge and information than President Clinton did 15 years ago.
translation.zh: 如果他们使用智能手机访问Google, 他们将得到比克林顿总统15年前

translation.en: They're living in a world of information and communication abundance  that no one could have ever predicted.
translation.zh: 所得到的更多的知识和信息。 他们生活在一个信息和通讯富足的世界 这在过去没人能预测到的。

translation.en: Better than that,  the things that you and I  spent tens and hundreds of thousands of dollars for --  GPS, HD video and still images,  libraries of books and music,  medical diagnostic technology --  are now literally dematerializing and demonetizing  into your cellphone.
translation.zh: 还有更棒的， 我们花费了 成千上百美金所获得的－ GPS，高清电视和 图形图像， 以及医疗诊断技术－ 被非物质化并非商业化 输入到你的行动电话中。

translation.en: Probably the best part of it  is what's coming down the pike in health.
translation.zh: 这其中最好的 部分或许是医疗。

translation.en: Last month, I had the pleasure of announcing with Qualcomm Foundation  something called the $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder X Prize.
translation.zh: 上个月我很荣幸和高通基金共同宣布 1000万美金高通手持移动分析仪X大赛。

translation.en: We're challenging teams around the world  to basically combine these technologies  into a mobile device  that you can speak to, because it's got A.I.,  you can cough on it, you can do a finger blood prick.
translation.zh: 我们向全世界的团队发出挑战 来将这些科技 组合进移动设备。 你可以向它说话，因为它拥有人工智能 也可以对着它咳嗽，或者扎手指验血。

translation.en: And to win, it needs to be able to diagnose you better  than a team of board-certified doctors.
translation.zh: 要赢得竞赛，这个设备需要能为你提供比一组 经过委员会验证的医师更好的诊断。

translation.en: So literally, imagine this device  in the middle of the developing world where there are no doctors, 25 percent of the disease burden  and 1.3 percent of the health care workers.
translation.zh: 想象这个设备 应用在缺少医师，25％的疾病负担 仅有1.3%的医疗人员 的发展中国家。

translation.en: When this device sequences an RNA or DNA virus  that it doesn't recognize,  it calls the CDC  and prevents the pandemic from happening in the first place.
translation.zh: 如果这个设备对病毒的RNA或者DNA进行测序后 无法识别， 它会呼叫疾病控制中心 第一时间防止大规模疫情的爆发。

translation.en: But here, here is the biggest force  for bringing about a world of abundance.
translation.zh: 还有最能创造 富足的世界的力量。

translation.en: I call it the rising billion.
translation.zh: 我称之为“崛起的十亿人”。

translation.en: So the white lines here are population.
translation.zh: 这道白线代表人口。

translation.en: We just passed the seven billion mark on Earth.
translation.zh: 地球上的人口最近超过了70亿。

translation.en: And by the way,  the biggest protection against a population explosion  is making the world educated  and healthy.
