translation.en: So if anyone would like a hundred million copies of my business card,  I have plenty for everyone in the room,  and, in fact, everyone in the world,  and it's right here.
translation.zh: 所以如果有人需要数百万份我的名片， 我有足够多份给在座每个人， 甚至是全世界每个人， 就在这。

translation.en: If I had really been a egotist,  I would have put it into a virus and released it in the room.
translation.zh: 要是我是个自大的人， 我就会把它放到病毒里散布到屋子中。

translation.en: So what was the next step?
translation.zh: 所以下一步是什么？

translation.en: Writing down the DNA was an interesting step.
translation.zh: 记录去氧核糖核酸是有趣的一步。

translation.en: And that caused these cells --  that kept them happy for another billion years.
translation.zh: 它导致了细胞的形成—— 让它们又高兴了几十亿年。

translation.en: But then there was another really interesting step  where things became completely different,  which is these cells started exchanging and communicating information,  so that they began to get communities of cells.
translation.zh: 不过还有个很有趣的环节 事情开始变得完全不同， 那就是这些细胞开始交换和交流资讯， 从而形成细胞团体。

translation.en: I don't know if you know this,  but bacteria can actually exchange DNA.
translation.zh: 我不知道你们是否知道这个， 细菌实际上就可以交换去氧核糖核酸。

translation.en: Now that's why, for instance,  antibiotic resistance has evolved.
translation.zh: 这就是为什么，比如， 演变出抗菌免疫。

translation.en: Some bacteria figured out how to stay away from penicillin,  and it went around sort of creating its little DNA information  with other bacteria,  and now we have a lot of bacteria that are resistant to penicillin,  because bacteria communicate.
translation.zh: 有些细菌知道怎么远离青霉素， 然后它创造它这点去氧核糖核酸资讯， 并在别的细菌中到处游走， 现在我们有很多对青霉素免疫的细菌了， 因为细菌会交流资讯。

translation.en: Now what this communication allowed  was communities to form  that, in some sense, were in the same boat together;  they were synergistic.
translation.zh: 这样，这些交流致使 群落的形成， 在某种意义上，它们在同一条船上了； 它们是协作的。

translation.en: So they survived  or they failed together,  which means that if a community was very successful,  all the individuals in that community  were repeated more  and they were favored by evolution.
translation.zh: 因此它们一起幸存下来 或者一起死去， 也就是说如果一个群落成功了， 所有群落里的个体 都能复制更多， 进化得更有利。

translation.en: Now the transition point happened  when these communities got so close  that, in fact, they got together  and decided to write down the whole recipe for the community  together on one string of DNA.
translation.zh: 于是，转换点到了， 当这些族群很亲近时， 事实上，它们聚集到一起 并决定在一条去氧核糖核酸上 写下整个族群的成分谱。

translation.en: And so the next stage that's interesting in life  took about another billion years.
translation.zh: 生命中下一个有趣的阶段 又要几十亿年。

translation.en: And at that stage,  we have multi-cellular communities,  communities of lots of different types of cells,  working together as a single organism.
translation.zh: 在这个时期， 有多细胞族群， 就是有很多种不同细胞的群落， 作为有机体一起合作。

translation.en: And in fact, we're such a multi-cellular community.
translation.zh: 实际上，我们就是这样的多细胞族群。

translation.en: We have lots of cells  that are not out for themselves anymore.
translation.zh: 我们有很多细胞， 它们不再是只为自己存活。

translation.en: Your skin cell is really useless  without a heart cell, muscle cell,  a brain cell and so on.
translation.zh: 皮肤细胞根本没用， 要是没有心脏细胞，肌肉细胞， 脑细胞等等。

translation.en: So these communities began to evolve  so that the interesting level on which evolution was taking place  was no longer a cell,  but a community which we call an organism.
translation.zh: 所以这些族群开始进化 这样发生有趣的进化的 不再仅仅是单一细胞。 而是我们称为有机体的族群。

translation.en: Now the next step that happened  is within these communities.
translation.zh: 接下来发生 就是在这些族群中。

translation.en: These communities of cells,  again, began to abstract information.
translation.zh: 这些细胞群落， 再次，开始提取资讯。

translation.en: And they began building very special structures  that did nothing but process information within the community.
translation.zh: 它们开始构建非常特别的 专门处理群落内资讯的结构。

translation.en: And those are the neural structures.
translation.zh: 这些就是神经结构。

translation.en: So neurons are the information processing apparatus  that those communities of cells built up.
translation.zh: 所以神经元是 这些细胞群建立的资讯处理仪器。

translation.en: And in fact, they began to get specialists in the community  and special structures  that were responsible for recording,  understanding, learning information.
translation.zh: 实际上，群落里开始出现专家 以及特殊结构 负责记录， 理解，学习资讯。

translation.en: And that was the brains and the nervous system  And that gave them an evolutionary advantage.
translation.zh: 这就是这些细胞群的 大脑和神经系统。 这给了它们进化的有利条件。

translation.en: Because at that point,  an individual --  learning could happen  within the time span of a single organism,  instead of over this evolutionary time span.
translation.zh: 因为这样的话， 对每个个体—— 学习可以发生 在单个有机体的时间跨度内， 而不是整个进化时间跨度。

translation.en: So an organism could, for instance,  learn not to eat a certain kind of fruit  because it tasted bad and it got sick last time it ate it.
translation.zh: 所以一个有机体能够，比如说， 学会不吃某种水果 因为它不好吃而且上次吃的觉得恶心。

translation.en: That could happen within the lifetime of a single organism,  whereas before they'd built these special information processing structures,  that would have had to be learned evolutionarily  over hundreds of thousands of years  by the individuals dying off that ate that kind of fruit.
translation.zh: 这可以发生在一个单个有机体的一生中， 然后在这种特殊信息处理结构建成前， 这得要进化学习 千万年， 通过吃了这种水果前仆后继死去的个体。

translation.en: So that nervous system,  the fact that they built these special information structures,  tremendously sped up the whole process of evolution.
translation.zh: 所以神经系统， 生物组建这种特殊结构的事实， 极大地加速了进化的进程。

translation.en: Because evolution could now happen within an individual.
translation.zh: 因为至此进化可以在个体中发生了。

translation.en: It could happen in learning time scales.
translation.zh: 它能发生在学习的时间跨度内。

translation.en: But then what happened  was the individuals worked out,  of course, tricks of communicating.
translation.zh: 但是接下来发生的 是每个个体发现了， 当然，交流的秘诀。

translation.en: And for example,  the most sophisticated version that we're aware of is human language.
translation.zh: 比如说， 我们所知道的最精密的版本就是人类语言。

translation.en: It's really a pretty amazing invention if you think about it.
translation.zh: 想想看，这真是个奇妙的发明。

translation.en: Here I have a very complicated, messy,  confused idea in my head.
translation.zh: 我脑子里有个很复杂，混乱， 疑惑的想法。

translation.en: I'm sitting here making grunting sounds basically,  and hopefully constructing a similar messy, confused idea in your head  that bears some analogy to it.
translation.zh: 我坐在这，基本上就是吐字发声， 希望在你们头脑里建立一个类似的混乱 跟它有点类似的想法。

translation.en: But we're taking something very complicated,  turning it into sound, sequences of sounds,  and producing something very complicated in your brain.
translation.zh: 但是我们正在把很复杂的东西 转化成声音，一连串的声音， 并在你们大脑产生很复杂的东西。

translation.en: So this allows us now  to begin to start functioning  as a single organism.
translation.zh: 所以现在这推动我们 开始运作 作为单个有机体。

translation.en: And so, in fact, what we've done  is we, humanity,  have started abstracting out.
translation.zh: 所以，实际上，我们已经完成的 就是我们，人类， 开始抽离出来。

translation.en: We're going through the same levels  that multi-cellular organisms have gone through --  abstracting out our methods of recording,  presenting, processing information.
translation.zh: 我们正在经历多细胞有机体经历的 相同的阶段—— 提取我们记录， 展示，处理资讯的方式。

translation.en: So for example, the invention of language  was a tiny step in that direction.
translation.zh: 比如说，语言的发明 就是这个方向上很小一步。

translation.en: Telephony, computers,  videotapes, CD-ROMs and so on  are all our specialized mechanisms  that we've now built within our society  for handling that information.
translation.zh: 电话，电脑， 影碟，光碟等等 都是我们的特殊机制， 我们正在社会里构建 用来处理资讯的机制。

translation.en: And it all connects us together  into something  that is much bigger  and much faster  and able to evolve  So now, evolution can take place  on a scale of microseconds.
translation.zh: 这些都是把我们联系在一起， 变的 比我们之前 更大， 更快， 更有能力进化。 所以，现在进化可以发生在 微妙的时间跨度级上。

translation.en: And you saw Ty's little evolutionary example  where he sort of did a little bit of evolution  on the Convolution program right before your eyes.
translation.zh: 你们看过泰伊的那个进化的小例子 它好像就在你们眼前的卷积程式上 展现了一点进化了。

translation.en: So now we've speeded up the time scales once again.
translation.zh: 所以现在我们再次加快时间跨度。

translation.en: So the first steps of the story that I told you about  took a billion years a piece.
translation.zh: 我讲的故事的第一步 每一步花费了几十亿年。

translation.en: And the next steps,  like nervous systems and brains,  took a few hundred million years.
translation.zh: 下一步， 像神经系统和大脑， 消耗几百万年。

translation.en: Then the next steps, like language and so on,  took less than a million years.
translation.zh: 再接下来，像语言等等， 需要不到一百万年。

translation.en: And these next steps, like electronics,  seem to be taking only a few decades.
translation.zh: 再下一步，像电子器件， 仿佛只要几十年。

translation.en: The process is feeding on itself  and becoming, I guess, autocatalytic is the word for it --  when something reinforces its rate of change.
translation.zh: 这个过程是自给自足， 并且变成，我猜，应该自我催化描述更合适—— 当事物加快改变的速度。

translation.en: The more it changes, the faster it changes.
translation.zh: 变化越多，变化就越快。

translation.en: And I think that that's what we're seeing here in this explosion of curve.
translation.zh: 我想这就是我们在这看到的激增曲线。

translation.en: We're seeing this process feeding back on itself.
translation.zh: 我们看到这个过程回馈到自己。

translation.en: Now I design computers for a living,  and I know that the mechanisms  that I use to design computers  would be impossible  without recent advances in computers.
translation.zh: 我现在工作就是自己设计电脑， 我知道用来设计电脑的 这些机制 不可能存在， 要是没有近期电脑的进步。

translation.en: So right now, what I do  is I design objects at such complexity  that it's really impossible for me to design them in the traditional sense.
translation.zh: 现在，我做的 是设计复杂到 不可能从传统意义上设计的物体。

translation.en: I don't know what every transistor in the connection machine does.
translation.zh: 我不知道连接机器上每个电晶体的作用。

translation.en: There are billions of them.
translation.zh: 有几十亿电晶体。

translation.en: Instead, what I do  and what the designers at Thinking Machines do  is we think at some level of abstraction  and then we hand it to the machine  and the machine takes it beyond what we could ever do,  much farther and faster than we could ever do.
translation.zh: 实际上，我所做的 思考机器的设计师们做的， 我们认为是为某种程度的资讯抽取， 然后把它传给机器 而机器把它运用到超出我们所能做的范围， 而且比我们从前所做的更深远更快。

translation.en: And in fact, sometimes it takes it by methods  that we don't quite even understand.
translation.zh: 实际上，有时候它采用的方法 我们并不很懂。

translation.en: One method that's particularly interesting  that I've been using a lot lately  is evolution itself.
translation.zh: 有个尤其有趣 我最近一直在用的 就是进化本身。

translation.en: So what we do  is we put inside the machine  a process of evolution  that takes place on the microsecond time scale.
translation.zh: 我们做的就是 在机器里 放入一个进化进程， 这个进程在微妙时间跨度上就能发生。

translation.en: So for example,  in the most extreme cases,  we can actually evolve a program  by starting out with random sequences of instructions.
translation.zh: 比如， 大部分极端情况下， 我们实际上能 通过从随机的指令序列开始进化一个程式。

translation.en: Say, "Computer, would you please make  a hundred million random sequences of instructions.
translation.zh: 说“电脑，请你产生 一亿随机指令序列。

translation.en: Now would you please run all of those random sequences of instructions,  run all of those programs,  and pick out the ones that came closest to doing what I wanted."
translation.zh: 现在请你运行所有这些随机指令列， 运行所有程式， 并选出最接近我想要的。”

translation.en: So in other words, I define what I wanted.
translation.zh: 也就是说，我定义我要什么。

translation.en: Let's say I want to sort numbers,  as a simple example I've done it with.
translation.zh: 假设我需要分类资料， 这是个我用它试验过的简单例子。

translation.en: So find the programs that come closest to sorting numbers.
translation.zh: 找到最接近资料分类的程式。

translation.en: So of course, random sequences of instructions  are very unlikely to sort numbers,  so none of them will really do it.
translation.zh: 当然，随机的指令序列 非常不可能分类资料， 所以它们中没有一个能完成。

translation.en: But one of them, by luck,  may put two numbers in the right order.
translation.zh: 但是中间有一个，运气很好， 可能会把两个数按顺序排列。

translation.en: And I say, "Computer,  would you please now take the 10 percent  of those random sequences that did the best job.
translation.zh: 我说，“电脑， 请你现在选出序列中百分之十 完成得最好的。

translation.en: Save those. Kill off the rest.
translation.zh: 保存这些。删掉其他的。

translation.en: And now let's reproduce  the ones that sorted numbers the best.
translation.zh: 现在来复制 资料分类得最好的这些。

translation.en: And let's reproduce them by a process of recombination  analogous to sex."
translation.zh: 以类似交配的重组过程 来复制它们。

translation.en: Take two programs and they produce children  by exchanging their subroutines,  and the children inherit the traits of the subroutines of the two programs.
translation.zh: 取两个程式 交换它们的副程式让它们产生子女， 这些子女继承了两个程式副程式的特征。

translation.en: So I've got now a new generation of programs  that are produced by combinations  of the programs that did a little bit better job.
translation.zh: 所以我得到新一代的 由组合做的比较好的程式 而产生的程式。

translation.en: Say, "Please repeat that process."
translation.zh: 说，“请重复这个过程。”

translation.en: Score them again.
translation.zh: 再做一次。

translation.en: Introduce some mutations perhaps.
translation.zh: 可能引入一些突变。

translation.en: And try that again and do that for another generation.
translation.zh: 再试一次并用在新的一代上。

translation.en: Well every one of those generations just takes a few milliseconds.
translation.zh: 这一代上每个程式只需要几毫秒。

translation.en: So I can do the equivalent  of millions of years of evolution on that  or in the complicated cases, in a few hours.
translation.zh: 所以我在电脑上用几分钟 能做等同于 几百万年的进化过程， 或者，情况复杂时，在几小时内完成。

translation.en: At the end of that, I end up with programs  that are absolutely perfect at sorting numbers.
translation.zh: 结束时，我得到 绝对完美的分类资料的程式。

translation.en: In fact, they are programs that are much more efficient  than programs I could have ever written by hand.
translation.zh: 实际上，这些程式比我手写的 任何程式都要有效率。

translation.en: Now if I look at those programs,  I can't tell you how they work.
translation.zh: 现在，如果我读这些程式， 我说不出它们怎么工作的。

translation.en: I've tried looking at them and telling you how they work.
translation.zh: 我尝试过阅读并且解释它们如何工作的。

translation.en: They're obscure, weird programs.
translation.zh: 它们很抽象，奇怪。

translation.en: But they do the job.
translation.zh: 但是它们能完成任务。

translation.en: And in fact, I know, I'm very confident that they do the job  because they come from a line  of hundreds of thousands of programs that did the job.
translation.zh: 实际上，我知道，我很有信心，它们能完成任务 因为它们来自于一行 上千万能完成认为的程式。

translation.en: In fact, their life depended on doing the job.
translation.zh: 事实上，它们的生命就是靠着这工作。

translation.en: I was riding in a 747  with Marvin Minsky once,  and he pulls out this card and says, "Oh look. Look at this.
translation.zh: 我曾经有一次 和马文·明斯基一起坐747， 他拿出一张卡，说，“看，看这。

translation.en: It says, 'This plane has hundreds of thousands of tiny parts  working together to make you a safe flight.'  Doesn't that make you feel confident?"
translation.zh: 这上面说，‘本飞机有很多精密部件 协作，保障你飞行安全。’ 这是不是让你很有信心？”

translation.en: In fact, we know that the engineering process doesn't work very well  when it gets complicated.
translation.zh: 事实上，我们知道工程过程复杂化 并不能很好工作。

translation.en: So we're beginning to depend on computers  to do a process that's very different than engineering.
translation.zh: 所以我们开始依赖电脑 来做与工程有很大不同的一个过程。

translation.en: And it lets us produce things of much more complexity  than normal engineering lets us produce.
translation.zh: 它能让我们生产出 比普通工程能生产的更复杂的东西。

translation.en: And yet, we don't quite understand the options of it.
translation.zh: 然而，我们还不明白它的选择。

translation.en: So in a sense, it's getting ahead of us.
translation.zh: 从某种意义上说，电脑比我们超前。

translation.en: We're now using those programs  to make much faster computers  so that we'll be able to run this process much faster.
translation.zh: 我们现在正用这些程式 创造更快的电脑 以便能更快地运行这个进程。

translation.en: So it's feeding back on itself.
translation.zh: 所以它是自我回馈的。

translation.en: The thing is becoming faster  and that's why I think it seems so confusing.
translation.zh: 这正变得更快， 这也是为什么我觉得电脑似乎很让人摸不清。

translation.en: Because all of these technologies are feeding back on themselves.
translation.zh: 由于所有这些技术都回馈给自己。

translation.en: We're taking off.
translation.zh: 我们正在起飞。

translation.en: And what we are is we're at a point in time  which is analogous to when single-celled organisms  were turning into multi-celled organisms.
translation.zh: 我们正是在时间的某一点， 这一点类似于单细胞有机体 正转变成多细胞机体的时刻。

translation.en: So we're the amoebas  and we can't quite figure out what the hell this thing is we're creating.
translation.zh: 我们就像变形虫。 搞不清自己正在创造的是什么东西。

translation.en: We're right at that point of transition.
translation.zh: 我们正在转折点上。

translation.en: But I think that there really is something coming along after us.
translation.zh: 不过我认为一定有跟随着我们的东西。

translation.en: I think it's very haughty of us  to think that we're the end product of evolution.
translation.zh: 我想它是很崇拜我们的， 认为我们是进化的终极产物。

translation.en: And I think all of us here  are a part of producing  whatever that next thing is.
translation.zh: 我认为我们这所有人 都是繁衍的一部分， 无论下一步是什么。

translation.en: So lunch is coming along,  and I think I will stop at that point,  before I get selected out.
translation.zh: 午饭时间快到了， 趁我还没被选走， 我想我就在这里结束。

translation.en: I think we have to do something  about a piece of the culture of medicine that has to change.
translation.zh: 我觉得在当今的医学文化中， 有一部份文化必须要开始改变。

translation.en: And I think it starts with one physician, and that's me.
translation.zh: 而这个改变可以从一个医生开始，那就是我。

translation.en: And maybe I've been around long enough  that I can afford to give away some of my false prestige  to be able to do that.
translation.zh: 或许是因为我已经行医多年， 我可以承受放弃一些虚无的名利 来开始这样的改变。

translation.en: Before I actually begin the meat of my talk,  let's begin with a bit of baseball.
translation.zh: 在进入主题之前， 让我们先谈谈棒球吧。

translation.en: Hey, why not?
translation.zh: 为什么不呢？

translation.en: We're near the end, we're getting close to the World Series.
translation.zh: 常规赛季就快结束，世界职业棒球大赛即将开始。

translation.en: We all love baseball, don't we?
translation.zh: 我们都喜爱棒球，不是吗？

translation.en: Baseball is filled with some amazing statistics.
translation.zh: 棒球的世界中充斥着成千上百种

translation.en: And there's hundreds of them.
translation.zh: 让人咋舌的统计数据。

translation.en: "Moneyball" is about to come out, and it's all about statistics  and using statistics to build a great baseball team.
translation.zh: 即将上映的电影 “点球成金”，便是完全关于统计数据， 以及如何在这些数据的基础上建造一个伟大的球队。

translation.en: I'm going to focus on one stat  that I hope a lot of you have heard of.
translation.zh: 我想讲一个 我希望大家都听说过的数据，

translation.en: It's called batting average.
translation.zh: 叫做击球率。

translation.en: So we talk about a 300, a batter who bats 300.
translation.zh: 当我们说一名挥棒球员的击球率为三成的时候，

translation.en: That means that ballplayer batted safely, hit safely  three times out of 10 at bats.
translation.zh: 我们是指这位球员的打击非常稳定， 每十次种就会有三次安打。

translation.en: That means hit the ball into the outfield,  it dropped, it didn't get caught,  and whoever tried to throw it to first base didn't get there in time  and the runner was safe.
translation.zh: 安打意味着球会被击中并被打入外野， 而且并不会被立刻接杀， 球也不会在跑者成功上到一垒之前 被及时的传回。

translation.en: Three times out of 10.
translation.zh: 十次中有三次安打。

translation.en: Do you know what they call a 300 hitter  in Major League Baseball?
translation.zh: 各位知道棒球大联盟如何评论 这些击球率上了三成的球员吗？

translation.en: Good, really good,  maybe an all-star.
translation.zh: 很棒，非常棒， 明星球员一般的棒。

translation.en: Do you know what they call  a 400 baseball hitter?
translation.zh: 各位知道他们又是如何称呼一位 击球率有着四成，

translation.en: That's somebody who hit, by the way,  four times safely out of every 10.
translation.zh: 也就是每十次打击 就会打出四个安打的球员吗。

translation.en: Legendary --  as in Ted Williams legendary --  the last Major League Baseball player  to hit over 400 during a regular season.
translation.zh: 是传奇 -- 像泰德. 威廉斯那样的传奇-- 他是棒球大联盟里最后一个在常规赛中 拥有超过四成击球率的球员。

translation.en: Now let's take this back into my world of medicine  where I'm a lot more comfortable,  or perhaps a bit less comfortable  after what I'm going to talk to you about.
translation.zh: 现在让我们回到我的世界 - 医疗领域。 这个领域我比较熟悉， 但我接下来要说的 却让我有些困扰。

translation.en: Suppose you have appendicitis  and you're referred to a surgeon  who's batting 400 on appendectomies.
translation.zh: 假设你得了阑尾炎， 然后你被推荐给了一位 在阑尾移除手术中有着四成“击球率”的外科医生。

translation.en: Somehow this isn't working out, is it?
translation.zh: 这听起来怪怪的，对吧？

translation.en: Now suppose you live  in a certain part of a certain remote place  and you have a loved one  who has blockages in two coronary arteries  and your family doctor refers that loved one to a cardiologist  who's batting 200 on angioplasties.
translation.zh: 又假设你住在 某一个较为偏远的地区， 而你所爱的人的 两条冠状动脉都被堵塞。 你的家庭医生将她推荐给了一位在血管成形手术上 有着两成“击球率”的心脏科医师。

translation.en: But, but, you know what?
translation.zh: 但是，等等，你知道吗？

translation.en: She's doing a lot better this year. She's on the comeback trail.
translation.zh: 她今年的表现有着很大的提高，她的水准也在恢复。

translation.en: And she's hitting a 257.
translation.zh: 她的“击球率”达到了两成五。

translation.en: Somehow this isn't working.
translation.zh: 但是这样还是不能被接受。

translation.en: But I'm going to ask you a question.
translation.zh: 而我现在想问各位一个问题。

translation.en: What do you think a batting average  for a cardiac surgeon or a nurse practitioner  or an orthopedic surgeon,  an OBGYN, a paramedic  is supposed to be?
translation.zh: 你们认为， 一位心脏外科医生，或一位职业护理师， 一位骨科外科医生 妇产科医生或急救人员的 “击球率” 应该是多少？

translation.en: 1,000, very good.
translation.zh: 十成？非常好。

translation.en: Now truth of the matter is,  nobody knows in all of medicine  what a good surgeon  or physician or paramedic  is supposed to bat.
translation.zh: 事实上， 医学界中没有人知道 一个好的外科医生， 医师或急救人员 应该有多少的 “击球率”。

translation.en: What we do though is we send each one of them, including myself,  out into the world  with the admonition, be perfect.
translation.zh: 我们将他们每个人，包括我自己， 送上职业岗位后 便告诫他们以完美来要求自己 --

translation.en: Never ever, ever make a mistake,  but you worry about the details, about how that's going to happen.
translation.zh: 绝对，绝对不能作出错误的诊断 -- 但我们让他们自己考虑细节，考虑如何达到这样的标准。

translation.en: And that was the message that I absorbed  when I was in med school.
translation.zh: 这就是我在医学院时 得到的信息。

translation.en: I was an obsessive compulsive student.
translation.zh: 我是一个有着强迫症倾向的学生。

translation.en: In high school, a classmate once said  that Brian Goldman would study for a blood test.
translation.zh: 在中学时，有个同学曾经说 布莱恩.高德曼会为了血液测验复习。

translation.en: And so I did.
translation.zh: 而我的确这么做了。

translation.en: And I studied in my little garret  at the nurses' residence at Toronto General Hospital,  not far from here.
translation.zh: 我在离这不远处的多伦多总医院里 护士住宅里的一个小阁楼中， 完成了我的学业。

translation.en: And I memorized everything.
translation.zh: 我背下了所有东西。

translation.en: I memorized in my anatomy class  the origins and exertions of every muscle,  every branch of every artery that came off the aorta,  differential diagnoses obscure and common.
translation.zh: 我背下了解剖课中 提到的每一块肌肉的起端和伸展方式， 每一条从主动脉延伸出来的动脉的分支系统， 以及一切鲜为人知的或者常见的鉴别诊断。

translation.en: I even knew the differential diagnosis  in how to classify renal tubular acidosis.
translation.zh: 我甚至知道如何鉴别诊断 不同的肾小管性酸中毒症。

translation.en: And all the while,  I was amassing more and more knowledge.
translation.zh: 在这段时间中， 我积累了越来越多的知识。

translation.en: And I did well, I graduated with honors,  And I came out of medical school  with the impression  that if I memorized everything and knew everything,  or as much as possible,  as close to everything as possible,  that it would immunize me against making mistakes.
translation.zh: 我的表现很好， 并以优等的成绩毕业。 当我从医学院出来时， 我觉得 我只要记下和明白了所有的东西 – 或者稍退一步 – 将近所有的东西， 那我犯医疗错误的几率就会微乎其微。

translation.en: for a while,  until I met Mrs. Drucker.
translation.zh: 而我在一段时间之内 的确没有犯错。 直到我遇到了 Drucker 女士。

translation.en: I was a resident at a teaching hospital here in Toronto  when Mrs. Drucker was brought to the emergency department  of the hospital where I was working.
translation.zh: Drucker 女士被带入多伦多的 一家教学医院的急诊室时， 我正作为一个实习医生在那里工作。

translation.en: At the time I was assigned to the cardiology service  on a cardiology rotation.
translation.zh: 当时我正因心脏科轮调 而被指派在心血管诊所。

translation.en: And it was my job,  when the emergency staff called for a cardiology consult,  to see that patient in emerg.
translation.zh: 我的工作是， 当紧急救护人员需要有关于心脏的专业会诊时， 在急症室诊断病人，

translation.en: and to report back to my attending.
translation.zh: 并在之后向负责我的主治医生汇报。

translation.en: And I saw Mrs. Drucker, and she was breathless.
translation.zh: 当我见到Drucker女士的时候，她的气息已经很微弱。

translation.en: And when I listened to her, she was making a wheezy sound.
translation.zh: 在我与她交谈时，我听到她的呼吸有喘息的声音。

translation.en: And when I listened to her chest with a stethoscope,  I could hear crackly sounds on both sides  that told me that she was in congestive heart failure.
translation.zh: 当我用听诊器聆听她的胸腔时， 两边都传来的爆裂的声音告诉我， 这是郁血性心脏衰竭。

translation.en: This is a condition in which the heart fails,  and instead of being able to pump all the blood forward,  some of the blood backs up into the lung, the lungs fill up with blood,  and that's why you have shortness of breath.
translation.zh: 这是由于心脏在衰竭后， 无法将所有的血液完全的输送出去， 而导致部分血液回流入肺脏。肺脏里充满了血液， 而造成呼吸短促。

translation.en: And that wasn't a difficult diagnosis to make.
translation.zh: 这不是一个困难的诊断。

translation.en: I made it and I set to work treating her.
translation.zh: 作出诊断后我开始着手帮她治疗。

translation.en: I gave her aspirin. I gave her medications to relieve the strain on her heart.
translation.zh: 我开给了她阿司匹林，并给了她一些可以减轻她心脏负担的药物。

translation.en: I gave her medications that we call diuretics, water pills,  to get her to pee out the access fluid.
translation.zh: 我还给了她一些利尿剂，俗称水丸， 帮助她将体内多余的水分排出。

translation.en: And over the course of the next hour and a half or two,  she started to feel better.
translation.zh: 在接下来的一两个小时里， 她开始觉得好转，

translation.en: And I felt really good.
translation.zh: 我也感到高兴。

translation.en: And that's when I made my first mistake;  I sent her home.
translation.zh: 而就在此时我犯了第一个错误： 我让她回了家。

translation.en: Actually, I made two more mistakes.
translation.zh: 正确的来说，我还犯了两个错误。

translation.en: I sent her home  without speaking to my attending.
translation.zh: 我在和我的主治汇报之前 便让她回了家。

translation.en: I didn't pick up the phone and do what I was supposed to do,  which was call my attending and run the story by him  so he would have a chance to see her for himself.
translation.zh: 我没有做我照着我应该做的， 拿起电话打给我的主治并让他看一下这个案例， 给他一个亲自见见这名病患的机会。

translation.en: And he knew her,  he would have been able to furnish additional information about her.
translation.zh: 我的主治认识她， 因此可以提供更详细的病历资料。

translation.en: Maybe I did it for a good reason.
translation.zh: 或许我有这么做的理由。

translation.en: Maybe I didn't want to be a high-maintenance resident.
translation.zh: 或许我并不想做一个需要经常地指导的实习医生。

translation.en: Maybe I wanted to be so successful  and so able to take responsibility  that I would do so  and I would be able to take care of my attending's patients  without even having to contact him.
translation.zh: 也许我太想 可以独当一面， 可以不需要 和我的主治沟通 便照顾好他的病患。

translation.en: The second mistake that I made was worse.
translation.zh: 而我犯的第二个错误更加严重。

translation.en: In sending her home,  I disregarded a little voice deep down inside  that was trying to tell me,  "Goldman, not a good idea. Don't do this."
translation.zh: 在让她回家时， 我忽视了我内心一个微小的声音。 这个声音试图告诉我： “高德曼，这样不好，不要这么做。”

translation.en: In fact, so lacking in confidence was I  that I actually asked the nurse  who was looking after Mrs. Drucker,  "Do you think it's okay if she goes home?"
translation.zh: 其实，当时的我是如此的没有自信， 以至于我甚至向照顾Drucker女士 的护士寻求了意见： “你觉得让她回家好么？”

translation.en: And the nurse thought about it  and said very matter-of-factly, "Yeah, I think she'll do okay."
translation.zh: 那位护士想了想， 然后就事论事的说：“嗯，我觉得没有问题。”

translation.en: I can remember that like it was yesterday.
translation.zh: 这一切对我来说，都还像是发生在了昨天。

translation.en: So I signed the discharge papers,  and an ambulance came, paramedics came to take her home.
translation.zh: 我在出院单上签了名， 一辆救护车来后急救人员将她送回了家。

translation.en: And I went back to my work on the wards.
translation.zh: 之后我回到了我在诊所的工作。

translation.en: All the rest of that day,  that afternoon,  I had this kind of gnawing feeling inside my stomach.
translation.zh: 在接下来的一天中， 那天下午， 我的肠胃有着一种翻滚的感觉。

translation.en: But I carried on with my work.
translation.zh: 但我还是照常的继续工作。

translation.en: And at the end of the day, I packed up to leave the hospital  and walked to the parking lot  to take my car and drive home  when I did something that I don't usually do.
translation.zh: 在工作结束后，我整理了下便离开了医院。 在我走向停车场 去取我的车的路程中， 我做了一件我平常不会做的事情。

translation.en: I walked through the emergency department on my way home.
translation.zh: 我从急诊室借了道。

translation.en: And it was there that another nurse,  not the nurse who was looking after Mrs. Drucker before, but another nurse,  said three words to me  that are the three words  that most emergency physicians I know dread.
translation.zh: 而就在那里，另外一位护士， 不是之前照顾Drucker女士的那位， 对我说了 绝大部分急诊医生 都害怕听到的三个字。

translation.en: Others in medicine dread them as well,  but there's something particular about emergency medicine  because we see patients so fleetingly.
translation.zh: 其他科系的医生也害怕这三个字， 但因为急诊医生看的病人都来去匆匆， 这三个字对我们有着特别的意义。

translation.en: The three words are:  Do you remember?
translation.zh: 这三个字是： 记得吗？

translation.en: "Do you remember that patient you sent home?"
translation.zh: “记得吗？你送回家的那个患者？”

translation.en: the other nurse asked matter-of-factly.
translation.zh: 那位护士就事论事的问道。

translation.en: "Well she's back,"  in just that tone of voice.
translation.zh: “她又回来了。” 她就用了这样平常的语调。

translation.en: Well she was back all right.
translation.zh: 她的确回来了。

translation.en: She was back and near death.
translation.zh: 回来时已经濒临死亡。

translation.en: About an hour after she had arrived home,  after I'd sent her home,  she collapsed and her family called 911  and the paramedics brought her back to the emergency department  where she had a blood pressure of 50,  which is in severe shock.
translation.zh: 在我让她回家后 大约一个小时后， 她昏倒在了地上，她的家人打了911， 急救人员将她重新带回了急诊室。 此时的她已严重休克， 血压只有 50。

translation.en: And she was barely breathing and she was blue.
translation.zh: 她的呼吸极其微弱，面色发青。

translation.en: And the emerg. staff pulled out all the stops.
translation.zh: 急救人员们使出了浑身解数。

translation.en: They gave her medications to raise her blood pressure.
translation.zh: 他们给了她提升血压的药物，

translation.en: They put her on a ventilator.
translation.zh: 并将她连接上了人工呼吸器。

translation.en: And I was shocked  and shaken to the core.
translation.zh: 我震惊不已， 吓得不得了。

translation.en: And I went through this roller coaster,  because after they stabilized her,  she went to the intensive care unit,  and I hoped against hope that she would recover.
translation.zh: 之后我的心情便像是做着云霄飞车一般， 因为当他们将她的情况稳定下来后， 便将她送进了加护病房， 我在绝望中希望她能够醒过来。

translation.en: And over the next two or three days,  it was clear that she was never going to wake up.
translation.zh: 但在接下来的两三天中， 她再也不会醒来的可能性越来越大。

translation.en: She had irreversible brain damage.
translation.zh: 她的脑部已经受到了无法逆转的损伤。

translation.en: And the family gathered.
translation.zh: 她的家人聚在了一起。

translation.en: And over the course of the next eight or nine days,  they resigned themselves to what was happening.
translation.zh: 在接下来的八到九天里， 他们慢慢的接受了这件事实。

translation.en: And at about the nine day mark, they let her go --  Mrs. Drucker,  a wife, a mother  and a grandmother.
translation.zh: 在第九天，他们选择让她离开人间 -- Drucker女士， 一个家庭的妻子，母亲， 和祖母。

translation.en: They say you never forget the names  of those who die.
translation.zh: 有人说你永远不会忘记那些 (因你的疏忽而过世的）人的名字，

translation.en: And that was my first time to be acquainted with that.
translation.zh: 而那是我第一次意识到这句话的现实。

translation.en: Over the next few weeks,  I beat myself up  and I experienced for the first time  the unhealthy shame that exists  in our culture of medicine --  where I felt alone, isolated,  not feeling the healthy kind of shame that you feel,  because you can't talk about it with your colleagues.
translation.zh: 在接下来的几个星期内， 我无比的沮丧， 并第一次经历了 那种在医学文化中存在的 危险的羞愧感 -- 我觉得孤单无助。 这不是那种健康的羞愧感， 因为你不能和你的同事提起讨论它。

translation.en: You know that healthy kind,  when you betray a secret that a best friend made you promise never to reveal  and then you get busted  and then your best friend confronts you  and you have terrible discussions,  but at the end of it all that sick feeling guides you  and you say, I'll never make that mistake again.
translation.zh: – 就是那种， 当你背叛了对挚友的承诺而说出了答应要保守的秘密， 并被他知道了以后， 你的挚友找你算账时， 虽然你们会争执不休， 但最后那层罪恶感仍然会主导你， 你告诉自己，我绝对不会再犯同样的错误。

translation.en: And you make amends and you never make that mistake again.
translation.zh: 如是，你做了修正的承诺，然后你永不会再犯那样的错。

translation.en: That's the kind of shame that is a teacher.
translation.zh: 这种羞愧有着教导的作用。

translation.en: The unhealthy shame I'm talking about  is the one that makes you so sick inside.
translation.zh: 而我所说的那种非良性的羞愧 会让你愧对于心。

translation.en: It's the one that says,  not that what you did was bad,  but that you are bad.
translation.zh: 它会对你说， 并非你做的是错的， 而是你根本就是坏人。

translation.en: And it was what I was feeling.
translation.zh: 这便是我当时的感觉。

translation.en: And it wasn't because of my attending; he was a doll.
translation.zh: 而这也不是因为我的主治；他人非常好。

translation.en: He talked to the family, and I'm quite sure that he smoothed things over  and made sure that I didn't get sued.
translation.zh: 他和那家人好好的谈过。我确定他为了确保 我没有被控告而替我打了圆场。

translation.en: And I kept asking myself these questions.
translation.zh: 但我仍然不断问我自己这些问题：

translation.en: Why didn't I ask my attending? Why did I send her home?
translation.zh: 为什么当时我没有联系我的主治？为什么我当时会让她回家？

translation.en: And then at my worst moments:  Why did I make such a stupid mistake?
translation.zh: 更加沮丧时，我会问： 我为什么会犯下如此愚蠢的错误？

translation.en: Why did I go into medicine?
translation.zh: 为什么我会选择进入医学界？

translation.en: Slowly but surely,  it lifted.
translation.zh: 慢慢的但稳定地， 那糟糕的感觉开始淡化了。

translation.en: I began to feel a bit better.
translation.zh: 我开始觉得缓和了些。

translation.en: And on a cloudy day,  there was a crack in the clouds and the sun started to come out  and I wondered,  maybe I could feel better again.
translation.zh: 然后在一个阴云密布的日子里， 当我看到一束阳光从云隙中探出， 我觉得， 或许我能再次感觉好起来。

translation.en: And I made myself a bargain  that if only I redouble my efforts to be perfect  and never make another mistake again,  please make the voices stop.
translation.zh: 然后我和自己做了一个约定： 如果我加倍努力做到完美， 不再犯错， 请就此让那自责的声音消去。

translation.en: And they did.
translation.zh: 那个声音的确停止了。

translation.en: And I went back to work.
translation.zh: 我回到了工作岗位。

translation.en: And then it happened again.
translation.zh: 但错误又发生了。

translation.en: Two years later I was an attending in the emergency department  at a community hospital just north of Toronto,  and I saw a 25 year-old man with a sore throat.
translation.zh: 两年后，当我在一家多伦多北部一间社区医院的 急症室做主治医生时， 我看了一位喉咙酸痛的25岁的男人。

translation.en: It was busy, I was in a bit of a hurry.
translation.zh: 当时诊所很忙，所以我也有些急。

translation.en: He kept pointing here.
translation.zh: 他不停的指着这里。

translation.en: I looked at his throat, it was a little bit pink.
translation.zh: 我看了看，他的喉咙有些红肿。

translation.en: And I gave him a prescription for penicillin  and sent him on his way.
translation.zh: 我给他开了盘尼西林的处方后 便让他离开了。

translation.en: And even as he was walking out the door,  he was still sort of pointing to his throat.
translation.zh: 即便当他走出诊所的大门的时候， 他似乎还在指着他的喉咙。

translation.en: And two days later I came to do my next emergency shift,  and that's when my chief asked to speak to me quietly in her office.
translation.zh: 两天后，又轮到我在急诊室值班。 那时我的主任要我去她的办公室里私下谈谈。

translation.en: And she said the three words:  Do you remember?
translation.zh: 她说了那三个字： 记得吗？

translation.en: "Do you remember that patient you saw with the sore throat?"
translation.zh: “记得吗？那位你看过的喉咙酸痛的患者？”

translation.en: Well it turns out, he didn't have a strep throat.
translation.zh: 原来，他并没有得链球菌性咽喉炎。

translation.en: He had a potentially life-threatening condition  called epiglottitis.
translation.zh: 得的是一种有可能威胁到生命的病症， 叫会厌炎。

translation.en: You can Google it,  but it's an infection, not of the throat, but of the upper airway,  and it can actually cause the airway to close.
translation.zh: 各位可以在谷歌上查询， 但它不是喉咙，而是上呼吸道的感染， 并有可能造成呼吸道阻塞。

translation.en: And fortunately he didn't die.
translation.zh: 幸好，他并没有过世。

translation.en: He was placed on intravenous antibiotics  and he recovered after a few days.
translation.zh: 在被安排做抗生素静脉注射的几天之后， 他便痊愈了。

translation.en: And I went through the same period of shame and recriminations  and felt cleansed and went back to work,  until it happened again and again and again.
translation.zh: 而我又回到了那个愧疚和自责的时光中， 然后等情绪平复后，又回到了工作岗位， 直到这些错误再度重复的发生。

translation.en: Twice in one emergency shift, I missed appendicitis.
translation.zh: 在同一个急诊的值班中，我两次没有发现病患得了盲肠炎。

translation.en: Now that takes some doing,  especially when you work in a hospital  that at the time saw but 14 people a night.
translation.zh: 这是很难想象会发生的事情， 尤其是当你在一间一个晚上 只见十四名病患的医院工作。

translation.en: Now in both cases, I didn't send them home  and I don't think there was any gap in their care.
translation.zh: 虽然对这两个病例，我都没有让他们回家， 而我也不觉得在治疗照顾过程中有任何空隙和差错。

translation.en: One I thought had a kidney stone.
translation.zh: 其中一位我诊断他有肾结石，

translation.en: I ordered a kidney X-ray. When it turned out to be normal,  my colleague who was doing a reassessment of the patient  noticed some tenderness in the right lower quadrant and called the surgeons.
translation.zh: 并安排了肾脏X光，但结果正常。 我的同事当时正在对病人的病情做重新的诊断。 在他留意到病人右下腹的地方有些柔软时，便联系了外科医生。

translation.en: The other one had a lot of diarrhea.
translation.zh: 另一位病患有严重的腹泻。

translation.en: I ordered some fluids to rehydrate him  and asked my colleague to reassess him.
translation.zh: 我给了他一些液体帮助他补充水分， 并让我的同事重新看了看。

translation.en: And he did  and when he noticed some tenderness in the right lower quadrant, called the surgeons.
translation.zh: 他照做了。 当他注意到病人右下腹有些柔软时，也联系了外科医生。

translation.en: In both cases,  they had their operations and they did okay.
translation.zh: 这两名病患 都做了手术并康复了。

translation.en: But each time,  they were gnawing at me, eating at me.
translation.zh: 但每当我想到这两起病例， 那种感觉都会折磨啃噬我。

translation.en: And I'd like to be able to say to you  that my worst mistakes only happened in the first five years of practice  as many of my colleagues say, which is total B.S.
translation.zh: 而我也希望我可以告诉你 我造成的最严重的错误只发生在了我开始行医的前五年， 像我众多的同事所称一般。但这完全是扯淡。

translation.en: Some of my doozies have been in the last five years.
translation.zh: 在最近的五年中，我也犯了一些错误。

translation.en: Alone, ashamed and unsupported.
translation.zh: 我依然觉得孤独，羞愧，无助。

translation.en: Here's the problem:  If I can't come clean  and talk about my mistakes,  if I can't find the still-small voice  that tells me what really happened,  how can I share it with my colleagues?
translation.zh: 但问题的症结是： 如果我不能理清 和谈论我所犯过的错误， 如果我无法找到那可以告诉我错误的源头的 那仍然微小的声音， 我又如何能和我的同事分享我的经验？

translation.en: How can I teach them about what I did  so that they don't do the same thing?
translation.zh: 我又如何教导他们， 让他们不再重蹈我的覆辙？

translation.en: If I were to walk into a room --  like right now, I have no idea what you think of me.
translation.zh: 当我走入一个场合时 -- 就像现在，我完全不知道各位如何看待我。

translation.en: When was the last time you heard somebody talk  about failure after failure after failure?
translation.zh: 你们上一次听到别人谈论自己 一次又一次的失败是什么时候的事情？

translation.en: Oh yeah, you go to a cocktail party  and you might hear about some other doctor,  but you're not going to hear somebody  talking about their own mistakes.
translation.zh: 是的，如果你们去参加一场聚会， 你或许会听到某些关于其他医生的错误的闲聊， 但你不会听到有人 谈论自己所犯的错误。

translation.en: If I were to walk into a room filled with my colleages  and ask for their support right now  and start to tell what I've just told you right now,  I probably wouldn't get through two of those stories  before they would start to get really uncomfortable,  somebody would crack a joke,  they'd change the subject and we would move on.
translation.zh: 如果我现在走入一间坐满我的同事的房间， 向他们寻求帮助 并开始和他们说我刚才告诉各位的事情， 或许在我还没讲超过两个故事之前， 他们就会开始感到非常的不自在。 有人就会讲个笑话， 然后他们会改变话题。

translation.en: And in fact, if I knew and my colleagues knew  that one of my orthopedic colleagues took off the wrong leg in my hospital,  believe me, I'd have trouble  making eye contact with that person.
translation.zh: 事实上，如果我，或者我的同事， 知道医院中一位骨科的同事帮病人截错了腿， 相信我，当我遇到他时， 我也无法与他有正常眼神的交汇。

translation.en: That's the system that we have.
translation.zh: 这就是我们所拥有的体系 --

translation.en: It's a complete denial of mistakes.
translation.zh: 一个完完全全的否定错误的体系。

translation.en: It's a system  in which there are two kinds of physicians --  those who make mistakes  and those who don't,  those who can't handle sleep deprivation and those who can,  those who have lousy outcomes  and those who have great outcomes.
translation.zh: 在这个制度当中 只有两种人 -- 犯错的 不犯错的， 可以调适睡眠不足的和不可以忍受的， 以及那些有着糟糕的结果 和有着优秀的结果的。

translation.en: And it's almost like an ideological reaction,  like the antibodies begin to attack that person.
translation.zh: 这几乎就像免疫系统的自我反应， 像抗体一般开始攻击那个不一样的人。

translation.en: And we have this idea  that if we drive the people who make mistakes  out of medicine,  what will we be left with, but a safe system.
translation.zh: 我们有着一种想法： 当我们将所有的会犯错的人 赶出医学界后， 我们便会得到一个安全的系统。

translation.en: But there are two problems with that.
translation.zh: 但这种想法会衍生出两个问题。

translation.en: In my 20 years or so  of medical broadcasting and journalism,  I've made a personal study of medical malpractice and medical errors  to learn everything I can,  from one of the first articles I wrote for the Toronto Star  to my show "White Coat, Black Art."
translation.zh: 在我二十余年的 医疗广播和新闻工作中， 从我为多伦多星报所写的第一篇文章 到我的节目《白袍魔艺》， 我自行研究了我可以接触到的 一切医疗疏失和医疗错误。

translation.en: And what I've learned  is that errors are absolutely ubiquitous.
translation.zh: 而我所学到的， 便是错误绝对是无处不在。

translation.en: We work in a system  where errors happen every day,  where one in 10 medications  are either the wrong medication given in hospital  or at the wrong dosage,  where hospital-acquired infections are getting more and more numerous,  causing havoc and death.
translation.zh: 我们工作在一个 每天都会发生错误的制度中。 医院有十分之一的几率 会给错药 或者给了错误的剂量， 而在医院内被传染的病例正在日渐增多， 造成不必要的伤害和死亡。

translation.en: In this country,  as many as 24,000 Canadians die  of preventable medical errors.
translation.zh: 在这个国家中， 有将近2万4千多加拿大人死于 可以避免的医疗错误。

translation.en: In the United States, the Institute of Medicine pegged it at 100,000.
translation.zh: 在美国，据医学学院统计，这个人数达到了10万之多。

translation.en: In both cases, these are gross underestimates,  because we really aren't ferreting out the problem  as we should.
translation.zh: 即使如此，这两项数据也还是过于低估了现实， 因为我们从未像我们该做的那般 深入地探究这个问题。

translation.en: And here's the thing.
translation.zh: 重点是，

translation.en: In a hospital system  where medical knowledge is doubling  every two or three years, we can't keep up with it.
translation.zh: 在一个医疗知识 以两到三年为单位成倍增长的 医院体系中，我们无法紧跟着这些知识的增长。

translation.en: Sleep deprivation is absolutely pervasive.
translation.zh: 睡眠不足的情形绝对是非常普遍的，

translation.en: We can't get rid of it.
translation.zh: 而我们也无法摆脱这个问题。

translation.en: We have our cognitive biases,  so that I can take a perfect history on a patient with chest pain.
translation.zh: 我们自己的直觉偏差也会直接影响到我们的结论。 比如说，我可以为一位胸痛的病人记录下完美的病历。

translation.en: Now take the same patient with chest pain,  make them moist and garrulous  and put a little bit of alcohol on their breath,  and suddenly my history is laced with contempt.
translation.zh: 但如果这位同样的胸痛的病人 当时胡言乱语 再加上呼吸带着些许的酒精味的话， 我写下的病历便会挟带着些许的轻蔑。

translation.en: I don't take the same history.
translation.zh: 而这份病历便会截然不同。

translation.en: I'm not a robot;  I don't do things the same way each time.
translation.zh: 我不是机器人， 不会每次都做同样的事情。

translation.en: And my patients aren't cars;  they don't tell me their symptoms in the same way each time.
translation.zh: 我的病患也不是车子， 他们不会每次都用相同的方式去描述他们的症状。

translation.en: Given all of that, mistakes are inevitable.
translation.zh: 因此错误是无可避免的。

translation.en: So if you take the system, as I was taught,  and weed out all the error-prone health professionals,  well there won't be anybody left.
translation.zh: 如果真像我被教导的体系那般 赶出所有易出错的医护专业人员， 那么这个领域便不会有人留下。

translation.en: And you know that business  about people not wanting  to talk about their worst cases?
translation.zh: 还有就是关于 人们不愿 谈论他们所犯的最糟糕的错误一事。

translation.en: On my show, on "White Coat, Black Art,"  I made it a habit of saying, "Here's my worst mistake,"  I would say to everybody  from paramedics to the chief of cardiac surgery,  "Here's my worst mistake," blah, blah, blah, blah, blah,  "What about yours?" and I would point the microphone towards them.
translation.zh: 在我的节目《白袍魔艺》中， 我已经会习惯性地说：“这是我最糟糕的错误”。 我会对从急救医士 到心脏外科首席医师的每个人这么说： “这是我最糟糕的错误，如是，如是。” 然后我会把麦克风递给他们，问：“你呢？”

translation.en: And their pupils would dilate,  they would recoil,  then they would look down and swallow hard  and start to tell me their stories.
translation.zh: 此时他们的瞳孔会放大， 他们会退却。 然后他们会看着地上，猛吞着口水 并开始向我倾诉他们的故事。

translation.en: They want to tell their stories. They want to share their stories.
translation.zh: 他们想说他们的故事，他们也想分享他们的故事。

translation.en: They want to be able to say,  "Look, don't make the same mistake I did."
translation.zh: 他们想能够说： “听着，别犯和我一样的错。”

translation.en: What they need is an environment to be able to do that.
translation.zh: 他们只是需要一个场合来吐露心声。

translation.en: What they need is a redefined medical culture.
translation.zh: 他们需要的是一个重新定义的医学文化，

translation.en: And it starts with one physician at a time.
translation.zh: 从一位又一位个别的医生开始。

translation.en: The redefined physician is human,  knows she's human,  accepts it, isn't proud of making mistakes,  but strives to learn one thing  from what happened  that she can teach to somebody else.
translation.zh: 重新定义过的医生也是人类， 明白她自己是人， 并接受这个事实。她并不觉得犯错误是光荣的， 却可以 从其中学习 并教于他人。

translation.en: She shares her experience with others.
translation.zh: 她会与他人分享她的经验，

translation.en: She's supportive when other people talk about their mistakes.
translation.zh: 并在别人谈论自己过错的时候给于支持。

translation.en: And she points out other people's mistakes,  not in a gotcha way,  but in a loving, supportive way  so that everybody can benefit.
translation.zh: 她不会有一种落井下石的心态， 而会以一种 可以让每个人都从中受惠的关怀，了解的方式 来指出他人的错误。

translation.en: And she works in a culture of medicine  that acknowledges  that human beings run the system,  and when human beings run the system, they will make mistakes from time to time.
translation.zh: 而她所工作的医学文化 承认 整个体系是由人在运作， 而当人在运作一个体系的时候，时不时地错误在所难免。

translation.en: So the system is evolving  to create backups  that make it easier to detect those mistakes  that humans inevitably make  and also fosters in a loving, supportive way  places where everybody who is observing  in the health care system  can actually point out things that could be potential mistakes  and is rewarded for doing so, and especially people like me, when we do make mistakes,  we're rewarded for coming clean.
translation.zh: 这样系统才可以不断地进化改革， 产生可以让人更加容易察觉 这些无法避免的错误的 补救方案。 与此同时，我们可以培养一个热心关怀的工作环境， 鼓励每一位 在观察我们的 医疗系统的人 随时指出一些潜在的错误。 尤其是鼓励像我一样的人，当我们犯错后， 我们可以去正面面对并加以改正。

translation.en: My name is Brian Goldman.
translation.zh: 我是布莱恩.高德曼，

translation.en: I am a redefined physician.
translation.zh: 我是一位重新定义后的医生。

translation.en: I'm human. I make mistakes.
translation.zh: 我是一个人类，我也会犯错。

translation.en: I'm sorry about that,  but I strive to learn one thing  that I can pass on to other people.
translation.zh: 我为此感到抱歉， 但我会尽力从中学习 并教于他人。

translation.en: I still don't know what you think of me,  but I can live with that.
translation.zh: 我仍然不知各位如何看待我， 但我想我对此可以接受。

translation.en: And let me close with three words of my own:  I do remember.
translation.zh: 最后让我以我自己的三个字做为结语： 我记得。

translation.en: Do you know how many choices you make  in a typical day?
translation.zh: 你知道在日常生活中你平均 每天做多少选择？

translation.en: Do you know how many choices you make  in typical week?
translation.zh: 你知道你平均每周 做多少选择？

translation.en: I recently did a survey with over 2,000 Americans,  and the average number of choices  that the typical American reports making  is about 70 in a typical day.
translation.zh: 我最近在超过2000美国人中 做了一个调查， 结果显示，一个典型的美国人 平均每天 做70个选择。

translation.en: There was also recently a study done with CEOs  in which they followed CEOs around for a whole week.
translation.zh: 另外最近还有一个对于CEO们的研究 科学家们在一星期中跟着CEO们

translation.en: And these scientists simply documented all the various tasks  that these CEOs engaged in  and how much time they spent engaging  in making decisions related to these tasks.
translation.zh: 然后记录下他们所参与和完成的 各种不同的活动与任务 和他们做的所有与这些任务有关的 决定所用的时间。

translation.en: And they found that the average CEO  engaged in about 139 tasks in a week.
translation.zh: 科学家们由此发现，每一个CEO平均 每周参与完成大概139个任务。

translation.en: Each task was made up of many, many, many sub-choices of course.
translation.zh: 当然了，每个任务又都是由许多小的选择构成的。

translation.en: 50 percent of their decisions  were made in nine minutes or less.
translation.zh: 这其中50%的决定 都是他们在九分钟甚至更短的时间内做出的。

translation.en: Only about 12 percent of the decisions  did they make an hour or more of their time.
translation.zh: 只有其中百分之十二的决定， 用了他们一小时或更长的时间。

translation.en: Think about your own choices.
translation.zh: 想一想你每天做的选择。

translation.en: Do you know how many choices  make it into your nine minute category  versus your one hour category? How well do you think you're doing  at managing those choices?
translation.zh: 你知道它们中多少 是“九分钟抉择” 又有多少是一小时的选择？ 在管理这些选择上， 你做的如何？

translation.en: Today I want to talk  about one of the biggest modern day choosing problems that we have,  which is the choice overload problem.
translation.zh: 今天我要讲一讲 现在社会中我们所面对的最严重的选择问题： 选择过多。

translation.en: I want to talk about the problem  and some potential solutions.
translation.zh: 我想要讲一讲这些问题 与一些可行的解决办法。

translation.en: Now as I talk about this problem,  I'm going to have some questions for you  and I'm going to want to know your answers.
translation.zh: 我现在先将这个问题， 我要问你们一些问题 然后我希望得到你们的答案。

translation.en: So when I ask you a question,  since I'm blind,  only raise your hand if you want to burn off some calories.
translation.zh: 所以当我问你们一个问题 由于我看不见， 不要举手除非你只是想消耗一下卡路里。

translation.en: Otherwise, when I ask you a question,  and if your answer is yes,  I'd like you to clap your hands.
translation.zh: （笑声) 否则，当我问你们一个问题， 如果你的答案是：是， 我希望你们可以鼓掌。

translation.en: So for my first question for you today:  Are you guys ready to hear about the choice overload problem?
translation.zh: 所以，我今天给你们的第一个问题是： 对于选择过多这个问题你们准备好听了么？

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: （观众鼓掌） 谢谢

translation.en: So when I was a graduate student at Stanford University,  I used to go to this very, very upscale grocery store;  at least at that time it was truly upscale.
translation.zh: 当我还是斯坦福大学的一名本科学生时， 我经常去一个非常高级的杂货店； 至少在当时看来那家店是十分高级的。

translation.en: It was a store called Draeger's.
translation.zh: 它的名字是Draeger‘s。

translation.en: Now this store, it was almost like going to an amusement park.
translation.zh: 去那家店，就像是去游乐园一样。

translation.en: They had 250 different kinds of mustards and vinegars  and over 500 different kinds  of fruits and vegetables  and more than two dozen different kinds of bottled water --  and this was during a time when we actually used to drink tap water.
translation.zh: 他们有250种不同的黄芥末和醋 还有超过500中不同种类的 蔬菜和水果 还有超过24中不同的瓶装水 而那是我们还在喝水龙头里的水的年代。

translation.en: I used to love going to this store,  but on one occasion I asked myself,  well how come you never buy anything?
translation.zh: 我过去十分喜欢去这家店， 但是有一次我问自己， 为什么你从来都不买东西呢？

translation.en: Here's their olive oil aisle.
translation.zh: 这是卖橄榄油的过道。

translation.en: They had over 75 different kinds of olive oil,  including those that were in a locked case  that came from thousand-year-old olive trees.
translation.zh: 他们有75种以上不同的橄榄油， 包括那些被锁在盒子里 从4000年的橄榄树上取来的油。

translation.en: So I one day decided to pay a visit to the manager,  and I asked the manager,  "Is this model of offering people all this choice really working?"
translation.zh: 于是有一天我决定去拜访一下这家店的经理， 我问他， “这个给人们所有选择的模型真的有用么？”

translation.en: And he pointed to the busloads of tourists  that would show up everyday,  with cameras ready usually.
translation.zh: 然后他向我示意了那些每天都会来的 一车一车的 举着相机的游客。

translation.en: We decided to do a little experiment,  and we picked jam for our experiment.
translation.zh: 我们决定做一个小实验， 然后选择了果酱作为试验品。

translation.en: Here's their jam aisle.
translation.zh: 这是卖果酱的走廊。

translation.en: They had 348 different kinds of jam.
translation.zh: 他们有148种不同的果酱。

translation.en: We set up a little tasting booth  right near the entrance of the store.
translation.zh: 在店门口的地方 我们摆设了一个小的品尝台。

translation.en: We there put out six different flavors of jam  or 24 different flavors of jam,  and we looked at two things:  First, in which case  were people more likely to stop, sample some jam?
translation.zh: 我们在那儿摆6种 或24种不同味道的果酱， 然后我们观察了两件事： 第一，人们在哪种情况下 更愿意停下脚步品尝一些果酱？

translation.en: More people stopped when there were 24, about 60 percent,  than when there were six,  about 40 percent.
translation.zh: 相比较下，大部分，约60%的人，在有24种果酱走廊停了脚步， 而当有6种果酱时 只有40%的人。

translation.en: The next thing we looked at  is in which case were people more likely  to buy a jar of jam.
translation.zh: 我们观察的另一件事是： 在人们在哪种情况下更愿意 买一罐果酱

translation.en: Now we see the opposite effect.
translation.zh: 这时，我们观察到了相反的结果。

translation.en: Of the people who stopped when there were 24,  only three percent of them actually bought a jar of jam.
translation.zh: 在那些在有24种果酱时停下的人们中， 只有3%的人真正买了果酱。

translation.en: Of the people who stopped when there were six,  well now we saw that 30 percent of them  actually bought a jar of jam.
translation.zh: 而此时，在那些在有6种果酱时停下的人们中， 我们发现有30%的人 买了果酱。

translation.en: Now if you do the math,  people were at least six times more likely to buy a jar of jam  Now choosing not to buy a jar of jam  is probably good for us --  at least it's good for our waistlines --  but it turns out that this choice overload problem affects us  even in very consequential decisions. We choose not to choose,  even when it goes against our best self-interests.
translation.zh: 现在如果你算一下的话， 当人们只有六种选择时， 比有24种时 买果酱的倾向上升了至少六倍 选择不买果酱 也许对我们来说是一件好事儿 至少对我们的水桶腰来说， 但是结果证明过度选择甚至在 非常重要的决定上影响我们。 我们甚至在有悖个人利益的情况下， 宁愿放弃选择。

translation.en: So now for the topic of today: financial savings.
translation.zh: 所以现在来介绍我们今天的话题：金融理财。

translation.en: Now I'm going to describe to you a study I did with Gur Huberman, Emir Kamenica, Wei Jang  where we looked at the retirement savings decisions  of nearly a million Americans  from about 650 plans  all in the U.S.
translation.zh: 现在我要向你们介绍我与Gur Huberman, Emir Kamerica, Wei Jang 一起做的一个关于 近百万美国人在全美650多种 养老金计划中 选择的

translation.en: And what we looked at  was whether the number of fund offerings  available in a retirement savings plan,  the 401 plan,  does that affect people's likelihood  to save more for tomorrow.
translation.zh: 研究。 我们研究了 养老金计划， 也就是401（k)雇员福利中 所提供的基金选择数量， 是否影响人们 为未来存款的几率。

translation.en: And what we found  was that indeed there was a correlation.
translation.zh: 我们发现， 这之前却是有联系。

translation.en: So in these plans, we had about 657 plans  that ranged from offering people  anywhere from two to 59 different fund offerings.
translation.zh: 于是在这些计划中，我们选择了657个 从提供2到59种基金 的不同计划。

translation.en: And what we found was that,  the more funds offered,  indeed, there was less participation rate.
translation.zh: 我们发现， 事实上，提供的基金越多， 参购率就越低。

translation.en: So if you look at the extremes,  those plans that offered you two funds,  participation rates were around in the mid-70s --  still not as high as we want it to be.
translation.zh: 所以如果观察一下极端的情况的话， 会发现那些提供给客户两种基金的计划 的参购率在70左右， 仍然没有我们期待中的那么高。

translation.en: In those plans that offered nearly 60 funds,  participation rates have now dropped  to about the 60th percentile.
translation.zh: 那些提供接近60种基金的计划， 参购率降低到了 60多的参购率。

translation.en: Now it turns out  that even if you do choose to participate  when there are more choices present,  even then, it has negative consequences.
translation.zh: 由此看来， 即使是你真的选择参与一个计划， 当那么多计划摆在你面前时， 还是会造成负面的影响。

translation.en: So for those people who did choose to participate,  the more choices available,  the more likely people were  to completely avoid stocks or equity funds.
translation.zh: 所以对于那些选择参与计划的人来说， 选择越多， 他们越容易选择 完全避开股票或类似的基金。

translation.en: The more choices available,  the more likely they were  to put all their money in pure money market accounts.
translation.zh: 选择越多， 越容易造成人们 把钱存进单纯的存钱账户中。

translation.en: Now neither of these extreme decisions  are the kinds of decisions  that any of us would recommend for people  when you're considering their future financial well-being.
translation.zh: 现在，这两种极端选择 没有一种是当考虑到朋友未来的生活时， 我们会推荐给朋友的 好的选择。

translation.en: Well, over the past decade,  we have observed three main negative consequences to offering people more and more choices.
translation.zh: 在过去十年中， 我们观察到了提供人们越来越多的选择

translation.en: They're more likely to delay choosing --  procrastinate even when it goes against their best self-interest.
translation.zh: 所造成的负面影响 他们越来越容易推迟选择的过程， 即使这样做会损害到自身的利益。

translation.en: They're more likely to make worse choices --  worse financial choices, medical choices.
translation.zh: 人们更容易做出更差的选择- 更差的理财选择，医疗选择。

translation.en: They're more likely to choose things that make them less satisfied,  even when they do objectively better.
translation.zh: 人们更容易选择那些令自己不满意的选项， 即使那些选择也许客观来讲并没有那么差。

translation.en: The main reason for this  is because, we might enjoy gazing at those giant walls  of mayonnaises, mustards, vinegars, jams,  but we can't actually do the math of comparing and contrasting  and actually picking from that stunning display.
translation.zh: 这是因为， 虽然我们很享受看一排一排 由美乃滋，黄芥末，醋和果酱建成的的高墙， 却不愿意亲自比较 然后在如此庞大的陈列中做出选择。

translation.en: So what I want to propose to you today  are four simple techniques --  techniques that we have tested in one way or another  in different research venues --  that you can easily apply  in your businesses.
translation.zh: 所以今天我想向你们介绍 四种简单的技巧- 它们都是你可以轻松地 运用在生意上， 并且被测试过许多次的 可靠技巧。

translation.en: The first: Cut.
translation.zh: 一：精减。

translation.en: You've heard it said before,  but it's never been more true than today,  that less is more.
translation.zh: 你们以前也许听过， 但这个说法在从前的社会从未像现今一样的适用- “少即是多”

translation.en: People are always upset when I say, "Cut."
translation.zh: 每一次我说“精减"的时候，人们总是会很生气。

translation.en: They're always worried they're going to lose shelf space.
translation.zh: 他们担心这样做会导致他们丢失自我空间。

translation.en: But in fact, what we're seeing more and more  is that if you are willing to cut,  get rid of those extraneous redundant options,  well there's an increase in sales,  there's a lowering of costs,  there is an improvement of the choosing experience.
translation.zh: 但事实上，根据我们所观察到的是 当一个人越是愿意 放弃多余的选择， 使得营业额上升， 价格降低， 越是会改善原则的经历。

translation.en: When Proctor & Gamble  went from 26 different kinds of Head & Shoulders to 15,  they saw an increase in sales by 10 percent.
translation.zh: 当保洁公司 将26种不同的海飞丝减至15种时， 销售额上升了百分之十。

translation.en: When the Golden Cat Corporation  got rid of their 10 worst-selling cat litter products,  they saw an increase in profits  by 87 percent --  a function of both increase in sales  and lowering of costs.
translation.zh: 当金猫公司 停止了他们的十种销售量最差的猫粮的销售， 盈利上升了 百分之八十七- 是又能增加销售额 还降低了成本两全其美的好方法。

translation.en: You know, the average grocery store today  offers you 45,000 products.
translation.zh: 正如你们所知道的，现在一个普通的杂货店 提供45000种商品给你选择。

translation.en: The typical Walmart today offers you 100,000 products.
translation.zh: 一个典型的沃尔玛为你提供100000种商品。

translation.en: But the ninth largest retailer,  the ninth biggest retailer in the world today  is Aldi,  and it offers you only 1,400 products --  one kind of canned tomato sauce.
translation.zh: 但是，第九大的零售商 今天世界上第九大的零售商， 是阿尔迪， 而他们只提供给顾客1400种商品- 一种罐装番茄酱。

translation.en: Now in the financial savings world,  I think one of the best examples that has recently come out  on how to best manage the choice offerings  has actually been something that David Laibson was heavily involved in designing,  which was the program that they have at Harvard.
translation.zh: 在这个理财的世界中， 我认为在关于如何最有效地管理选择中 最好的例子是 David Laibson十分投入的 一个哈佛的项目。

translation.en: Every single Harvard employee  is now automatically enrolled  in a lifecycle fund.
translation.zh: 哈佛的每一个教职工 都自动被登记加入 一个生活周期基金中。

translation.en: For those people who actually want to choose,  they're given 20 funds,  not 300 or more funds.
translation.zh: 那些愿意自己选择的人， 有20种不同的基金选择， 而不是300种甚至更多。

translation.en: You know, often, people say,  "I don't know how to cut.
translation.zh: 你知道，人们很喜欢说， ”我不知道怎么消减

translation.en: They're all important choices."
translation.zh: 这些都是非常重要的选择。”

translation.en: And the first thing I do is I ask the employees,  "Tell me how these choices are different from one another.
translation.zh: 所以我做的第一件事是问这些教职工， “告诉我这些选择与其他那些有何不同，

translation.en: And if your employees can't tell them apart,  neither can your consumers."
translation.zh: 如果你的员工们不能分辨它们的不同， 你的顾客肯定也不能。“

translation.en: Now before we started our session this afternoon,  I had a chat with Gary.
translation.zh: 今天下午在这个活动开始之前， 我跟Gary聊了一会儿。

translation.en: And Gary said that he would be willing  to offer people in this audience  an all-expenses-paid free vacation to the most beautiful road in the world.
translation.zh: Gary跟我说他愿意 为今天在场的所有观众提供 一次到这个世界上最美的路的旅行，

translation.en: Here's a description of the road.
translation.zh: 并且完全免费。

translation.en: And I'd like you to read it.
translation.zh: 我希望你们读一下 对这条路的描写。

translation.en: And now I'll give you a few seconds to read it  if you're ready to take Gary up on his offer.
translation.zh: 现在我给你们几秒钟自己读一下， 如果你愿意接受Gary的提议的话，

translation.en: Okay. Anybody who's ready to take him up on his offer.
translation.zh: 就请鼓掌。  好，有人愿意接受他的提议么？

translation.en: Is that all?
translation.zh: 没有其他人了么？

translation.en: All right, let me show you some more about this.
translation.zh: 好吧，我多给你们看一些有关此事的。

translation.en: You guys knew there was a trick, didn't you.
translation.zh: 你们早就知道这是个诡计了，是吧？

translation.en: Now who's ready to go on this trip.
translation.zh: 现在，有谁愿意去这次旅行？

translation.en: I think I might have actually heard more hands.
translation.zh: （观众鼓掌）  我以为我会听到更多掌声呢。

translation.en: All right.
translation.zh: 好吧，

translation.en: Now in fact,  you had objectively more information  the first time around than the second time around,  but I would venture to guess  that you felt that it was more real the second time around.
translation.zh: 事实上， 客观地来讲， 你们第一次的时候比第二次得到的信息要多， 但是我冒昧地猜 你们觉得第二次更真实一些。

translation.en: Because the pictures made it feel  more real to you.
translation.zh: 因为那些照片让你们 感觉更真实。

translation.en: Which brings me to the second technique  for handling the choice overload problem,  which is concretization.
translation.zh: 而这个例子就是我们今天要讲的第二个 处理选择过多的技巧， 具体化。

translation.en: That in order for people to understand  the differences between the choices,  they have to be able to understand  the consequences associated with each choice,  and that the consequences need to be felt  in a vivid sort of way, in a very concrete way.
translation.zh: 为了令人们更好地理解 众多选择之间的区别， 他们必须理解， 每一个选择所将带来的后果， 而这些后果必须是可以 十分清晰、具体地感受到的。

translation.en: Why do people spend an average of 15 to 30 percent more  when they use an ATM card or a credit card  as opposed to cash?
translation.zh: 为什么人们平均每天花 比用现今多15%到30%的时间 在自动提款机或信用卡上呢？

translation.en: Because it doesn't feel like real money.
translation.zh: 因为那样感觉不像是真正的钱。

translation.en: And it turns out  that making it feel more concrete  can actually be a very positive tool  to use in getting people to save more.
translation.zh: 所以 原来使感觉更具体化 可以成为令人们节约的 好方法。

translation.en: So a study that I did with Shlomo Benartzi  and Alessandro Previtero,  we did a study with people at ING --  employees that are all working at ING --  and now these people were all in a session  where they're doing enrollment for their 401 plan.
translation.zh: 所以在一个我与Shlomo Benartzi 和Alessandro Precitero做的研究中， 我们和所有ING的 员工一起做了一个研究， 所有人都参加了一个 一起注册401雇员福利的会议。

translation.en: And during that session,  we kept the session exactly the way it used to be,  but we added one little thing.
translation.zh: 在这个过程中 我们在保持每个会议完全相同的情况下， 加了一个小东西。

translation.en: The one little thing we added  was we asked people  to just think about all the positive things that would happen in your life  By doing that simple thing,  there was an increase in enrollment by 20 percent  and there was an increase in the amount of people willing to save  or the amount that they were willing to put down into their savings account  by four percent.
translation.zh: 我们加的是， 让他们 每个人都想象如果多存一些 生命中可能会发生的那些美好的事情。 仅仅是这样做后， 参与率上升了百分之二十， 人们愿意存钱的数额或者说是 愿意放进自己储蓄账户的金额增长了 百分之四。

translation.en: The third technique: Categorization.
translation.zh: 第三个技巧：分类。

translation.en: We can handle more categories  than we can handle choices.
translation.zh: 相比处理选择来说， 我们可以轻松处理更多类别。

translation.en: So for example,  here's a study we did in a magazine aisle.
translation.zh: 比如说， 我们做了一个有关买杂志类过道的研究，

translation.en: It turns out that in Wegmans grocery stores  up and down the northeast corridor,  the magazine aisles range anywhere  from 331 different kinds of magazines  all the way up to 664.
translation.zh: 发现在Wegmans百货商店中， 在东北走廊的地方， 买杂志的那一栏 有331到 甚至664种杂志。

translation.en: But you know what?
translation.zh: 但是你们知道么？

translation.en: If I show you 600 magazines  and I divide them up into 10 categories,  versus I show you 400 magazines  and divide them up into 20 categories,  you believe that I have given you  more choice and a better choosing experience  if I gave you the 400  than if I gave you the 600.
translation.zh: 如果我先给你们看600本杂志， 然后把它们分成10类， 然后再给你们看400本杂志， 但是分成20类， 你们会相信， 当我给你们看 400本杂志时 比给你们600本时的选择更多，选择体验更好。

translation.en: Because the categories tell me how to tell them apart.
translation.zh: 因为类别可以帮我分辨它们的区别。

translation.en: Here are two different jewelry displays.
translation.zh: 这里有两个不同的珠宝展示，

translation.en: One is called "Jazz" and the other one is called "Swing."
translation.zh: 一个叫“爵士”，另一个叫“摇摆”

translation.en: If you think the display on the left is Swing  and the display on the right is Jazz,  clap your hands.
translation.zh: 如果你觉得左边的是“摇摆” 右边的是“爵士” 就请鼓掌。

translation.en: Okay, there's some.
translation.zh: 好吧，有一些。

translation.en: If you think the one on the left is Jazz and the one on the right is Swing,  clap your hands.
translation.zh: 如果你觉得左边的是“爵士”， 右边的是“摇摆” 请鼓掌。

translation.en: Okay, a bit more.
translation.zh: 稍微多一点儿了。

translation.en: Now it turns out you're right.
translation.zh: 你们是对的。

translation.en: The one on the left is Jazz and the one on the right is Swing,  but you know what?
translation.zh: 左边的的确是“爵士”，而右边的正是“摇摆”， 但是你知道么？

translation.en: This is a highly useless categorization scheme.
translation.zh: 这是一个十分无用的分类阴谋。

translation.en: The categories need to say something  to the chooser, not the choice-maker.
translation.zh: 类别必须可以告诉 选择者一些事情，而不是创造选择的人。

translation.en: And you often see that problem  when it comes down to those long lists of all these funds.
translation.zh: 你们也许可以在 那些冗长的基金名单中看到这个问题。

translation.en: Who are they actually supposed to be informing?
translation.zh: 到底谁才是应该得到信息的人呢？

translation.en: My fourth technique: Condition for complexity.
translation.zh: 我的第四个技巧是：从简入繁

translation.en: It turns out we can actually  handle a lot more information than we think we can,  we've just got to take it a little easier.
translation.zh: 事实上，我们所能 承受的信息量比我们想象的要高， 我们需要做的就是用轻松地面度对待。

translation.en: We have to gradually increase the complexity.
translation.zh: 我们必须逐渐加大复杂程度。

translation.en: I'm going to show you one example of what I'm talking about.
translation.zh: 现在我给你们举一个有关的例子。

translation.en: Let's take a very, very complicated decision:  buying a car.
translation.zh: 我们来一起做一个非常非常复杂的决定： 买车。

translation.en: Here's a German car manufacturer  that gives you the opportunity to completely custom make your car.
translation.zh: 现在有一个德国制造商， 愿意让你定制一辆完全个性化的车。

translation.en: You've got to make 60 different decisions,  completely make up your car.
translation.zh: 你必须要做60个不同的决定 才能做好这辆车。

translation.en: Now these decisions vary  in the number of choices that they offer per decision.
translation.zh: 这些决定包括 每一个决定所提供的选择。

translation.en: Car colors, exterior car colors --  I've got 56 choices.
translation.zh: 光车的颜色，内置的颜色 就有56种选择。

translation.en: Engines, gearshift -- four choices.
translation.zh: 有四种发动机，变速排档选择。

translation.en: So now what I'm going to do  is I'm going to vary the order in which these decisions appear.
translation.zh: 现在我要做的是 改变这些要做的决定出线的顺序。

translation.en: So half of the customers  are going to go from high choice, 56 car colors,  to low choice, four gearshifts.
translation.zh: 所以，一般的观众 要从选择多的决定开始-56种颜色 开始到选择少的决定-四种变速排档。

translation.en: The other half of the customers  are going to go from low choice, four gearshifts,  to 56 car colors, high choice.
translation.zh: 另外一半的观众 要从选择少的决定，四种变档开始 到56种车颜色，选择多的决定

translation.en: What am I going to look at?
translation.zh: 我想要观察什么呢？

translation.en: How engaged you are.
translation.zh: 你们有多积极。

translation.en: If you keep hitting the default button per decision,  that means you're getting overwhelmed,  that means I'm losing you.
translation.zh: 如果你不停地按默认选项的话 就说明你已经被选择淹没了， 也就是说我正在失去你的参与。

translation.en: What you find  is the people who go from high choice to low choice,  they're hitting that default button over and over and over again.
translation.zh: 你会发现， 从选择多的开始到选择少的人 会不停地选择默认选项。

translation.en: We're losing them.
translation.zh: 我们就会逐渐失去他们了

translation.en: They go from low choice to high choice,  they're hanging in there.
translation.zh: 那些从选择少开始到选择多的人， 还在坚持着。

translation.en: It's the same information. It's the same number of choices.
translation.zh: 可是他们所得到的信息是完全一样的。所要做的选择也是一样的。

translation.en: The only thing that I have done  is I have varied the order  in which that information is presented.
translation.zh: 我所做的唯一一件事就是 改变了 信息所出现的顺序。

translation.en: If I start you off easy,  I learn how to choose.
translation.zh: 如果我给你一个轻松的开始， 教你如何选择。

translation.en: Even though choosing gearshift  doesn't tell me anything about my preferences for interior decor,  it still prepares me for how to choose.
translation.zh: 即使选择变速排档 不能说明我对车内颜色的偏好 却仍能教会我如何去选择。

translation.en: It also gets me excited about this big product that I'm putting together,  so I'm more willing to be motivated  to be engaged.
translation.zh: 另一件令我兴奋的事实是我所要组成的是如此一个庞然大物， 所以我变得更有动力 去参与。

translation.en: So let me recap.
translation.zh: 让我重新整理一下重点，

translation.en: I have talked about four techniques  for mitigating the problem of choice overload --  cut -- get rid of the extraneous alternatives;  concretize -- make it real;  categorize -- we can handle more categories, less choices;  condition for complexity.
translation.zh: 我讲了四种可以减缓过多选择的 技巧- 精简-放弃没有用的选择； 具体化-让选择变得更真实一些； 分类-我们能承受的类别比选择多； 从简入繁。

translation.en: All of these techniques that I'm describing to you today  are designed to help you manage your choices --  better for you, you can use them on yourself,  better for the people that you are serving.
translation.zh: 今天我所讲的所有技巧， 都是为了帮助你更好地管理选择而设计的- 使用这些技巧对你更好， 也对你所服务的那些人更好。

translation.en: Because I believe that the key  to getting the most from choice  is to be choosy about choosing.
translation.zh: 所以我相信 从选择中获益最多的关键是 对选择挑剔一些。

translation.en: And the more we're able to be choosy about choosing  the better we will be able  to practice the art of choosing.
translation.zh: 我们对选择越是挑剔 就越能 掌握选择的艺术。

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢。

translation.en: In the 1980s  in the communist Eastern Germany,  if you owned a typewriter,  you had to register it with the government.
translation.zh: 20世纪80年代 在共产主义的东德， 如果你有一台打字机， 你就得去跟政府登记。

translation.en: You had to register  a sample sheet of text  out of the typewriter.
translation.zh: 你必须登记 出自那台打字机的 一份文本的样本。

translation.en: And this was done  so the government could track where text was coming from.
translation.zh: 这样做后， 政府就能跟踪文本出自何方。

translation.en: If they found a paper  which had the wrong kind of thought,  they could track down  who created that thought.
translation.zh: 如果他们发现一张纸上 写着错误的观点， 他们就能跟踪 是谁产生这样的观点。

translation.en: And we in the West  couldn't understand how anybody could do this,  how much this would restrict freedom of speech.
translation.zh: 而在西方 我们不能理解有人怎么能做这种事， 这将会多么限制言论自由啊。

translation.en: We would never do that  in our own countries.
translation.zh: 我们永远不会在我们自己的国家 里这样做。

translation.en: But today in 2011,  if you go and buy a color laser printer  from any major laser printer manufacturer  and print a page,  that page will end up  having slight yellow dots  printed on every single page  in a pattern which makes the page unique  to you and to your printer.
translation.zh: 可是，2011年的今天， 如果你从任何一家大型的激光打印机厂商 买一台彩色激光打印机 打印出一页， 这页纸最后 会有一些小黄点 印在每一页上 图案让这页纸是独特 对你和你的打印机都是。

translation.en: This is happening  to us today.
translation.zh: 这就是今天 发生在我们身上的。

translation.en: And nobody seems to be making a fuss about it.
translation.zh: 似乎没有人为此大惊小怪。

translation.en: And this is an example  of the ways  that our own governments  are using technology  against us, the citizens. And this is one of the main three sources  of online problems today.
translation.zh: 这是个 展示 我们的政府 使用科技 来对付我们这些公民们的例子。 这是今天网络问题的

translation.en: If we take a look at what's really happening in the online world,  we can group the attacks based on the attackers.
translation.zh: 三大来源之一。 如果我们看一下在线世界到底发生了什么， 我们根据攻击者来分组。

translation.en: We have three main groups.
translation.zh: 我们有三个主要的组。

translation.en: We have online criminals.
translation.zh: 我们有在线罪犯。

translation.en: Like here, we have Mr. Dimitry Golubov  from the city of Kiev in Ukraine.
translation.zh: 这里，我们有位德米特里 戈卢博夫先生 来自乌克兰的基辅市。

translation.en: And the motives of online criminals  are very easy to understand.
translation.zh: 在线罪犯的动机 非常容易理解。

translation.en: These guys make money.
translation.zh: 这些家伙为了赚钱。

translation.en: They use online attacks  to make lots of money,  and lots and lots of it.
translation.zh: 他们通过在线攻击 赚很多钱， 很多很多钱。

translation.en: We actually have several cases  of millionaires online, multimillionaires,  who made money with their attacks.
translation.zh: 我们实际上有好几个案子 都是在线百万富翁，千万富翁， 都是通过在线攻击赚的。

translation.en: Here's Vladimir Tsastsin form Tartu in Estonia.
translation.zh: 这里还有来自爱沙尼亚的塔尔图的弗拉基米尔·莎斯森。

translation.en: This is Alfred Gonzalez.
translation.zh: 这位是阿尔弗雷德·冈萨雷斯。

translation.en: This is Stephen Watt.
translation.zh: 这是斯蒂芬·瓦特

translation.en: This is Bjorn Sundin.
translation.zh: 这是比昂·松丁

translation.en: This is Matthew Anderson, Tariq Al-Daour  and so on and so on.
translation.zh: 这是马修·安德森，塔利克·阿尔杜 等等等等。

translation.en: These guys  make their fortunes online,  but they make it through the illegal means  of using things like banking trojans  to steal money from our bank accounts  while we do online banking,  or with keyloggers  to collect our credit card information  while we are doing online shopping from an infected computer.
translation.zh: 这些人 在线挣了很多钱， 但他们挣的钱是非法的 通过使用类似银行木马 从我们账户偷钱 当我们在网上进行银行业务， 或者使用键盘记录 来收集我们的信用卡信息 当我们通过被感染的电脑来在线购物的时候。

translation.en: The U.S. Secret Service,  two months ago,  froze the Swiss bank account  of Mr. Sam Jain right here,  and that bank account had 14.9 million U.S. dollars on it  Mr. Jain himself is on the loose;  nobody knows where he is.
translation.zh: 美国情报局， 两个月前， 冻结了萨姆 杰恩先生 在瑞士的银行账户， 那个账户冻结的时候 帐上有一千四百九十万美金。 杰恩先生本人仍逍遥法外； 没人知道他在哪。

translation.en: And I claim it's already today  that it's more likely for any of us  to become the victim of a crime online  than here in the real world.
translation.zh: 今天我断言 我们当中的任何一位都有可能 成为在线犯罪的受害者 甚至超越现实世界。

translation.en: And it's very obvious  that this is only going to get worse.
translation.zh: 而且很显然 这种情况越来越糟。

translation.en: In the future, the majority of crime  will be happening online.
translation.zh: 将来，大多数的犯罪 会发生在线上。

translation.en: The second major group of attackers  that we are watching today  are not motivated by money.
translation.zh: 第二类主要的攻击集团 我们今天观察的 不是出于金钱。

translation.en: They're motivated by something else --  motivated by protests,  motivated by an opinion,  motivated by the laughs.
translation.zh: 他们的动机源于别处 -- 出于抗议， 出于发表意见， 出于被嘲笑过。

translation.en: Groups like Anonymous  have risen up over the last 12 months  and have become a major player  in the field of online attacks.
translation.zh: 这些匿名集团 在过去的12个月中很活跃 并且变成了在线攻击领域的 主要的参与者

translation.en: So those are the three main attackers:  criminals who do it for the money,  hacktivists like Anonymous  doing it for the protest,  but then the last group are nation states,  governments doing the attacks.
translation.zh: 这些就是三组主要的攻击者： 为了钱的罪犯， 匿名的攻击活跃者 为了抗议而作的， 而最后一组是民族国家， 政府在攻击。

translation.en: And then we look at cases  like what happened in DigiNotar.
translation.zh: 我们看一下例子 就像DigiNotar公司发生的。

translation.en: This is a prime example of what happens  when governments attack  against their own citizens.
translation.zh: 这是政府攻击的 典型例子 来反对自己的民众。

translation.en: DigiNotar is a Certificate Authority  from The Netherlands --  or actually, it was.
translation.zh: DigiNotar是荷兰的 一个权威证书 或者说它曾经是。

translation.en: It was running into bankruptcy  last fall  because they were hacked into.
translation.zh: 它去年秋天遭遇 破产 因为他们遭到入侵。

translation.en: Somebody broke in  and they hacked it thoroughly.
translation.zh: 有人闯进去 彻底毁了它。

translation.en: And I asked last week  in a meeting with Dutch government representatives,  I asked one of the leaders of the team  whether he found plausible  that people died  because of the DigiNotar hack.
translation.zh: 我上周 在与荷兰政府代表开会时问过， 我问一位领导 是否他发现有可能 有人会 因为Diginotar攻击而死亡。

translation.en: And his answer was yes.
translation.zh: 他的回答是肯定的。

translation.en: So how do people die  as the result of a hack like this?
translation.zh: 那么，究竟如何人们的死亡 归咎于这样一个攻击呢？

translation.en: Well DigiNotar is a C.A.
translation.zh: DigiNotar是一个权威证书。

translation.en: They sell certificates.
translation.zh: 他们卖证书。

translation.en: What do you do with certificates?
translation.zh: 你用证书做什么？

translation.en: Well you need a certificate  if you have a website that has https,  SSL encrypted services,  services like Gmail.
translation.zh: 你需要证书的情况会是 你有一个有https的网站， SSL加密服务， 类似Gmail的服务。

translation.en: Now we all, or a big part of us,  use Gmail or one of their competitors,  but these services are especially popular  in totalitarian states  like Iran,  where dissidents  use foreign services like Gmail  because they know they are more trustworthy than the local services  and they are encrypted over SSL connections,  so the local government can't snoop  on their discussions.
translation.zh: 当今我们所有人或大部分人， 使用Gmail或它对手们中的任何一家， 这些服务在极权主义国家 尤其流行 比如伊朗， 持异议者 使用诸如Gmail的国外服务 因为他们知道这些比当地的服务更可靠 他们通过SSL的连接加密， 所以当地政府窥探不到 他们的讨论。

translation.en: Except they can if they hack into a foreign C.A.
translation.zh: 他们也能，如果他们攻击了一个国外权威证书，

translation.en: and issue rogue certificates.
translation.zh: 出具伪劣证书。

translation.en: And this is exactly what happened  with the case of DigiNotar.
translation.zh: 这恰恰就是发生在 DigiNotar的案子中。

translation.en: What about Arab Spring  and things that have been happening, for example, in Egypt?
translation.zh: 阿拉伯跳是怎么回事？ 比如说在埃及发生的那些事？

translation.en: Well in Egypt,  the rioters looted the headquarters  of the Egyptian secret police  in April 2011,  and when they were looting the building they found lots of papers.
translation.zh: 在埃及， 暴徒们洗劫了 埃及秘密警察的总部 那是2011年4月， 他们洗劫时找到很多文件。

translation.en: Among those papers,  was this binder entitled "FINFISHER."
translation.zh: 在这些文件中， 有一个名叫FINFISHER的夹子。

translation.en: And within that binder were notes  from a company based in Germany  which had sold the Egyptian government  a set of tools  for intercepting --  and in very large scale --  all the communication of the citizens of the country.
translation.zh: 夹子中有些笔记 是来自一家德国公司 这家公司卖给埃及政府 一套工具 用来截取-- 很大比例是 国家公众的所有通信。

translation.en: They had sold this tool  for 280,000 Euros to the Egyptian government.
translation.zh: 他们把这套工具 以28万欧元卖给埃及政府。

translation.en: The company headquarters are right here.
translation.zh: 公司的总部就在那里。
