translation.en: So Western governments  are providing totalitarian governments with tools  to do this against their own citizens.
translation.zh: 所以，西方政府 给极权政府提供工具 来反对他们自己的民众。

translation.en: But Western governments are doing it to themselves as well.
translation.zh: 但西方政府也同样对他们自己这样做。

translation.en: For example, in Germany,  just a couple of weeks ago  the so-called State Trojan was found,  which was a trojan  used by German government officials  to investigate their own citizens.
translation.zh: 比如，在德国， 就是几周前 发现一个叫Scuinst Trojan 的 木马病毒 被德国政府官方用来 调查他们自己的民众。

translation.en: If you are a suspect in a criminal case,  well it's pretty obvious, your phone will be tapped.
translation.zh: 如果你是一宗刑事案件的嫌疑， 很显然，你的电话会被监听。

translation.en: But today, it goes beyond that.
translation.zh: 可是今天，事情已经超越了。

translation.en: They will tap your Internet connection.
translation.zh: 他们会监视你的网络连接。

translation.en: They will even use tools like State Trojan  to infect your computer with a trojan,  which enables them  to watch all your communication,  to listen to your online discussions,  to collect your passwords.
translation.zh: 他们会用类似Scuinst Trojan的工具 用一个木马来感染你的电脑， 这样就让他们 监视你所有的通信， 监听你的在线讨论， 收集你的密码。

translation.en: Now when we think deeper  about things like these,  the obvious response from people should be  that, "Okay, that sounds bad,  but that doesn't really affect me because I'm a legal citizen.
translation.zh: 当我们更深的想一下 这些事情， 人们的反应显然应是 “对啊，听起来很糟糕， 但因为我是合法公民，也不会真正影响我啦。

translation.en: Why should I worry?
translation.zh: 为什么我要担忧呢？

translation.en: Because I have nothing to hide."
translation.zh: 我没有什么可隐藏的。”

translation.en: And this is an argument,  which doesn't make sense.
translation.zh: 这就是争论所在， 没什么道理。

translation.en: Privacy is implied.
translation.zh: 隐私是不言而喻。

translation.en: Privacy is not up for discussion.
translation.zh: 隐私用不着讨论。

translation.en: This is not a question  between privacy  against security.
translation.zh: 这不是个 隐私 反对安全的问题。

translation.en: It's a question of freedom  against control.
translation.zh: 而是一个 自由反对管制的问题。

translation.en: And while we might trust our governments  any right we give away will be given away for good.
translation.zh: 我们2011年的当下 会信任我们的政府， 我们放弃的任何权力会永远失去。

translation.en: And do we trust, do we blindly trust,  any future government,  a government we might have  50 years from now?
translation.zh: 我们会不会信任未来的政府， 盲目地信任， 一个50年后的 政府呢？

translation.en: And these are the questions  that we have to worry about for the next 50 years.
translation.zh: 这些就是我们要为下一个50年 而担忧的问题。

translation.en: This is where I live. I live in Kenya,  at the south parts of the Nairobi National Park.
translation.zh: 这是我所生活的地方，肯尼亚， 在内罗毕国家公园的南部

translation.en: Those are my dad's cows at the back,  and behind the cows,  that's the Nairobi National Park.
translation.zh: 在我的身后是我父亲的奶牛 在奶牛的后边 就是内罗毕国家公园

translation.en: Nairobi National Park is not fenced in the south widely,  which means wild animals like zebras  migrate out of the park freely.
translation.zh: 内罗毕国家公园的南部并没有全部围起栅栏 这就意味着像斑马这样的野生动物 可以自由地在公园外移动

translation.en: So predators like lions follow them,  and this is what they do.
translation.zh: 所以像狮子这样的捕食者会跟随他们 这就是他们的所作所为，

translation.en: They kill our livestock.
translation.zh: 他们捕杀了我们的家畜。

translation.en: This is one of the cows which was killed at night,  and I just woke up in the morning and I found it dead,  and I felt so bad,  because it was the only bull we had.
translation.zh: 这就是其中一只在夜晚被杀害的奶牛 我在早晨醒来时就发现它已经死了， 我的心情槽透了， 因为这是我家里唯一的公牛

translation.en: My community, the Maasai, we believe that  we came from heaven with all our animals and all the land  for herding them, and that's why we value them so much.
translation.zh: 我们马赛族的人相信 我们是带着我们的动物和家园从天堂而来 然后放牧、生活，这就是我们为什么如此重视它们。

translation.en: So I grew up hating lions so much.
translation.zh: 所以我逐渐地变得十分厌恶狮子

translation.en: The morans are the warriors  who protect our community and the livestock,  and they're also upset about this problem.
translation.zh: 莫兰人都是勇士 他们保护我们的家族和牲畜 但是他们同样对这个问题感到沮丧，素手无策

translation.en: So they kill the lions.
translation.zh: 所以他们决定杀了这些狮子

translation.en: It's one of the six lions which were killed in Nairobi.
translation.zh: 这是他们在内罗毕国家公园杀的六个狮子中的其中一个

translation.en: And I think this is why the Nairobi National Park lions are few.
translation.zh: 我想这就是内罗毕公园的狮子会那么少的原因。

translation.en: So a boy, from six to nine years old, in my community  is responsible for his dad's cows,  and that's the same thing which happened to me.
translation.zh: 在我们家族，凡是六到九岁的男孩 都有肩负着保卫他们父亲奶牛的责任， 同样的事业发生在我身上。

translation.en: So I had to find a way of solving this problem.
translation.zh: 所以我必须找到一个解决问题的方法。

translation.en: And the first idea I got was to use fire,  because I thought lions were scared of fire.
translation.zh: 我想到的第一个办法是使用火， 因为我知道狮子们都惧怕火。

translation.en: But I came to realize that that didn't really help,  because it was even helping the lions  to see through the cowshed.
translation.zh: 但我又意识到这并没有什么成效， 反倒还帮助了狮子 看到了我们的牛棚。

translation.en: So I didn't give up. I continued.
translation.zh: 但我并没有因此放弃，我坚持不懈着

translation.en: And a second idea I got was  to use a scarecrow.
translation.zh: 于是有了第二个办法： 利用稻草人。

translation.en: I was trying to trick the lions  [into thinking] that I was standing near the cowshed.
translation.zh: 我想要欺骗狮子 让它们误以为是我站在牛舍旁边。

translation.en: But lions are very clever.   They will come the first day and they see the scarecrow, and they go back,  but the second day, they'll come and they say,  this thing is not moving here, it's always here.   So he jumps in and kills the animals.
translation.zh: 但是狮子十分聪明。 他们第一天来时看到了稻草人，然后就回去了。 但是第二天，他们会再来并且说： 这个东西从没动过，他一直呆在这儿 所以他们又跳进来，杀死了动物。

translation.en: So one night, I was walking around the cowshed with a torch,  and that day, the lions didn't come.
translation.zh: 有一天晚上，我拿着手电筒在牛棚边走动， 那天晚上，狮子并没有来。

translation.en: And I discovered that lions are afraid of a moving light.
translation.zh: 我开始意识到狮子们会害怕移动的光。

translation.en: So I had an idea.
translation.zh: 所以我又有了个主意。

translation.en: Since I was a small boy,  I used to work in my room for the whole day,  and I even took apart my mom's new radio,  and that day she almost killed me,  but I learned a lot about electronics.   So I got an old car battery,  an indicator box. It's a small device found in a motorcycle,  and it helps motorists when they want to turn right or left. It blinks.
translation.zh: 因为我当时是个小孩子， 我可以一整天不干别的，在自己的房间里鼓捣一天， 我甚至把我妈妈新买的收音机拆得七零八落， 那天她差点杀了我， 尽管如此，我学到了许多关于电子的知识。 所以我找到了一个旧的车用蓄电池， 一个指示器。这是一个从摩托车中找到的小装备， 用来控制摩托车的转向灯，能够让灯闪烁。

translation.en: And I got a switch where I can switch on the lights, on and off.
translation.zh: 同时我找到了一个开关，可以控制灯的亮灭。

translation.en: And that's a small torch from a broken flashlight.
translation.zh: 灯泡来自于一个坏掉的手电筒。

translation.en: So I set up everything.
translation.zh: 一切都准备好了。

translation.en: As you can see, the solar panel charges the battery,  and the battery supplies the power  to the small indicator box. I call it a transformer.
translation.zh: 就如你所见，由太阳能接收板来给电池充电， 再由电池来指示器给提供能量 我把这个叫做“变压器”，

translation.en: And the indicator box makes the lights flash.
translation.zh: 这个指示器又会使光线闪动，

translation.en: As you can see, the bulbs face outside,  because that's where the lions come from.
translation.zh: 你可以看到，这个电灯泡是朝外的， 因为狮子是从那儿过来的。

translation.en: And that's how it looks to lions when they come at night.
translation.zh: 当狮子晚上走近的时候看到的就是这个样子。

translation.en: The lights flash and trick  the lions into thinking I was walking around the cowshed,  but I was sleeping in my bed.
translation.zh: 这个灯光一闪动就会使狮子受到欺骗 它们会以为是我在牛棚附近走动， 但实际上，此时的我正在自己的床上做着春秋大梦。

translation.en: Thanks.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: So I set it up in my home two years ago,  and since then, we have never experienced any problem with lions.
translation.zh: 我在两年前把这个装置装在了我家中， 从那时起，我们就再没有狮子捕食家禽的烦恼了。

translation.en: And my neighboring homes heard about this idea.
translation.zh: 我的邻居们都听说了这个办法。

translation.en: One of them was this grandmother.
translation.zh: 他们中的其中一个就是这位老奶奶。

translation.en: She had a lot of her animals being killed by lions,  and she asked me if I could put the lights for her.
translation.zh: 她家有一大堆的家禽被狮子捕食了。 她问我是否可以帮她在家里也装一个这样的灯。

translation.en: And I said, "Yes."
translation.zh: 我欣然同意。

translation.en: So I put the lights. You can see at the back, those are the lion lights.
translation.zh: 我装上了这些灯，你们可以在背后看到，这些就是赶狮灯。

translation.en: Since now, I've set up seven homes around my community,  and they're really working.
translation.zh: 至今为止，我已为我们家族社区中的七户家庭装上了这个赶狮灯， 它们非常有用。

translation.en: And my idea is also being used now all over Kenya  for scaring other predators like hyenas, leopards,  and it's also being used  to scare elephants away from people's farms.
translation.zh: 现在，我的方法已经被肯尼亚的所有人使用 来驱赶其他类似的捕食动物，像鬣狗，美洲豹等 它们同样被用来 驱赶大象远离人类的农庄。

translation.en: Because of this invention, I was lucky to get a scholarship  in one of the best schools in Kenya,  Brookhouse International School,  and I'm really excited about this.
translation.zh: 我也很幸运地因为这项发明而获得了奖学金 这是肯尼亚最好的学校—— 布鲁克豪斯国际学校所颁发的， 我对此感到十分的兴奋。

translation.en: My new school now is coming in and helping  by fundraising and creating an awareness.
translation.zh: 我的新学校现在也加入进来，并帮助我 提高知名度并筹集更多资金。

translation.en: I even took my friends back to my community,  and we're installing the lights to the homes  which don't have [any], and I'm teaching them how to put them.
translation.zh: 我甚至将我的朋友带回我的社区， 帮助他们在没有赶狮灯的人家里安装这个 我教他们怎么安装。

translation.en: So one year ago, I was just a boy in the savanna grassland  herding my father's cows,  and I used to see planes flying over,  and I told myself that one day, I'll be there inside.
translation.zh: 一年前，我只是一个热带大草原上 帮爸爸放牛的普通男孩， 我常常看着飞机飞过， 并且告诉自己：总有一天，我也会在里面。

translation.en: And here I am today.
translation.zh: 今天，我做到了。

translation.en: I got a chance to come by plane for my first time for TED.
translation.zh: 我获得了乘飞机来TED的机会，这是我的第一次

translation.en: So my big dream is to become an aircraft engineer and pilot when I grow up.
translation.zh: 所以我伟大的梦想是：当我长大以后，成为一个飞机工程师兼飞行员。

translation.en: I used to hate lions, but now because my invention  is saving my father's cows and the lions,  we are able to stay with the lions without any conflict.
translation.zh: 我过去讨厌狮子，但是现在，就是因为我的发明 拯救了我爸爸的牛以及狮子 我们终于可以狮子和平共处了。

translation.en: Ashê olên. It means in my language, thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢（肯尼亚语）。在我的语言里，它的意思是：非常感谢！

translation.en: Chris Anderson: You have no idea how exciting it is  to hear a story like yours.
translation.zh: Chris Anderson：你不会相信， 听到你这样的故事是多么使人振奋。

translation.en: So you got this scholarship.Richard Turere: Yep.
translation.zh: 所以你已经拿到了这个奖学金。Richard Turere：是的。

translation.en: CA: You're working on other electrical inventions.
translation.zh: CA：你是不是正在进行另一项电子发明？

translation.en: What's the next one on your list?
translation.zh: 你的下一步计划是什么？

translation.en: RT: My next invention is,  I want to make an electric fence.CA: Electric fence?
translation.zh: RT：我的下一项发明是， 我想做一个电力栅栏。CA：电力栅栏？

translation.en: RT: But I know electric fences are already invented,  but I want to make mine.
translation.zh: RT：我知道，电力栅栏已经有了， 但是我只想做我自己的那一个。

translation.en: CA: You already tried it once, right, and you --RT: I tried it before,  but I stopped because it gave me a shock.   CA: In the trenches. Richard Turere, you are something else.
translation.zh: CA：你已经尝试过一次了，对吧，但是你——RT：我之前有过尝试， 但我停止了，因为它惊吓到我了。 CA：会是一场苦战。Richard Turere，你与众不同。

translation.en: We're going to cheer you on every step of the way, my friend.
translation.zh: 我们将为你在成长中的每一步喝彩，朋友。

translation.en: Thank you so much.RT: Thank you.
translation.zh: 很感谢你。RT：谢谢。

translation.en: When I was little, I thought my country was the best on the planet.
translation.zh: 当我还是个孩子的时候， 我认为我的国家是世界上最好的。

translation.en: And I grew up singing a song called "Nothing To Envy."
translation.zh: 我大一点后学会了一首叫做"无可羡慕"的歌，

translation.en: And I was very proud.
translation.zh: 我觉得十分自豪。

translation.en: In school, we spent a lot of time studying the history of Kim Il-Sung,  but we never learned much about the outside world,  except that America, South Korea, Japan are the enemies.
translation.zh: 在学校，我们用很多时间 来学习金日成的历史， 但是我们从来没有对外面的世界有过太多了解， 除了知道美国、韩国和日本是敌人外。

translation.en: Although I often wondered about the outside world,  I thought I would spend my entire life in North Korea,  until everything suddenly changed.
translation.zh: 虽然我也时常憧憬外面的世界， 我以为我会在朝鲜度过我的一生， 直到所有事情都忽然改变。

translation.en: When I was seven years old, I saw my first public execution.
translation.zh: 当我七岁的时候，我第一次见证了公开处决，

translation.en: But I thought my life in North Korea was normal.
translation.zh: 但是我认为我在朝鲜的生活很正常。

translation.en: My family was not poor,  and myself, I had never experienced hunger.
translation.zh: 我的家庭并不贫穷。 而且对我自己来说，我从来没有体验过饥饿的感觉。

translation.en: But one day, in 1995, my mom brought home a letter  from a coworker's sister.
translation.zh: 但是1995年的一天，我妈妈带了一封信回家 是从她同事的姐妹那里寄来的。

translation.en: It read, "When you read this,  our five family members will not exist in this world,  because we haven't eaten for the past three weeks.
translation.zh: 上面写道，”当你读到这封信时,我家的所有五个人 都将离开人世。 因为我们已经连续两周没有吃东西了。

translation.en: We are lying on the floor together,  and our bodies are so weak, we are waiting to die."
translation.zh: 我们现在一起躺在地板上， 我们的身体都太虚弱，准备等死。“

translation.en: I was so shocked.
translation.zh: 我当时非常震惊，

translation.en: This was the first time I heard that people in my country were suffering.
translation.zh: 那是我第一次听到 活在我的国家的人们所在承受的一切。

translation.en: Soon after, when I was walking past a train station,  I saw something terrible that to this day I can't erase from my memory.
translation.zh: 在这之后不久，当我走过一个火车站时， 我看到一件非常痛心的事情 让我难以忘怀。

translation.en: A lifeless woman was lying on the ground,  while an emaciated child in her arms  just stared helplessly at his mother's face.
translation.zh: 一个奄奄一息的女人正躺在地上， 怀里抱着一个虚弱的孩子， 那个孩子只能绝望地望着他母亲的脸。

translation.en: But nobody helped them,  because they were so focused on taking care of themselves and their families.
translation.zh: 但是没有人帮助他们， 因为大家连自己和自己的家人都无法顾全。

translation.en: A huge famine hit North Korea in the mid-1990s.
translation.zh: 90年代中期朝鲜发生了一次严重的饥荒。

translation.en: Ultimately, more than a million North Koreans died during the famine,  and many only survived by eating grass, bugs and tree bark.
translation.zh: 很不幸地，超过一百万朝鲜人 饿死在饥荒里。并且很多幸存者 是依靠吃草、虫子和树根活下来的。

translation.en: Power outages also became more and more frequent,  so everything around me was completely dark at night,  except for the sea of lights in China,  just across the river from my home.
translation.zh: 停电也变得越来越频繁， 到了晚上我周围的一切都变得漆黑一片， 除了中国的灯火通明， 只要穿过我家旁的河就是。

translation.en: I always wondered why they had lights, but we didn't.
translation.zh: 我经常思考为什么他们有灯火而我们没有。

translation.en: This is a satellite picture showing North Korea at night,  compared to neighbors.
translation.zh: 这是一张卫星图，拍摄了夜晚的朝鲜 和周边国家的比较。

translation.en: This is the Amnok River,  which serves as a part of the border between North Korea and China.
translation.zh: 这是鸭绿江， 作为着中国和朝鲜 边界的一部分。

translation.en: As you can see, the river can be very narrow at certain points,  allowing North Koreans to secretly cross.
translation.zh: 如同你们所见，这条河在某些地方非常窄， 窄到朝鲜人能借此偷渡到中国。

translation.en: But many die.
translation.zh: 但是很多尝试偷渡的人死了。

translation.en: Sometimes, I saw dead bodies floating down the river.
translation.zh: 有时候我看见尸体浮在水面上。

translation.en: I can't reveal many details about how I left North Korea,  but I only can say that during the ugly years of the famine,  I was sent to China to live with distant relatives.
translation.zh: 我不能披露太多我离开朝鲜时的细节， 但是我只能说那是在饥荒中最艰难的几年， 我被送到中国和远亲一起住。 当时我以为，

translation.en: But I only thought that I would be separated from my family for a short time.
translation.zh: 我只是和我的家人分开很短一段时间。

translation.en: I could have never imagined  that it would take 14 years to live together.
translation.zh: 但是我从没想到， 经历了14年我们才得以重聚。

translation.en: In China, it was hard living as a young girl without my family.
translation.zh: 在中国，我作为一个没家的小女孩过得很辛苦。

translation.en: I had no idea what life was going to be like  as a North Korean refugee.
translation.zh: 我根本不知道，身为一个朝鲜的难民 我未来的生活会怎样。

translation.en: But I soon learned it's not only extremely difficult,  it's also very dangerous,  since North Korean refugees are considered in China as illegal migrants.
translation.zh: 但是我很快意识到那生活不但充满了艰辛， 甚至无比危险。 因为朝鲜难民在中国 被视为非法移民，

translation.en: So I was living in constant fear that my identity could be revealed,  and I would be repatriated to a horrible fate,  back in North Korea.
translation.zh: 所以我总是生活在恐惧中， 我害怕我的身份会被人发现。 我会被遣送回朝鲜， 去接受悲惨的命运。

translation.en: One day, my worst nightmare came true,  when I was caught by the Chinese police,  and brought to the police station for interrogation.
translation.zh: 有一天，我最糟糕的恶梦成真了， 我被中国警察抓住 并带去警察局接受审问。

translation.en: Someone had accused me of being North Korean,  so they tested my Chinese language abilities,  and asked me tons of questions.
translation.zh: 有人指控我是朝鲜人， 所以警察测试了我的汉语能力， 并且问了我很多问题。

translation.en: I was so scared.
translation.zh: 我当时非常害怕，

translation.en: I thought my heart was going to explode.
translation.zh: 感觉我的心都快因恐惧而爆炸了。

translation.en: If anything seemed unnatural, I could be imprisoned and repatriated.
translation.zh: 如果有任何异样，我就会入狱 并被遣送回去，

translation.en: I thought my life was over.
translation.zh: 我以为我这辈子完了。

translation.en: But I managed to control all the emotions inside me,  and answer the questions.
translation.zh: 尽管如此，我还是努力隐藏了自己的恐惧和担忧， 并回答了他们的问题。

translation.en: After they finished questioning me,  one official said to another,  "This was a false report. She's not North Korean."
translation.zh: 这之后， 一个警察对另一个人说，“ 报告是错误的， 她不是朝鲜人。”

translation.en: And they let me go. It was a miracle.
translation.zh: 然后他们放我走了。真是个奇迹。

translation.en: Some North Koreans in China seek asylum in foreign embassies.
translation.zh: 一些朝鲜人在中国 到外国大使馆去寻求庇护，

translation.en: But many can be caught by the Chinese police,  and repatriated.
translation.zh: 但是很多人被中国警察抓住， 并被送回朝鲜。

translation.en: These girls were so lucky.
translation.zh: 这些女孩是幸运的，

translation.en: Even though they were caught,  they were eventually released, after heavy international pressure.
translation.zh: 尽管她们被抓住了， 但是迫于巨大的国际舆论压力 她们最终被释放了。

translation.en: These North Koreans were not so lucky.
translation.zh: 但还有一些朝鲜人就没那么幸运了。

translation.en: Every year, countless North Koreans are caught in China  and repatriated to North Korea,  where they can be tortured, imprisoned, or publicly executed.
translation.zh: 每年，无数的朝鲜人在中国被捕 并被遣送， 回到朝鲜后，他们被折磨、关押 或者被公开处决。

translation.en: Even though I was really fortunate to get out,  many other North Koreans have not been so lucky.
translation.zh: 尽管我足够幸运能离开朝鲜， 我的好多同胞却没有这样的好运气。

translation.en: It's tragic that North Koreans have to hide their identities  and struggle so hard just to survive.
translation.zh: 这是个很悲惨的事实，那就是朝鲜人必须要隐姓埋名， 如此努力仅仅为了能生存下去。

translation.en: Even after learning a new language and getting a job,  their whole world can be turned upside down in an instant.
translation.zh: 即使他们学会了中文，找到了工作， 他们的整个世界也会在顷刻间颠覆。

translation.en: That's why, after 10 years of hiding my identity,  I decided to risk going to South Korea.
translation.zh: 这就是为什么，在隐姓埋名10年后， 我决定冒险去韩国。

translation.en: And I started a new life yet again.
translation.zh: 就这样，我又一次开始了新的生活。

translation.en: Settling down in South Korea  was a lot more challenging than I had expected.
translation.zh: 在韩国定居比我想象的更加困难 并且充满了挑战。

translation.en: English was so important in South Korea,  so I had to start learning my third language.
translation.zh: 英语在韩国太重要了， 所以我必须要开始学习第三门语言——英语。

translation.en: Also, I realized there was a wide gap between North and South.
translation.zh: 此外，我意识到， 韩国与朝鲜之间有巨大的差异。

translation.en: We are all Korean, but inside,  we have become very different, due to 67 years of division.
translation.zh: 尽管我们都是朝鲜族人， 但是我们的内在已经变得非常不同了， 由于67年的分裂。

translation.en: I even went through an identity crisis.
translation.zh: 我甚至经历了自我身份的质疑。

translation.en: Am I South Korean or North Korean?
translation.zh: 我到底是韩国人还是朝鲜人？

translation.en: Where am I from? Who am I?
translation.zh: 我从哪里来？我是谁？

translation.en: Suddenly, there was no country I could proudly call my own.
translation.zh: 突然间，我似乎无法骄傲地称任何一个国家 为我自己的国家。

translation.en: Even though adjusting to life in South Korea was not easy,  I made a plan -- I started studying for the university entrance exam.
translation.zh: 尽管适应韩国的生活并不是易事， 但是我还是决定 准备大学入学考试。

translation.en: Just as I was starting to get used to my new life,  I received a shocking phone call.
translation.zh: 就在我刚开始习惯新生活不久， 我接到了一个令人震惊的电话。

translation.en: The North Korean authorities intercepted some money  that I sent to my family,  and, as a punishment, my family was going to be forcibly removed  to a desolate location in the countryside.
translation.zh: 朝鲜政府拦截了 我寄回家的部分钱款， 作为惩罚，我的家人要被 强制搬走， 搬到农村的一个偏僻的地方去。

translation.en: They had to get out quickly.
translation.zh: 他们必须要赶快逃走，

translation.en: So I started planning how to help them escape.
translation.zh: 所以我开始计划帮助他们逃脱。

translation.en: North Koreans have to travel incredible distances  on the path to freedom.
translation.zh: 朝鲜人通往自由的道路 是如此遥不可及。

translation.en: It's almost impossible to cross the border  between North Korea and South Korea.
translation.zh: 要想穿越朝鲜与韩国 的边境几乎是不可能的，

translation.en: So, ironically, I took a flight back to China  and headed toward the North Korean border.
translation.zh: 所以，颇具讽刺意味的是，我坐飞机到了中国 然后再前往中朝边境。

translation.en: Since my family couldn't speak Chinese,  I had to guide them somehow through more than 2,000 miles  in China, and then into Southeast Asia.
translation.zh: 因为我的家人不懂中文， 所以我得帮助他们 在中国穿越2000多公里， 进入东南亚。

translation.en: The journey by bus took one week,  and we were almost caught several times.
translation.zh: 我们在巴士上的旅途有一周之久， 好几次都差点被抓住。

translation.en: One time, our bus was stopped and boarded by a Chinese police officer.
translation.zh: 又一次，我们坐的巴士被拦下了， 一个中国警官上了车，

translation.en: He took everyone's I.D. cards,  and he started asking them questions.
translation.zh: 他查看每个人的身份证， 并开始问问题。

translation.en: Since my family couldn't understand Chinese,  I thought my family was going to be arrested.
translation.zh: 因为我的家人不懂中文， 我害怕他们会被抓住。

translation.en: As the Chinese officer approached my family,  I impulsively stood up, and I told him  that these are deaf and dumb people that I was chaperoning.
translation.zh: 所以当那个中国警官快检查到我家人时， 我本能地站起来告诉他 这几位是聋哑人， 我是他们的监护人。

translation.en: He looked at me suspiciously,  but luckily, he believed me.
translation.zh: 他怀疑地看着我， 但幸运地，他相信了我的话。

translation.en: We made it all the way to the border of Laos.
translation.zh: 就这样我们一路来到了老挝，

translation.en: But I had to spend almost all my money  to bribe the border guards in Laos.
translation.zh: 但是我却要几乎花光全部积蓄来 贿赂老挝的边境警察。

translation.en: But even after we got past the border,  my family was arrested and jailed for illegal border crossing.
translation.zh: 而且即使我们过了这一关， 我的家人还是因非法入境， 被捕入狱了。

translation.en: After I paid the fine and bribe,  my family was released in one month.
translation.zh: 在我交了罚金和贿赂用的钱后， 我的家人一个月后被释放了，

translation.en: But soon after, my family was arrested and jailed again,  in the capital of Laos.
translation.zh: 但不久后，他们在老挝的首都， 又被抓起来了。

translation.en: This was one of the lowest points in my life.
translation.zh: 那是我人生中最低落的时刻之一。

translation.en: I did everything to get my family to freedom,  and we came so close,  but my family was thrown in jail,  just a short distance from the South Korean embassy.
translation.zh: 我为了让我的家人获得自由，倾尽所能 然而就在快要成功的时候， 家人却又要经历牢狱之灾， 并且这个监狱离朝鲜大使馆并不远。

translation.en: I went back and forth between the immigration office  and the police station,  desperately trying to get my family out.
translation.zh: 我在移民局和警察局， 来来回回折腾了好多次， 绝望地努力着，希望能把他们救出来，

translation.en: but I didn't have enough money to pay a bribe or fine anymore.
translation.zh: 但是我已没有足够的钱 来贿赂或是交罚金了。

translation.en: I lost all hope.
translation.zh: 我心灰意冷。

translation.en: At that moment, I heard one man's voice ask me,  "What's wrong?"
translation.zh: 就在这时，我听见一个人问我， “怎么了？” 我很是诧异，

translation.en: I was so surprised that a total stranger cared enough to ask.
translation.zh: 一个完全的陌生人这样关切地询问。

translation.en: In my broken English, and with a dictionary,  I explained the situation, and without hesitating,  the man went to the ATM,  and he paid the rest of the money for my family,  and two other North Koreans to get out of jail.
translation.zh: 我用蹩脚的英文再借助字典， 毫不犹豫地向那个人解释了情况。 那个人走去ATM机， 为我的家人以及另两个朝鲜人 支付了出狱的剩余的所有费用。

translation.en: I thanked him with all my heart, and I asked him,  "Why are you helping me?"
translation.zh: 我真心地感谢他，并问道， “你为什么要帮助我？”

translation.en: "I'm not helping you," he said.
translation.zh: “我并不是在帮助你，”他回答，

translation.en: "I'm helping the North Korean people."
translation.zh: “我是在帮助朝鲜的人们。“

translation.en: I realized that this was a symbolic moment in my life.
translation.zh: 我当时就意识到那是我人生很有象征意义的一个时刻。

translation.en: The kind stranger symbolized new hope for me and the North Korean people,  when we needed it most.
translation.zh: 那个善良的陌生人象征着我以及 朝鲜人最需要的希望。

translation.en: And he showed me that the kindness of strangers  and the support of the international community  are truly the rays of hope we North Korean people need.
translation.zh: 他使我明白，陌生人的善意 和国际社会的支持 真是我们朝鲜人需要的希望之光。

translation.en: Eventually, after our long journey,  my family and I were reunited in South Korea.
translation.zh: 最终，在经历了漫长的旅行后， 我和家人终于在韩国重聚。

translation.en: But getting to freedom is only half the battle.
translation.zh: 但是获得自由只是打赢了战争的一半。

translation.en: Many North Koreans are separated from their families,  and when they arrive in a new country,  they start with little or no money.
translation.zh: 很多朝鲜人和他们的家人分离， 并且当他们来到新的国家时， 他们通常都只有很少的钱，或者身无分文。

translation.en: So we can benefit from the international community  for education, English language training, job training, and more.
translation.zh: 所以我们可以通过国际社会的帮助 来接受教育，英语培训， 工作培训等等。

translation.en: We can also act as a bridge  between the people inside North Korea and the outside world.
translation.zh: 我们还可以作为 世界与生活在朝鲜的同胞之间 的沟通桥梁。

translation.en: Because many of us stay in contact with family members still inside,  and we send information and money  that is helping to change North Korea from inside.
translation.zh: 因为我们很多人都和 生活在朝鲜的家人保持联系。 我们寄送回去的信息和钱 都在内在地改变朝鲜。

translation.en: I've been so lucky, received so much help and inspiration in my life,  so I want to help give aspiring North Koreans  a chance to prosper with international support.
translation.zh: 我是如此幸运， 在人生中得到了这么多帮助和启示， 所以我想帮助那些心怀梦想的朝鲜人 在国际的援助下， 一个实现梦想的机会。

translation.en: I'm confident that you will see more and more North Koreans  succeeding all over the world,  including the TED stage.
translation.zh: 我有信心你们将会看到越来越多的 朝鲜人在世界的舞台上取得成功， 包括TED这个舞台。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: I live in South Central.
translation.zh: 我生活在洛杉矶南区。

translation.en: This is South Central:  liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
translation.zh: 这就是洛杉矶南区： 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

translation.en: So the city planners, they get together and they figure  they're going to change the name South Central to make it represent something else,  so they change it to South Los Angeles,  like this is going to fix what's really going wrong in the city.
translation.zh: 因此城市的规划者他们坐在一起讨论 想把洛杉矶南区这个名字改的代表点别的什么含义， 所以他们把它改成了南洛杉矶， 好像这将要解决这个城市真正的问题似的。

translation.en: This is South Los Angeles.   Liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
translation.zh: 这是南洛杉矶 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

translation.en: Just like 26.5 million other Americans,  I live in a food desert,  South Central Los Angeles,  home of the drive-thru and the drive-by.
translation.zh: 和其他两千六百五十万的美国人一样， 我生活在食物的荒漠， 洛杉矶南区， 是得来速（快餐商业模式，顾客不用下车即可获得服务）和飞车的家园。

translation.en: Funny thing is, the drive-thrus are killing more people than the drive-bys.
translation.zh: 有趣的是得来速比飞车杀死的人更多。

translation.en: People are dying from curable diseases  For instance, the obesity rate in my neighborhood  is five times higher than, say, Beverly Hills,  which is probably eight, 10 miles away.
translation.zh: 人们死于可治愈的疾病。 举个例子，我所住的街区的肥胖率 要比相距我们10英里不到的比佛利山庄 高出5倍，也许是8倍。

translation.en: I got tired of seeing this happening.
translation.zh: 我厌倦了这些现实。

translation.en: And I was wondering, how would you feel if you had no access to healthy food,  if every time you walk out your door you see the ill effects  that the present food system has on your neighborhood?
translation.zh: 同时我在考虑，如果没有途径去得到健康的食物 你的感受是什么， 如果每次你从家里出来，看到在你的社区 现有的食物系统的不良影响，你的感受是什么？

translation.en: I see wheelchairs bought and sold  like used cars.
translation.zh: 我看到轮椅像二手汽车一样 进行买卖。

translation.en: I see dialysis centers popping up like Starbucks.
translation.zh: 我看到透析中心像星巴克一样不断涌现。

translation.en: And I figured, this has to stop.
translation.zh: 我想不能再这样下去了。

translation.en: So I figured that the problem is the solution.
translation.zh: 我认为答案已经藏在问题之中。

translation.en: Food is the problem and food is the solution.
translation.zh: 食物是问题，食物也是解决方案。

translation.en: Plus I got tired of driving 45 minutes round trip  to get an apple that wasn't impregnated with pesticides.
translation.zh: 再加上我着实厌倦了开45分钟的来回 去买个没打过杀虫剂的苹果。

translation.en: So what I did, I planted a food forest in front of my house.
translation.zh: 因此我做的，就是在我的房子前种上食物森林。

translation.en: It was on a strip of land that we call a parkway.
translation.zh: 它位于我们称为公园路的绿化带上。

translation.en: It's 150 feet by 10 feet.
translation.zh: 150英尺乘以10英尺大小。

translation.en: Thing is, it's owned by the city.
translation.zh: 绿化带归政府所有。

translation.en: But you have to maintain it.
translation.zh: 但是总需要有人维护它。

translation.en: So I'm like, "Cool. I can do whatever the hell I want,  since it's my responsibility and I gotta maintain it."
translation.zh: 因此我觉得，“太好了！这是我的责任，我必须维护它， 所以我想做什么就可以做什么了！”

translation.en: And this is how I decided to maintain it.
translation.zh: 这是我为何要维护它的原因。

translation.en: So me and my group, L.A. Green Grounds, we got together  and we started planting my food forest, fruit trees,  you know, the whole nine, vegetables.
translation.zh: 因此我和我的团队，“洛杉矶绿地”，我们聚在一起 开始种植自己的食物森林，果树， 还有整整九种蔬菜。

translation.en: What we do, we're a pay-it-forward kind of group,  where it's composed of gardeners from all walks of life,  from all over the city, and it's completely volunteer,  and everything we do is free.
translation.zh: 我们是一个自由的组织， 由来自不同行业不同城市的园丁组成。 大家全都是志愿者， 我们所做的一切都是义务的。

translation.en: And the garden, it was beautiful.
translation.zh: 花园非常的美丽，

translation.en: And then somebody complained.
translation.zh: 但是很快就有人抱怨。

translation.en: The city came down on me,  and basically gave me a citation saying that I had to remove my garden,  which this citation was turning into a warrant.
translation.zh: 政府指责我， 给了我张告票通知我必须移除我的花园， 之后告票变成了警告函。

translation.en: And I'm like, "Come on, really?
translation.zh: 我心想“搞什么，来真的？

translation.en: A warrant for planting food on a piece of land  that you could care less about?"   And I was like, "Cool. Bring it."
translation.zh: 禁止在一小块土地上种食物 而之前这块土地却没人关心？ 然后我想，”酷，就这样吧。“

translation.en: Because this time it wasn't coming up.
translation.zh: 因为这次什么都没发生。

translation.en: So L.A. Times got ahold of it. Steve Lopez did a story on it and talked to the councilman,  and one of the Green Grounds members,  they put up a petition on Change.org,  and with 900 signatures, we were a success.
translation.zh: 所以洛杉矶时报报道了，斯蒂夫·洛佩兹写了个关于它的故事 并和议员以及一个绿地组织的成员 进行了交谈， 他们将请愿书上传到了Change.org， 并且收集到了900个签名，我们成功 了！

translation.en: We had a victory on our hands.
translation.zh: 我们用我们的双手获得成功。

translation.en: My councilman even called in and said how they endorse  and love what we're doing.
translation.zh: 议员甚至前来拜访，表达了他有多么赞赏 和热爱我们所做的。

translation.en: I mean, come on, why wouldn't they?
translation.zh: 我的意思是，当然啦，他们怎么能不这么做呢？

translation.en: L.A. leads the United States in vacant lots that the city actually owns.
translation.zh: 洛杉矶所拥有的空地的数量在美国名列前茅。

translation.en: They own 26 square miles of vacant lots.
translation.zh: 它拥有26平方公里的空地。

translation.en: That's 20 Central Parks.
translation.zh: 那是20个中央公园。

translation.en: That's enough space to plant 725 million tomato plants.
translation.zh: 有足够的空间去种植七亿两千五百万的番茄。

translation.en: Why in the hell would they not okay this?
translation.zh: 他们究竟为什么觉得这样不好呢？

translation.en: Growing one plant will give you 1,000, 10,000 seeds.
translation.zh: 种一棵树能够收到一千，甚至一万颗种子。

translation.en: When one dollar's worth of green beans  will give you 75 dollars' worth of produce.
translation.zh: 一美元的绿豆可以为你 带来75美元的收成。

translation.en: It's my gospel, when I'm telling people, grow your own food.
translation.zh: 这是我的信条，我告诉人们，种植你们自己的食物吧。

translation.en: Growing your own food is like printing your own money.
translation.zh: 自己种食物就好像自己印钱似的。

translation.en: See, I have a legacy in South Central.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 瞧，在洛杉矶我有了遗产。

translation.en: I grew up there. I raised my sons there.
translation.zh: 我在那里成长，我在那里养育我的儿子。

translation.en: And I refuse to be a part of this manufactured reality  that was manufactured for me by some other people,  and I'm manufacturing my own reality.
translation.zh: 我拒绝成为由别人为我打造的 这种现实的一部分 我要自己创造自己的现实。

translation.en: See, I'm an artist.
translation.zh: 看到了吧，我是个艺术家。

translation.en: Gardening is my graffiti. I grow my art.
translation.zh: 园艺工作就是我的涂鸦，我创造自己的艺术。

translation.en: Just like a graffiti artist, where they beautify walls,  me, I beautify lawns, parkways.
translation.zh: 就好像涂鸦艺术家一样，他们美化墙壁。 而我，美化草坪，绿化带。

translation.en: I use the garden, the soil, like it's a piece of cloth,  and the plants and the trees,  that's my embellishment for that cloth.
translation.zh: 我把花园和土地视为画布， 而植物和树木 就是我在画布上的装饰。

translation.en: You'd be surprised what the soil could do  if you let it be your canvas.
translation.zh: 你可能会震惊土地所能做的 如果你把它当成你的画布。

translation.en: You just couldn't imagine how amazing a sunflower is  and how it affects people.
translation.zh: 你无法想象向日葵有多么的神奇， 以及它将对人产生何种影响。

translation.en: So what happened?
translation.zh: 会发生什么呢？

translation.en: I have witnessed my garden become a tool for the education,  a tool for the transformation of my neighborhood.
translation.zh: 我目睹了我的花园变为了教育的工具， 变为了我社区改革的工具。

translation.en: To change the community, you have to change the composition of the soil.
translation.zh: 为了改变社区，你必须改变土壤的成分。

translation.en: We are the soil.
translation.zh: 我们就是土壤。

translation.en: You'd be surprised how kids are affected by this.
translation.zh: 你会为孩子们如何被影响而震惊。

translation.en: Gardening is the most therapeutic  and defiant act you can do,  especially in the inner city.
translation.zh: 园艺活动是最有益于身体健康以及 挑战性十足的活动， 尤其是这项活动在市中心进行。

translation.en: Plus you get strawberries.
translation.zh: 再加上你还能收获草莓。

translation.en: I remember this time,  there was this mother and a daughter came,  it was, like, 10:30 at night, and they were in my yard,  and I came out and they looked so ashamed.
translation.zh: 我记得有次， 一个妈妈和女儿在 差不多晚上10点半的时候偷偷摸摸的出现在我的菜园， 当我出来看到她们，她们显得非常难为情。

translation.en: So I'm like, man, it made me feel bad that they were there,  and I told them, you know, you don't have to do this like this.
translation.zh: 她们的出现使我感觉非常糟糕， 我告诉他们，你们不用像这样来拿食物。

translation.en: This is on the street for a reason.
translation.zh: 这是菜园在街上的原因。

translation.en: It made me feel ashamed to see people  that were this close to me that were hungry,  and this only reinforced why I do this,  and people asked me, "Fin, aren't you afraid  people are going to steal your food?"
translation.zh: 当我看到我身边的人们 饿着肚子时，这让我觉得非常羞愧。 这加强了我做（食物森林）的决心。 人们问我，“Fin，你难道不怕 人们来偷你食物吗？”

translation.en: And I'm like, "Hell no, I ain't afraid they're gonna steal it.
translation.zh: 我回答说，“当然不啦，我当然不怕人们会偷它，

translation.en: That's why it's on the street.
translation.zh: 而这也是为什么它在街上的原因。

translation.en: That's the whole idea.
translation.zh: 这正是我想要的。

translation.en: I want them to take it, but at the same time,  I want them to take back their health."
translation.zh: 我想要人们拿走它，但是同时， 我也希望人们能够重归健康的身体。”

translation.en: There's another time when I put  a garden in this homeless shelter in downtown Los Angeles.
translation.zh: 还有一次当我 在洛杉矶市中心的一个流浪汉之家安置了一个花园。

translation.en: These are the guys, they helped me unload the truck.
translation.zh: 这些小伙子帮助我卸了货。

translation.en: It was cool, and they just shared the stories  about how this affected them and how  they used to plant with their mother and their grandmother,  and it was just cool to see how this changed them,  if it was only for that one moment.
translation.zh: 这很酷，他们分享了关于花园如何对他们 产生影响以及他们如何与自己的 母亲以及祖母一起种植的故事， 看到花园可以改变他们真是一件非常酷的事情， 仅仅为了这一刻，

translation.en: So Green Grounds has gone on to plant  maybe 20 gardens.
translation.zh: 绿地组织又开始安置 也许是20个花园。

translation.en: We've had, like, 50 people come to our dig-ins  and participate, and it's all volunteers.
translation.zh: 我们已经有大约50人参与到我们的团队中来， 他们全都是志愿者。

translation.en: If kids grow kale, kids eat kale.
translation.zh: 如果孩子们种植甘蓝，孩子们就会吃甘蓝。

translation.en: If they grow tomatoes, they eat tomatoes.   But when none of this is presented to them,  if they're not shown how food affects the mind and the body,  they blindly eat whatever the hell you put in front of them.
translation.zh: 如果他们种植番茄，他们就会吃番茄。 但是当这些都没有呈现在孩子们眼前， 如果他们并没有体会到食物是如何影响人的想法和身体的， 他们只是盲目的吃着任何摆在他们面前的食物。

translation.en: I see young people  and they want to work,  but they're in this thing where they're caught up --  I see kids of color and they're just on this track  that's designed for them,  that leads them to nowhere.
translation.zh: 我看到年轻人们 他们想要工作， 但是他们都很乐意在这件事上花时间， 我看到不同肤色的孩子们，他们一直循规蹈矩 走着别人为他们设计的路， 而这条路却不知所终。

translation.en: So with gardening, I see an opportunity  where we can train these kids  to take over their communities,  to have a sustainable life.
translation.zh: 当进行园艺活动时，我发现了一个机会 我们能训练这些孩子们 接管他们的社区， 过上一种可持续发展的生活。

translation.en: And when we do this, who knows?
translation.zh: 我们这么做的时候，谁知道我们是否会

translation.en: We might produce the next George Washington Carver.
translation.zh: 培养出下一个乔治华盛顿呢。

translation.en: but if we don't change the composition of the soil,  we will never do this.
translation.zh: 但是如果我们不改变土壤的成分， 我们永远不会这样做。

translation.en: Now this is one of my plans. This is what I want to do.
translation.zh: 这使我目前计划中的一个。这是我想要做的。

translation.en: I want to plant a whole block of gardens  where people can share in the food in the same block.
translation.zh: 我想要种一整个街区的菜园 在这个街区人们能够分享食物。

translation.en: I want to take shipping containers  and turn them into healthy cafes.
translation.zh: 我想要把集装箱 改造为健康的咖啡屋。

translation.en: Now don't get me wrong.
translation.zh: 别误会。

translation.en: I'm not talking about no free shit,  because free is not sustainable.
translation.zh: 我没想着免费， 因为免费是不能持续的。

translation.en: The funny thing about sustainability,  you have to sustain it.
translation.zh: 而可持续性的搞笑之处在于 你必须维持它。

translation.en: What I'm talking about is putting people to work,  and getting kids off the street, and letting them know  the joy, the pride and the honor in growing your own food,  opening farmer's markets.
translation.zh: 我所讲的就是让人们得到工作， 让孩子们远离街道，让他们了解 自己种植食物的喜悦，荣誉和荣耀， 开放农民市场。

translation.en: So what I want to do here,  we gotta make this sexy.
translation.zh: 因此我想要做的 是想把这个计划弄的更加吸引人。

translation.en: So I want us all to become ecolutionary renegades,  gangstas, gangsta gardeners.
translation.zh: 我想要我们成为环境革命的叛徒， 流氓，流氓园丁。

translation.en: We gotta flip the script on what a gangsta is.
translation.zh: 我们要改写流氓的定义

translation.en: If you ain't a gardener, you ain't gangsta.
translation.zh: 如果你不是个园丁，那你就不是个流氓。

translation.en: Get gangsta with your shovel, okay?
translation.zh: 当个拿铲子的流氓，怎么样？

translation.en: And let that be your weapon of choice.
translation.zh: 让铲子成为你选择的武器吧。

translation.en: So basically, if you want to meet with me,  you know, if you want to meet,  don't call me if you want to sit around in cushy chairs  and have meetings where you talk about doing some shit --  where you talk about doing some shit.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 基本上，如果你们想见我， 如果想要碰面， 如果想坐在舒适的椅子上 讲一些有的没的 就别给我打电话。

translation.en: If you want to meet with me, come to the garden  with your shovel so we can plant some shit.
translation.zh: 如果想见我，就拿着铁铲来花园吧 这样我们就可以种点东西啦。

translation.en: Peace. Thank you.
translation.zh: 讲完了，谢谢！

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: You probably all agree with me  that this is a very nice road.
translation.zh: (锤声）  （微波炉声） 你们也许会同意 这条路很不错。

translation.en: It's made of asphalt,  and asphalt is a very nice material to drive on,  but not always, especially not on these days as today,  when it's raining a lot.
translation.zh: 它是沥青做的， 沥青是一种很好的材料，在上面开车很好 但也不总是，特别是像今天这样的天气， 下大雨的时候。

translation.en: Then you can have a lot of splash water in the asphalt.
translation.zh: 在沥青路上会溅起很多水。

translation.en: And especially if you then ride with your bicycle,  and pass these cars, then that's not very nice.
translation.zh: 尤其是如果你正骑着自行车， 与那些车擦肩而过，就不太好啦。

translation.en: Also, asphalt can create a lot of noise.
translation.zh: 同时，沥青路会产生很大噪音。

translation.en: It's a noisy material,  and if we produce roads like in the Netherlands,  very close to cities, then we would like a silent road.
translation.zh: 这种材料有点吵， 如果我们要修的路紧邻城市， 像荷兰的道路那样，我们就会希望噪音小一些。

translation.en: The solution for that is to make roads  out of porous asphalt.
translation.zh: 解决的办法就是 使用多孔沥青来修路。

translation.en: Porous asphalt, a material that we use now  in most of the highways in the Netherlands,  it has pores and water can just rain through it,  so all the rainwater will flow away to the sides,  and you have a road that's easy to drive on,  so no splash water anymore.
translation.zh: 多孔沥青这种材料 用在荷兰的多数高速公路上， 它有些小毛孔让水渗过去， 雨水会流向旁边， 路上驾车就容易了， 也没有溅起的水花。

translation.en: Also the noise will disappear in these pores.
translation.zh: 噪音也会消失在这些毛孔里。

translation.en: Because it's very hollow, all the noise will disappear,  so it's a very silent road.
translation.zh: 因为它有很多空洞，相互抵消了噪音， 所以路就很安静。

translation.en: It also has disadvantages, of course,  and the disadvantage of this road is that raveling can occur.
translation.zh: 当然，它也有缺点， 这种路的缺点是沥青可能会松脱。

translation.en: What is raveling? You see that in this road  that the stones at the surface come off.
translation.zh: 什么叫松脱？看看这条路 路面上的石头脱落。

translation.en: First you get one stone, then several more,  and more and more and more and more,  and then they -- well, I will not do that.   But they can damage your windshield,  so you're not happy with that.
translation.zh: 开始一块，接着几块， 越来越多， 后来就——我就不演示了。 但它们会损坏你的挡风玻璃， 你肯定不高兴。

translation.en: And finally, this raveling can also lead to more and more damage.
translation.zh: 最后，这种松脱会带来越来越多的损害。

translation.en: Sometimes you can create potholes with that.
translation.zh: 有时候路面会出现坑槽

translation.en: Ha. He's ready.
translation.zh: 哈，他早有准备。

translation.en: Potholes, of course, that can become a problem,  but we have a solution.
translation.zh: 坑坑洼洼当然会变成问题， 但我们有解决的办法。

translation.en: Here you see actually how the damage appears in this material.
translation.zh: 这里你看到的是这种材料上出现的损害。

translation.en: It's a porous asphalt, like I said, so you have only  a small amount of binder between the stones.
translation.zh: 这是沥青，就像我说的， 石头中间有少量的粘合剂。

translation.en: Due to weathering, due to U.V. light, due to oxidation,  this binder, this bitumen,  the glue between the aggregates is going to shrink,  and if it shrinks, it gets micro-cracks,  and it delaminates from the aggregates.
translation.zh: 由于风化、紫外线、氧化等原因 这种粘合剂，这种沥青， 集料之间的黏胶会收缩， 如果它收缩，就会有小裂纹， 从集块开始会出现分层。

translation.en: Then if you drive over the road, you take out the aggregates --  what we just saw here.
translation.zh: 如果你在这种路上行驶，你会带出这些集料-- 就是我们看到的。

translation.en: To solve this problem, we thought of self-healing materials.
translation.zh: 为了解决这个问题，我们考虑到了自我修复材料。

translation.en: If we can make this material self-healing,  then probably we have a solution.
translation.zh: 如果我们能让这种材料自我修复， 就有可能有解决方案。

translation.en: So what we can do is use steel wool just to clean pans,  and the steel wool we can cut in very small pieces,  and these very small pieces we can mix to the bitumen.
translation.zh: 我们用的就是清洁厨具用的钢丝绒， 钢丝绒可以裁成很小块， 我们把这些小块混进沥青。

translation.en: So then you have asphalt  with very small pieces of steel wool in it.
translation.zh: 所以现在的沥青 有一些小钢丝绒在里面。

translation.en: Then you need a machine, like you see here,  that you can use for cooking -- an induction machine.
translation.zh: 你再需要一个像这样的机器， 一个感应电机——它可以用来做饭。

translation.en: Induction can heat, especially steel; it's very good at that.
translation.zh: 感应电机可以加热东西，尤其擅长加热钢铁

translation.en: Then what you do is you heat up the steel,  you melt the bitumen,  and the bitumen will flow into these micro-cracks,  and the stones are again fixed to the surface.
translation.zh: 所以我们要做的就是把钢铁加热， 把沥青溶化， 沥青就会流进那些小裂缝里， 脱落的小石子就又被粘上了。

translation.en: Today I use a microwave because I cannot take  the big induction machine here onstage.
translation.zh: 由于感应电机太大了拿不上来， 我在这里就用微波炉演示了。

translation.en: So a microwave is a similar system.
translation.zh: 微波炉跟感应电机的原理类似。

translation.en: So I put the specimen in, which I'm now going to take out  to see what happened.
translation.zh: 我把样品放进去了，现在把它拿出来 看看发生了什么事。

translation.en: So this is the specimen coming out now.
translation.zh: 这是样品现在的样子。

translation.en: So I said we have such an industrial machine in the lab  to heat up the specimens.
translation.zh: 我们实验室里有工业用的机器 来加热样品。

translation.en: We tested a lot of specimens there,  and then the government, they actually saw our results,  and they thought, "Well, that's very interesting. We have to try that."
translation.zh: 我们测试过很多样品， 政府也看过我们的结果， 他们决定，“这很有趣，我们应该试一下。”

translation.en: So they donated to us a piece of highway,  400 meters of the A58, where we had to make  a test track to test this material.
translation.zh: 政府免费授权了一段高速公路给我们， 在A58号上400米的距离， 我们就在那里做了材料测试。

translation.en: So that's what we did here. You see where we were making the test road,  and then of course this road will last several years  without any damage. That's what we know from practice.
translation.zh: 这就是我们做的。你看到的就是做的实验路段， 当然这段路近几年不会坏。 我们在实践中确认了这点。

translation.en: So we took a lot of samples from this road  and we tested them in the lab.
translation.zh: 我们在这段路上取了很多样品 在实验室里进行各种测试。

translation.en: So we did aging on the samples,  did a lot of loading on it, healed them with our induction machine,  and healed them and tested them again.
translation.zh: 我们做了老化实验， 加了很多负载，用我们的感应电机给它们加热， 重复加热和测试。

translation.en: Several times we can repeat that.
translation.zh: 我们可以多次重复。

translation.en: So actually, the conclusion from this research is that  if we go on the road every four years  with our healing machine -- this is the big version  we have made to go on the real road --  if we go on the road every four years  we can double the surface life of this road,  which of course saves a lot of money.
translation.zh: 事实上，这项实验得到的结论是 如果我们每四年在这段路上 用我们的加热机器——超大号微波炉 我们要把这个机器搬到公路上用—— 我们每四年上这段路 路面的寿命会加倍， 当然会省很多钱。

translation.en: Well, to conclude, I can say  that we made a material  using steel fibers, the addition of steel fibers,  using induction energy to really  increase the surface life of the road,  double the surface life you can even do,  so it will really save a lot of money with very simple tricks.
translation.zh: 所以，结论是 我们制造了一种材料 使用钢纤维，加了钢纤维 使用感应能量 有效的增加了路面的寿命， 能使路面的寿命加倍， 用这种简单的技巧就会省很多钱。

translation.en: And now you're of course curious if it also worked.
translation.zh: 你会好奇是否会有效。

translation.en: So we still have the specimen here. It's quite warm.
translation.zh: 我们看这个样品。现在还有点烫。

translation.en: Actually, it still has to cool down first  before I can show you that the healing works.
translation.zh: 事实上，我要先让它冷却下来 才能向你们展示加热修复是否有效。

translation.en: But I will do a trial.
translation.zh: 但是要尝试一下。

translation.en: Let's see. Yeah, it worked.
translation.zh: 看，真的，修好了。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢！

translation.en: When I was 11,  I remember waking up one morning to the sound of joy in my house.
translation.zh: 我11岁那年， 记得有一天早晨醒来，听见家里有愉悦的声音。

translation.en: My father was listening to BBC News on his small, gray radio.
translation.zh: 我的父亲在用他的灰色小收音机

translation.en: There was a big smile on his face which was unusual then,  because the news mostly depressed him.
translation.zh: 他面带笑容，这很少见， 因为大部分的新闻都只会使他沮丧。

translation.en: "The Taliban are gone!" my father shouted.
translation.zh: “塔利班走了！” 父亲大声叫着。

translation.en: I didn't know what it meant,  but I could see that my father was very, very happy.
translation.zh: 我不知道那意味着什么， 但是我能看出父亲非常非常高兴。

translation.en: "You can go to a real school now," he said.
translation.zh: “你现在可以去个真正的学校念书了。” 他说。

translation.en: A morning that I will never forget.
translation.zh: 我永远不会忘记那个早晨。

translation.en: A real school.
translation.zh: 一个真正的学校。

translation.en: You see, I was six when the Taliban took over Afghanistan  and made it illegal for girls to go to school.
translation.zh: 我6岁那年，塔利班占领阿富汗 并规定女孩上学是违法的。

translation.en: So for the next five years, I dressed as a boy  to escort my older sister, who was no longer allowed  to be outside alone, to a secret school.
translation.zh: 所以在那之后5年，我女扮男装 陪着我姐姐去一个秘密学校 姐姐那时已经不被允许独自外出了。

translation.en: It was the only way we both could be educated.
translation.zh: 这是我们俩人唯一的受教育方式。

translation.en: Each day, we took a different route  so that no one would suspect where we were going.
translation.zh: 我们每天要走不同的路线 这样才没有人会怀疑我们要去哪里。

translation.en: We would cover our books in grocery bags  so it would seem we were just out shopping.
translation.zh: 我们把书放在食品杂货袋中 这样别人就会以为我们只是要去购物

translation.en: The school was in a house,  more than 100 of us packed in one small living room.
translation.zh: 学校在一个房屋里， 我们100多人挤在一个小客厅里。

translation.en: It was cozy in winter but extremely hot in summer.
translation.zh: 冬天很舒服，但夏天却极热。

translation.en: We all knew we were risking our lives --  the teacher, the students and our parents.
translation.zh: 我们都知道自己正冒着生命的危险- 老师，学生以及家长都很明白

translation.en: From time to time, the school would suddenly be canceled  for a week because Taliban were suspicious.
translation.zh: 有时，学校会突然停课一周 因为被塔利班怀疑了。

translation.en: We always wondered what they knew about us.
translation.zh: 我们总是担心会被塔利班发现。

translation.en: Were we being followed?
translation.zh: 我们在被跟踪吗？

translation.en: Do they know where we live?
translation.zh: 他们知道我们的住处吗？

translation.en: We were scared,  but still, school was where we wanted to be.
translation.zh: 我们很害怕， 但是，我们仍然渴望去学校。

translation.en: I was very lucky to grow up in a family  where education was prized and daughters were treasured.
translation.zh: 我很幸运地成长在一个 珍视教育也珍爱女儿的家庭。

translation.en: My grandfather was an extraordinary man for his time.
translation.zh: 我的祖父在他的年代是位非凡的人。

translation.en: A total maverick from a remote province of Afghanistan,  he insisted that his daughter, my mom,  go to school, and for that he was disowned by his father.
translation.zh: 他出身阿富汗边远地区，有着与他人不同的见解 他坚持让他的女儿，我的母亲， 去上学，并因此被迫与他的父亲断绝父子关系。

translation.en: But my educated mother became a teacher.
translation.zh: 但是我那受过教育的母亲成为了一名教师。

translation.en: There she is.
translation.zh: 那就是她。

translation.en: She retired two years ago, only to turn our house  into a school for girls and women in our neighborhood.
translation.zh: 她两年前退休了，结果却把我家 变成了一所学校，教育社区中的女孩和妇女

translation.en: And my father -- that's him --  he was the first ever in his family to receive an education.
translation.zh: 我的父亲-那就是他- 他是他家族中第一个受到教育的人。

translation.en: There was no question that his children  would receive an education, including his daughters,  despite the Taliban, despite the risks.
translation.zh: 因此毫无疑问，他的孩子 应当受到教育，包括他的女儿， 尽管有塔利班，尽管有风险。

translation.en: To him, there was greater risk in not educating his children.
translation.zh: 对他来说，孩子不接受教育才是更大的风险。

translation.en: During Taliban years, I remember  there were times I would get so frustrated by our life  and always being scared and not seeing a future.
translation.zh: 在塔利班控制阿富汗的那些年，我记得 有时我会对自己的生活感到沮丧 总是会害怕，看不见未来。

translation.en: I would want to quit,  but my father,  he would say,  "Listen, my daughter,  you can lose everything you own in your life.
translation.zh: 我想过要放弃， 但我的父亲 这时就会说 “听着，我的女儿， 你可能失去你生命中的任何东西。

translation.en: Your money can be stolen. You can be forced to leave your home during a war.
translation.zh: 你的钱可能被偷，你可能因战争而背井离乡。

translation.en: But the one thing that will always remain with you  is what is here,  and if we have to sell our blood to pay your school fees,  we will.
translation.zh: 而你唯一能够守护住的东西 就是这里， 如果我们不得不靠卖血来支付你的学费， 我们会毫不犹豫。

translation.en: So do you still not want to continue?"
translation.zh: 即便如此你还是不想继续吗？”

translation.en: Today I am 22.
translation.zh: 如今我22岁。

translation.en: I was raised in a country that has been destroyed  by decades of war.
translation.zh: 我所成长的国家被几十年的 战争所摧毁。

translation.en: Fewer than six percent of women my age have made it beyond high school,  and had my family not been so committed to my education,  I would be one of them.
translation.zh: 我这个年龄的女性中，高中毕业的人数不到6%， 如果不是我家人的坚持， 我也会像绝大多数人一样。

translation.en: Instead, I stand here a proud graduate of Middlebury College.
translation.zh: 而如今我已经是一名自豪的明德学院的毕业生

translation.en: When I returned to Afghanistan, my grandfather,  the one exiled from his home for daring to educate his daughters,  was among the first to congratulate me.
translation.zh: 当我回到阿富汗时，我的祖父， 那位因让女儿接受教育而被逐出家门的老人， 最先向我表示了祝贺。

translation.en: He not only brags about my college degree,  but also that I was the first woman,  and that I am the first woman  to drive him through the streets of Kabul.
translation.zh: 他骄傲的不仅仅是因为我的大学学历， 也是因为在女性中，我是第一个， 在女性中，我是第一个 开车带他在喀布尔的大街兜风的人。

translation.en: My family believes in me.
translation.zh: 我的家人很信任我。

translation.en: I dream big, but my family dreams even bigger for me.
translation.zh: 我的梦想很大，但他们对我的期待甚至更高。

translation.en: That's why I am a global ambassador for 10x10,  a global campaign to educate women.
translation.zh: 这就是我成为 "10x10" 的全球大使的原因， 这是一个致力于女性教育的全球组织。

translation.en: That's why I cofounded SOLA,  the first and perhaps only boarding school  for girls in Afghanistan,  a country where it's still risky for girls to go to school.
translation.zh: 那也是我参与创立 SOLA 的原因， 这是第一所，可能也是阿富汗唯一一所 寄宿女校， 因为在阿富汗，让女孩接受教育依然十分危险。

translation.en: The exciting thing is that I see students at my school  with ambition grabbing at opportunity.
translation.zh: 让我兴奋的是，我看见我学校中的学生 能够把握机遇，志向远大。

translation.en: And I see their parents and their fathers  who, like my own, advocate for them,  despite and even in the face of daunting opposition.
translation.zh: 我看见她们的双亲，尤其是她们的父亲， 就像我父亲那样支持她们， 尽管从他们脸上也看出了畏惧。

translation.en: Like Ahmed. That's not his real name,  and I cannot show you his face,  but Ahmed is the father of one of my students.
translation.zh: 比如艾哈迈德，这不是真名， 我也不能让你们看见他的长相， 他是我一个学生的父亲。

translation.en: Less than a month ago, he and his daughter  were on their way from SOLA to their village,  and they literally missed being killed  by a roadside bomb by minutes.
translation.zh: 不到一个月前，他和他女儿 在从学校回村里的路上 他们差一点就被 路边炸弹炸死。

translation.en: As he arrived home, the phone rang,  a voice warning him  that if he sent his daughter back to school,  they would try again.
translation.zh: 他到家时，电话响了， 一个声音警告他 如果他再将女儿送去学校， 刚才的事情就会再次发生。

translation.en: "Kill me now, if you wish," he said,  "but I will not ruin my daughter's future  because of your old and backward ideas."
translation.zh: “如果你想，现在就可以杀了我。”他说， “但我不会因你落后的思想 而毁了我女儿的未来。”

translation.en: What I've come to realize about Afghanistan,  and this is something that is often dismissed in the West,  that behind most of us who succeed  is a father who recognizes the value in his daughter  and who sees that her success is his success.
translation.zh: 对于阿富汗，我意识到 ——这是西方国家也不曾意识到的—— 即在我们成功的背后 是一个这样的父亲——他能认识到自己女儿的价值， 也明白女儿的成功，就是他自己的成功。

translation.en: It's not to say that our mothers aren't key in our success.
translation.zh: 这并不是说母亲们对于我们的成功并不重要。

translation.en: In fact, they're often the initial and convincing negotiators  of a bright future for their daughters,  but in the context of a society like in Afghanistan,  we must have the support of men.
translation.zh: 事实上，为了女儿的美好未来，她们通常是 最初和最有说服力的交涉者， 但是在像阿富汗这样的社会中， 我们必须有男性的支持。

translation.en: Under the Taliban, girls who went to school  numbered in the hundreds --  remember, it was illegal.
translation.zh: 在塔利班控制下，去上学的女孩 曾经只有几百人—— 请不要忘了，当时是非法的。

translation.en: But today, more than three million girls are in school in Afghanistan.
translation.zh: 但是今天，阿富汗接受教育的女孩已经超过300万。

translation.en: Afghanistan looks so different from here in America.
translation.zh: 阿富汗与美国有很大不同。

translation.en: I find that Americans see the fragility in changes.
translation.zh: 我发现，美国人能看出我们变化中的脆弱性。

translation.en: I fear that these changes will not last  much beyond the U.S. troops' withdrawal.
translation.zh: 我担心这些变化在美军撤军之后 能够维持多久。

translation.en: But when I am back in Afghanistan,  when I see the students in my school  and their parents who advocate for them,  who encourage them, I see a promising future  and lasting change.
translation.zh: 但是当我回到阿富汗 看见我的学生 以及支持她们 并鼓励她们的父母时，我看到了未来的希望， 也看到这种变化会延续下去。

translation.en: To me, Afghanistan is a country of hope and boundless possibilities,  and every single day  the girls of SOLA remind me of that.
translation.zh: 对我来说，阿富汗充满了希望和无限的可能性， 每一天 在 SOLA 读书的女孩儿都这么提醒着我。

translation.en: Like me, they are dreaming big.
translation.zh: 像我一样，她们也有很大的梦想。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: I have never, ever forgotten the words of my grandmother  who died in her exile:  "Son, resist Gaddafi. Fight him.
translation.zh: 我永远也不会忘记我那在流亡中去世的祖母 对我说过的话： “孩子，反抗卡扎菲，与他抗争。

translation.en: But don't you ever turn  into a Gaddafi-like revolutionary."
translation.zh: 但你千万不要变成 卡扎菲那样的革命者。”

translation.en: since the Libyan Revolution broke out,  inspired by the waves of mass mobilization  in both the Tunisian and the Egyptian revolutions.
translation.zh: 利比亚革命爆发至今 已有两年， 这次革命受到了突尼斯和埃及革命中 全民积极参与的鼓舞。

translation.en: I joined forces with many other Libyans inside and outside Libya  to call for a day of rage  and to initiate a revolution against the tyrannical regime of Gaddafi.
translation.zh: 我同利比亚国内外的同胞们一起 呼吁民众举行“愤怒日”游行 并开始了反抗卡扎菲专制统治的革命。

translation.en: And there it was, a great revolution.
translation.zh: 这是一场伟大的革命运动。

translation.en: Young Libyan women and men were at the forefront  calling for the fall of the regime,  raising slogans of freedom, dignity, social justice.
translation.zh: 利比亚的年轻男女站在革命的最前线 要求专制政府下台， 呼喊着自由、尊严、社会公正的口号。

translation.en: They have shown an exemplary bravery  in confronting the brutal dictatorship of Gaddafi.
translation.zh: 他们在同残暴的卡扎菲专政的抗争中 表现出的勇气堪作典范。

translation.en: They have shown a great sense of solidarity  from the far east to the far west to the south.
translation.zh: 他们展现出来了高度的团结精神， 从东面到西面再到南面，全国的人民都团结在一起。

translation.en: Eventually, after a period of six months of brutal war  and a toll rate of almost 50,000 dead,  we managed to liberate our country and to topple the tyrant.
translation.zh: 最终，经过六个月惨烈的战争， 以50,000人死亡为代价， 我们推翻了暴政统治，迎来了国家的自由。

translation.en: However, Gaddafi left behind a heavy burden,  a legacy of tyranny, corruption and seeds of diversions.
translation.zh: 但是，卡扎菲给我们留下沉重负担 他留下专政、腐败的陋习，埋下了分裂的种子。

translation.en: For four decades Gaddafi's tyrannical regime  destroyed the infrastructure as well as the culture and the moral fabric of Libyan society.
translation.zh: 卡扎菲长达40年的专政 破坏了利比亚的基础设施，也破坏了利比亚的文化和道德观念。

translation.en: Aware of the devastation and the challenges,  I was keen among many other women to rebuild the Libyan civil society,  calling for an inclusive and just transition  to democracy and national reconciliation.
translation.zh: 我深知卡扎菲独裁所造成的破坏，也深知我们面临的挑战， 我同许多热血女性一起尝试重建利比亚的公民社会， 我们呼吁在利比亚体现宽容与公正的精神 以实现民主和民族间的和解。

translation.en: Almost 200 organizations were established in Benghazi  during and immediately after the fall of Gaddafi --  almost 300 in Tripoli.
translation.zh: 在卡扎菲倒台之时及之后 有将近200个组织在班加西成立 而在黎波里有将近300个组织成立。

translation.en: After a period of 33 years in exile, I went back to Libya,  and with unique enthusiasm,  I started organizing workshops  on capacity building, on human development of leadership skills.
translation.zh: 在流亡33年后，我回到利比亚 怀着不同寻常的热情， 我着手组织研讨会， 讨论能力建设以及人类发展中领导力培养的问题。

translation.en: With an amazing group of women,  I co-founded the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace,  a movement of women, leaders, from different walks of life,  to lobby for the sociopolitical empowerment of women  and to lobby for our right  for equal participation in building democracy and peace.
translation.zh: 我和一群了不起的女性一起， 创办了利比亚女性和平平台。 这是一场各行各业女性的运动、领导者的运动。 我们为女性争取参与社会政治生活的权利， 为我们女性争取 平等参与民主与和平建设的权利。

translation.en: I met a very difficult environment in the pre-elections,  an environment which was increasingly polarized,  an environment which was shaped by the selfish politics of dominance and exclusion.
translation.zh: 在大选前，国内的形势非常糟糕， 国内两级分化日益严重， 这是因为我们的政治是自私的，是充满了控制和排斥的。

translation.en: I led an initiative by the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace  to lobby for a more inclusive electoral law,  a law that would give every citizen, no matter what your background,  the right to vote and run,  and most importantly to stipulate on political parties  the alternation of male and female candidates vertically and horizontally in their lists,  creating the zipper list.
translation.zh: 我在利比亚女性和平平台提出了一项倡议， 呼吁利比亚施行更具包容性的选举法, 让利比亚的每一位公民，无论背景如何， 都有选举和参选的权利， 最重要的是，我呼吁在政党中应当规定 无论在地区间还是在不同级别间， 都由男性和女性轮流担当候选人， 形成交叉式的候选人名单。

translation.en: Eventually, our initiative was adopted and successful.
translation.zh: 最终，我们的倡议获得了采纳，也取得了成功。

translation.en: Women won 17.5 percent of the National Congress  in the first elections ever in 52 years.
translation.zh: 在利比亚52年来的第一次大选中， 女性在国民议会中赢得了17.5%的席位。

translation.en: However, bit by bit, the euphoria of the elections,  and of the revolution as a whole,  was fading out --  for every day we were waking up to the news of violence.
translation.zh: 然而，一点一点地， 大选和革命所带来的欢欣喜悦 在我们国家中消失了， 因为每天早上起床，我们都会看到有关暴力行径的新闻。

translation.en: One day we wake up to the news  of the desecration of ancient mosques and Sufi tombs.
translation.zh: 一天我们看到 亵渎古代清真寺和苏非圣徒墓的新闻。

translation.en: On another day we wake up to the news  of the murder of the American ambassador and the attack on the consulate.
translation.zh: 另一天我们看到 谋杀美国大使和袭击美国领事馆的新闻。

translation.en: On another day we wake up to the news  of the assassination of army officers.
translation.zh: 又一天我们看到 暗杀军官的新闻。

translation.en: And every day, every day we wake up with the rule of the militias  and their continuous violations of human rights of prisoners  and their disrespect of the rule of law.
translation.zh: 还有就是，每天我们都处于国民军的统治之下， 都要忍受他们不断侵犯囚犯的人权， 忍受他们对法治的蔑视。

translation.en: Our society, shaped by a revolutionary mindset,  became more polarized  and has driven away from the ideals and the principles --  freedom, dignity, social justice --  Intolerance, exclusion and revenge  became the icons of the [aftermath] of the revolution.
translation.zh: 我们的社会深受武装革命的心态影响， 越来越分化， 也背弃了我们起初秉持的理想和原则， 也就是—— 自由、尊严和社会公正。 偏狭、排斥和报复 成了革命后我们社会的标志。

translation.en: I am here today not at all to inspire you  with our success story of the zipper list and the elections.
translation.zh: 我今天站在这里， 不想用交叉式候选人名单和大选的成功来鼓舞大家。

translation.en: I'm rather here today to confess  that we as a nation took the wrong choice, made the wrong decision.
translation.zh: 我在这里是要坦白， 我们在推翻卡扎菲政府时所作出的决定是错误的，

translation.en: We did not prioritize right.
translation.zh: 我们没有认清事情的关键。

translation.en: For elections did not bring peace and stability and security in Libya.
translation.zh: 因为选举并没有为利比亚带来和平与稳定。

translation.en: Did the zipper list and the alternation between female and male candidates  bring peace and national reconciliation?
translation.zh: 我们倡导的交叉式候选人名单 为利比亚带来和平，带来民族间的和解了吗？

translation.en: No, it didn't.
translation.zh: 不，并没有。

translation.en: What is it, then?
translation.zh: 那么，关键的问题到底是什么呢？

translation.en: Why does our society continue to be polarized and dominated  with selfish politics of dominance and exclusion, by both men and women?
translation.zh: 为什么我们的社会还是分化严重？ 为什么我们的政治在男女都参与的情况下，还是充满了控制和排斥呢？

translation.en: Maybe what was missing was not the women only,  but the feminine values of compassion, mercy and inclusion.
translation.zh: 也许，我们缺的不只是女性， 而是女性的价值观——同情、怜悯和包容。

translation.en: Our society needs national dialogue and consensus-building  more than it needed the elections,  which only reinforced polarization and division.
translation.zh: 我们的社会需要全国性的对话，建立起全国性的共识， 这对我们的社会来说比选举更为重要， 因为选举只是加重了分化与分裂。

translation.en: Our society needs the qualitative representation of the feminine  more than it needs the numerical, quantitative representation of the feminine.
translation.zh: 我们的社会需要的是女性特质的代表， 这对我们的社会来说比女性在数量上的代表更为重要。

translation.en: We need to stop acting as agents of rage and calling for days of rage.
translation.zh: 我们需要停止愤怒的行径，停止号召“愤怒日”游行。

translation.en: We need to start acting as agents of compassion and mercy.
translation.zh: 我们需要开始表现出同情心和怜悯心。

translation.en: We need to develop a feminine discourse  that not only honors but also implements  mercy instead of revenge, collaboration instead of competition,  inclusion instead of exclusion.
translation.zh: 我们需要女性化的话语， 要尊崇并且贯彻同情、合作和包容， 要抛开报复，抛开竞争， 抛开偏狭。

translation.en: These are the ideals that a war-torn Libya  needs desperately in order to achieve peace.
translation.zh: 这才是饱受战乱的利比亚要走向和平 所迫切需要的努力目标。

translation.en: For peace has an alchemy,  between the feminine and masculine perspectives.
translation.zh: 因为和平有独到的炼造方式， 需要女性和男性观念的密切联系

translation.en: That's the real zipper.
translation.zh: 和不断交替。 这才是真正的交叉。

translation.en: And we need to establish that existentially  before we do so sociopolitically.
translation.zh: 而且我们需要在社会政治生活运作前 先建立起这种男女交叉的存在。

translation.en: According to a Quranic verse  "Salam" -- peace -- "is the word of the all-merciful God, raheem."
translation.zh: 《可兰经》的一段经文里说， “Salam”——也就是和平——“来自我们最仁慈的主Raheem。”

translation.en: In turn, the word "raheem," which is known in all Abrahamic traditions,  has the same root in Arabic as the word "rahem" -- womb --  symbolizing the maternal feminine encompassing all humanity  from which the male and the female,  from which all tribes, all peoples, have emanated from.
translation.zh: 而在所有亚伯拉罕诸教的传统中都闻名的词“raheem” 在阿拉伯语中与“rahem”同根， “rahem”则象征着充满母性的女性包容着所有人类， 男人和女人 以及所有部落、所有民族的人都是从她发源而来的。

translation.en: And so just as the womb entirely envelopes the embryo, which grows within it,  the divine matrix of compassion nourishes the entire existence.
translation.zh: 就像子宫完全包裹着在其内生长的胚胎一样， 满怀同情之心的神圣母体滋养着世间万物。

translation.en: Thus we are told that "My mercy encompasses all things."
translation.zh: 因此，我们所受的教导告诉我们：“我的怜悯之心包容万物。”

translation.en: Thus we are told that "My mercy takes precedence over my anger."
translation.zh: 因此，我们所受的教导告诉我们：“我的怜悯之心战胜我的愤怒。”

translation.en: May we all be granted a grace of mercy.
translation.zh: 愿我们都被赐予怜悯之心。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢你们。

translation.en: I'm here today to talk about a disturbing question,  which has an equally disturbing answer.
translation.zh: 今天，我想聊一个令人不安的问题， 这个问题的答案同样令人烦扰。

translation.en: My topic is the secrets of domestic violence,  and the question I'm going to tackle  is the one question everyone always asks:  Why does she stay?
translation.zh: 我要说的是家庭暴力的秘密， 而我将要回答的问题 这个问题每个人都曾经问起： “为什么她会留下来？”

translation.en: Why would anyone stay with a man who beats her?
translation.zh: “怎么会有人愿意和一个打她的男人继续住在一起？”

translation.en: I'm not a psychiatrist, a social worker  or an expert in domestic violence.
translation.zh: 我并不是精神病医生、社会工作者、 也不是家庭暴力方面的专家。

translation.en: I'm just one woman with a story to tell.
translation.zh: 我只是一个有着亲身经历要讲述的女人。

translation.en: I was 22. I had just graduated from Harvard College.
translation.zh: 当时我22岁，刚从哈佛学院毕业。

translation.en: I had moved to New York City for my first job  as a writer and editor at Seventeen magazine.
translation.zh: 我搬到了纽约，开始了自己第一份工作 在“Seventeen”杂志社当编辑和撰稿人。

translation.en: I had my first apartment,  my first little green American Express card,  and I had a very big secret.
translation.zh: 我第一次有了自己的房子， 有了第一张信用卡。 我还有一个非常大的秘密。

translation.en: My secret was that I had this gun  loaded with hollow-point bullets pointed at my head  by the man who I thought was my soulmate,  many, many times.
translation.zh: 这个秘密就是我曾经 被我认为是我灵魂伴侣的男人 用这把装满空心弹头的枪指着我的头 太多、太多次。

translation.en: The man who I loved more than anybody on Earth  held a gun to my head and threatened to kill me  more times than I can even remember.
translation.zh: 这个我曾经最爱的人， 用枪指着我的头，并威胁要杀掉我， 我已经记不得对我做了多少次。

translation.en: I'm here to tell you the story of crazy love,  a psychological trap disguised as love,  one that millions of women and even a few men  fall into every year.
translation.zh: 现在我所讲述的这个“疯狂爱情”的故事， 是一个伪装成爱情的心理陷阱， 每年都会有上百万的女性，甚至也包括一些男性 会掉进这个陷阱。

translation.en: It may even be your story.
translation.zh: 或许，它正发生在你的身上。

translation.en: I don't look like a typical domestic violence survivor.
translation.zh: 我看起来不像是典型的家庭暴力受害者。

translation.en: I have a B.A. in English from Harvard College,  an MBA in marketing from Wharton Business School.
translation.zh: 我拥有哈佛学院的英语学士学位， 还拿到了沃顿商学院的市场营销方面的MBA学位。

translation.en: I've spent most of my career working for Fortune 500 companies  including Johnson & Johnson, Leo Burnett and The Washington Post.
translation.zh: 我决大多数时间都在为"财富"500强公司工作， 包括强生，李奥贝纳和华盛顿邮报。

translation.en: I've been married for almost 20 years to my second husband  and we have three kids together.
translation.zh: 我嫁给我的第二任丈夫差不多20年了 并育有3个孩子。

translation.en: My dog is a black lab, and I drive a Honda Odyssey minivan.
translation.zh: 我养了一只黑色拉布拉多猎犬，开本田奥赛德面包车。

translation.en: So my first message for you is that domestic violence  happens to everyone --  all races, all religions, all income and education levels.
translation.zh: 这就是我要告诉你的第一个事实：家庭暴力 可能发生在每个人身上 无关你的种族、信仰、收入和教育水平。

translation.en: It's everywhere.
translation.zh: 它随处可见。

translation.en: And my second message is that everyone thinks  domestic violence happens to women,  that it's a women's issue.
translation.zh: 我要说的第二个事实，是很多人认为 既然家庭暴力发生在女性身上， 那应该是女性自身的问题。

translation.en: Not exactly.
translation.zh: 不是的。

translation.en: Over 85 percent of abusers are men, and domestic abuse  happens only in intimate, interdependent, long-term relationships,  in other words, in families,  the last place we would want or expect to find violence,  which is one reason domestic abuse is so confusing.
translation.zh: 超过85%的施虐者是男性，并且家庭暴力 只发生在亲密的、相互依存的、长期的关系中， 换句话说，发生在家庭中， 这是我们最不愿意，或最不期望看到暴力的地方。 这也是为什么家庭暴力如此叫人困扰的原因之一。

translation.en: I would have told you myself that I was the last person on Earth  who would stay with a man who beats me,  but in fact I was a very typical victim because of my age.
translation.zh: 我原本以为世界上只有我一个人 会继续留在一个打我的男人身边， 但是事实上在我这个年龄段这种事情非常普遍。

translation.en: I was 22, and in the United States,  women ages 16 to 24 are three times as likely  to be domestic violence victims  as women of other ages,  and over 500 women and girls this age  are killed every year by abusive partners,  boyfriends, and husbands in the United States.
translation.zh: 我当时22岁。而在美国， 16至24岁的女性相比其他年龄段的女性 受到家庭暴力伤害的可能性 要高出两倍以上。 同样在美国，每年有超过500位 妇女或女孩被施虐者杀害， 凶手是她们的男友，或者丈夫。

translation.en: I was also a very typical victim because I knew nothing  about domestic violence, its warning signs or its patterns.
translation.zh: 我是一个非常典型的受害者， 还因为我家庭暴力的预兆和发展模式一无所知。

translation.en: I met Conor on a cold, rainy January night.
translation.zh: 我在一个雨夜遇见了康纳，那时是一月份，天很冷。

translation.en: He sat next to me on the New York City subway,  and he started chatting me up.
translation.zh: 我们在纽约的地铁上碰巧坐在一起， 他先跟我聊了起来。

translation.en: He told me two things.
translation.zh: 他告诉我两件事。

translation.en: One was that he, too, had just graduated from an Ivy League school,  and that he worked at a very impressive Wall Street bank.
translation.zh: 第一件是他也毕业于常春藤联盟学校， 并且在一个非常好的华尔街银行工作。

translation.en: But what made the biggest impression on me that first meeting  was that he was smart and funny  and he looked like a farm boy.
translation.zh: 但是第一次见面给我留下最深印象的是 他的智慧和幽默， 而他的外貌看起来像农场男孩。

translation.en: He had these big cheeks, these big apple cheeks  and this wheat-blond hair,  and he seemed so sweet.
translation.zh: 他的脸颊像大苹果一样红扑扑的 小麦色的金发， 看起来十分讨人喜欢。

translation.en: One of the smartest things Conor did, from the very beginning,  was to create the illusion that I was the dominant partner in the relationship.
translation.zh: 在初次交往中康纳做的最聪明的事情， 是让我相信，在这段感情中我是强势的一方。

translation.en: He did this especially at the beginning  by idolizing me.
translation.zh: 尤其刚开始的时候，他让我觉得 我是他崇拜的偶像。

translation.en: We started dating, and he loved everything about me,  that I was smart, that I'd gone to Harvard,  that I was passionate about helping teenage girls, and my job.
translation.zh: 我们开始交往，他喜欢关于我的一切， 例如我的聪明，我在哈佛的求学经历， 我给予青少年女性的热情帮助，以及我的工作。

translation.en: He wanted to know everything about my family  and my childhood and my hopes and dreams.
translation.zh: 他很愿意了解我的家庭、 我的童年、我的愿望和梦想。

translation.en: Conor believed in me, as a writer and a woman,  in a way that no one else ever had.
translation.zh: 康纳对我信任的程度，我身为一个女人和撰稿人， 之前从未没有在别人那里得到过。

translation.en: And he also created a magical atmosphere of trust between us  by confessing his secret,  which was that, as a very young boy starting at age four,  he had been savagely and repeatedly physically abused  by his stepfather,  and the abuse had gotten so bad that he had had to drop out of school in eighth grade,  even though he was very smart,  and he'd spent almost 20 years rebuilding his life.
translation.zh: 通过透露他不为人知的秘密，他在我们之间营造了 奇特的相互信任的氛围。 他告诉我，他从四岁开始 他的继父就开始持续野蛮的 在身体上虐待他。 虐待的结果是如此之坏，使得他不得不在八年级的时候辍学， 尽管当时他十分的聪明。 他花了几乎20年的时间重建他的生活。

translation.en: Which is why that Ivy League degree  and the Wall Street job and his bright shiny future  meant so much to him.
translation.zh: 这也就是为什么常春藤大学的学位， 华尔街的工作和光明的未来， 对他意义重大。

translation.en: If you had told me  that this smart, funny, sensitive man who adored me  would one day dictate whether or not I wore makeup,  how short my skirts were,  where I lived, what jobs I took,  who my friends were and where I spent Christmas,  I would have laughed at you,  because there was not a hint of violence or control  or anger in Conor at the beginning.
translation.zh: 如果那时有人对我说 这个聪明、幽默、体贴并喜欢我的男人 会有一天命令我是否化妆， 我的裙子能多短， 我生活在哪，要做什么工作， 能和谁交朋友和在哪度过圣诞， 我会嘲笑你， 因为我在康纳身上看不出一点暴力或者控制欲 或者愤怒的预兆。

translation.en: I didn't know that the first stage  in any domestic violence relationship is to seduce and charm the victim.
translation.zh: 当时我并不知道， 引诱和迷惑受害者是家庭暴力关系

translation.en: I also didn't know that the second step is to isolate the victim.
translation.zh: 开始的第一步 我当时也不知道，第二步是孤立受害者。

translation.en: Now, Conor did not come home one day and announce,  "You know, hey, all this Romeo and Juliet stuff has been great,  but I need to move into the next phase  where I isolate you and I abuse you" —  —  "so I need to get you out of this apartment  where the neighbors can hear you scream  and out of this city where you have friends and family  and coworkers who can see the bruises."
translation.zh: 康纳并不是回到家，向我宣布 “嘿，虽然罗曼蒂克之类的很棒， 但是我们要进入下一阶段了 我要孤立你然后虐待你。” “所以我要你离开你自己的公寓， 防止你的邻居他听见你的惨叫， 我还要让你离开这个有你的朋友、家人和同事的城市 不然他们会看到你的伤痕。”

translation.en: Instead, Conor came home one Friday evening  and he told me that he had quit his job that day,  his dream job,  and he said that he had quit his job because of me,  because I had made him feel so safe and loved  that he didn't need to prove himself on Wall Street anymore,  and he just wanted to get out of the city  and away from his abusive, dysfunctional family,
translation.zh: 事实是，康纳在一个周五的晚上回到家， 告诉我他辞掉了他的工作， 他梦寐以求的工作， 他说他是因为我才辞职， 我让他拥有了无比的幸福和安全感， 他再不需要到华尔街证明自己。 现在他只想离开这座城市， 原理那个充满虐待的、不正常的家庭，

translation.en: and move to a tiny town in New England  where he could start his life over with me by his side.
translation.zh: 搬到新英格兰的某个小镇 和我一起在那里开始新的生活。

translation.en: Now, the last thing I wanted to do was leave New York,  and my dream job,  but I thought you made sacrifices for your soulmate,  so I agreed, and I quit my job,  and Conor and I left Manhattan together.
translation.zh: 当时，我最不想做的就是离开纽约， 离开我热爱的工作， 但是为了自己灵魂伴侣，我想我需要做出牺牲。 所以我同意了，辞掉了工作， 跟康纳一起离开了曼哈顿。

translation.en: I had no idea I was falling into crazy love,  that I was walking headfirst into a carefully laid  physical, financial and psychological trap.
translation.zh: 我以为自己陷入了疯狂的爱情，还不知道 我已经懵懂的走进了一张精心编织的 控制你身体、心灵和经济的陷阱。

translation.en: The next step in the domestic violence pattern  is to introduce the threat of violence  and see how she reacts.
translation.zh: 家庭暴力模式的第三阶段 就是开始用暴力威胁 并观察她的反应。

translation.en: And here's where those guns come in.
translation.zh: 这就是刚才枪的用途。

translation.en: As soon as we moved to New England -- you know,  that place where Connor was supposed to feel so safe --  he bought three guns.
translation.zh: 我们刚搬到新英格兰小镇 ——我想，康纳应该是觉得这里很安全—— 他就买了三支枪。

translation.en: He kept one in the glove compartment of our car.
translation.zh: 一支放在车子的置物箱里，

translation.en: He kept one under the pillows on our bed,  and the third one he kept in his pocket at all times.
translation.zh: 一支放在床的枕头下面， 第三支则一直放在口袋里。

translation.en: And he said that he needed those guns  because of the trauma he'd experienced as a young boy.
translation.zh: 他说小时候的精神创伤 使得他需要拥有这些枪

translation.en: He needed them to feel protected.
translation.zh: 来让他自己保持安全感。

translation.en: But those guns were really a message for me,  and even though he hadn't raised a hand to me,  my life was already in grave danger every minute of every day.
translation.zh: 那些枪对我来说是一个明显的信号， 尽管他并没有拿起枪指着我， 我已经无时不刻不处在危险的边缘。

translation.en: Conor first physically attacked me  five days before our wedding.
translation.zh: 康纳第一次打我 是在我们婚礼的五天前。

translation.en: It was 7 a.m. I still had on my nightgown.
translation.zh: 那是早上七点，我还穿着睡袍。

translation.en: I was working on my computer trying to finish a freelance writing assignment,  and I got frustrated,  and Conor used my anger as an excuse  to put both of his hands around my neck  and to squeeze so tightly that I could not breathe or scream,  and he used the chokehold  to hit my head repeatedly against the wall.
translation.zh: 我正在用电脑工作，想要完成自由职业撰稿的任务， 当时我有些烦躁， 康纳以我的愤怒为借口， 用双手掐住我的脖子， 死死的掐着，让我无法呼吸，喊不出声。 他从背后勒着我的脖子 一次一次的把我的头往墙上撞。

translation.en: Five days later, the ten bruises on my neck had just faded,  and I put on my mother's wedding dress,  and I married him.
translation.zh: 五天之后，脖子上的十个手指印刚消退， 我就穿上我妈妈的婚纱， 嫁给了他。

translation.en: Despite what had happened,  I was sure we were going to live happily ever after,  because I loved him, and he loved me so much.
translation.zh: 尽管发生了那些事情， 我还是相信我们以后能幸福的生活， 因为我们如此的相爱，也因为

translation.en: And he was very, very sorry.
translation.zh: 他表现出的深深的悔意。

translation.en: He had just been really stressed out by the wedding  and by becoming a family with me.
translation.zh: 他只是压力太大了，婚礼的筹备和 我家庭成员的到来让他喘不过气。

translation.en: It was an isolated incident,  and he was never going to hurt me again.
translation.zh: 这是一个意外， 而他以后不会再伤害我。

translation.en: It happened twice more on the honeymoon.
translation.zh: 蜜月期间我又被打了两次。

translation.en: The first time, I was driving to find a secret beach  and I got lost,  and he punched me in the side of my head so hard  that the other side of my head repeatedly hit  the driver's side window.
translation.zh: 第一次，我驾车去寻找秘密的海滩 我迷路了， 他（坐在副驾驶座上）不停的打我的头，打得如此的使劲 以至于我的头不断的撞到 驾驶座车门的玻璃。

translation.en: And then a few days later, driving home from our honeymoon,  he got frustrated by traffic,  and he threw a cold Big Mac in my face.
translation.zh: 没过几天，过完蜜月开车回家的路上 堵车让他很烦躁， 他把一个冰冷的巨无霸砸在我的脸上。

translation.en: Conor proceeded to beat me once or twice a week  for the next two and a half years of our marriage.
translation.zh: 在我跟康纳两年半的婚姻生活中， 我每周都会被打一到两次。

translation.en: I was mistaken in thinking that I was unique  and alone in this situation.
translation.zh: 我曾经误以为只有我一个人 有这样的遭遇。
