translation.en: One in three American women  experiences domestic violence or stalking at some point in her life,  and the CDC reports that 15 million children  are abused every year, 15 million.
translation.zh: 事实上，每三个美国女性中 就有一个曾是家庭暴力受害者或潜在的目标， 而CDC的报告称每年有1500万的儿童 遭受虐待，1500万。

translation.en: So actually, I was in very good company.
translation.zh: 所以事实上，我不是个例。

translation.en: Back to my question:  Why did I stay?
translation.zh: 回到我的问题： 为什么我要留下来了？

translation.en: The answer is easy.
translation.zh: 答案很简单。

translation.en: I didn't know he was abusing me.
translation.zh: 我并不知道他是在虐待我。

translation.en: Even though he held those loaded guns to my head,  pushed me down stairs,  threatened to kill our dog,  pulled the key out of the car ignition as I drove down the highway,  poured coffee grinds on my head  as I dressed for a job interview,  I never once thought of myself as a battered wife.
translation.zh: 尽管他用上膛的枪指着我的头， 把我推下楼梯， 威胁杀掉我们的狗， 在高速公路上拔掉车钥匙， 在我为了面试而准备着装时 把咖啡粉从我头上倒下来， 我从来没有想过自己是一个受到虐待的妻子。

translation.en: Instead, I was a very strong woman  in love with a deeply troubled man,  and I was the only person on Earth  who could help Conor face his demons.
translation.zh: 正好相反，我是一个很强硬的女性 深爱着这个饱受困扰的男人， 而且我是这世上唯一一个 可以帮助康纳面对自己心魔的人。

translation.en: The other question everybody asks is,  why doesn't she just leave?
translation.zh: 大家都想问的另一个问题是， 为什么她不离开？

translation.en: Why didn't I walk out? I could have left any time.
translation.zh: 我为什么没有逃跑？我有很多的机会。

translation.en: To me, this is the saddest and most painful question that people ask,  because we victims know something you usually don't:  It's incredibly dangerous to leave an abuser.
translation.zh: 对我来说，这是人们问过的最让我伤心和痛苦的问题， 你不能理解，但是只有我们受害者自己清楚 离开施虐者是多么的危险。

translation.en: Because the final step in the domestic violence pattern  is kill her.
translation.zh: 因为在家庭暴力中的最后一步 就是杀掉她。

translation.en: Over 70 percent of domestic violence murders  happen after the victim has ended the relationship,  after she's gotten out,  because then the abuser has nothing left to lose.
translation.zh: 超过70%的家庭暴力谋杀 发生在受害者结束这段关系后， 在她离开之后， 因为施虐者已经毫无顾忌。

translation.en: Other outcomes include long-term stalking,  even after the abuser remarries;  denial of financial resources;  and manipulation of the family court system  to terrify the victim and her children,  who are regularly forced by family court judges to spend unsupervised time  with the man who beat their mother.
translation.zh: 其他可能的结果包括长期的跟踪， 甚至施虐者再婚之后（仍会跟踪）； 拒绝经济支持； 欺骗家庭法庭 来恐吓受害者和她的孩子。 孩子们通常会被家庭问题法官要求 和那个打他们母亲的男人 一起度过一段无人监管的时间。

translation.en: And still we ask, why doesn't she just leave?
translation.zh: 现在我们仍然会问，她为什么不逃走？

translation.en: I was able to leave,  because of one final, sadistic beating  that broke through my denial.
translation.zh: 我之所以决定离开， 是因为最后一次残暴的殴打 突破了我能承受的极限。

translation.en: I realized that the man who I loved so much  was going to kill me if I let him.
translation.zh: 我意识到如果我不反抗，这个我曾 深爱的男人会杀掉我。

translation.en: So I broke the silence.
translation.zh: 所以我打破了沉默。

translation.en: I told everyone:  the police, my neighbors,  my friends and family, total strangers,  and I'm here today because you all helped me.
translation.zh: 我向所有人求助： 警察，邻居， 我的朋友和家人，完全陌生的人， 今天我能站在这里，因为你们每个人都帮助了我。

translation.en: We tend to stereotype victims  as grisly headlines, self-destructive women, damaged goods.
translation.zh: 我们倾向于将受害者描述成 就像新闻中可怕的标题所言。

translation.en: The question, "Why does she stay?"
translation.zh: “为什么她要留下？” 问这个问题

translation.en: is code for some people for, "It's her fault for staying,"  as if victims intentionally choose to fall in love with men  intent upon destroying us.
translation.zh: 的一些人实际上在说，“这是她自己的错“， 就好像受害者是有意的和意图 摧残她们的男人相爱。

translation.en: But since publishing "Crazy Love,"  I have heard hundreds of stories from men and women  who also got out,  who learned an invaluable life lesson from what happened,  and who rebuilt lives -- joyous, happy lives --  as employees, wives and mothers,  lives completely free of violence, like me.
translation.zh: 但”Crazy Love”这本书出版之后， 很多男人和女人跟我诉说了他们的故事 他们也想告诉别人， 他们从发生的事情中学到了无价的一课， 他们重新开始了生活——开心快乐的生活—— 作为员工、妻子和母亲， 就像我现在一样生活，远离暴力。

translation.en: Because it turns out that I'm actually a very typical domestic violence victim  and a typical domestic violence survivor.
translation.zh: 实际上，我是典型的家庭暴力受害者， 也是典型的家庭暴力幸存者。

translation.en: I remarried a kind and gentle man,  and we have those three kids.
translation.zh: 我和一个温柔善良男人再次结婚， 有了三个孩子。

translation.en: I have that black lab, and I have that minivan.
translation.zh: 我养了一只黑色拉布拉多猎犬，开本田奥赛德面包车。

translation.en: What I will never have again,  ever,  is a loaded gun held to my head  by someone who says that he loves me.
translation.zh: 而我永远不会再拥有的， 永远 是一个嘴里说爱我的人用 上膛了的枪指着我的脑袋。

translation.en: Right now, maybe you're thinking,  "Wow, this is fascinating,"  or, "Wow, how stupid was she,"  but this whole time, I've actually been talking about you.
translation.zh: 此时此刻，你可能在想， 哇，这才神奇了， 或者，“喔，她真蠢，” 但是在整个过程中，事实上，我在谈论的是你。

translation.en: I promise you there are several people  listening to me right now  who are currently being abused  or who were abused as children  or who are abusers themselves.
translation.zh: 我敢保证，现在正在听我说话的人中 有一些人 正遭受着虐待 或者曾经在小时候被虐待过 或者你就是一个施虐者。

translation.en: Abuse could be affecting your daughter,  your sister, your best friend right now.
translation.zh: 虐待可能正发生在你的女儿身上， 发生在你的姐妹、你最好的朋友身上。

translation.en: I was able to end my own crazy love story  by breaking the silence.
translation.zh: 我能够结束自己“疯狂的爱”的故事 靠的是打破沉默。

translation.en: I'm still breaking the silence today.
translation.zh: 今天我仍然在打破着沉默。

translation.en: It's my way of helping other victims,  and it's my final request of you.
translation.zh: 这是我帮助其他的受害者的方式， 同时也是我对你们最后的请求。

translation.en: Talk about what you heard here.
translation.zh: 告诉别人你今天听到的。

translation.en: Abuse thrives only in silence.
translation.zh: 虐待只能活在沉默中。

translation.en: You have the power to end domestic violence  simply by shining a spotlight on it.
translation.zh: 你有能力制止家庭暴力 只需要点亮星星之火。

translation.en: We victims need everyone.
translation.zh: 我们受害者需要每一个人的帮助。

translation.en: We need every one of you to understand  the secrets of domestic violence.
translation.zh: 我们需要你们每一个人理解 家庭暴力的秘密。

translation.en: with your children, your coworkers,  your friends and family.
translation.zh: 和你的孩子，你的同事， 你的朋友和家人讨论这个话题， 将虐待曝之于光，

translation.en: Recast survivors as wonderful, lovable people  with full futures.
translation.zh: 帮助幸存者重新找回美好、可爱的自己， 重新拥有未来。

translation.en: Recognize the early signs of violence  and conscientiously intervene,  deescalate it, show victims a safe way out.
translation.zh: 发现家庭暴力的预兆 并认真的干预， 减少发生的可能性，给受害者提供安全的出路。

translation.en: Together we can make our beds,  our dinner tables and our families  the safe and peaceful oases they should be.
translation.zh: 让我们携起手来， 让我们的床，我们餐桌和家庭 成为它们应该成为的安全、和平的绿洲。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: Hi. My name is Cameron Russell,  and for the last little while, I've been a model.
translation.zh: 嗨，我是Cameron Russell, 过去的一段时间里 我是个模特

translation.en: Actually, for 10 years.
translation.zh: 其实，10年。

translation.en: And I feel like  there's an uncomfortable tension in the room right now  because I should not have worn this dress.   So luckily, I brought an outfit change.
translation.zh: 现在，我在这个房间内感到一种 令人不适的紧张感 因为我不该穿这条裙子 幸亏我带了另外一套

translation.en: This is the first outfit change on the TED stage,  so you guys are pretty lucky to witness it, I think.
translation.zh: 这是TED讲台上第一次现场换装 所以我觉得今天在场的人都很幸运啊，

translation.en: If some of the women were really horrified when I came out,  you don't have to tell me now, but I'll find out later on Twitter.
translation.zh: 如果有些女士对的我出现感到惊恐 不必现在告诉我。但我马上就会在twitter上知道的

translation.en: I'd also note that I'm quite privileged  to be able to transform what you think of me  in a very brief 10 seconds.
translation.zh: 我也想告诉各位我有幸 能够在10秒内 改变我在你们心中的形象

translation.en: Not everybody gets to do that.
translation.zh: 这不是所有人都能做得到的

translation.en: These heels are very uncomfortable, so good thing I wasn't going to wear them.
translation.zh: 这双高跟鞋很不舒服 而好消息是我不打算穿他们

translation.en: The worst part is putting this sweater over my head,  because that's when you'll all laugh at me,  so don't do anything while it's over my head.
translation.zh: 最坏的消息是我要把这件毛衣从头上套进去 因为这时候你们会笑我 所以当我穿衣服的时候,什么都不要做

translation.en: All right.
translation.zh: 可以了

translation.en: So, why did I do that?
translation.zh: 那么，我为什么做这个呢？

translation.en: That was awkward.
translation.zh: 这很怪

translation.en: Well --  Hopefully not as awkward as that picture.
translation.zh: 呃 希望不会像图片上这样怪

translation.en: Image is powerful,  but also, image is superficial.
translation.zh: 图象是强大的 但同时又是表面化的

translation.en: I just totally transformed what you thought of me, in six seconds.
translation.zh: 我只是在6秒内就彻底改变了自己在你们心中的形象

translation.en: And in this picture,  I had actually never had a boyfriend in real life.
translation.zh: 在这张照片里 我事实上在现实生活中根本没有男朋友

translation.en: I was totally uncomfortable,  and the photographer was telling me to arch my back  and put my hand in that guy's hair.
translation.zh: 当摄影师 要我弓起背，摸那个男士的头发时 我非常不自在

translation.en: And of course, barring surgery,  or the fake tan that I got two days ago for work,  there's very little that we can do to transform how we look,  and how we look, though it is superficial and immutable,  has a huge impact on our lives.
translation.zh: 确定的是，除了手术 或像两天前我为了工作做的棕褐色 我们基本上是没法改变外表的 我们的外表，虽然是表面化的，固定的 还是极大地影响着我们的生活

translation.en: So today, for me, being fearless means being honest.
translation.zh: 所以今天，对我来说，变的无惧就意味着要诚实

translation.en: And I am on this stage because I am a model.
translation.zh: 今天我站在这里是因为我是个模特

translation.en: I am on this stage because I am a pretty, white woman,  and in my industry, we call that a sexy girl.
translation.zh: 我在这个舞台上是因为我是个漂亮的白种女性 在我们业内我们称此为“性感女孩”

translation.en: I'm going to answer the questions that people always ask me,  but with an honest twist.
translation.zh: 我要回答下人们常常问我的那些问题 以一种诚实的方式

translation.en: So the first question is, how do you become a model?
translation.zh: 第一个问题是，你是怎么成为模特的？

translation.en: I always just say, "Oh, I was scouted," but that means nothing.
translation.zh: 我总是说：“我是被发现的”，但这其实什么也说明不了

translation.en: The real way that I became a model  is I won a genetic lottery, and I am the recipient of a legacy,  and maybe you're wondering what is a legacy.
translation.zh: 我成为模特的真正的原因是 我拥有极佳的基因，我是遗产的接受者 你可能在疑问什么是遗产.

translation.en: Well, for the past few centuries  we have defined beauty not just as health and youth  and symmetry that we're biologically programmed to admire,  but also as tall, slender figures,  and femininity and white skin.
translation.zh: 呃，在过去的几个世纪里 我们定义里的美不仅仅只包括健康，年轻 和身材匀称这些我们出于生物本能去赞美的元素 还包括高挑，苗条的体型， 富有女性气质，白色皮肤这些特征。

translation.en: And this is a legacy that was built for me,  and it's a legacy that I've been cashing out on.
translation.zh: 这就是我的遗产， 这就是我一直在兑现的遗产，

translation.en: And I know there are people in the audience  who are skeptical at this point,  and maybe there are some fashionistas who are like,  "Wait. Naomi. Tyra. Joan Smalls. Liu Wen."
translation.zh: 我知道你们中有些人 可能对这个观点存疑 你们可能会举出一些时尚圈人物，例如 Naomi, Tyra, Joan Smalls和Liu Wen

translation.en: And first, I commend you on your model knowledge. Very impressive.
translation.zh: 首先，我要表扬下你们对于模特界的了解令人印象深刻

translation.en: But unfortunately, I have to inform you that in 2007,  a very inspired NYU Ph.D. student  counted all the models on the runway, every single one that was hired,  and of the 677 models that were hired,  only 27, or less than four percent, were non-white.
translation.zh: 但不幸的是，我得告诉你们，在2007年时 一名纽约大学的博士在启发之下 统计了所有在职模特的人数 在677名正式受雇模特中 只有27名，也就是不到百分之四，是非白种人

translation.en: The next question people always ask is,  "Can I be a model when I grow up?"
translation.zh: 下一个人们常问我的问题是 “我长大了能当模特吗？”

translation.en: And the first answer is, "I don't know, they don't put me in charge of that."
translation.zh: 我的第一个答案是：“我也不知道，因为他们没让我来掌管这件事”

translation.en: But the second answer, and what I really want to say to these little girls is,  "Why? You know? You can be anything.
translation.zh: 但第二个答案，也是我想对问问题的那些小姑娘说的是“为什么？” 你知道吗？你可以选择任何的职业。

translation.en: You could be the President of the United States,  or the inventor of the next Internet,  or a ninja cardiothoracic surgeon poet,  which would be awesome, because you'd be the first one."
translation.zh: 你可以成为美国总统 或是下一代互联网的发明者 或是个忍者般的心胸外科诗人, --这个不错，因为你会是第一个

translation.en: If, after this amazing list, they still are like,  "No, no, Cameron, I want to be a model,"  well, then I say, "Be my boss."
translation.zh: 如果，听完这些她们还是说 “不，不，Cameron，我想当模特” 我会说：“当我的老板吧”

translation.en: Because I'm not in charge of anything,  and you could be the editor in chief of American Vogue  or the CEO of H&M, or the next Steven Meisel.
translation.zh: 因为我不能决定任何事 你可以成为美国Vogue杂志的主编 或是H&M的首席执行官，或下一个Steven Meisel

translation.en: Saying that you want to be a model when you grow up  is akin to saying that you want to win the Powerball when you grow up.
translation.zh: 说你长大后想当模特 就像你说你长大后想赢彩票一样

translation.en: It's out of your control, and it's awesome,  and it's not a career path.
translation.zh: （能不能成为模特）不在你的掌控范围之内。当模特很棒 但它不是一个可规划的行业

translation.en: I will demonstrate for you now 10 years of accumulated model knowledge,  because unlike cardiothoracic surgeons,  it can just be distilled right now.
translation.zh: 我将为大家展示我模特从业十年的一些经验 因为不像一个忍者般的心胸科诗人 它只能立足当下

translation.en: So, if the photographer is right there,  the light is right there, like a nice HMI,  and the client says, "We want a walking shot,"  this leg goes first, nice and long, this arm goes back, this arm goes forward,  the head is at three quarters, and you just go back and forth,  just do that, and then you look back at your imaginary friends,  300, 400, 500 times.   It will look something like this.
translation.zh: 所以如果摄影师就在这里 灯光就在这里--比如漂亮的水银灯 客户说：“Cameron,我想要一张走路时的快门照” 这条修长的美腿先迈步，这条手臂放在后面，这条手臂放前面 露出四分之三侧脸，来来回回， 就这样，然后回头看你臆想中的朋友 300，400，500次 这看上去就像这样

translation.en: Hopefully less awkward than that one in the middle.
translation.zh: 希望不像中间那张那么怪

translation.en: That was -- I don't know what happened there.
translation.zh: 我不知道那张是怎么回事儿

translation.en: Unfortunately, after you've gone to school,  and you have a résumé and you've done a few jobs,  you can't say anything anymore,  so if you say you want to be the President of the United States,  but your résumé reads, "Underwear Model: 10 years,"  people give you a funny look.
translation.zh: 现实是，当你毕业后 有了简历，做过了几份工作 你就不能再说其它的了 所以如果你说你想成为美国总统 但你的简历上写着：有十年工作经验的内衣模特 人们会笑着看你

translation.en: The next question is, "Do they retouch all the photos?"
translation.zh: 下一个人们常问的问题是：“他们会修照片吗？”

translation.en: And yeah, they pretty much retouch all the photos,  but that is only a small component of what's happening.
translation.zh: 是的，他们会修几乎所有照片 但这只是工作的一小部分

translation.en: This picture is the very first picture that I ever took,  and it's also the very first time that I had worn a bikini,  and I didn't even have my period yet.
translation.zh: 这是我第一张模特照片 也是我第一次穿比基尼 我基至还没有过月经

translation.en: I know we're getting personal, but I was a young girl.
translation.zh: 我知道这有点私人，但 那时我还很年轻

translation.en: This is what I looked like with my grandma just a few months earlier.
translation.zh: 这是那张照片几个月前我跟祖母一起拍的照片

translation.en: Here's me on the same day as this shoot.
translation.zh: 这是拍照片当天

translation.en: My friend got to come.
translation.zh: 我朋友跟我在一起

translation.en: Here's me at a slumber party a few days before I shot French Vogue.
translation.zh: 这是我拍法国Vogue杂志前几天前在睡衣party上拍的照片

translation.en: Here's me on the soccer team and in V Magazine.
translation.zh: 这是我在足球队和V杂志的照片

translation.en: And here's me today.
translation.zh: 这是现在的我

translation.en: And I hope what you're seeing  is that these pictures are not pictures of me.
translation.zh: 我希望你们明白的是 这些不是我自己的照片

translation.en: They are constructions,  and they are constructions by a group of professionals,  by hairstylists and makeup artists and photographers and stylists  and all of their assistants and pre-production and post-production,  and they build this. That's not me.
translation.zh: 而是 由一群专业人士制出的图象, 发型师，化装师，摄影师，造型师 以及他们的助理，还有前期制作，后期制作 他们制造出了这些图象，而不是我

translation.en: Okay, so the next question people always ask me is,  "Do you get free stuff?"
translation.zh: 下一个问题是 “你能得到免费的东西吗？”

translation.en: I do have too many 8-inch heels which I never get to wear,  except for earlier,  but the free stuff that I get is the free stuff that I get in real life, and that's what we don't like to talk about.
translation.zh: 我确实有太多 从没机会穿的8英寸高跟鞋， 但是免费的东西 却是我在现实生活中得到的。而这恰恰是我们不愿意谈的

translation.en: I grew up in Cambridge,  and one time I went into a store and I forgot my money  and they gave me the dress for free.
translation.zh: 我在剑桥市长大 有一次我走进一家商店却忘了带钱 他们送了我一条裙子

translation.en: When I was a teenager, I was driving with my friend  who was an awful driver and she ran a red and of course,  we got pulled over,  and all it took was a "Sorry, officer," and we were on our way.
translation.zh: 十几岁时，我跟朋友一起开车 她是个糟糕的司机，闯了红灯 我们被停车 我只说了句：“长官抱歉” 我们就继续上路了

translation.en: And I got these free things because of how I look,  not who I am, and there are people paying a cost  for how they look and not who they are.
translation.zh: 我得到这些是因为我的外表 而不是我是身份。有些人为了他们的外表 而不是身份付出了代价。

translation.en: I live in New York, and last year,  of the 140,000 teenagers that were stopped and frisked,  86% of them were black and Latino, and most of them were young men.
translation.zh: 我住在纽约，去年 有14万青年被停车搜身 他们中百分之86是黑人和拉美人 大多数是年轻的男孩子

translation.en: And there are only 177,000 young black and Latino men in New York,  so for them, it's not a question of, "Will I get stopped?"
translation.zh: 而在纽约年轻黑人和拉美男性总数只有17万7千 所以，对他们来说，问题不是：“我会被停车吗”

translation.en: but "How many times will I get stopped? When will I get stopped?"
translation.zh: 而是“我要被停几次？我什么时候会被停？“

translation.en: When I was researching this talk,  I found out that of the 13-year-old girls in the United States,  53% don't like their bodies,  and that number goes to 78% by the time that they're 17.
translation.zh: 我在为这次演讲做调查时 发现在美国13岁女孩儿群体中 百分之53不喜欢她们的身体 到了17岁，这一比例上升至百分之78。

translation.en: So, the last question people ask me is,  "What is it like to be a model?"
translation.zh: 那么最后一个问题是 ”当模特是什么感觉？“

translation.en: And I think the answer that they're looking for is,  "If you are a little bit skinnier and you have shinier hair,  you will be so happy and fabulous."
translation.zh: 我猜他们期待的答案是 ”如果你再瘦一点儿，你的头发再有光泽一些 你就会很开心，很难以置信“

translation.en: And when we're backstage,  we give an answer that maybe makes it seem like that.
translation.zh: 当在后台时,我们会给出一个 像这样的答案。

translation.en: We say, "It's really amazing to travel, and it's amazing to get to work  with creative, inspired, passionate people."
translation.zh: 我们说”能到处旅行 和有创造力的，热情的，灵感不断的人一起工作真的很棒”

translation.en: And those things are true, but they're only one half of the story,  because the thing that we never say on camera,  that I have never said on camera, is,  "I am insecure."
translation.zh: 这不假，但这只是事实的一半 因为我们永远不会在镜头前说的是, 我永远不会说的是, “我没有安全感“

translation.en: And I'm insecure because I have to think about what I look like every day.
translation.zh: 因为我必须每天都要担心 我看上去怎么样

translation.en: And if you ever are wondering,  "If I have thinner thighs and shinier hair, will I be happier?"
translation.zh: 如果你曾经也想过 如果我的大腿更瘦，头发更好，我会更开心吗？

translation.en: you just need to meet a group of models,  because they have the thinnest thighs, the shiniest hair and the coolest clothes,  and they're the most physically insecure women probably on the planet.
translation.zh: 你只要去看看模特就知道了 因为她们有最瘦的大腿，最漂亮的头发，最酷的衣服 而她们却可能是世界上最没有身理安全感的女人

translation.en: When I was writing this talk,  I found it very difficult to strike an honest balance, because on the one hand,  I felt very uncomfortable to come out here and say,  "Look I've received all these benefits from a deck stacked in my favor,"  and it also felt really uncomfortable to follow that up with,  "and it doesn't always make me happy."
translation.zh: 所以当我为这次演讲做准备时时，发现 很难为诚实找到一个平衡点。因为一方面 如果我站在这儿，说 ”看，我凭着天生的优势得到了这么多东西，”心里会不舒服 可是如果这句话接着 “可是这些都不能让我开心”也很不自在

translation.en: But mostly it was difficult to unpack a legacy of gender and racial oppression  when I am one of the biggest beneficiaries.
translation.zh: 但最难的是去展现 性别和种族歧视的职业传统 因为我自己本身是最大的受益者

translation.en: But I'm also happy and honored to be up here  before 10 or 20 or 30 years had passed and I'd had more agency in my career,  because maybe then I wouldn't tell the story of how I got my first job,  or maybe I wouldn't tell the story of how I paid for college,  which seems so important right now.
translation.zh: 但同时我又很开心并受尊重的站在这里 趁着我还年轻，而不是已经工作了10，20或30年 和模特行业间有越来越多的阻隔（不能获得最直接的感觉） 因为可能到那时我就不会讲我怎样得到第一份工作 怎样付大学学费 这些现在看来是如此重要的东西

translation.en: If there's a takeaway to this talk,  I hope it's that we all feel more comfortable acknowledging  the power of image in our perceived successes  and our perceived failures.
translation.zh: 如果这次演讲能使你有所受益，我希望 是我们都能欣然接受 图象的力量带来的我们所理解的成功 和我们所理解的失败

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: ever since I was old enough to pick up a camera,  but today I want to share with you  the 15 most treasured photos of mine,  and I didn't take any of them.
translation.zh: 自从我足够大拿起相机以来， 我一直热衷摄影， 但我今天想和你们分享 15张我最珍爱的照片， 它们没有一张是我拍的。

translation.en: There were no art directors, no stylists,  no chance for reshoots, not even any regard for lighting.
translation.zh: 没有艺术指导，没有造型师， 没有重拍的机会，更别提灯光效果。

translation.en: In fact, most of them were taken by random tourists.
translation.zh: 事实上，它们大多数是随机找来的游客拍的。

translation.en: My story begins  when I was in New York City for a speaking engagement,  and my wife took this picture of me holding my daughter  on her first birthday. We're on the corner of 57th and 5th.
translation.zh: 我的故事源起于 有一次我获邀到纽约市演讲， 我的妻子拍了张照片，我抱着我的女儿 那天是她的一岁生日。我们站在第57大道和第5大道的交界处。

translation.en: We happened to be back in New York exactly a year later,  so we decided to take the same picture.
translation.zh: 碰巧一年后，我们又回到了纽约市， 所以我们决定拍一张同样的照片。

translation.en: Well you can see where this is going.
translation.zh: 你可以猜到事情是怎么发展的。

translation.en: Approaching my daughter's third birthday,  my wife said, "Hey, why don't you take Sabina back to New York  and make it a father-daughter trip, and continue the ritual?"
translation.zh: 接近女儿三岁生日时， 妻子说，“嘿，你为什么不带萨比娜回纽约， 来个父女之旅，继续这个小传统？”

translation.en: This is when we started asking passing tourists to take the picture.
translation.zh: 也就是从这次开始我们找路上的游客帮我们拍照。

translation.en: the gesture is of handing your camera to a total stranger.
translation.zh: 你们知道，把相机递给一个完全陌生人拍照 是多么普遍而又不寻常的事。

translation.en: No one's ever refused, and luckily no one's ever run off with our camera.
translation.zh: 没有人会拒绝，幸运的是也没有人拿着我们的相机跑掉。

translation.en: Back then, we had no idea how much this trip would change our lives.
translation.zh: 那时，我们并不知道这样的旅程会深深改变我们的生活。

translation.en: It's really become sacred to us.
translation.zh: 对我们而言，它渐渐变得神圣起来。

translation.en: This one was taken just weeks after 9/11,  and I found myself trying to explain what had happened that day  in ways a five-year-old could understand.
translation.zh: 这张是在911的几周后拍的， 我那时尝试解释911那天发生的事 试图采用让这个五岁孩子明白的方式。

translation.en: So these photos are far more than proxies  for a single moment, or even a specific trip.
translation.zh: 所以这些照片远远不止是记录了 一个瞬间，或一次特别的旅程。

translation.en: They're also ways for us to freeze time  for one week in October  and reflect on our times  and how we change from year to year,  and not just physically, but in every way.
translation.zh: 它们是我们保藏时间的方式 记住10月的某一周， 让我们回想岁月， 以及我们年复一年是如何变化的， 不止是身体上的变化，而是各方面的变化。

translation.en: Because while we take the same photo,  our perspectives change,  and she reaches new milestones,  and I get to see life through her eyes,  and how she interacts with and sees everything.
translation.zh: 因为，我每年们拍同样的照片， 我们的视角并不一样， 女儿她到达新的里程碑， 我透过她的眼睛看待生活， 看她如何反应，如何看待一切。

translation.en: This very focused time we get to spend together  is something we cherish and anticipate the entire year.
translation.zh: 这是我们亲子相处的时间， 是一年里面我们最珍惜也最期待的时间。

translation.en: Recently, on one trip, we were walking,  and she stops dead in her tracks,  and she points to a red awning of the doll store  that she loved when she was little  on our earlier trips.
translation.zh: 最近一次旅程，我们在路上走着， 她突然停了下来， 她指着一间玩偶店的红色外棚 说她小时候非常喜欢那外棚 也就是从我们之前的旅程开始。

translation.en: And she describes to me the feeling she felt  as a five-year-old standing in that exact spot.
translation.zh: 她向我形容 5岁的时候，她站在那个拍照点时的感受。

translation.en: She said she remembers her heart bursting out of her chest  when she saw that place for the very first time  nine years earlier.
translation.zh: 她说她记得第一次看到那个地方时 她的心快要跳出来， 那是9年前的事了。

translation.en: And now what she's looking at in New York  are colleges,  because she's determined to go to school in New York.
translation.zh: 现在她去纽约关注的是 大学校园， 因为她决定要去纽约读书。

translation.en: And it hit me: One of the most important things  we all make are memories.
translation.zh: 我突然明白：我们创造的最重要的事情之一 是我们的记忆。

translation.en: So I want to share the idea of taking an active role  in consciously creating memories.
translation.zh: 所以我希望分享这种主动 且有意识去创造记忆的想法。

translation.en: I don't know about you, but aside from these 15 shots,  I'm not in many of the family photos.
translation.zh: 我不知道你们的情况，但我个人而言，除了这15张照片， 我不会经常出现在家庭照片里面。

translation.en: I'm always the one taking the picture.
translation.zh: 我总是那个拿相机拍照的人。

translation.en: So I want to encourage everyone today  to get in the shot,  and don't hesitate to go up to someone and ask,  "Will you take our picture?"
translation.zh: 我希望鼓励今天在座的各位， 争取到照片里面去， 别犹豫，走向前问路人， “可以帮我们拍照吗？”

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: I would like to talk to you about  a very special group of animals.
translation.zh: 我想和大家聊聊 一种非常不寻常的动物。

translation.en: There are 10,000 species of birds in the world.
translation.zh: 地球上总共有一万种鸟类。

translation.en: Vultures are amongst the most threatened group of birds.
translation.zh: 秃鹫是他们中最濒临灭绝的一种。

translation.en: When you see a vulture like this, the first thing  that comes to your mind is, these are disgusting, ugly,  greedy creatures that are just after your flesh,  associated with politicians.    I want to change that perception. I want to change  those feelings you have for these birds, because  they need our sympathy. They really do.   And I'll tell you why.
translation.zh: 每当你看到秃鹫就像这只，首先 浮现在你脑海中一定是，这是一些令人厌恶， 贪得无厌并且追逐腐肉的可怕生物， 让人禁不住联想到政客们。 我想改变这种看法。我想改变 大家对秃鹫的这些不好的联想，因为 他们需要我们的同情。他们真的很需要。 让我来告诉大家为什么。

translation.en: First of all, why do they have such a bad press?
translation.zh: 首先，为什么他们会给我们留下这种坏印象呢？

translation.en: When Charles Darwin went across the Atlantic in 1832  on the Beagle, he saw the turkey vulture,  and he said, "These are disgusting birds  with bald scarlet heads that are formed to revel in putridity."   You could not get a worse insult, and that from Charles Darwin.   You know, he changed his mind when he came back,  and I'll tell you why.
translation.zh: 1832年 查尔斯 达尔文在搭乘贝格尔号穿越大西洋的 旅途中，发现了土耳其秃鹫， 他当时说道，“这些令人恶心的，长着猩红色 秃头的鸟儿们总是沉湎于腐肉中不可自拔." 你很难找到比这更恶毒的侮辱了，这些话可是查尔斯 达尔文说的。 你们知道吗，达尔文返回英国之后就改变他的看法， 我马上会告诉你们为什么。

translation.en: They've also be associated with Disney —  —  personified as goofy, dumb, stupid characters.
translation.zh: 秃鹫还曾经被迪斯尼看上—— 像高飞狗一样，被人格化，变成了麻木的，愚蠢的动画角色。

translation.en: More recently, if you've been following the Kenyan press  —    —  these are the attributes that they associated  the Kenyan MPs with. But I want to challenge that.
translation.zh: 而最近，如果你留意过肯尼亚的新闻 ——（欢呼）—— 肯尼亚的国会议员们被讽刺为像秃鹫一般 贪婪和愚蠢。但是我想叫板它。

translation.en: I want to challenge that. Do you know why?
translation.zh: 我要质疑它。你们知道为什么吗？

translation.en: Because MPs  do not keep the environment clean.   MPs do not help to prevent the spread of diseases.
translation.zh: 因为国会议员们 不能保持自然环境的清洁。 不能阻止疾病的传播。

translation.en: They are hardly monogamous.    They are far from being extinct.   And, my favorite is, vultures are better looking.    So there's two types of vultures in this planet.
translation.zh: 几乎没人遵守一夫一妻制度。 他们离灭绝还很远。 并且，这条我最喜欢，秃鹫比议员们好看多了。 在这个世界上有两大类秃鹫。

translation.en: There are the New World vultures that are mainly found  in the Americas, like the condors and the caracaras,  and then the Old World vultures, where we have  16 species. From these 16, 11 of them are facing  a high risk of extinction.
translation.zh: 新大陆的秃鹫主要生长在 美洲大陆，像是美洲秃鹫和委内瑞拉秃鹫， 而在其他的大陆，那里 总共有16种秃鹫，他们中的11种正面临着 灭绝的风险。

translation.en: So why are vultures important? First of all,  they provide vital ecological services. They clean up.
translation.zh: 所以为什么说秃鹫重要呢？首先， 秃鹫对生态循环做出了至关重要的作用。他们净化环境。

translation.en: They're our natural garbage collectors.
translation.zh: 秃鹫是我们的大自然垃圾清道夫。

translation.en: They clean up carcasses right to the bone.
translation.zh: 他们会把尸体上的肉吃的干干净净只剩白骨。

translation.en: They help to kill all the bacteria. They help absorb anthrax  that would otherwise spread and cause  huge livestock losses and diseases in other animals.
translation.zh: 他们能消灭所有尸体上的细菌，他们能吸收炭疽病毒 阻止病毒的传播与扩散 从而使大量的家畜和动物远离死亡和疾病。

translation.en: Recent studies have shown that in areas where there are  no vultures, carcasses take up to three to four times  to decompose, and this has huge ramifications for the spread of diseases.
translation.zh: 最近的研究还显示在那些 没有秃鹫生存的地区，尸体的分解会多花 三到四倍的时间，这给疾病的传播与扩散

translation.en: Vultures also have tremendous historical significance.
translation.zh: 提供了更多的机会。 秃鹫还有非常多的历史意义。

translation.en: They have been associated in ancient Egyptian culture.
translation.zh: 他们和古埃及文化有着密切的联系。

translation.en: Nekhbet was the symbol of the protector  and the motherhood, and together with the cobra,  symbolized the unity between Upper and Lower Egypt.
translation.zh: 奈库贝特女神在古埃及文化中象征着监护人 和母性，通常和眼镜蛇女神维阿杰特一起出现， 象征着上埃及和下埃及的团结和统一。

translation.en: In Hindu mythology, Jatayu was the vulture god,  and he risked his life in order to save the goddess Sita  from the 10-headed demon Ravana.
translation.zh: 在印度教神话中，秃鹫之神名为雅达尤， 他冒着生命危险 从10头恶魔罗波那手中救出了西妲女神。

translation.en: In Tibetan culture, they are performing very important  sky burials. In places like Tibet, there are no places  to bury the dead, or wood to cremate them,  so these vultures provide a natural disposal system.
translation.zh: 在西藏文化中，秃鹫尤其显得重要 天葬。在那些类似西藏的地方，既没有条件 土葬，也没有木材去进行火葬， 所以秃鹫为当地人提供了一种天然的尸体处理系统。

translation.en: So what is the problem with vultures?
translation.zh: 那么秃鹫都面临着哪些问题呢？

translation.en: We have eight species of vultures that occur in Kenya,  of which six are highly threatened with extinction.
translation.zh: 肯尼亚生长着八种秃鹫， 其中的六种正濒临灭绝。

translation.en: The reason is that they're getting poisoned, and the reason  that they're getting poisoned is because there's  human-wildlife conflicts. The pastoral communities  are using this poison to target predators,  and in return, the vultures are falling victim to this.
translation.zh: 很多秃鹫被毒死，中毒的原因 是因为在肯尼亚正在发生的 人类与野生动物之间对于生存空间的争夺。牧人们 使用毒药来对付掠食动物， 掠食动物被毒死之后，秃鹫们随之成为了下一个受害者。

translation.en: In South Asia, in countries like India and Pakistan,  four species of vultures are listed as critically endangered,  which means they have less than 10 or 15 years to go extinct,  and the reason is because they are falling prey  by consuming livestock that has been treated  with a painkilling drug like Diclofenac.
translation.zh: 在南亚，一些国家类似于印度和巴基斯坦， 四种秃鹫被列为极度濒临灭绝中， 这意味着在他们将会在10到15年之内彻底灭绝， 灭绝的原因是因为秃鹫们 食用了那些生前曾被喂食过 含有双氯芬酸成分止疼药的家畜。

translation.en: This drug has now been banned for veterinary use in India,  and they have taken a stand.
translation.zh: 现在含有双氯芬酸的兽药已经被禁止在印度使用， 印度政府表现出了积极的态度。

translation.en: Because there are no vultures, there's been a spread  in the numbers of feral dogs at carcass dump sites,  and when you have feral dogs, you have a huge time bomb  of rabies. The number of cases of rabies  has increased tremendously in India.
translation.zh: 因为秃鹫数量的骤减，野狗开始 在牲畜尸体掩埋场周围泛滥成灾， 在野狗泛滥的地区，狂犬病就像定时炸弹一样 随时都会爆发。狂犬病案例的数量 在印度出现了惊人的增长。

translation.en: Kenya is going to have one of the largest wind farms in Africa:  353 wind turbines are going to be up at Lake Turkana.
translation.zh: 肯尼亚即将拥有全非洲最大规模的风力发电厂： 353台涡轮发电机即将被安装在图尔卡纳湖区。

translation.en: I am not against wind energy, but we need to work  with the governments, because wind turbines  do this to birds. They slice them in half.
translation.zh: 我不反对开发风能，但是我们应该呼吁 政府重新考虑这项决定，因为风力涡轮机 会对鸟类造成威胁。高速的扇叶会把鸟儿“切”成两半。

translation.en: They are bird-blending machines.
translation.zh: 它们简直就是鸟类粉碎机。

translation.en: In West Africa, there's a horrific trade  of dead vultures to serve the witchcraft and the fetish market.
translation.zh: 在西非，一些人毫无怜悯的叫卖 死去的秃鹫来满足巫术和收藏的需求。

translation.en: So what's being done? Well, we're conducting research  on these birds. We're putting transmitters on them.
translation.zh: 我们正在做什么呢？我们正在研究 这些秃鹫。我们在它们身上安装定位器。

translation.en: We're trying to determine their basic ecology,  and see where they go.
translation.zh: 我们试图去查明秃鹫与周围环境的关系 并且了解秃鹫的行踪。

translation.en: We can see that they travel different countries, so  if you focus on a problem locally, it's not going to help you.
translation.zh: 我们发现它们会在不同的国家之间旅行，所以 如果只是关注一个地区，你很难取得什么进展。

translation.en: We need to work with governments in regional levels.
translation.zh: 我们需要去和整个地区的政府们打交道。

translation.en: We're working with local communities.
translation.zh: 我们正努力与当地的居民们沟通。

translation.en: We're talking to them about appreciating vultures,  about the need from within to appreciate these  wonderful creatures and the services that they provide.
translation.zh: 我们正在尽力让他们了解到秃鹫的益处， 并且发自内心得去感激这些 奇妙的生物和他们为自然所做的贡献。

translation.en: How can you help? You can become active,  make noise. You can write a letter to your government  and tell them that we need to focus on these very  misunderstood creatures. Volunteer your time  to spread the word. Spread the word.
translation.zh: 你们能做些什么呢？你们可以行动起来， 制造声势。你们可以写信给你们的政府 并且告诉他们，我们需要去关注这些被严重 误解的生物。花些时间 告诉你身边的人。尽可能多的人。

translation.en: When you walk out of this room, you will be informed  about vultures, but speak to your families, to your children,  to your neighbors about vultures.
translation.zh: 当你走出这个房间的时候，你们就是 秃鹫达人了，不但要告诉你的家人们，还要 告诉你们的邻居们有关秃鹫的故事。

translation.en: They are very graceful. Charles Darwin said  he changed his mind because he watched them fly  effortlessly without energy in the skies.
translation.zh: 它们是那么的优雅。查尔斯 达尔文曾说到 他改变了自己的看法，在他看到秃鹫们在空中 优雅而又浑然天成的身姿之后。

translation.en: Kenya, this world, will be much poorer  without these wonderful species.
translation.zh: 肯尼亚，全世界，都将会有很大的损失 如果失去了这些奇妙的物种。

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢。（鼓掌）

translation.en: Everything I do, and everything I do professionally --  my life -- has been shaped  by seven years of work as a young man in Africa.
translation.zh: 我所做的一切，不论是生活上还是工作上 我的整个人生--深深受到 年轻时在非洲工作的那七年的影响，

translation.en: From 1971 to 1977 --  I look young, but I'm not —  --  I worked in Zambia, Kenya, Ivory Coast, Algeria, Somalia,  in projects of technical cooperation with African countries.
translation.zh: 从1971年到1977年。 我看起来很年轻，但其实我老了-- 我曾在赞比亚，肯尼亚，象牙海岸，阿尔及利亚，索马里 参与过不少与非洲各国的技术合作项目。

translation.en: I worked for an Italian NGO,  and every single project that we set up in Africa  failed.
translation.zh: 当时我在一家意大利非政府组织工作。 我们在非洲建立的每一个项目， 都失败了。

translation.en: And I was distraught.
translation.zh: 我都快抓狂了。

translation.en: I thought, age 21, that we Italians were good people  and we were doing good work in Africa.
translation.zh: 那时21岁的我觉得我们意大利人是大好人， 我们在为非洲做好事谋福利。

translation.en: Instead, everything we touched we killed.
translation.zh: 然而，我们干什么赔什么。

translation.en: Our first project, the one that has inspired my first book,  "Ripples from the Zambezi,"  was a project where we Italians  decided to teach Zambian people how to grow food.
translation.zh: 我们第一个项目给了我写第一本书的灵感， 书名叫《赞比西河的涟漪》。 在这个项目中，我们意大利人 决定教赞比亚人种粮食。

translation.en: So we arrived there with Italian seeds in southern Zambia  in this absolutely magnificent valley  going down to the Zambezi River,  and we taught the local people how to grow Italian tomatoes  and zucchini and ...
translation.zh: 所以，我们带着意大利的种子来到了赞比亚南部， 一个壮丽迷人的山谷， 通向赞比西河。 我们教当地人种植意大利西红柿 和西葫芦等等。

translation.en: And of course the local people had absolutely no interest  in doing that, so we paid them to come and work,  and sometimes they would show up.   And we were amazed that the local people, in such a fertile valley, would not have any agriculture.
translation.zh: 当然，当地人对此表示毫无兴趣， 所以我们付工资请他们来劳作， 他们也是一会儿来一会儿不来的。 有着如此肥沃的山谷，当地人居然不耕种，

translation.en: But instead of asking them how come they were not  growing anything, we simply said, "Thank God we're here."   "Just in the nick of time to save the Zambian people from starvation."
translation.zh: 我们对此感到十分惊奇。 但我们并没有问他们原因， 而仅仅是感叹道：“幸亏我们来了。” “在饥饿的赞比亚人民命悬一线时伸出了援手。”

translation.en: And of course, everything in Africa grew beautifully.
translation.zh: 当然，在非洲种的东西都长得很好。

translation.en: We had these magnificent tomatoes. In Italy, a tomato  would grow to this size. In Zambia, to this size.
translation.zh: 我们种的西红柿漂亮极了。在意大利，一个西红柿 长这么大。在赞比亚，能长这么大。

translation.en: And we could not believe, and we were telling the Zambians,  "Look how easy agriculture is."
translation.zh: 这真是难以置信。我们跟赞比亚人说： “看，耕种多容易啊。”

translation.en: When the tomatoes were nice and ripe and red,  overnight, some 200 hippos came out from the river  and they ate everything.   And we said to the Zambians, "My God, the hippos!"
translation.zh: 当西红柿成熟了，红彤彤的好看极了， 一夜之间，从赞比西河跑来两百多头河马 把所有西红柿都啃光了。 我们跟赞比亚人说：“天呐，这些该死的河马！”

translation.en: And the Zambians said, "Yes, that's why we have no agriculture here."   "Why didn't you tell us?""You never asked."
translation.zh: 赞比亚人说：“没错，这就是我们不在这里耕种的原因。” “你们为什么不早说？” “你又没问过。”

translation.en: I thought it was only us Italians blundering around Africa,  but then I saw what the Americans were doing,  what the English were doing, what the French were doing,  and after seeing what they were doing,  I became quite proud of our project in Zambia.
translation.zh: 我本以为只有我们意大利人在非洲栽了跟头， 但当我知道美国人的情况， 英国人的情况，法国人的情况， 当看了他们的所作所为之后， 我为我们在赞比亚的项目感到非常自豪。

translation.en: Because, you see, at least we fed the hippos.
translation.zh: 因为，我们至少喂饱了河马。

translation.en: You should see the rubbish —  --  You should see the rubbish that we have bestowed  on unsuspecting African people.
translation.zh: 你们应该看看这些垃圾---- 你们应该看看我们塞了多少垃圾给 这些满怀信任的非洲人民。

translation.en: You want to read the book,  read "Dead Aid," by Dambisa Moyo,  Zambian woman economist.
translation.zh: 你们可以读读这本书， 叫《致命援助》，作者是丹比萨·莫约， 一位赞比亚女经济学家。

translation.en: The book was published in 2009.
translation.zh: 这本书出版于2009年。

translation.en: We Western donor countries have given the African continent  two trillion American dollars in the last 50 years.
translation.zh: 我们这些西方援助国在过去50年里 向非洲大陆投入了两万亿美元。

translation.en: I'm not going to tell you the damage that that money has done.
translation.zh: 我不打算跟你们细说这笔钱所造成的损害。

translation.en: Just go and read her book.
translation.zh: 你们自己去读读看。

translation.en: Read it from an African woman, the damage that we have done.
translation.zh: 看看以一位非洲女性的眼光，我们所带来的损害有多大。

translation.en: We Western people are imperialist, colonialist missionaries,  and there are only two ways we deal with people:  We either patronize them, or we are paternalistic.
translation.zh: 我们西方人是帝国主义者，殖民主义者，以及传教士， 我们跟人们打交道的方式只有两种： 一是居高临下，二是家长做派。

translation.en: The two words come from the Latin root "pater,"  which means "father."
translation.zh: 这两个词来自于拉丁词根“pater”， 意即“父亲”。

translation.en: But they mean two different things.
translation.zh: 但两个词的意思不同。

translation.en: Paternalistic, I treat anybody from a different culture  as if they were my children. "I love you so much."
translation.zh: 家长做派意味着我把不同文化背景的人 当成我的孩子对待。“我爱你孩子。”

translation.en: Patronizing, I treat everybody from another culture  as if they were my servants.
translation.zh: 居高临下意味着我把另一文化背景的人 当做我的仆人对待。

translation.en: That's why the white people in Africa are called "bwana," boss.
translation.zh: 这也就是为什么在非洲白人被称作“老爷”，也就是老板。

translation.en: I was given a slap in the face reading a book,  "Small is Beautiful," written by Schumacher, who said,  above all in economic development, if people  do not wish to be helped, leave them alone.
translation.zh: 我在读一本书时，如遭当头棒喝， 这本书叫《小即是美》，作者是舒马赫， 他说，经济发展最重要的一点是，如果人们 不想让别人帮忙，就随他们去。

translation.en: This should be the first principle of aid.
translation.zh: 这应该是援助的首要原则。

translation.en: The first principle of aid is respect.
translation.zh: 援助的首要原则就是尊重。

translation.en: This morning, the gentleman who opened this conference  lay a stick on the floor, and said,  "Can we -- can you imagine a city  that is not neocolonial?"
translation.zh: 今天早上，给这次大会致开幕词的先生 在地上放了一根棍子，说道， “我们能不能--你们能不能想象一座城市 没被新殖民主义侵略吗？”

translation.en: I decided when I was 27 years old  to only respond to people,  and I invented a system called Enterprise Facilitation,  where you never initiate anything,  you never motivate anybody, but you become a servant  of the local passion, the servant of local people  who have a dream to become a better person.
translation.zh: 27岁时，我做出一个决定， 只基于人们的需求提供援助。 我创立了一套工作系统，叫“企业梦工厂”。 我们不做创始人， 也不激励任何人，而是为当地人们的 创业热情而服务，为当地人们 找到更好的人生定位。

translation.en: So what you do -- you shut up.
translation.zh: 所以我们要做的--就是闭嘴。

translation.en: You never arrive in a community with any ideas,  and you sit with the local people.
translation.zh: 我们走进一个社区时不会将任何想法强加于对方， 而是与当地人坐在一起交流。

translation.en: We don't work from offices.
translation.zh: 我们的工作地点不在办公室。

translation.en: We meet at the cafe. We meet at the pub.
translation.zh: 我们与客户在餐馆和酒吧见面。

translation.en: We have zero infrastructure.
translation.zh: 我们没有任何基础设施的建设。

translation.en: And what we do, we become friends,  and we find out what that person wants to do.
translation.zh: 我们所做的，是跟他们交朋友， 并发现他们的兴趣和意向。

translation.en: The most important thing is passion.
translation.zh: 最重要的是热情。

translation.en: You can give somebody an idea.
translation.zh: 你可以向客户提出你的点子，

translation.en: If that person doesn't want to do it,  what are you going to do?
translation.zh: 但如果对方不感兴趣， 你又有什么办法？

translation.en: The passion that the person has for her own growth  is the most important thing.
translation.zh: 客户热衷于自我提升的这份热情 才是最重要的。

translation.en: The passion that that man has for his own personal growth  is the most important thing.
translation.zh: 对方的热情是建立在自我提升的基础上， 这才是最重要的

translation.en: And then we help them to go and find the knowledge,  because nobody in the world can succeed alone.
translation.zh: 然后我们帮助他们搜集相关知识和信息， 因为这世上，单丝不成线，独木不成林。

translation.en: The person with the idea may not have the knowledge,  but the knowledge is available.
translation.zh: 有点子的人未必懂得相关知识， 但我们可以提供支持。

translation.en: So years and years ago, I had this idea:  Why don't we, for once, instead of arriving in the community  to tell people what to do, why don't, for once,  listen to them? But not in community meetings.
translation.zh: 所以很多年前，我有个想法， 我们为何不能至少有一次做到聆听他们的想法， 而不是把我们的想法强加于他们？ 但这不能以社区会议的形式进行。

translation.en: Let me tell you a secret.
translation.zh: 我告诉你们一个秘密。

translation.en: There is a problem with community meetings.
translation.zh: 社区会议存在一个问题。

translation.en: Entrepreneurs never come,  and they never tell you, in a public meeting,  what they want to do with their own money,  what opportunity they have identified.
translation.zh: 企业家们从不出席， 他们绝不会在公众集会上告诉你， 他们打算把钱用在哪儿， 他们窥测到了什么商机。

translation.en: So planning has this blind spot.
translation.zh: 所以做计划有一个盲区，

translation.en: The smartest people in your community you don't even know,  because they don't come to your public meetings.
translation.zh: 你甚至都无从结识社区里最聪明的那些人 因为他们根本不参与你们的公众集会。

translation.en: What we do, we work one-on-one,  and to work one-on-one, you have to create  a social infrastructure that doesn't exist.
translation.zh: 我们的做法是，与客户一对一， 为了能一对一，我们必须建设 一套前所未有的社会基础设施。

translation.en: You have to create a new profession.
translation.zh: 我们必须创造一个全新的职业。

translation.en: The profession is the family doctor of enterprise,  the family doctor of business, who sits with you  in your house, at your kitchen table, at the cafe,  and helps you find the resources to transform your passion  into a way to make a living.
translation.zh: 这种职业相当于企业的家庭医生， 这位企业家庭医生，会与你面对面 在你的家里，你的厨房餐桌旁，或是咖啡馆， 帮助你集结资源来将你的创业热情 转换为谋生技能。

translation.en: I started this as a tryout in Esperance, in Western Australia.
translation.zh: 我在西澳大利亚州的埃斯佩兰斯进行了试验。

translation.en: I was a doing a Ph.D. at the time,  trying to go away from this patronizing bullshit  that we arrive and tell you what to do.
translation.zh: 那时我在读博士， 努力摒弃那种居高临下的狗屁做法 到了之后只会颐指气使指手划脚。

translation.en: And so what I did in Esperance that first year  was to just walk the streets, and in three days  I had my first client, and I helped this first guy  who was smoking fish from a garage, was a Maori guy,  and I helped him to sell to the restaurant in Perth,  to get organized, and then the fishermen came to me to say,  "You the guy who helped Maori? Can you help us?"
translation.zh: 我在埃斯佩兰斯的第一年 只是出去遛街，在那些日子里， 我有了第一位客户，我帮助了这第一个人。 他是毛利人，在一家车库里做熏鱼。 我教他把鱼卖给珀斯的餐馆， 帮他进行了筹划。然后当地的渔民们跑来跟我说， “你就是那个帮毛利佬卖鱼的人？你能帮帮我们吗？”

translation.en: And I helped these five fishermen to work together  and get this beautiful tuna not to the cannery in Albany  for 60 cents a kilo, but we found a way  to take the fish for sushi to Japan for 15 dollars a kilo,  and the farmers came to talk to me, said,  "Hey, you helped them. Can you help us?"
translation.zh: 我让这五个渔民合伙运作， 不是把美味的金枪鱼以60美分一公斤的低价 卖给奥尔巴尼的罐头工厂， 而是以15美元一公斤的高价卖给日本做寿司。 接着又有农民跑来跟我说， “嘿，你帮助了他们，能帮帮我们吗？”

translation.en: In a year, I had 27 projects going on,  and the government came to see me to say,  "How can you do that?
translation.zh: 一年之内，我做了27个项目， 政府的人跑来问我， “你是怎么办到的？

translation.en: How can you do — ?" And I said, "I do something very, very, very difficult.
translation.zh: 你怎么能--？”我答道：“我做了一件很困难的事，

translation.en: I shut up, and listen to them."   So —  —  So the government says, "Do it again."   We've done it in 300 communities around the world.
translation.zh: 那就是闭上嘴，听他们说。” 所以---- 所以政府的人说：“那接着做。” 我们在世界上300个社区开展了这个项目。

translation.en: We have helped to start 40,000 businesses.
translation.zh: 我们已帮助建立了40,000家企业。

translation.en: There is a new generation of entrepreneurs  who are dying of solitude.
translation.zh: 新一代的创业者们 皆因闭门造车而一事无成。

translation.en: Peter Drucker, one of the greatest management consultants in history,  died age 96, a few years ago.
translation.zh: 彼得·德鲁克，史上最伟大的管理咨询师之一， 几年前去世了，享年96岁，

translation.en: Peter Drucker was a professor of philosophy  before becoming involved in business,  and this is what Peter Drucker says:  "Planning is actually incompatible  with an entrepreneurial society and economy."
translation.zh: 彼得·德鲁克在涉足商界之前 是一位哲学教授， 彼得·德鲁克曾说过： “计划其实是与创业型社会 及创业型经济不相容的。”

translation.en: Planning is the kiss of death of entrepreneurship.
translation.zh: 计划是给创业帮了倒忙。

translation.en: So now you're rebuilding Christchurch  without knowing what the smartest people in Christchurch  want to do with their own money and their own energy.
translation.zh: 现在，我们重建基督城， 却不知道基督城最聪明的那群人 想如何运用他们自己的钱财和精力。

translation.en: You have to learn how to get these people  to come and talk to you.
translation.zh: 我们必须学会如何让这些人 给出他们的意见。

translation.en: You have to offer them confidentiality, privacy,  you have to be fantastic at helping them,  and then they will come, and they will come in droves.
translation.zh: 我们必须给予他们保密的承诺，并尊重他们的隐私， 我们要擅长为他们提供帮助， 这样他们才会上门，才会纷至沓来。

translation.en: In a community of 10,000 people, we get 200 clients.
translation.zh: 在一个10,000人的社区里，我们有200个客户。

translation.en: Can you imagine a community of 400,000 people,  the intelligence and the passion?
translation.zh: 你能想象一个400,000人的社区， 凝聚了多少智力和热情吗？

translation.en: Which presentation have you applauded the most this morning?
translation.zh: 今天上午你们鼓掌最多的演讲来自谁？

translation.en: Local, passionate people. That's who you have applauded.
translation.zh: 是充满创业热情的当地人。你们为他们鼓掌。

translation.en: So what I'm saying is that  entrepreneurship is where it's at.
translation.zh: 所以我想说的是， 创业精神是当今社会的潮流。

translation.en: We are at the end of the first industrial revolution --  nonrenewable fossil fuels, manufacturing --  and all of a sudden, we have systems which are not sustainable.
translation.zh: 当我们处于第一次工业革命的末期时-- 我们使用不可再生矿物燃料，发展制造业-- 但我们忽然意识到这种发展是不可持续的。

translation.en: The internal combustion engine is not sustainable.
translation.zh: 内燃机的燃料总有耗尽的一天。

translation.en: Freon way of maintaining things is not sustainable.
translation.zh: 用氟利昂冷藏食物也非长久之计。

translation.en: What we have to look at is at how we  for seven billion people in a sustainable way.
translation.zh: 我们现在要关心的是我们如何 以一种可持续的发展方式来满足70亿人的 食物、医疗、教育、运输及通信需求。

translation.en: The technologies do not exist to do that.
translation.zh: 现有的科技水平尚做不到这一点。

translation.en: Who is going to invent the technology  for the green revolution? Universities? Forget about it!
translation.zh: 谁能发明这种科技来 实现绿色革命？大学吗？别想了！

translation.en: Government? Forget about it!
translation.zh: 政府吗？别想了！

translation.en: It will be entrepreneurs, and they're doing it now.
translation.zh: 是创业者们，是他们正在为之奋斗。

translation.en: There's a lovely story that I read in a futurist magazine  many, many years ago.
translation.zh: 许多年前，我在一本未来主义杂志上 看过一篇有趣的文章。

translation.en: There was a group of experts who were invited  to discuss the future of the city of New York in 1860.
translation.zh: 1860年，有一批专家受到邀请 去讨论纽约市的未来是怎样。

translation.en: And in 1860, this group of people came together,  and they all speculated about what would happen  to the city of New York in 100 years,  and the conclusion was unanimous:  The city of New York would not exist in 100 years.
translation.zh: 那是1860年，这批人聚到一起， 他们都对100年后的纽约市 作出了推断。 他们的结论众口一词： 100年后，纽约市将不复存在。

translation.en: Why? Because they looked at the curve and said,  if the population keeps growing at this rate,  to move the population of New York around,  they would have needed six million horses,  and the manure created by six million horses  would be impossible to deal with.
translation.zh: 为什么？因为他们看着图表上的曲线说， 如果人口继续以这种速度增长， 纽约的人们出行 将需要六百万匹马， 而六百万匹马所排泄的粪便 将无法处理。

translation.en: They were already drowning in manure.   So 1860, they are seeing this dirty technology  that is going to choke the life out of New York.
translation.zh: 到时人们将会被马粪淹没。 所以1860年，他们认为，这种肮脏的科技 将扼杀纽约的生命。

translation.en: So what happens? In 40 years' time, in the year 1900,  in the United States of America, there were 1,001  car manufacturing companies -- 1,001.
translation.zh: 那么结果呢？40年之后，1900年， 美利坚合众国有了1,001家 汽车制造商--有1,001家之多。

translation.en: The idea of finding a different technology  had absolutely taken over,  and there were tiny, tiny little factories in backwaters.
translation.zh: 找到一种新科技取而代之 才是发展的王道， 而停滞不前的小工厂还有很多。

translation.en: Dearborn, Michigan. Henry Ford.
translation.zh: 例如密歇根州迪尔伯恩市的福特汽车公司。

translation.en: However, there is a secret to work with entrepreneurs.
translation.zh: 然而，与创业者打交道有个秘诀。

translation.en: First, you have to offer them confidentiality.
translation.zh: 第一，你要给予他们保密的承诺。

translation.en: Otherwise they don't come and talk to you.
translation.zh: 不然他们不会来找你谈的。

translation.en: Then you have to offer them absolute, dedicated,  passionate service to them.
translation.zh: 然后你要为他们提供专注 而热情的服务。

translation.en: And then you have to tell them the truth about entrepreneurship.
translation.zh: 你要告诉他们创业精神的真谛。

translation.en: The smallest company, the biggest company,  has to be capable of doing three things beautifully:  The product that you want to sell has to be fantastic,  you have to have fantastic marketing,  and you have to have tremendous financial management.
translation.zh: 不论是大公司还是小企业， 都能把以下三件事做得很好： 产品质量要过硬， 市场营销要高效， 财务管理要精明。

translation.en: Guess what?
translation.zh: 问题是什么呢？

translation.en: We have never met a single human being  in the world who can make it, sell it and look after the money.
translation.zh: 这世上从来没有一个人 能同时做好生产、销售以及财务的工作。

translation.en: It doesn't exist.
translation.zh: 这种人不存在。

translation.en: This person has never been born.
translation.zh: 这样的能人尚未出生。

translation.en: We've done the research, and we have looked  at the 100 iconic companies of the world --  Carnegie, Westinghouse, Edison, Ford,  all the new companies, Google, Yahoo.
translation.zh: 我们做过调查，对世界上 100家标杆企业进行研究-- 卡内基培训公司，西屋公司，爱迪生公司，福特汽车公司， 以及所有这些新兴产业的公司，如谷歌，雅虎。

translation.en: There's only one thing that all the successful companies  in the world have in common, only one:  None were started by one person.
translation.zh: 世界上所有成功的企业只有一个 共同点，只有一个： 没有一个企业是靠一人之力创建的。

translation.en: Now we teach entrepreneurship to 16-year-olds  in Northumberland, and we start the class  by giving them the first two pages of Richard Branson's autobiography,  and the task of the 16-year-olds is to underline,  in the first two pages of Richard Branson's autobiography  how many times Richard uses the word "I"  and how many times he uses the word "we."
translation.zh: 现在我们在诺森伯兰郡 教授16岁青年们创业学，我们一开始 把理查德·布兰森自传的前两页给他们看， 这些学生们的任务就是用下划线标出 并统计理查德·布兰森自传前两页中 用了多少次“我”这个字 和用了多少次“我们”这个词。

translation.en: Never the word "I," and the word "we" 32 times.
translation.zh: “我”一次都没有，“我们”用了32次。

translation.en: He wasn't alone when he started.
translation.zh: 他刚起步时并非单枪匹马。

translation.en: Nobody started a company alone. No one.
translation.zh: 没人能独自创立一个企业。没人。

translation.en: So we can create the community  where we have facilitators who come from a small business background  sitting in cafes, in bars, and your dedicated buddies  who will do to you, what somebody did for this gentleman  who talks about this epic,  somebody who will say to you, "What do you need?
translation.zh: 所以我们可以建立一个社区， 在这个社区里，我们有来自小型企业背景的辅助商 在咖啡馆中、酒吧里为你出谋划策， 我们能为你提供这位满怀抱负的先生 所受到的帮助， 我们会问你：“你需要什么？

translation.en: What can you do? Can you make it?
translation.zh: 你能做什么？你能生产出来吗？

translation.en: Okay, can you sell it? Can you look after the money?"
translation.zh: 你能销售出去吗？你能打理资金吗？”

translation.en: "Oh, no, I cannot do this.""Would you like me to find you somebody?"
translation.zh: “啊，这个我办不到。”“那要我替你找人帮忙吗？”

translation.en: We activate communities.
translation.zh: 我们鼓舞各个社区进行创业。

translation.en: We have groups of volunteers supporting the Enterprise Facilitator  to help you to find resources and people  and we have discovered that the miracle  of the intelligence of local people is such  that you can change the culture and the economy  of this community just by capturing the passion,  the energy and imagination of your own people.
translation.zh: 我们有志愿者团队帮助创业辅助商 为客户集结资源及人力。 我们发现当地人群的智慧 能创造出奇迹 能改变社区的文化和经济， 只要你能好好利用人们这份热情， 这种活力，这种想象力。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: There are a lot of ways the people around us  can help improve our lives.
translation.zh: 我们周围的人能以很多种方式 来帮我们把生活变得更美好

translation.en: We don't bump into every neighbor,  so a lot of wisdom never gets passed on,  though we do share the same public spaces.
translation.zh: 我们不一定能常常碰到我们的邻居 所以即使我们生活在同一片公共空间里 邻居的智慧也难以被传递开来

translation.en: So over the past few years, I've tried ways to share more  using simple tools like stickers, stencils and chalk.
translation.zh: 所以在过去的几年里，我尝试着以不同的方式 如用贴纸、展板和粉笔这些简单工具 来在公共空间里与邻居分享更多的东西

translation.en: And these projects came from questions I had, like:  How much are my neighbors paying for their apartments?
translation.zh: 这些项目都源自于我自己的一些疑问，如 我的邻居得付多少房租？

translation.en: How can we lend and borrow more things,  without knocking on each other's doors at a bad time?
translation.zh: 我们怎么样能够从邻里间互借到更多的东西 同时避免在不合时宜的时候敲开对方的门？

translation.en: How can we share more memories of our abandoned buildings,  and gain a better understanding of our landscape?
translation.zh: 我们怎样能够更好地分享各自的 关于被毁弃的建筑的回忆 并更好地理解我们居住的这片土地？

translation.en: How can we share more of our hopes for our vacant storefronts,  so our communities can reflect our needs and dreams today?
translation.zh: 怎样更能表达我们对空置的店面的期待 使我们的社区能反映出 我们现在的需求和梦想？

translation.en: Now, I live in New Orleans,  and I am in love with New Orleans.
translation.zh: 我现时住在新奥尔良 并深深地爱上了这座城市

translation.en: My soul is always soothed by the giant live oak trees,  shading lovers, drunks and dreamers for hundreds of years,  and I trust a city that always makes way for music.
translation.zh: 那些生生不息的巨型橡树总是可以抚慰我的灵魂 几百年来，情侣、醉汉和追梦人们 总会稍息在树影下 我深信这一座充满着音乐律动的城市

translation.en: I feel like every time someone sneezes,  New Orleans has a parade.   The city has some of the most beautiful architecture in the world,  but it also has one of the highest amounts of abandoned properties in America.
translation.zh: 每当有人打喷嚏时， 我都感觉新奥尔良来了一只游行队伍 新奥尔良拥有世界上很多最漂亮的建筑 但同时，她也是全美拥有最多 废弃建筑的城市

translation.en: I live near this house,  and I thought about how I could make it a nicer space for my neighborhood,  and I also thought about something that changed my life forever.
translation.zh: 我住在这栋房子附近，我就想如何让它 在这片社区里成为一个更好的地方 也思考了另一件事 这件事彻底改变了我的人生

translation.en: In 2009, I lost someone I loved very much.
translation.zh: 2009年，我失去了一个我挚爱的人

translation.en: Her name was Joan, and she was a mother to me.
translation.zh: 她的名字叫琼，对我来讲，她就像我的母亲一样

translation.en: And her death was sudden and unexpected.
translation.zh: 她死得很突然，没有人预料到

translation.en: And I thought about death a lot.
translation.zh: 然后我思考了很多关于死亡的事

translation.en: And ... this made me feel deep gratitude for the time I've had.
translation.zh: 然后⋯⋯ 这件事让我对我拥有的时光怀着深切致意

translation.en: And ... brought clarity to the things that are meaningful to my life now.
translation.zh: 并且 显现出了那些 对我的生命有真正意义的东西

translation.en: But I struggle to maintain this perspective in my daily life.
translation.zh: 但我却很难在日常生活中保持这种心态

translation.en: I feel like it's easy to get caught up in the day-to-day,  and forget what really matters to you.
translation.zh: 我觉得人们太容易被日复一日的琐碎困住 而忘记什么才是真正重要的事

translation.en: So with help from old and new friends,  I turned the side of this abandoned house into a giant chalkboard,  and stenciled it with a fill-in-the-blank sentence:  "Before I die, I want to ..."
translation.zh: 我于是在一些新老朋友的帮助下 把这栋废弃的房子的一面墙 做成了一个巨型黑板 我在上面写满了同一道填空题 “在死之前，我想⋯⋯”

translation.en: So anyone walking by can pick up a piece of chalk,  reflect on their life,  and share their personal aspirations in public space.
translation.zh: 所以每一个路过的人都可以捡起一根粉笔 在公共场合里留下一些他们人生的痕迹 且来分享他们内心深处的愿望

translation.en: I didn't know what to expect from this experiment,  but by the next day, the wall was entirely filled out,  and it kept growing.
translation.zh: 我并不知道该从这个实验里期待些什么 但是第二天，整个墙壁都被填满了 而且不断有人添加新的答案

translation.en: And I'd like to share a few things that people wrote on this wall.
translation.zh: 我想跟大家分享一些人们在那面墙上 写的东西

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to be tried for piracy."   "Before I die, I want to straddle the International Dateline."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想为我的海盗行为接受审判” “在死之前，我想跨过国际日期变更线”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to sing for millions."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想在上百万的观众面前唱歌”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to plant a tree."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想种一棵树”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to live off the grid."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想过隐居的生活”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to hold her one more time."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想再抱她一次”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to be someone's cavalry."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想成为某个人的骑士”

translation.en: "Before I die, I want to be completely myself."
translation.zh: “在死之前，我想要做完全真实的自己”

translation.en: So this neglected space became a constructive one,  and people's hopes and dreams made me laugh out loud, tear up,  and they consoled me during my own tough times.
translation.zh: 这个本来被遗忘的建筑变成了一个极具建设性的地方 这些人的希望和梦想 让我放声大笑，也黯然落泪 也曾在我经历困境的时候给我安慰

translation.en: It's about knowing you're not alone;  it's about understanding our neighbors in new and enlightening ways;  it's about making space for reflection and contemplation,  and remembering what really matters most to us as we grow and change.
translation.zh: 这让我们相信自己并不孤单 让我们对邻居有了全新的 启发心智的了解 这为我们营造了一个反省和思考的空间 也提醒我们在不断成长改变的过程中 什么才是最为重要的

translation.en: I made this last year,  and started receiving hundreds of messages from passionate people  who wanted to make a wall with their community.
translation.zh: 这个黑板是我去年做的，然后我就不断收到 一些热情的人们给我发的信息 说想在他们的社区里也设立一面这样的墙壁

translation.en: So, my civic center colleagues and I made a tool kit,  and now walls have been made in countries around the world,  including Kazakhstan, South Africa,  Australia,  Argentina, and beyond.
translation.zh: 所以我和我的同事们就做了一个小型工具箱 现在，这面墙壁已经遍布全球 包括哈萨克斯坦，南非 澳大利亚 阿根廷等地

translation.en: Together, we've shown how powerful our public spaces can be  if we're given the opportunity to have a voice,  and share more with one another.
translation.zh: 这些迹象表明，如果我们能有一个 表达自己的意愿并与他人分享的机会 那么公共空间将发挥巨大的作用

translation.en: Two of the most valuable things we have  are time, and our relationships with other people.
translation.zh: 我们所拥有的最珍贵的两样东西，一个是时间 还有一个，是与他人的联系

translation.en: In our age of increasing distractions,  it's more important than ever to find ways to maintain perspective,  and remember that life is brief and tender.
translation.zh: 在这个物欲横流的时代里 努力坚持自我，铭记人生的短暂与生命的脆弱 变得比以往任何时代都更重要

translation.en: Death is something that we're often discouraged to talk about,  or even think about,  but I've realized that preparing for death  is one of the most empowering things you can do.
translation.zh: 我们总是没有勇气谈论死亡 甚至没有勇气去想着死亡 但是我意识到，为死亡做心理准备 是我们能够做到的最有力的事情之一

translation.en: Thinking about death clarifies your life.
translation.zh: 思考死亡能够让你对自己的人生有更清醒的认识

translation.en: Our shared spaces can better reflect what matters to us,  as individuals and as a community,  and with more ways to share our hopes, fears and stories,  the people around us can not only help us make better places,  they can help us lead better lives.
translation.zh: 公共空间可以更好的体现到底什么对我们是真正重要的 无论是对个人来说或者对于整个社区来说 有了更多的方式来分享我们的希望，恐惧和经历 我们身边的人不仅能够帮助我们创造更美好的地方 更帮助我们过上更美好的生活

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: Today I have just one request.
translation.zh: 今天我只要求一件事

translation.en: Please don't tell me I'm normal.
translation.zh: 不要说我是正常人

translation.en: Now I'd like to introduce you to my brothers.
translation.zh: 我想介绍给你们认识我的两个兄弟

translation.en: Remi is 22,  tall and very handsome.
translation.zh: Remi今年22岁 又高又帅

translation.en: He's speechless, but he communicates joy  in a way that some of the best orators cannot.
translation.zh: 他不讲话，但能传达欢乐 用他特有的方式，最好的演讲家也望尘莫及

translation.en: Remi knows what love is.
translation.zh: Remi知道什么是爱

translation.en: He shares it unconditionally and he shares it regardless.
translation.zh: 他无条件无保留地分享他的那份爱

translation.en: He's not greedy. He doesn't see skin color.
translation.zh: 他不贪心，也不在乎别人是什么肤色

translation.en: He doesn't care about religious differences, and get this:  He has never told a lie.
translation.zh: 他无所谓宗教信仰的差异，还有： 他从来没说过谎

translation.en: When he sings songs from our childhood,  attempting words that not even I could remember,  he reminds me of one thing:  how little we know about the mind, and how wonderful  the unknown must be.
translation.zh: 当他唱起我们儿时的歌谣 唱出就连我都忘记了的歌词 他提醒了我 我们对精神知之甚少 而未知的事物是如此迷人

translation.en: Samuel is 16. He's tall. He's very handsome.
translation.zh: Samuel今年16岁，也是又高又帅

translation.en: He has the most impeccable memory.
translation.zh: 他有着超凡的记忆力

translation.en: He has a selective one, though.
translation.zh: 但这记忆力是有选择性的

translation.en: He doesn't remember if he stole my chocolate bar,  but he remembers the year of release for every song on my iPod,  conversations we had when he was four,  weeing on my arm on the first ever episode of Teletubbies,  and Lady Gaga's birthday.
translation.zh: 他不记得偷了我的巧克力棒 但记得我iPod里面每首歌的发行年份 他四岁时我们的谈话 看天线宝宝第一集时尿在我手臂上的囧事 还有Lady Gaga的生日

translation.en: Don't they sound incredible?
translation.zh: 听起来很神奇吧？

translation.en: But most people don't agree.
translation.zh: 但很多人不这么认为

translation.en: And in fact, because their minds don't fit  into society's version of normal,  they're often bypassed and misunderstood.
translation.zh: 事实是，就因为他们的思维不符合 社会对正常人的定义 他们经常被孤立、被误解

translation.en: But what lifted my heart and strengthened my soul  was that even though this was the case,  although they were not seen as ordinary,  this could only mean one thing:  that they were extraordinary --  autistic and extraordinary.
translation.zh: 但让我坚定信念的是 即使现实如此 就算他们不被当作正常人看 这也只说明了一件事 他们是非凡的 虽然患有自闭症，但非凡无比

translation.en: Now, for you who may be less familiar with the term "autism,"  it's a complex brain disorder that affects social communication,  learning and sometimes physical skills.
translation.zh: 你们中的一些人可能还不太了解“孤独症”这个术语 它是由复杂的大脑功能紊乱而导致的社交障碍 学习障碍，有时伴有运动功能障碍

translation.en: It manifests in each individual differently,  hence why Remi is so different from Sam.
translation.zh: 每一个病例的情况都是特殊的 所以Remi与Sam的情况也是不同的

translation.en: And across the world, every 20 minutes, one new person  is diagnosed with autism, and although it's one of  the fastest-growing developmental disorders in the world,  there is no known cause or cure.
translation.zh: 在全世界，每20分钟，就有一个 新的孤独症确诊病例 虽然这是全球增长最快的疾病之一 但是我们尚不清楚它的致病原因和治疗方法

translation.en: And I cannot remember the first moment I encountered autism,  but I cannot recall a day without it.
translation.zh: 我记不起第一次知道“孤独症”这个词的情形 我也记不起有哪一天我是对“孤独症”一无所知的

translation.en: I was just three years old when my brother came along,  and I was so excited that  I had a new being in my life.
translation.zh: 我三岁的时候，弟弟出生了 我非常兴奋 我有了新的家人

translation.en: And after a few months went by,  I realized that he was different.
translation.zh: 而就在几个月之后 我意识到他与众不同

translation.en: He screamed a lot.
translation.zh: 他经常尖叫

translation.en: He didn't want to play like the other babies did,  and in fact, he didn't seem  very interested in me whatsoever.
translation.zh: 他不愿意像其他婴儿那样玩儿 实际上，他好像 对我一点儿也不感兴趣

translation.en: Remi lived and reigned in his own world, with his own rules,  and he found pleasure in the smallest things,  like lining up cars around the room  and staring at the washing machine  and eating anything that came in between.
translation.zh: Remi沉浸在他自己的世界里，应用他自己制定的法则 他从细微的事物中寻找乐趣 比如绕着屋子排列他的玩具车 盯着洗衣机 把他和洗衣机之间的所有东西都吃下去

translation.en: And as he grew older, he grew more different,  and the differences became more obvious.
translation.zh: 当他长大了，他变得更加独特 这些特别的地方更加明显

translation.en: Yet beyond the tantrums and the frustration  and the never-ending hyperactivity  was something really unique:  a pure and innocent nature, a boy who saw the world  without prejudice, a human who had never lied.
translation.zh: 除了经常性的发脾气、沮丧 和永无休止的多动 还有一点特别之处 就是他纯真无邪的天性，不带偏见地看世界 他是个从不撒谎的人

translation.en: Extraordinary.
translation.zh: 太不简单了

translation.en: Now, I cannot deny that there have been  some challenging moments in my family,  moments where I've wished that they were just like me.
translation.zh: 我无法否认 家里的确有过艰难的时候 我多想他们跟我一样

translation.en: But I cast my mind back to the things that they've taught me  about individuality and communication and love,  and I realize that these are things that  I wouldn't want to change with normality.
translation.zh: 但我转而又想到他们教我的那些事 关于个性、交流和爱 我意识到这些东西 我可不愿意用“正常”去换

translation.en: Normality overlooks the beauty that differences give us,  and the fact that we are different doesn't mean that one of us is wrong.
translation.zh: “正常”忽视了差异带来的美 人与人的差异不代表其中一方是错的

translation.en: It just means that there's a different kind of right.
translation.zh: 只是说明“对”有不同种类

translation.en: And if I could communicate just one thing to Remi  and to Sam  and to you,  it would be that you don't have to be normal.
translation.zh: 我只想说一句话，对Remi 对Sam 对你们 你们不必一定是“正常”的

translation.en: You can be extraordinary.
translation.zh: 你可以是非凡的

translation.en: Because autistic or not,  the differences that we have --  We've got a gift! Everyone's got a gift inside of us,  and in all honesty, the pursuit of normality  is the ultimate sacrifice of potential.
translation.zh: 无论是否是孤独症 我们之间的差异—— 我们每个人都有各自的天赋 老实说，追求“正常” 也就是完全抹杀了潜能

translation.en: The chance for greatness, for progress and for change  dies the moment we try to be like someone else.
translation.zh: 卓越、进步和改变的可能性 在我们想与他人变得一样的努力中消亡

translation.en: Please -- don't tell me I'm normal.
translation.zh: 请不要说我“正常”

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: Five years ago, I experienced a bit  of what it must have been like to be Alice in Wonderland.
translation.zh: 五年前，我曾有过一个 有如漫游爱丽丝仙境的经历。

translation.en: Penn State asked me, a communications teacher,  to teach a communications class for engineering students.
translation.zh: 宾夕法尼亚州立大学让我这个教沟通学的老师 给工程系的学生上沟通学课。

translation.en: And I was scared.   Really scared. Scared of these students with their big brains  and their big books and their big, unfamiliar words.
translation.zh: 我被吓到了。 我真的被吓坏了。这些学生发达的大脑， 还有他们所读的巨著，及他们使用的又长又生僻的词语通通都吓到我了。

translation.en: But as these conversations unfolded,  I experienced what Alice must have when she went down  that rabbit hole and saw that door to a whole new world.
translation.zh: 不过随着对话的展开， 我的经历就如爱丽丝一样，顺着那个兔子洞 下去，看到了那扇通往一个全新世界的大门。

translation.en: That's just how I felt as I had those conversations  with the students. I was amazed at the ideas  that they had, and I wanted others to experience this wonderland as well.
translation.zh: 这就是我和那些学生们对话时的感受。 我对他们的想法感到惊奇， 而且我希望其他人也能体验这种在仙境中的感觉。

translation.en: And I believe the key to opening that door  is great communication.
translation.zh: 我相信打开那扇门的关键 就是要有很好的交流与沟通。

translation.en: We desperately need great communication from our  scientists and engineers in order to change the world.
translation.zh: 为了改变世界，我们迫切需要从我们的 科学家和工程师那里得到良好的沟通。

translation.en: Our scientists and engineers are the ones  that are tackling our grandest challenges, from energy  to environment to health care, among others,  and if we don't know about it and understand it,  then the work isn't done, and I believe it's our responsibility  as non-scientists to have these interactions.
translation.zh: 我们的科学家和工程师们解决的都是 我们所面临的最大的难题，从能源 到环境再到卫生保健，等等。 如果我们不明白也不理解的话， 他们的工作对我们就没有什么意义了，并且我相信 我们作为非科学家们有责任与他们进行互动交流。

translation.en: But these great conversations can't occur if our scientists  and engineers don't invite us in to see their wonderland.
translation.zh: 可是如果我们的科学家和工程师们不把我们领进门 去看看他们的仙境的话，我们之间也就不可能有很好的交流。

translation.en: So scientists and engineers, please, talk nerdy to us.
translation.zh: 所以科学家和工程师们，请跟我们说说高科技是什么吧。

translation.en: I want to share a few keys on how you can do that  to make sure that we can see that your science is sexy  and that your engineering is engaging.
translation.zh: 我想来分享几个有用的方法，告诉你们如何才能保证 让我们也觉得你们的科学"性感"迷人、 你们的工程学魅力四射。

translation.en: First question to answer for us: so what?
translation.zh: 第一个要回答我们的问题： 高科技又怎样？

translation.en: Tell us why your science is relevant to us.
translation.zh: 告诉我们，为什么你们的科学与我们有关。

translation.en: Don't just tell me that you study trabeculae,  but tell me that you study trabeculae, which is the mesh-like structure of our bones  because it's important to understanding and treating osteoporosis.
translation.zh: 别光告诉我你们研究骨小梁， 要告诉我你们研究骨小梁是因为这种骨骼的网状组织 对认识和治疗骨质疏松症很重要。

translation.en: And when you're describing your science, beware of jargon.
translation.zh: 另外当你们描述科学原理时，要注意术语的使用。

translation.en: Jargon is a barrier to our understanding of your ideas.
translation.zh: 术语是我们理解你们想法的一个障碍。

translation.en: Sure, you can say "spatial and temporal," but why not just say  "space and time," which is so much more accessible to us?
translation.zh: 当然了，你们可以说“空间性与瞬时性”，可是为什么不说 "空间与时间"呢？这对我们来说容易理解多了。

translation.en: And making your ideas accessible is not the same as dumbing it down.
translation.zh: 让你们的想法简单易懂并不等于简化它，

translation.en: Instead, as Einstein said, make everything  as simple as possible, but no simpler.
translation.zh: 相反，正如爱因斯坦所说，让一切 尽可能的简单，而不是简化。

translation.en: You can clearly communicate your science  without compromising the ideas.
translation.zh: 你不必非得改变你的观点才能清楚地 传达出你的科学理论。

translation.en: A few things to consider are having examples, stories  and analogies. Those are ways to engage  and excite us about your content.
translation.zh: 可以考虑用一些例子、故事、 还有类比。这些都是使你们的谈论内容 吸引我们、让我们兴奋的方法。

translation.en: And when presenting your work, drop the bullet points.
translation.zh: 还有在用幻灯片演示你们的研究成果时，不要使用点句式。

translation.en: Have you ever wondered why they're called bullet points?   What do bullets do? Bullets kill,  and they will kill your presentation.
translation.zh: 你想过为什么点句式符号叫"子弹"点儿吗？ 子弹是干什么的？子弹能杀人， 也能灭了你的演示报告。

translation.en: A slide like this is not only boring, but it relies too much  on the language area of our brain, and causes us to become overwhelmed.
translation.zh: 像这样的幻灯片不仅仅乏味无聊，而且太过依赖 我们大脑的语言区，使我们不知所措。

translation.en: Instead, this example slide by Genevieve Brown is  much more effective. It's showing that the special structure  of trabeculae are so strong that they actually inspired the unique design of the Eiffel Tower.
translation.zh: 而这张由Genevieve Brown制作的示例幻灯片 效果就好多了。它向我们说明骨小梁的特殊结构 超级强大，甚至连埃菲尔铁塔的独特设计

translation.en: And the trick here is to use a single, readable sentence  that the audience can key into if they get a bit lost,  and then provide visuals which appeal to our other senses  and create a deeper sense of understanding  of what's being described.
translation.zh: 都受到了它的启发。 这里的窍门就是使用简单、易读的句子， 让观众即使有点儿不明白也能够掌握要点， 然后接下来提供一些能够刺激我们感官的图像， 并且能让我们对所描述的内容 有更深层次的理解。

translation.en: So I think these are just a few keys that can help  the rest of us to open that door and see the wonderland  that is science and engineering.
translation.zh: 以上这些就是我觉得能够帮助 我们大家打开那扇大门的钥匙，感受科学与工程学 仙境的好方法。

translation.en: And because the engineers that I've worked with have  taught me to become really in touch with my inner nerd,  I want to summarize with an equation.   Take your science, subtract your bullet points  and your jargon, divide by relevance,  meaning share what's relevant to the audience,  and multiply it by the passion that you have for  this incredible work that you're doing,  and that is going to equal incredible interactions
translation.zh: 那么因为与我共事过的工程师们教会我 接触我内心存在的学术狂人， 我想用一个方程式来总结一下我的观点。 用你们研究的科学，减去你们的点句式 和术语，除以相关内容， 就是要分享和观众有关的内容， 再乘以你对自己正在从事的 这份神奇工作的激情， 它就会等于：具备充分理解的、

translation.en: that are full of understanding.
translation.zh: 效果惊人的互动交流。

translation.en: And so, scientists and engineers, when you've solved  this equation, by all means, talk nerdy to me.   Thank you.
translation.zh: 因此，科学家和工程师们，当你们解决了 这个方程式以后，就想尽一切办法，跟我说说高科技吧。 谢谢。

translation.en: One of my favorite words in the whole of  the Oxford English Dictionary is "snollygoster."
translation.zh: 我很喜欢的词之一 在整个牛津英语词典里叫“snollygoster”。

translation.en: Just because it sounds so good.
translation.zh: 不仅因为它听起来很不错。

translation.en: And what snollygoster means is  "a dishonest politician."
translation.zh: 而且它的意思是 “一个诡诈的政客”。

translation.en: Although there was a 19th-century  newspaper editor who defined it rather better when he said,  "A snollygoster is a fellow who seeks office  regardless of party, platform or principle,  and who, when he wins,  gets there by the sheer force  of monumental talknophical assumnancy."
translation.zh: 尽管这只是一个19世纪的 报纸编辑给出的一个很好的定义，他的原话： “‘snollygoster’是一个这样的家伙，他会为了谋求高位 而不在乎任何政党、任何舞台或任何原则， 他会用其三寸不烂之舌 口若悬河而赢得高位。”

translation.en: Now I have no idea what "talknophical" is.
translation.zh: 我一点儿也不明白“talknophical”是什么意思。

translation.en: Something to do with words, I assume.
translation.zh: 大概是和言语词汇相关的词汇，我假设。

translation.en: But it's very important that words are at the center of politics,  and all politicians know they have to try and control language.
translation.zh: 但是言语词汇对于政治中心之作用是非常重要的， 并且所有的政客都明白他们必须尝试着控制他们的话语言论。

translation.en: It wasn't until, for example, 1771  that the British Parliament allowed newspapers to report  the exact words that were said in the debating chamber.
translation.zh: 举例来说，一直到1771年， 英国议会才允许新闻报纸报道 在辩论会上政客们说的真实话语。

translation.en: And this was actually all down to the bravery  of a guy with the extraordinary name of Brass Crosby,  who took on Parliament.
translation.zh: 而且实际上这全是因为一个勇敢的人， 这个伟大的名字叫布艾斯·克若斯比 ， 在议会上提议。

translation.en: And he was thrown into the Tower of London  and imprisoned,  but he was brave enough,  he was brave enough to take them on,  and in the end he had such popular support in London that he won.
translation.zh: 他被丢到了伦敦塔里 遭到囚禁， 但是他还是很勇敢 拥有足够的勇气在议会上提议， 并且到最后他在伦敦拥有众多的支持声音而赢得了胜利。

translation.en: And it was only a few years later  that we have the first recorded use of the phrase  "as bold as brass."
translation.zh: 而且仅仅几年后 我们有了第一次记录使用短语 “as bold as brass” （意译：敢作敢为）

translation.en: Most people think that's down to the metal.
translation.zh: 很多人认为这个短语出自于金属什么的。

translation.en: It's not. It's down to a campaigner  for the freedom of the press.
translation.zh: 不是的，它是出自于 一个新闻自由卫士。

translation.en: But to really show you how  words and politics interact,  I want to take you back to the United States of America,  just after they'd achieved independence.
translation.zh: 不过为了真实的表明 词汇和政治怎样互相影响， 我想带你回到过去的美国， 在它刚刚宣布独立的时候。

translation.en: And they had to face the question  of what to call George Washington, their leader.
translation.zh: 那时他们有一个问题要面对 就是怎样称号乔治·华盛顿, 他们的领袖。

translation.en: They didn't know.
translation.zh: 他们不知道，

translation.en: What do you call the leader of a republican country?
translation.zh: 应该尊称一个共和国的领袖为什么？

translation.en: And this was debated in Congress for ages and ages.
translation.zh: 就这个问题在国会上争论了很久很久。

translation.en: And there were all sorts of suggestions on the table,  which might have made it.
translation.zh: 并且产生了很多建议， 这些建议貌似可行。

translation.en: I mean, some people wanted him to be called  Chief Magistrate Washington,  and other people, His Highness George Washington,  and other people, Protector of the Liberties of the People of the United States of America Washington.
translation.zh: 我的意思是，一些人想叫他为 首席行政官华盛顿， 而另一些人称他为乔治·华盛顿殿下， 还有人叫他美利坚联合政府自由解放的保卫者华盛顿。

translation.en: Not that catchy.
translation.zh: 没有一个朗朗上口的名字。

translation.en: Some people just wanted to call him King.
translation.zh: 一些人只是想叫他国王。

translation.en: They thought it was tried and tested.
translation.zh: 他们认为是个称号是过去用过并经过考验的。

translation.en: And they weren't even being monarchical there,  they had the idea that you could be elected King  for a fixed term.
translation.zh: 他们甚至并没有延续君主制， 他们的主意是你可以是选举的国王 有一个固定的任期。

translation.en: And, you know, it could have worked.
translation.zh: 你知道的，这样大概会可行。

translation.en: And everybody got insanely bored, actually,  because this debate went on for three weeks.
translation.zh: 而且每一个人都感到神经错乱似地厌烦了，事实上， 因为这场辩论持续了3个礼拜。

translation.en: I read a diary of this poor senator,  who just keeps coming back, "Still on this subject."
translation.zh: 我读过一个当时可怜议员的日记， 里面持续的记录着，“竟然又是这个议题。”

translation.en: And the reason for the delay and the boredom was that  the House of Representatives were against the Senate.
translation.zh: 而致使延期和厌倦的原因是 众议院对战参议院。

translation.en: The House of Representatives didn't want Washington  to get drunk on power.
translation.zh: 众议院不想让华盛顿 沉醉于权力。

translation.en: They didn't want to call him King  in case that gave him ideas, or his successor ideas.
translation.zh: 他们不想称他为国王 以防万一他或他的继任者会产生什么想法。

translation.en: So they wanted to give him the humblest, meagerest,  most pathetic title that they could think of.
translation.zh: 所以他们给他一个他们能够想到的，最低微的、最微不足道的、 最为可悲的头衔。

translation.en: And that title was "President."
translation.zh: 而这个头衔叫“President”。

translation.en: President. They didn't invent the title. I mean, it existed before,  but it just meant somebody who presides over a meeting.
translation.zh: President （会议主持，总统）。他们没有创造这个头衔。我的意思是，这个头衔以前就有， 但是它是指一个会议的主持人。

translation.en: It was like the foreman of the jury.
translation.zh: 同陪审团主席的意思相似。

translation.en: And it didn't have much more grandeur  than the term "foreman" or "overseer."
translation.zh: 并且它一点也不显得非常极其地位显赫 比起“foreman”和“overseer”来。

translation.en: There were occasional presidents of little colonial councils  and bits of government, but it was really a nothing title.
