translation.zh: 我们的儿子需要能够适应这些改变， 适应相互之间的新关系， 我认为我们需要身先士卒,展示如何成为 一个真正的男人， 他会信任他的姐妹 尊重她们，希望与她们为伍， 对抗真正的坏蛋， 那些虐待妇女的大坏蛋。

translation.en: And I think our job in the Netflix queue  is to look out for those movies that pass the Bechdel Test,  if we can find them, and to seek out the heroines  who are there,  who show real courage, who bring people together,  and to nudge our sons to identify with those heroines  and to say, "I want to be on their team,"  because they're going to be on their team.
translation.zh: 而且我认为我们需要在 Netflix Queue 中 寻找符合贝尔德尔测试的电影， 找到之后，再找出电影中的 女英雄们, 她们英勇无比，把大家团结起来， 并且鼓励我们的儿子认识到这些女主人公的英勇 并且说：“我想加入她的队伍。” 因为他们将来需要与她们合作。

translation.en: When I asked my daughter who her favorite character was in "Star Wars,"  do you know what she said?
translation.zh: 当我问我的女儿最喜欢《星球大战》中的哪个角色， 你猜她说谁？

translation.en: Obi-Wan Kenobi and Glinda.
translation.zh: 欧比-旺 欧比-旺·克诺比和葛琳达

translation.en: What do these two have in common?
translation.zh: 他们有什么共同点？

translation.en: Maybe it's not just the sparkly dress.
translation.zh: 或许跟漂亮的衣服没有关系。

translation.en: I think these people are experts.
translation.zh: 我认为他们都是专家。

translation.en: I think these are the two people in the movie  who know more than anybody else,  and they love sharing their knowledge with other people  to help them reach their potential.
translation.zh: 两个人在各自的电影中 都拥有比别人更多的知识， 并且乐意与他人分享他们的知识 帮助他人挖掘潜能。

translation.en: Now, they are leaders.
translation.zh: 现在，他们是领袖。

translation.en: I like that kind of quest for my daughter,  and I like that kind of quest for my son.
translation.zh: 我希望自己的女儿有这样的追求， 也希望自己的儿子有这样的追求。

translation.en: I want more quests like that.
translation.zh: 我希望这样的追求越多越好。

translation.en: I want fewer quests where my son is told,  "Go out and fight it alone,"  and more quests where he sees that it's his job to join a team,  maybe a team led by women,  to help other people become better  and be better people,  like the Wizard of Oz.
translation.zh: 我希望我的儿子不要被教育成 “冲出去一个人战斗” 而是主动的融入一个团队， 或许由一个女性来指挥， 帮助其他人成就自己， 变得更好， 就像奥兹仙女一样。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: When I was a child growing up in Maine,  one of my favorite things to do  was to look for sand dollars on the seashores of Maine,  because my parents told me it would bring me luck.
translation.zh: 当我在缅因州长大的时候， 一件我最喜欢做的事 是在海滩上找沙钱。 因为大人说沙钱会带来好运。

translation.en: But you know, these shells, they're hard to find.
translation.zh: 但其实这些贝壳不好找，

translation.en: They're covered in sand, they're difficult to see.
translation.zh: 因为沙子会盖在上面，几乎看不到。

translation.en: However, over time, I got used to looking for them.
translation.zh: 但是过了一段时间，我就找到诀窍了。

translation.en: I started seeing shapes  and patterns that helped me to collect them.
translation.zh: 我开始习惯 沙钱的形状以及规律

translation.en: This grew into a passion for finding things,  a love for the past and archaeology.
translation.zh: 之后我养成了一股找东西的热情， 一股对古物和考古学的热爱。

translation.en: And eventually, when I started studying Egyptology,  I realized that seeing with my naked eyes alone wasn't enough.
translation.zh: 后来当我开始研究埃及的时候， 我意识到光用肉眼去看是不够的。

translation.en: Because all of the sudden, in Egypt,  my beach had grown from a tiny beach in Maine  to one eight hundred miles long,  next to the Nile.
translation.zh: 因为在埃及，忽然间 我的沙滩，从一片缅因的小海滩 变成了800公里长，紧邻尼罗河的沙滩。 而我的沙钱

translation.en: And my sand dollars had grown to the size of cities.
translation.zh: 也变得跟城市一样大。

translation.en: This is really what brought me to using satellite imagery.
translation.zh: 这是我启用卫星照片的原因。

translation.en: For trying to map the past, I knew that I had to see differently.
translation.zh: 为了画出过去的地图，我必须从另一个角度去观察。

translation.en: So I want to show you an example of how we see differently  using the infrared.
translation.zh: 让我来给你们一个例子，如何运用红外线 来从另一个角度观察。

translation.en: This is a site located in the eastern Egyptian delta  called Mendes.
translation.zh: 这个遗址坐落在埃及三角洲东部， 名叫班迪克斯。

translation.en: And the site visibly appears brown,  but when we use the infrared  and we process it, all of the sudden, using false color,  the site appears as bright pink.
translation.zh: 从肉眼看来，遗址看起来是褐色的。 但当我们用红外线时， 经过假色处理，忽然间， 遗址反映出亮粉色。

translation.en: What you are seeing  are the actual chemical changes to the landscape  caused by the building materials and activities of the ancient Egyptians.
translation.zh: 你看到的其实是 古埃及人的建筑施工的材料 对地面产生的化学影响。

translation.en: What I want to share with you today  is how we've used satellite data  to find an ancient Egyptian city,  called Itjtawy, missing for thousands of years.
translation.zh: 我今天想和你们分享的是 我们是如何用卫星数据 来找到一座已经失踪了数千年之久的 埃及古城： “伊其塔维”。

translation.en: Itjtawy was ancient Egypt's capital  for over four hundred years,  at a period of time called the Middle Kingdom,  about four thousand years ago.
translation.zh: 伊其塔维曾经是古埃及的首都， 历时400年， 当时古埃及处于中王国时期， 大约4000年前。

translation.en: The site is located in the Faiyum of Egypt,  and the site is really important, because in the Middle Kingdom there was this great renaissance  for ancient Egyptian art, architecture and religion.
translation.zh: 遗址坐落在如今埃及的法尤姆。 这座遗址非常珍贵，因为在中王国时期 是一个古埃及艺术，建筑，宗教的复兴时期

translation.en: Egyptologists have always known the site of Itjtawy  was located somewhere near the pyramids of the two kings who built it,  indicated within the red circles here,  but somewhere within this massive flood plain.
translation.zh: 埃及学家很早就知道伊其塔维的大概位置， 在两位开城国王的金字塔附近， 也就是用红圈的区域， 在这片广阔的泛洪区的某处。

translation.en: This area is huge --  it's four miles by three miles in size.
translation.zh: 这篇区域非常广阔， 四公里长，三公里宽。

translation.en: The Nile used to flow right next to the city of Itjtawy,  and as it shifted and changed and moved over time to the east,  it covered over the city.
translation.zh: 尼罗河曾经在“伊其塔维”古城周围流过 随着河道变化，河流渐渐的向东移动 最终覆盖了这座城市。

translation.en: So, how do you find a buried city  in a vast landscape?
translation.zh: 所以，如何在那么大的范围里 寻找一座被埋没的城市？

translation.en: Finding it randomly would be the equivalent  of locating a needle in a haystack,  blindfolded, wearing baseball mitts.
translation.zh: 随機的去尋找这座城市 就好像在海底捞针的同时， 还蒙着眼，带着棒球手套。

translation.en: So what we did is we used NASA topography data  to map out the landscape, very subtle changes.
translation.zh: 所以，我们用NASA的地形数据 来精确的画出地形图。

translation.en: We started to be able to see where the Nile used to flow.
translation.zh: 然后看出尼罗河过去流经哪里。

translation.en: But you can see in more detail, and even more interesting,  this very slight raised area seen within the circle up here  which we thought could possibly be the location of the city of Itjtawy.
translation.zh: 但你可以看到更多细节——更有意思的是 这一小片略微隆起的区域 就在这个圈内，是我们认为伊其塔维古城可能的位置

translation.en: So we collaborated with Egyptian scientists  to do coring work, which you see here.
translation.zh: 所以我们和埃及的科学家合作 一起完成了取芯的工作，也就是你现在看到的

translation.en: When I say coring, it's like ice coring,  but instead of layers of climate change, you're looking for layers of human occupation.
translation.zh: 我指的取芯工作，有点象是冰层取芯， 但我们寻找的是有人类的痕迹的地层，而不是气候变化的痕迹。

translation.en: And, five meters down,  underneath a thick layer of mud,  we found a dense layer of pottery.
translation.zh: 5米朝下， 在一层厚厚的泥浆下， 我们发现了包含大量陶器的地层。

translation.en: What this shows is that at this possible location of Itjtawy,  five meters down,  we have a layer of occupation for several hundred years,  dating to the Middle Kingdom, dating to the exact period of time we think Itjtawy is.
translation.zh: 这说明，在这个可能的位置 5米朝下 是一层有几百年历史的地层， 其历史可以追溯到中王国时期，正好是我们认为伊其塔维存在的时期。

translation.en: We also found work stone --  carnelian, quartz and agate  that shows that there was a jeweler's workshop here.
translation.zh: 我们还找到了石料—— 各种玛瑙，水晶，显示出 这里曾经有一个珠宝作坊。

translation.en: These might not look like much,  but when you think about the most common stones  used in jewelry from the Middle Kingdom,  these are the stones that were used.
translation.zh: 这些可能看起来很普通， 但比较一下中王国时期 珠宝最常用的石料， 这就是那些最常见的石料。

translation.en: So, we have a dense layer of occupation  dating to the Middle Kingdom at this site.
translation.zh: 所以我们在这里找到了一层人类居住过的痕迹， 一直追溯到中王国时期。

translation.en: We also have evidence of an elite jeweler's workshop,  showing that whatever was there was a very important city.
translation.zh: 我们同样有一座名贵珠宝作坊的证据， 显示不论如何，这是一座非常重要的城市。

translation.en: No Itjtawy was here yet,  but we're going to be returning to the site  in the near future to map it out.
translation.zh: 这里还不一定是伊其塔维， 但我们在不遠的未來就会回到这片遗址 去进行绘图。

translation.en: And even more importantly,  we have funding to train young Egyptians in the use of satellite technology  so they can be the ones making great discoveries as well.
translation.zh: 更重要的是， 我们筹资训练年轻的埃及人 使用卫星技术， 这样他们自己也能够做出这些重要发现了。

translation.en: So I wanted to end with my favorite quote from the Middle Kingdom --  it was probably written at the city of Itjtawy four thousand years ago.
translation.zh: 所以我想用中王国时期，我最喜欢的引述 来作为结尾—— 这句话很可能在4000年前，在伊其塔维写下的

translation.en: "Sharing knowledge is the greatest of all callings.
translation.zh: “分享知识是最伟大的使命。

translation.en: There's nothing like it in the land."
translation.zh: 世间没有其他事可以相提并论。”

translation.en: So as it turns out, TED was not founded in 1984 AD.
translation.zh: 结果你发觉，TED并不是公元1984年建立的。

translation.en: Making ideas actually started in 1984 BC  at a not-lost-for-long city, found from above.
translation.zh: 这个想法其实是从公元前1984年， 从一座“失落了没多久”，又这样被找到的古城开始的。

translation.en: It certainly puts finding seashells by the seashore in perspective.
translation.zh: 这也让人们对找贝壳这事有了新的理解。

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: I'd like to invite you to close your eyes.
translation.zh: 请大家跟我一起闭上眼睛

translation.en: Imagine yourself standing outside the front door of your home.
translation.zh: 想象一下 你站在 自己家门口的外面

translation.en: I'd like you to notice the color of the door,  the material that it's made out of.
translation.zh: 请留心一下门的颜色 以及门的材质

translation.en: Now visualize a pack of overweight nudists on bicycles.
translation.zh: 现在请想象一群超重的裸骑者

translation.en: They are competing in a naked bicycle race,  and they are headed straight for your front door.
translation.zh: 正在进行一场裸体自行车赛 向你的前门直冲而来

translation.en: I need you to actually see this.
translation.zh: 尽量让画面想象得栩栩如生近在眼前

translation.en: They are pedaling really hard, they're sweaty,  they're bouncing around a lot.
translation.zh: 他们都在奋力地踩脚踏板 汗流浃背 路面非常颠簸

translation.en: And they crash straight into the front door of your home.
translation.zh: 然后径直撞进了你家前门

translation.en: Bicycles fly everywhere, wheels roll past you,  spokes end up in awkward places.
translation.zh: 自行车四下飞散 车轮从你身旁滚过 辐条扎进了各种尴尬角落

translation.en: Step over the threshold of your door into your foyer, your hallway,  and appreciate the quality of the light.
translation.zh: 跨过门槛 进到门厅 走廊 和门里的其他地方 室内光线柔和舒适

translation.en: The light is shining down on Cookie Monster.
translation.zh: 光线洒在甜饼怪物身上

translation.en: Cookie Monster is waving at you from his perch on top of a tan horse.
translation.zh: 他坐在一匹棕色骏马的马背上 正向你招手

translation.en: It's a talking horse.
translation.zh: 这匹马会说话

translation.en: You can practically feel his blue fur tickling your nose.
translation.zh: 你可以感觉到他的蓝色鬃毛让你鼻子发痒

translation.en: You can smell the oatmeal raisin cookie that he's about to shovel into his mouth.
translation.zh: 你可以闻到他正要扔进嘴里的葡萄燕麦曲奇的香气

translation.en: Walk past him into your living room.
translation.zh: 绕过他 绕过他走进客厅

translation.en: In your living room, in full imaginative broadband,  picture Britney Spears.
translation.zh: 站在客厅里 把你的想象力调到最大档 想象小甜甜布兰妮

translation.en: She is scantily clad, she's dancing on your coffee table,  and she's singing "Hit Me Baby One More Time."
translation.zh: 她衣着暴露 在你咖啡桌上跳舞 并唱着"Hit Me Baby One More Time"

translation.en: And then, follow me into your kitchen.
translation.zh: 接下来 跟着我走进你的厨房

translation.en: In your kitchen, the floor has been paved over with a yellow brick road,  and out of your oven are coming towards you Dorothy, the Tin Man,  the Scarecrow and the Lion from "The Wizard of Oz,"  hand-in-hand, skipping straight towards you.
translation.zh: 厨房的地面被一道黄砖路覆盖 依次钻出你的烤箱向你走来的是 《绿野仙踪》里的多萝西 铁皮人 稻草人 和狮子 他们手挽着手 蹦蹦跳跳地向你走来

translation.en: Okay. Open your eyes.
translation.zh: 好了 睁开眼睛吧

translation.en: I want to tell you about a very bizarre contest that is held every spring in New York City.
translation.zh: 我要给你们讲一个每年春天在纽约

translation.en: It's called the United States Memory Championship.
translation.zh: 都会举办的奇异竞赛 叫做全美记忆冠军赛

translation.en: And I had gone to cover this contest a few years back as a science journalist,  expecting, I guess, that this was going to be like the Superbowl of savants.
translation.zh: 几年前我作为一名科技类记者 去报道这项竞赛 心里想着 大概那儿得像 怪才的"超级碗冠军赛"一样热闹吧

translation.en: This was a bunch of guys and a few ladies,  widely varying in both age and hygienic upkeep.
translation.zh: 一大堆男人和屈指可数的女性 从小孩儿到老人 有些还不怎么注意个人卫生

translation.en: They were memorizing hundreds of random numbers,  They were memorizing the names of dozens and dozens and dozens of strangers.
translation.zh: 有的奋力在只看一次的情况下 记下上百个任意列出的数字 有的在努力记住成群的陌生人的名字

translation.en: They were memorizing entire poems in just a few minutes.
translation.zh: 有的想在几分钟内努力背下整篇诗歌

translation.en: They were competing to see who could memorize  the order of a shuffled pack of playing cards the fastest.
translation.zh: 还有的在比赛谁能以最快速度 记下一整副打乱的牌的顺序

translation.en: I was like, this is unbelievable.
translation.zh: 我当时觉得 这太不可思议了

translation.en: These people must be freaks of nature.
translation.zh: 这些人肯定天赋异禀

translation.en: And I started talking to a few of the competitors.
translation.zh: 所以我开始采访参赛者

translation.en: This is a guy called Ed Cook, who had come over from England,  where he had one of the best-trained memories.
translation.zh: 这位叫Ed Cook 是从英格兰来的 他在那儿接受了最好的记忆训练

translation.en: And I said to him, "Ed, when did you realize  that you were a savant?"
translation.zh: 我问他 "Ed 你是什么时候开始意识到 自己是记忆天才的?"

translation.en: And Ed was like, "I'm not a savant.
translation.zh: Ed答道 “我并不是什么专家

translation.en: In fact, I have just an average memory.
translation.zh: 其实 我的记忆力很一般

translation.en: Everybody who competes in this contest will tell you  that they have just an average memory.
translation.zh: 来参赛的每一个人 都会告诉你他们的记忆力只是一般水平

translation.en: We've all trained ourselves to perform these utterly miraculous feats of memory  using a set of ancient techniques,  techniques invented 2,500 years ago in Greece,  the same techniques that Cicero had used to memorize his speeches,  that medieval scholars had used to memorize entire books."
translation.zh: 我们都在训练自己后才能 完成这些奇迹般的记忆游戏 我们运用了一系列古老的技巧 这些技巧是希腊人在两千五百年前发明的 西塞罗正是用了这些技巧 来记忆他的演讲稿的 中世纪学者用这种技巧来背诵正本书籍的内容"

translation.en: And I said, "Whoa. How come I never heard of this before?"
translation.zh: 我惊讶不已 "哇噻 怎么我从来没听说过呢?"

translation.en: And we were standing outside the competition hall,  and Ed, who is a wonderful, brilliant, but somewhat eccentric English guy,  says to me, "Josh, you're an American journalist.
translation.zh: 我们站在竞技大厅外 聪明过人 令人惊叹 而又稍有些古怪的英国人Ed 对我说 "Josh 你是个美国记者

translation.en: Do you know Britney Spears?"
translation.zh: 你知道小甜甜布兰妮吧?”

translation.en: I'm like, "What? No. Why?"
translation.zh: 我茫然不解 "什么? 当然 为什么要问这个?"

translation.en: "Because I really want to teach Britney Spears  how to memorize the order of a shuffled pack of playing cards  It will prove to the world that anybody can do this."
translation.zh: “因为我真的很想在 美国国家电台上教会布兰妮 怎样记住一整副打乱的牌的顺序 就能证明这是人人都可以做到的了"

translation.en: I was like, "Well, I'm not Britney Spears,  but maybe you could teach me.
translation.zh: 我说 "虽然我不是布兰妮 但你也可以教教我呀

translation.en: I mean, you've got to start somewhere, right?"
translation.zh: 总得找个人开教嘛 不是吗?"

translation.en: And that was the beginning of a very strange journey for me.
translation.zh: 接着 一段非常奇特的历程在我面前展开了序幕

translation.en: I ended up spending the better part of the next year  not only training my memory,  but also investigating it,  trying to understand how it works,  why it sometimes doesn't work,  and what its potential might be.
translation.zh: 结果 第二年的大部分时间 我都花在了训练自己的记忆力 同时调查研究记忆上 我想尝试理解产生记忆的原理 为何有时会记了又忘 及其它到底隐藏着什么样的潜力

translation.en: And I met a host of really interesting people.
translation.zh: 途中我遇到了很多有趣的人

translation.en: This is a guy called E.P.
translation.zh: 其中一个叫E.P.

translation.en: He's an amnesic who had, very possibly,  the worst memory in the world.
translation.zh: 他患有健忘症 他的记忆力 恐怕是世界上最差的了

translation.en: His memory was so bad,  that he didn't even remember he had a memory problem,  which is amazing.
translation.zh: 他的记忆能力差到 甚至记不得自己有健忘症 真的很神奇

translation.en: And he was this incredibly tragic figure,  but he was a window into the extent to which our memories make us who we are.
translation.zh: 虽然他是个悲剧角色 但通过他 我们能了解到 记忆在何种程度上塑造了我们的人格

translation.en: At the other end of the spectrum, I met this guy.
translation.zh: 情况的另一个极端是 我遇到了这样一个人

translation.en: This is Kim Peek, he was the basis for Dustin Hoffman's character  in the movie "Rain Man."
translation.zh: 他叫Kim Peek 他是Dustin Hoffman在电影《雨人》里的角色的原型

translation.en: We spent an afternoon together in the Salt Lake City Public Library  which was scintillating.
translation.zh: 我和他花了一下午 在盐湖城公共图书馆里背电话簿 让我大开眼界

translation.en: And I went back and I read a whole host of memory treatises,  treatises written 2,000-plus years ago in Latin,  in antiquity, and then later, in the Middle Ages.
translation.zh: 回家后 我读了许多关于记忆的论文 写于两千多年前的论文 用拉丁文写的 从古代 一直到后来中世纪期间

translation.en: And I learned a whole bunch of really interesting stuff.
translation.zh: 我学到很多很有意思的事儿

translation.en: One of the really interesting things that I learned  is that once upon a time,  this idea of having a trained, disciplined, cultivated memory  was not nearly so alien as it would seem to us to be today.
translation.zh: 其中一个就是 曾经 训练 规束 培养记忆力的这种概念 完全不像如今那样陌生

translation.en: Once upon a time, people invested in their memories,  in laboriously furnishing their minds.
translation.zh: 曾几何时 人们寄希望于自己的记忆 能不遗余力地装饰自己的心灵

translation.en: Over the last few millenia,  we've invented a series of technologies --  from the alphabet, to the scroll,  to the codex, the printing press, photography,  the computer, the smartphone --  that have made it progressively easier and easier  for us to externalize our memories,  for us to essentially outsource this fundamental human capacity.
translation.zh: 近几千年来 人类发明了一系列技术 从字母表到卷轴 到法典 印刷机 摄影技术 电脑 智能手机 让我们能越来越轻松地 外化记忆能力 让我们从根本上 把这种基础的人类能力拱手让出

translation.en: These technologies have made our modern world possible,  but they've also changed us.
translation.zh: 这些技术让现代生活变为可能 但同时也改变了我们

translation.en: They've changed us culturally,  and I would argue that they've changed us cognitively.
translation.zh: 不仅在文化上 我觉得也在认知上

translation.en: Having little need to remember anymore,  it sometimes seems like we've forgotten how.
translation.zh: 不再需要费劲去记忆 有时会觉得我们已经忘了如何去记忆

translation.en: One of the last places on Earth where you still find  people passionate about this idea of a trained, disciplined, cultivated memory,  is at this totally singular memory contest.
translation.zh: 在这片地球上已经很少有地方 能让你觉得人们仍热衷于 训练 规束 培养记忆力了 那非同寻常的记忆大赛算是一个

translation.en: It's actually not that singular,  there are contests held all over the world.
translation.zh: 其实它也没有那么非同寻常 世界各地都开始举办这样的竞赛

translation.en: And I was fascinated, I wanted to know how do these guys do it.
translation.zh: 我对此深深着迷 想要知道这些人是怎么做到的

translation.en: A few years back a group of researchers at University College London  brought a bunch of memory champions into the lab.
translation.zh: 几年前 伦敦大学学院的一组研究人员 请来一批记忆大赛的冠军接受研究

translation.en: They wanted to know:  Do these guys have brains that are somehow structurally,  anatomically different from the rest of ours?
translation.zh: 他们想要弄明白 这些人的大脑 是否跟我们其他人在解剖学上的结构不一样?

translation.en: The answer was no.
translation.zh: 答案是否定的

translation.en: Are they smarter than the rest of us?
translation.zh: 那他们比我们都聪明吗?

translation.en: They gave them a bunch of cognitive tests, and the answer was: not really.
translation.zh: 他们给研究对象实施了一系列认知测试 依旧得出了否定结论

translation.en: There was, however, one really interesting and telling difference  between the brains of the memory champions  and the control subjects that they were comparing them to.
translation.zh: 但对比受控制的比对目标的大脑 记忆大赛冠军们的大脑 确实有一处很有趣的不同 很说明问题

translation.en: When they put these guys in an fMRI machine,  scanned their brains while they were memorizing numbers  and people's faces and pictures of snowflakes,  they found that the memory champions were lighting up different parts of the brain  than everyone else.
translation.zh: 这些人被送去做功能磁共振 扫描大脑时 当他们在记忆数字或人脸或雪花图案时 研究人员发现记忆大赛冠军们 的大脑激活的区域 跟普通人不太一样

translation.en: Of note, they were using, or they seemed to be using,  a part of the brain that's involved in spatial memory and navigation.
translation.zh: 值得注意的是 他们看来是在用 脑中在空间记忆和导航时会用到的部分

translation.en: Why? And is there something that the rest of us can learn from this?
translation.zh: 为什么? 我们可以从中得出什么样的结论呢?

translation.en: The sport of competitive memorizing is driven by a kind of arms race where,  every year, somebody comes up with a new way to remember more stuff more quickly,  and then the rest of the field has to play catch-up.
translation.zh: 竞争性记忆的较量 被一种类似军事比赛的方式推向了白热化 每年都会有人 带着更有效的记忆方法现身赛场 而其他人就必须迎头赶上

translation.en: This is my friend Ben Pridmore,  three-time world memory champion.
translation.zh: 这是我的朋友Ben Pridmore 赢得过三次国际记忆大赛冠军

translation.en: On his desk in front of him are 36 shuffled packs of playing cards  that he is about to try to memorize in one hour,  using a technique that he invented and he alone has mastered.
translation.zh: 在他的台前 有三十六副打乱顺序的牌 他要在一个小时内记下全部 用的是一种他自己发明的 也只有他会的技巧

translation.en: He used a similar technique  to memorize the precise order of 4,140 random binary digits  in half an hour.
translation.zh: 用与此类似的方法 他曾一字不差地背下了 4140个任意排列的二进制数 只用了半个小时

translation.en: Yeah.
translation.zh: 很牛吧

translation.en: And while there are a whole host of ways  of remembering stuff in these competitions,  everything, all of the techniques that are being used,  ultimately come down to a concept  that psychologists refer to as "elaborative encoding."
translation.zh: 参赛者在这些竞赛中 运用过很多不同的记忆方法 各式各样 被运用到的所有技巧 最终都能归化为一个概念 心理学家称之为"精细编码"

translation.en: And it's well-illustrated by a nifty paradox  known as the Baker/baker paradox, which goes like this:  If I tell two people to remember the same word,  if I say to you,  "Remember that there is a guy named Baker."
translation.zh: 这个概念能用一则幽默的悖论完美诠释 叫做Baker/baker悖论 简单说来就是 假设我让两个人去记同一个词 我跟你说 "记住有个人叫Baker"

translation.en: That's his name.
translation.zh: Baker是人名

translation.en: And I say to you, "Remember that there is a guy who is a baker."
translation.zh: 我又来告诉你 "记住有个人是面包师"

translation.en: And I come back to you at some point later on,  and I say, "Do you remember that word that I told you a while back?
translation.zh: 过了一段时间我又回来找到你们 问 "还记得我之前 叫你们记住的那个词吗?"

translation.en: Do you remember what it was?"
translation.zh: ”还记得是什么词吗?“

translation.en: The person who was told his name is Baker  is less likely to remember the same word  than the person was told his job is a baker.
translation.zh: 被告知人名是Baker的人 记住这个词的可能性远不如 被告知职业是面包师的那个人

translation.en: Same word, different amount of remembering; that's weird.
translation.zh: 同样的词 导致不同的记忆程度

translation.en: What's going on here?
translation.zh: 到底是为什么呢

translation.en: Well, the name Baker doesn't actually mean anything to you.
translation.zh: 是因为 人名Baker没有任何特殊含义 没法跟你脑海里

translation.en: It is entirely untethered from all of the other memories  floating around in your skull.
translation.zh: 零碎繁杂的记忆产生任何联系 但是面包师作为一个常用名词

translation.en: But the common noun "baker" -- we know bakers.
translation.zh: 我们都知道面包师是什么

translation.en: Bakers wear funny white hats.
translation.zh: 面包师带着搞笑的白帽子

translation.en: Bakers have flour on their hands.
translation.zh: 他们手上沾满了面粉

translation.en: Bakers smell good when they come home from work.
translation.zh: 他们下班回到家带着扑鼻的烤面包香

translation.en: Maybe we even know a baker.
translation.zh: 甚至可能有些人有朋友就是面包师

translation.en: And when we first hear that word,  we start putting these associational hooks into it,  that make it easier to fish it back out at some later date.
translation.zh: 我们初次听到这个词时 马上就会产生各种各样的联想 这使我们能在一段时间后还能回忆起来

translation.en: The entire art of what is going on in these memory contests,  and the entire art of remembering stuff better in everyday life,  is figuring out ways to transform capital B Bakers  into lower-case B bakers --  to take information that is lacking in context,  in significance, in meaning,  and transform it in some way,  so that it becomes meaningful in the light of all the other things  that you have in your mind.
translation.zh: 其实 要理解记忆竞赛中的 一切奥妙 或在日常生活中改善记忆力的秘诀 仅仅在于想办法把Baker中的大写B 变为面包师中的小写b 把没有前因后果 没有重要性 没有涵义的信息 用某种方法转化为 有意义的内容 跟脑海里的其他记忆串联起来

translation.en: One of the more elaborate techniques for doing this  dates back 2,500 years to Ancient Greece.
translation.zh: 这种精确记忆的技巧 在两千五百年前的古希腊就已出现

translation.en: It came to be known as the memory palace.
translation.zh: 后来将其称为记忆宫殿

translation.en: The story behind its creation goes like this:  There was a poet called Simonides, who was attending a banquet.
translation.zh: 发明这种技巧的过程如下 有个叫做Simonides的诗人 他要去参加一个晚宴

translation.en: He was actually the hired entertainment,  because back then, if you wanted to throw a really slamming party,  you didn't hire a D.J., you hired a poet.
translation.zh: 其实他算是被请去做表演嘉宾的 因为在那个年代 炫酷派对的标准 不是请D.J.来打碟 而是要请诗人来颂诗

translation.en: And he stands up, delivers his poem from memory, walks out the door,  and at the moment he does,  the banquet hall collapses. Kills everybody inside.
translation.zh: 他站起来 背出了他的全篇诗作 然后潇洒离去 他刚走出门口 晚宴大厅就塌了 砸死了里面所有的人

translation.en: It doesn't just kill everybody,  it mangles the bodies beyond all recognition.
translation.zh: 不仅全体死亡 所有的死者都被砸得面目全非

translation.en: Nobody can say who was inside,  nobody can say where they were sitting.
translation.zh: 没人说得清死者都有些谁 没人说得清谁坐在哪儿

translation.en: The bodies can't be properly buried.
translation.zh: 导致死者的尸体没法得到合适的殉葬安置

translation.en: It's one tragedy compounding another.
translation.zh: 这又加重了整件事的悲剧色彩

translation.en: Simonides, standing outside,  the sole survivor amid the wreckage,  closes his eyes and has this realization,  which is that in his mind's eye,  he can see where each of the guests at the banquet had been sitting.
translation.zh: Simonides站在外面 作为废墟中的唯一幸存者 闭上眼睛 猛然意识到 在他的脑海中 他眼前出现了所有宾客所坐的位置

translation.en: And he takes the relatives by the hand,  and guides them each to their loved ones amid the wreckage.
translation.zh: 他就牵着亲属们的手 穿过废墟 把他们带到了亲人身边

translation.en: What Simonides figured out at that moment,  is something that I think we all kind of intuitively know,  which is that, as bad as we are at remembering names and phone numbers,  and word-for-word instructions from our colleagues,  we have really exceptional visual and spatial memories.
translation.zh: Simonides当时猛然醒悟的事 大概我们大家也都猜到了 其实是 不管我们 有多不善于记住姓名 电话号码 或是同事的每句指令 我们都拥有异常敏锐的视觉或空间记忆能力

translation.en: If I asked you to recount the first 10 words of the story  that I just told you about Simonides,  chances are you would have a tough time with it.
translation.zh: 要是我让你们逐字逐句地重述 我刚才讲的Simonides故事的前十个字 应该没几个人会记得

translation.en: But, I would wager that if I asked you to recall  who is sitting on top of a talking tan horse  in your foyer right now,  you would be able to see that.
translation.zh: 但我敢打赌 如果我让你们现在回想下 在你的门厅里 坐在会讲话的棕色骏马上的 是谁 你们就明白我刚才说的意思了

translation.en: The idea behind the memory palace  is to create this imagined edifice in your mind's eye,  and populate it with images of the things that you want to remember --  the crazier, weirder, more bizarre,  funnier, raunchier, stinkier the image is,  the more unforgettable it's likely to be.
translation.zh: 记忆宫殿的原理 就是在你的脑海里建立一栋想象大厦 并让你想记住的东西 的影像充满其中 越是疯狂 古怪 奇诡 荒诞搞笑 乱七八糟 招人厌恶的影像 就越容易记住

translation.en: This is advice that goes back 2,000-plus years  to the earliest Latin memory treatises.
translation.zh: 这个建议来自于两千多年前 拉丁最早的记忆学者

translation.en: So how does this work?
translation.zh: 那么 这种说法的原理到底是什么呢

translation.en: Let's say that you've been invited to TED center stage to give a speech,  and you want to do it from memory,  and you want to do it the way that Cicero would have done it,  if he had been invited to TEDxRome 2,000 years ago.
translation.zh: 假设你被邀请 站上TED的中心讲台演讲 而你想脱稿完成 如西塞罗在两千年前在TEDx罗马上的演讲一般 他就会这么霸气走一回 而你也想这样

translation.en: What you might do  is picture yourself at the front door of your house.
translation.zh: 你要做的就是 想象自己站在自家门前

translation.en: And you'd come up with some sort of crazy, ridiculous, unforgettable image,  to remind you that the first thing you want to talk about  is this totally bizarre contest.
translation.zh: 然后凭空想象出 一段完全荒诞疯狂难忘的景象 用来提示你上台要提的第一件事 就是这场诡异的裸骑大赛

translation.en: And then you'd go inside your house,  and you would see an image of Cookie Monster on top of Mister Ed.
translation.zh: 然后你走进房子里 想到甜饼怪物 坐在Ed先生背上的样子

translation.en: And that would remind you  that you would want to then introduce your friend Ed Cook.
translation.zh: 这个景象会提醒你 要介绍你的朋友Ed Cook

translation.en: And then you'd see an image of Britney Spears  to remind you of this funny anecdote you want to tell.
translation.zh: 然后你脑海里出现了小甜甜布兰妮的样子 你就会想起要讲那个关于布兰妮的小故事

translation.en: And you'd go into your kitchen,  and the fourth topic you were going to talk about  was this strange journey that you went on for a year,  and you'd have some friends to help you remember that.
translation.zh: 然后你走进厨房 你要说到的第四个话题是 你花了一整年走过的奇妙历程 通过绿野仙踪就可以联想得到

translation.en: This is how Roman orators memorized their speeches --  not word-for-word, which is just going to screw you up,  but topic-for-topic.
translation.zh: 这就是罗马演说家背诵演讲稿的秘诀 并非一字不差 逐字背诵只会平添麻烦 而是记住一个个主题

translation.en: In fact, the phrase "topic sentence" --  that comes from the Greek word "topos,"  which means "place."
translation.zh: 其实 短语"主题句" 就来源于希腊词"topos" 意思是"地点"

translation.en: That's a vestige of when people used to think about oratory and rhetoric  in these sorts of spatial terms.
translation.zh: 这是古时候 人们谈到演讲或是修辞时 会用到的空间术语

translation.en: The phrase "in the first place,"  that's like "in the first place of your memory palace."
translation.zh: 短语 "第一" 就意味着你的记忆宫殿的第一层

translation.en: I thought this was just fascinating,  and I got really into it.
translation.zh: 这简直太有意思了 我对这起了很大的兴趣

translation.en: And I went to a few more of these memory contests,  and I had this notion that I might write something longer  about this subculture of competitive memorizers.
translation.zh: 后来我又去了更多记忆大赛 我开始萌发了要更详细描写 这种竞技记忆文化的念头

translation.en: But there was a problem.
translation.zh: 但有一个问题

translation.en: The problem was that a memory contest  is a pathologically boring event.
translation.zh: 问题是记忆大赛 其实过程很无聊的

translation.en: Truly, it is like a bunch of people sitting around taking the SATs --  I mean, the most dramatic it gets  is when somebody starts massaging their temples.
translation.zh: 真的 就像一群人坐那儿高考一样 最最激动人心的时刻 也不过就是有人揉了揉太阳穴

translation.en: And I'm a journalist, I need something to write about.
translation.zh: 我是个记者 总得有东西可写呀

translation.en: I know that there's incredible stuff happening in these people's minds,  but I don't have access to it.
translation.zh: 我知道这些人脑子里肯定是惊涛骇浪 但我作为外人无法得见

translation.en: And I realized, if I was going to tell this story,  I needed to walk in their shoes a little bit.
translation.zh: 我意识到 若我真的想报道这事儿 一定得亲身体验才行

translation.en: And so I started trying to spend 15 or 20 minutes every morning, before I sat down with my New York Times,  just trying to remember something.
translation.zh: 所以我开始尝试着每天早上坐下来看纽约时报前 花上十五到二十分钟 尝试记忆一些事

translation.en: Maybe it was a poem,  maybe it was names from an old yearbook that I bought at a flea market.
translation.zh: 背背小诗 背背我在跳蚤市场买来的 旧年鉴里的人名

translation.en: And I found that this was shockingly fun.
translation.zh: 我惊奇地发现这其实非常带劲

translation.en: I never would have expected that.
translation.zh: 要不去尝试根本想不到

translation.en: It was fun because this is actually not about training your memory.
translation.zh: 有趣在于 其实目标并不是要通过训练提高记忆力

translation.en: What you're doing, is you're trying to get better and better  at creating, at dreaming up,  these utterly ludicrous, raunchy, hilarious,  and hopefully unforgettable images in your mind's eye.
translation.zh: 而是你在努力培养改善 创造力 想象力 在你的脑海里凭空造出 那些完全滑稽荒诞胡乱 最好是难忘的影像

translation.en: And I got pretty into it.
translation.zh: 而它成为了我的乐趣

translation.en: This is me wearing my standard competitive memorizer's training kit.
translation.zh: 这是我戴着标准竞赛记忆者训练套装的样子

translation.en: It's a pair of earmuffs  and a set of safety goggles that have been masked over  except for two small pinholes,  because distraction is the competitive memorizer's greatest enemy.
translation.zh: 它有一对耳塞 一副护目镜 镜面全部遮黑 就留了两个小孔 因为竞技记忆者最大的敌人就是注意力分散

translation.en: I ended up coming back to that same contest  that I had covered a year earlier,  sort of as an experiment in participatory journalism.
translation.zh: 最后 我再次回到了一年前报道的那场竞赛场上 我一时冲动 也想报名参加 就当做参与性新闻报道的实验了

translation.en: It'd make, I thought, maybe a nice epilogue to all my research.
translation.zh: 我当时想 到时能在前言里调侃一下自己也好

translation.en: Problem was, the experiment went haywire.
translation.zh: 问题是 实验最后得到了意想不到的结果

translation.en: I won the contest --  which really wasn't supposed to happen.
translation.zh: 那场竞赛我赢了 真是完全出乎我预料之外

translation.en: Now, it is nice to be able to memorize speeches  and phone numbers and shopping lists,  but it's actually kind of beside the point.
translation.zh: 对我来说现在 背演讲稿 电话号码 或是购物单 都是小菜一碟 倒是很不错 但其实这些都不重要了

translation.en: These are just tricks.
translation.zh: 这些都是小伎俩

translation.en: They work because they're based on some pretty basic principles  about how our brains work.
translation.zh: 这些记忆伎俩之所以有效 是因为它们依仗人类大脑运转的 一些基本原理

translation.en: And you don't have to be building memory palaces  or memorizing packs of playing cards  to benefit from a little bit of insight about how your mind works.
translation.zh: 并不用真的去建立记忆宫殿 或记下几副牌的顺序 你也完全可以从了解大脑运转原理中 获得一些益处

translation.en: We often talk about people with great memories  as though it were some sort of an innate gift,  but that is not the case.
translation.zh: 我们总会议论记忆力很好的人 总觉得那些人是天赋异禀 事实并不是这样

translation.en: Great memories are learned.
translation.zh: 强大的记忆力是可以习得的

translation.en: At the most basic level, we remember when we pay attention.
translation.zh: 从最根本的说起 专心致志就能记住

translation.en: We remember when we are deeply engaged.
translation.zh: 全心投入时就能记住

translation.en: We remember when we are able to take a piece of information and experience,  and figure out why it is meaningful to us,  why it is significant, why it's colorful,  when we're able to transform it in some way that makes sense  in the light of all of the other things floating around in our minds,  when we're able to transform Bakers into bakers.
translation.zh: 只要能想办法把信息和经历 转化为有意义的事 就能记住 想它为何重要 为何多彩 当我们能把它转化成为 有前因后果的事 并跟我们脑海中繁杂琐碎的其他事产生联想时 当我们能把人名Baker转化为面包师baker时

translation.en: The memory palace, these memory techniques --  they're just shortcuts.
translation.zh: 记忆宫殿 或是那些记忆技巧 都只是捷径而已

translation.en: In fact, they're not even really shortcuts.
translation.zh: 其实 说到底它们都不能算捷径

translation.en: They work because they make you work.
translation.zh: 这方法有效是因为它迫使你思考

translation.en: They force a kind of depth of processing,  a kind of mindfulness,  that most of us don't normally walk around exercising.
translation.zh: 它迫使你往更深层次去想 让你更加专注 大部分人平时并不会费力去训练这个

translation.en: But there actually are no shortcuts.
translation.zh: 其实捷径并不存在

translation.en: This is how stuff is made memorable.
translation.zh: 这一直就是我们能记住事物的原因

translation.en: And I think if there's one thing that I want to leave you with,  it's what E.P., the amnesic who couldn't even remember he had a memory problem,  left me with,  which is the notion that our lives are the sum of our memories.
translation.zh: 有一件事我希望你们能记住 就是E.P. 那个连自己患了健忘症都想不起来的人 让我深思 得出了一个感想 人生就是我们个人记忆的合集

translation.en: from our already short lives,  by losing ourselves in our Blackberries, our iPhones,  by not paying attention to the human being across from us  who is talking with us,  by being so lazy that we're not willing to process deeply?
translation.zh: 在短暂的人生里 你还愿意因为黑莓 iPhone 丧失多少瞬间 忽略对面坐着的人 在跟我们交谈的人 变得越发懒惰 不愿意

translation.en: I learned firsthand  that there are incredible memory capacities  latent in all of us.
translation.zh: 深究任何事？ 通过亲身经历 我发现 我们的身体里潜藏着

translation.en: But if you want to live a memorable life,  you have to be the kind of person  who remembers to remember.
translation.zh: 不可思议的记忆能力 但若你想活得难忘 就得做那种 记得时常记忆的人

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: Today I'm going to speak to you  about the last 30 years of architectural history.
translation.zh: 今天我要跟大家讲述 过去30年的建筑史。

translation.en: That's a lot to pack into 18 minutes.
translation.zh: 太多东西要在这18分钟内讲述了。

translation.en: It's a complex topic,  so we're just going to dive right in at a complex place:  New Jersey.
translation.zh: 这是一个复杂的题目， 那就让我们从这个复杂的地方开始： 新泽西。

translation.en: Because 30 years ago, I'm from Jersey,  and I was six, and I lived there in my parents' house  in a town called Livingston,  and this was my childhood bedroom.
translation.zh: 三十年前，我住新泽西 那时我六岁，我住在父母家 小镇名叫Livingston， 这是我儿时的卧室。

translation.en: Around the corner from my bedroom  was the bathroom that I used to share with my sister.
translation.zh: 在我卧室的角落 是我和姐姐共用的洗手间。

translation.en: And in between my bedroom and the bathroom  was a balcony that overlooked the family room.
translation.zh: 在我的卧室和浴室之间 是一个可以看到客厅的阳台。

translation.en: And that's where everyone would hang out and watch TV,  so that every time that I walked from my bedroom to the bathroom,  everyone would see me,  and every time I took a shower and would come back in a towel,  everyone would see me.
translation.zh: 那是家人聚会，看电视的客厅， 每次我从卧室走去浴室的时候， 每个人都能看到我， 每次我洗完澡 裹着浴巾走回卧室， 每个人都能看到我，

translation.en: And I looked like this.
translation.zh: 我看起来是这样。

translation.en: I was awkward,  insecure, and I hated it.
translation.zh: 我很尴尬， 没有安全感，我讨厌我的房间。

translation.en: I hated that walk, I hated that balcony,  I hated that room, and I hated that house.
translation.zh: 我讨厌那段路，我讨厌那个阳台， 我讨厌那个房间，我讨厌那个房子。

translation.en: And that's architecture.
translation.zh: 那就是建筑。

translation.en: Done.
translation.zh: 就这样。

translation.en: That feeling, those emotions that I felt,  that's the power of architecture,  because architecture is not about math and it's not about zoning,  it's about those visceral, emotional connections  that we feel to the places that we occupy.
translation.zh: 那种感觉，那种情绪， 那就是建筑的力量， 因为建筑并不有关于数学 也不关乎分区规划， 建筑关乎本能， 以及我们对所占有空间的 情感连接。

translation.en: And it's no surprise that we feel that way,  because according to the EPA,  Americans spend 90 percent of their time indoors.
translation.zh: 也难怪我们有这样的感觉， 美国环境保护局的调查表明， 美国人90%的时间呆在室内。

translation.en: That's 90 percent of our time surrounded by architecture.
translation.zh: 也就是说，我们人生中 90%的时间被建筑物围绕着。

translation.en: That's huge.
translation.zh: 真的太久了。

translation.en: That means that architecture is shaping us in ways that we didn't even realize.
translation.zh: 建筑在我们不曾意识到的 多个方面形塑我们。

translation.en: That makes us a little bit gullible and very, very predictable.
translation.zh: 那让我们很容易受骗， 也非常，非常可以预测。

translation.en: It means that when I show you a building like this,  I know what you think:  You think "power" and "stability" and "democracy."
translation.zh: 当我将这个建筑展示给你的时候， 我知道你在想什么： 你想到“权力” 和 “稳定” 还有“民主”。

translation.en: And I know you think that because it's based on a building  that was build 2,500 years ago by the Greeks.
translation.zh: 我知道因为这个建筑 是希腊人于2500年前建造的。

translation.en: This is a trick.
translation.zh: 这是个骗局。

translation.en: This is a trigger that architects use  to get you to create an emotional connection  to the forms that we build our buildings out of.
translation.zh: 也就是说，建筑 能够让你创造出那些 我们想通过建筑物表达含义的 情感连结。

translation.en: It's a predictable emotional connection,  and we've been using this trick for a long, long time.
translation.zh: 这是个可预测的情感连结， 我们使用这个诡计 很多很多年了。

translation.en: We used it [200] years ago to build banks.
translation.zh: 我们用这个方法 [200] 年前 建造银行。

translation.en: We used it in the 19th century to build art museums.
translation.zh: 我们19世纪建造艺术博物馆。

translation.en: And in the 20th century in America,  we used it to build houses.
translation.zh: 在20世纪的美洲， 我们用它来建筑房屋。

translation.en: And look at these solid, stable little soldiers  facing the ocean and keeping away the elements.
translation.zh: 看着这些坚固的小士兵 面朝大海，挡住这些东西。

translation.en: This is really, really useful,  because building things is terrifying.
translation.zh: 这真的非常非常有效， 因为建造东西真的很麻烦。

translation.en: It's expensive, it takes a long time, and it's very complicated.
translation.zh: 非常昂贵，耗时，而且很麻烦。

translation.en: And the people that build things --  developers and governments --  they're naturally afraid of innovation,  and they'd rather just use those forms that they know you'll respond to.
translation.zh: 建筑房屋的人 ──发展商和政府── 他们天生就害怕创新， 他们宁可选用这些你已熟知的风格。

translation.en: That's how we end up with buildings like this.
translation.zh: 这就是为什么这样的建筑存在。

translation.en: This is a nice building.
translation.zh: 这是个漂亮的建筑物。

translation.en: This is the Livingston Public Library  that was completed in 2004 in my hometown,  and, you know, it's got a dome  and it's got this round thing and columns, red brick,  and you can kind of guess what Livingston is trying to say with this building:  children, property values and history.
translation.zh: 这是我家乡的Livingston公共图书馆 于2004年完工， 你知道的，它有圆形的屋顶 有这样的圆形设计和柱子，红色的砖， 你可以由此猜测出Livingston 想要通过这个建筑表达些什么： 儿童、财产价值和历史。

translation.en: But it doesn't have much to do with what a library actually does today.
translation.zh: 但这和现代图书馆的理念不大一样。

translation.en: That same year, in 2004, on the other side of the country,  another library was completed,  and it looks like this.
translation.zh: 同一年，2004年， 这个国家的另一端， 另一个图书馆完工了， 就是这样。

translation.en: It's in Seattle.
translation.zh: 在西雅图。

translation.en: This library is about how we consume media in a digital age.
translation.zh: 这个图书馆关于在数字时代 我们是如何消费媒体的。

translation.en: It's about a new kind of public amenity for the city,  a place to gather and read and share.
translation.zh: 这是城市的一个新型的公众设施， 一个可以聚会，读书和分享生活的地方。

translation.en: So how is it possible  that in the same year, in the same country,  two buildings, both called libraries,  look so completely different?
translation.zh: 怎么会这样呢 在同一年，同一个国家， 两个建筑物，都是图书馆， 却有着巨大的差别？

translation.en: And the answer is that architecture works on the principle of a pendulum.
translation.zh: 答案就是，建筑风格是摇摆不定的。

translation.en: On the one side is innovation,  and architects are constantly pushing, pushing for new technologies,  new typologies, new solutions for the way that we live today.
translation.zh: 一边是创新， 建筑不断被推进， 加入新的科技元素， 根据我们现代生活所需 新的类型，新的方案。

translation.en: And we push and we push and we push  until we completely alienate all of you.
translation.zh: 我们推进、推进、推进， 直到我们完全疏远了你们。

translation.en: We wear all black, we get very depressed,  you think we're adorable,  we're dead inside because we've got no choice.
translation.zh: 我们穿黑色，我们压力很大， 你认为我们很可爱， 而我们内心已死， 因为别无选择。

translation.en: We have to go to the other side  and reengage those symbols that we know you love.
translation.zh: 我们走向另一端 重新找回那些我们了解到 你们热爱的符号。

translation.en: So we do that, and you're happy,  we feel like sellouts,  so we start experimenting again  and we push the pendulum back and back and forth and back and forth  we've gone for the last 300 years,  and certainly for the last 30 years.
translation.zh: 我们这样做，你们很开心。 我们感受到客满演出， 于是又开始试验 我们将钟摆推来推去， 推来推去 过去的300年里我们这样做， 过去的30年也是如此。

translation.en: Okay, 30 years ago we were coming out of the '70s.
translation.zh: 好的，30年前 我们刚走过70年代。

translation.en: Architects had been busy experimenting with something called brutalism.
translation.zh: 建筑师们忙着试验某种叫做 粗野主义的艺术。

translation.en: It's about concrete.
translation.zh: 它是关于混凝土的艺术...

translation.en: You can guess this.
translation.zh: 你可以想到。

translation.en: Small windows, dehumanizing scale.
translation.zh: 小窗户，毫无人性的巨大规模。

translation.en: This is really tough stuff.
translation.zh: 这些都很艰难。

translation.en: So as we get closer to the '80s,  we start to reengage those symbols.
translation.zh: 然后我们快进入80年代了， 我们开始重拾某些符号。

translation.en: We push the pendulum back into the other direction.
translation.zh: 我们把钟摆推回到另一个方向。

translation.en: We take these forms that we know you love  and we update them.
translation.zh: 你们热爱这样的建筑形式， 我们就将它们改造升级。

translation.en: We add neon  and we add pastels  and we use new materials.
translation.zh: 我们加入霓虹 我们加入柔和的粉蜡色 我们使用新型材料。

translation.en: And you love it.
translation.zh: 人们爱死这样的建筑了。

translation.en: And we can't give you enough of it.
translation.zh: 我们不断地建造。

translation.en: We take Chippendale armoires  and we turned those into skyscrapers,  and skyscrapers can be medieval castles made out of glass.
translation.zh: 我们取材自齐本德尔式衣橱 将它们变成摩天大楼， 这些摩天大楼像是 用玻璃制造的中世纪古堡。

translation.en: Forms got big,  forms got bold and colorful.
translation.zh: 这些建筑变得更大， 设计更大胆，更色彩丰富。

translation.en: Dwarves became columns.
translation.zh: 小矮人式的柱子。

translation.en: Swans grew to the size of buildings.
translation.zh: 天鹅从建筑顶上长出来。

translation.en: It was crazy.
translation.zh: 太疯狂了。

translation.en: But it's the '80s, it's cool.
translation.zh: 这就是80年代，很酷。

translation.en: We're all hanging out in malls  and we're all moving to the suburbs,  and out there, out in the suburbs,  we can create our own architectural fantasies.
translation.zh: 我们在大型商场里游玩， 我们在郊区生活， 在那里，在郊区， 我们可以按自己的幻想 建筑房屋。

translation.en: And those fantasies,  they can be Mediterranean  or French  or Italian.
translation.zh: 这些奇思幻想 可以是地中海风情， 或是法式优雅， 或是意大利风格。

translation.en: Possibly with endless breadsticks.
translation.zh: 也许源源不绝供应面包条儿。

translation.en: This is the thing about postmodernism.
translation.zh: 这就是后现代。

translation.en: This is the thing about symbols.
translation.zh: 这就是符号的意义。

translation.en: They're easy, they're cheap,  because instead of making places,  we're making memories of places.
translation.zh: 简单、便宜， 我们不是建造住所， 而是建造记忆中的住所。

translation.en: Because I know, and I know all of you know,  this isn't Tuscany.
translation.zh: 因为我知道， 我想各位也都知道， 这不是意大利托斯卡纳。

translation.en: This is Ohio.
translation.zh: 这是俄亥俄州。

translation.en: So architects get frustrated,  and we start pushing the pendulum back into the other direction.
translation.zh: 就这样，建筑师感到沮丧了， 于是我们把钟摆又推回了另一个方向。

translation.en: In the late '80s and early '90s,  we start experimenting with something called deconstructivism.
translation.zh: 在80年代末，90年代初期， 我们开始试验解构主义。

translation.en: We throw out historical symbols,  we rely on new, computer-aided design techniques,  and we come up with new compositions,  forms crashing into forms.
translation.zh: 我们找出历史符号， 我们用新的电脑辅助设计技术， 我们推出新的艺术作品， 各种形式撞击在一起。

translation.en: This is academic and heady stuff,  it's super unpopular,  we totally alienate you.
translation.zh: 这太学术太费脑筋了， 这样的建筑非常不受欢迎， 建筑师们疏远了人群。

translation.en: Ordinarily, the pendulum would just swing back into the other direction.
translation.zh: 通常来说，钟摆将会摇去另一个方向。

translation.en: And then, something amazing happened.
translation.zh: 随后，有意思的事情发生了。

translation.en: In 1997, this building opened.
translation.zh: 在1997年，这个建筑投入使用了。

translation.en: This is the Guggenheim Bilbao, by Frank Gehry.
translation.zh: 这是在西班牙毕尔巴鄂的古根海姆博物馆， 由弗兰克·盖里设计建筑。

translation.en: And this building  fundamentally changes the world's relationship to architecture.
translation.zh: 就是这个建筑 颠覆了世界与建筑的关系。

translation.en: Paul Goldberger said that Bilbao was one of those rare moments  when critics, academics, and the general public  were completely united around a building.
translation.zh: 保罗·戈德伯格说，毕尔巴鄂的 这个建筑很难得地 获得到批评家、学术界人士， 还有普通民众 的一致好评。

translation.en: The New York Times called this building a miracle.
translation.zh: 纽约时报称这个建筑为 一个奇迹。 在这个建筑完工后，

translation.en: Tourism in Bilbao increased 2,500 percent after this building was completed.
translation.zh: 毕尔巴鄂的游客数量 增长了25倍。

translation.en: So all of a sudden, everybody wants one of these buildings:  L.A.,  Seattle,  Chicago,  New York,  Cleveland,    Everybody wants one, and Gehry is everywhere.
translation.zh: 突然间，所有人都想要有这样的建筑： 洛杉矶、 西雅图、 芝加哥、 纽约、 克利夫兰、  每个人都想要这样的建筑， 盖里的设计随处可见。

translation.en: He is our very first starchitect.
translation.zh: 他是第一位明星建筑师。

translation.en: Now, how is it possible that these forms --  they're wild and radical --  how is it possible that they become so ubiquitous throughout the world?
translation.zh: 这样的建筑设计怎么会 受到热烈欢迎 -- 它们狂野又激进 -- 全世界范围内怎么会 无所不在呢？

translation.en: And it happened because media so successfully galvanized around them  that they quickly taught us that these forms mean culture and tourism.
translation.zh: 这要归功于媒体成功地包装， 它们很快速地传递了信号： 这建筑形式有文化内涵，而且可以吸引游客。

translation.en: We created an emotional reaction to these forms.
translation.zh: 人们与这样的建筑形式 建立了情感联系。

translation.en: So did every mayor in the world.
translation.zh: 世界上的市长们也是这样想的。

translation.en: So every mayor knew that if they had these forms,  they had culture and tourism.
translation.zh: 所有市长都认为 如果所在城市有这样的建筑， 他们就有文化，有游客。

translation.en: This phenomenon at the turn of the new millennium  happened to a few other starchitects.
translation.zh: 这样的现象出现在 进入21世纪的那些年 也捧红了一些其他的明星建筑师。

translation.en: It happened to Zaha  and it happened to Libeskind,  and what happened to these elite few architects  at the turn of the new millennium  could actually start to happen to the entire field of architecture,  as digital media starts to increase the speed  with which we consume information.
translation.zh: 被捧红的还有扎哈 还有里伯斯金， 发生于这些少数精英建筑师身上的现象 在千禧年即将到来的时候 也在整个建筑界中弥散开来了， 因为让我们得以获取信息的数字媒体 开始加速了。

translation.en: Because think about how you consume architecture.
translation.zh: 想想你是如何消费建筑。

translation.en: A thousand years ago,  you would have had to have walked to the village next door to see a building.
translation.zh: 一千年前， 你需要步行到隔壁村落去看一个建筑。

translation.en: Transportation speeds up:  You can take a boat, you can take a plane, you can be a tourist.
translation.zh: 交通运输业的高速发展： 你可以乘船，你可以搭飞机， 你可以当一名游客。

translation.en: Technology speeds up: You can see it in a newspaper, on TV,  until finally, we are all architectural photographers,  and the building has become disembodied from the site.
translation.zh: 科学技术高速发展： 你可以在报纸上、电视上欣赏建筑， 最终，我们都成为了建筑摄影师， 建筑不再只是实体。

translation.en: Architecture is everywhere now,  and that means that the speed of communication  has finally caught up to the speed of architecture.
translation.zh: 现在，建筑无处不在， 这意味着通讯的速度 终于赶上了建筑发展的速度。

translation.en: Because architecture actually moves quite quickly.
translation.zh: 建筑发展非常迅速。

translation.en: It doesn't take long to think about a building.
translation.zh: 观赏评论一个建筑不需要很久。

translation.en: It takes a long time to build a building,  three or four years,  and in the interim, an architect will design two or eight  or a hundred other buildings  before they know if that building that they designed four years ago  was a success or not.
translation.zh: 但建成一座建筑却要很长时间， 三到四年， 在这期间，建筑师要设计 2个，8个，或 也许是100个其他建筑， 他们甚至不知道自己4年前 设计的建筑成功与否。

translation.en: That's because there's never been a good feedback loop in architecture.
translation.zh: 因为建筑里没有一个意见反馈处。

translation.en: That's how we end up with buildings like this.
translation.zh: 因此我们最终得到这样的建筑。

translation.en: Brutalism wasn't a two-year movement,  it was a 20-year movement.
translation.zh: 粗野主义不是两年的运动， 而是长达20年的运动。

translation.en: For 20 years, we were producing buildings like this  because we had no idea how much you hated it.
translation.zh: 长达20年的时间， 我们建造这样的建筑 因为我们并不知道 你们是如此厌恶它们。

translation.en: It's never going to happen again,  I think,  because we are living on the verge of the greatest revolution in architecture  since the invention of concrete,  of steel, or of the elevator,  and it's a media revolution.
translation.zh: 这样的事再也不会发生了， 我想， 因为我们处在 最伟大的建筑革命的边缘， 这是继发明混凝土， 发明钢铁，或是发明电梯之后的 一次媒体革命。

translation.en: So my theory is that when you apply media to this pendulum,  it starts swinging faster and faster,  until it's at both extremes nearly simultaneously,  and that effectively blurs the difference between innovation and symbol,  between us, the architects, and you, the public.
translation.zh: 我的理论是，当我们将媒体 与这个钟摆结合之后， 摆动速度加快了， 直到摇摆 同时达到两边的极限， 这高效地模糊了， 创新和传统符号间的不同， 我们建筑师和你们公众间的不同。

translation.en: Now we can make nearly instantaneous, emotionally charged symbols  out of something that's brand new.
translation.zh: 现在我们可以用全新的事物创建 瞬间产生的情绪化的符号。

translation.en: Let me show you how this plays out  in a project that my firm recently completed.
translation.zh: 让我展示这是怎么进行的 这是我的建筑事务所最近完成的项目。

translation.en: We were hired to replace this building, which burned down.
translation.zh: 我们受雇去重建这座被烧毁的建筑。

translation.en: This is the center of a town called the Pines  in Fire Island in New York State.
translation.zh: 这座建筑位于小镇派恩斯的中心 小镇位于纽约州的火烧岛。

translation.en: It's a vacation community.
translation.zh: 这是一个度假社区。

translation.en: We proposed a building that was audacious,  that was different than any of the forms that the community was used to,  and we were scared and our client was scared  and the community was scared,  so we created a series of photorealistic renderings  that we put onto Facebook  and we put onto Instagram,  and we let people start to do what they do:  share it, comment, like it, hate it.
translation.zh: 我们提出了一个创新大胆的设计建议， 和这个社区出现过的任何形式的建筑都不同， 我们担心会吓到客户， 吓到社区的人们， 于是我们制作了一系列逼真的视觉图片， 把它们放到Facebook 和Instagram上， 让人们去 分享、评论、点赞，或是厌恶它。

translation.en: But that meant that two years before the building was complete,  it was already a part of the community,  so that when the renderings looked exactly like the finished product,  there were no surprises.
translation.zh: 这意味着在建筑完工前两年， 它已经是这个社区的一部分了， 所以当完工的作品和视觉图 看起来一模一样的时候， 就不会带来惊讶之感。

translation.en: This building was already a part of this community,  and then that first summer,  when people started arriving and sharing the building on social media,  the building ceased to be just an edifice and it became media,  because these, these are not just pictures of a building,  they're your pictures of a building.
translation.zh: 这座建筑已经是社区的一个部分， 第一个夏天， 人们来到这里，在社交媒体上分享照片， 这个只想成为建筑物的建筑 变成了媒体， 因为这，这不仅仅是建筑的照片。 它们是你拍摄的建筑相片。

translation.en: And as you use them to tell your story,  they become part of your personal narrative,  and what you're doing is you're short-circuiting  all of our collective memory,  and you're making these charged symbols for us to understand.
translation.zh: 你通过这样的照片来讲述故事， 建筑成为了你个人叙事的一个部分， 你在做的事情，就是短暂回顾 我们共同的记忆， 你在创造这些让我们理解的符号，

translation.en: That means we don't need the Greeks anymore  to tell us what to think about architecture.
translation.zh: 这意味着我们不再需要希腊 来告诉我们建筑的意义。

translation.en: We can tell each other what we think about architecture,  because digital media hasn't just changed the relationship between all of us,  it's changed the relationship between us and buildings.
translation.zh: 我们可以分享自己有关建筑的想法， 因为数字媒体不仅改变了 人与人间的关系， 它改变了我们和建筑的关系。

translation.en: Think for a second about those librarians back in Livingston.
translation.zh: 想象那些在Livingston的图书馆员。

translation.en: If that building was going to be built today,  the first thing they would do is go online and search "new libraries."
translation.zh: 如果今天我们要新建图书馆， 他们得知消息后会做的第一件事就是 上网去搜索“新图书馆”。

translation.en: They would be bombarded by examples of experimentation, of innovation,  of pushing at the envelope of what a library can be.
translation.zh: 他们会被建筑范例信息轰炸， 实验性的、创新型的、 尝试打破常规的图书馆建筑样例。

translation.en: That's ammunition.
translation.zh: 这些都是有力的信息冲击。

translation.en: That's ammunition that they can take with them  to the mayor of Livingston, to the people of Livingston,  and say, there's no one answer to what a library is today.
translation.zh: 那是人们可以带着的信息冲击， 给Livingston的市长、群众， 然后说，现代图书馆没有既定的模式。

translation.en: Let's be a part of this.
translation.zh: 让我们成为它的一部分。

translation.en: This abundance of experimentation  gives them the freedom to run their own experiment.
translation.zh: 丰富的实验过程 给予他们实验的自主性。

translation.en: Everything is different now.
translation.zh: 当今一切都不同了。

translation.en: Architects are no longer these mysterious creatures  that use big words and complicated drawings,  and you aren't the hapless public,  the consumer that won't accept anything that they haven't seen anymore.
translation.zh: 建筑师不再是神奇的生物， 滥用夸张的术语和繁琐的绘图， 你们也不再是倒霉的公众， 客户不再接受那些他们没见过的东西。

translation.en: Architects can hear you,  and you're not intimidated by architecture.
translation.zh: 建筑师能与你沟通， 你不再为建筑感到不适。

translation.en: That means that that pendulum swinging back and forth  from style to style, from movement to movement,  is irrelevant.
translation.zh: 这意味着钟摆来回摆动， 不同的风格、 不同的艺术运动， 已无关紧要。

translation.en: We can actually move forward  and find relevant solutions to the problems that our society faces.
translation.zh: 我们可以向前 寻找有效解决 社会急迫问题的方法。

translation.en: This is the end of architectural history,  and it means that the buildings of tomorrow  are going to look a lot different than the buildings of today.
translation.zh: 这是建筑史的终点， 它意味着，未来的建筑 会与当今的建筑有很大差别。

translation.en: It means that a public space in the ancient city of Seville  can be unique and tailored to the way that a modern city works.
translation.zh: 这意味着，塞维利亚古老城市的 某块公共空地 可以是独特的以现代城市功能 打造的区块。

translation.en: It means that a stadium in Brooklyn can be a stadium in Brooklyn,  not some red-brick historical pastiche  of what we think a stadium ought to be.
translation.zh: 这意味建在布鲁克林的体育场 可以是一个属于布鲁克林风格的体育场， 而不是我们脑中体育场该有的 模仿红砖历史建筑的模样。

translation.en: It means that robots are going to build our buildings,  because we're finally ready for the forms that they're going to produce.
translation.zh: 这意味着机器人可以去建造房屋， 因为我们已经能够接受机器建造的房屋。

translation.en: And it means that buildings will twist to the whims of nature  instead of the other way around.
translation.zh: 这还意味着，建筑会为了大自然而改变 而不是大自然为了建筑而改变。

translation.en: It means that a parking garage in Miami Beach, Florida,  can also be a place for sports  and for yoga  and you can even get married there late at night.
translation.zh: 这意味着佛罗里达迈阿密海滩的车库， 也可以是一个运动场所 瑜伽会馆 晚上你甚至可以在那里举办结婚。

translation.en: It means that three architects can dream about swimming  in the East River of New York,  and then raise nearly half a million dollars  from a community that gathered around their cause,  no one client anymore.
translation.zh: 这意味着三个建筑师能够梦想 在纽约东河游泳， 从围绕在附近的社区客户群 募集近50万美元， 建筑师们的客户不再是单一的。

translation.en: It means that no building is too small for innovation,  like this little reindeer pavilion  that's as muscly and sinewy as the animals it's designed to observe.
translation.zh: 这意味着，再小的建筑也能创新， 就像这个驯鹿观赏馆 如同它要观察的驯鹿般强健有力。

translation.en: And it means that a building doesn't have to be beautiful  to be lovable,  like this ugly little building in Spain,  where the architects dug a hole,  packed it with hay,  and then poured concrete around it,  and when the concrete dried,  they invited someone to come and clean that hay out  so that all that's left when it's done  is this hideous little room  that's filled with the imprints and scratches of how that place was made,
translation.zh: 这意味着建筑无需是漂亮的 惹人喜爱的， 就像西班牙这个丑丑的小房子， 建筑师挖了一个洞， 用甘草填充， 注入混凝土， 当混凝土干燥后， 他们邀请某位牛来讲甘草清理干净 所留下的 就是这个丑陋的小屋子 充满建筑它时留下的痕迹和沧桑，

translation.en: and that becomes the most sublime place to watch a Spanish sunset.
translation.zh: 这个建筑成了欣赏西班牙日落 最庄严的地方。

translation.en: Because it doesn't matter if a cow builds our buildings  or a robot builds our buildings.
translation.zh: 因为真的无关紧要， 无论是牛为我们建造的 还是机器人建造的，

translation.en: It doesn't matter how we build, it matters what we build.
translation.zh: 也无关于建筑的过程， 重要的是我们的建造了什么。

translation.en: Architects already know how to make buildings that are greener  and smarter and friendlier.
translation.zh: 建筑师知道如何建造更加绿色、 更加智能、更加人性化的建筑。

translation.en: We've just been waiting for all of you to want them.
translation.zh: 我们只是等待人们开始想要这样的建筑。

translation.en: And finally, we're not on opposite sides anymore.
translation.zh: 最终，我们不再站在对立面。

translation.en: Find an architect, hire an architect,  work with us to design better buildings, better cities, and a better world,  because the stakes are high.
translation.zh: 找一个建筑师、雇一个建筑师， 与我们一起设计更好的建筑、 更好的城市、更好的世界， 因为赌注很高。

translation.en: Buildings don't just reflect our society, they shape our society  down to the smallest spaces:  the local libraries,  the homes where we raise our children,  and the walk that they take from the bedroom to the bathroom.
translation.zh: 建筑不只反映了我们的社会， 建筑塑造着社会， 从生活中最小的空间： 地方图书馆， 我们养育子女的家， 从卧室走向浴室的那条路。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: This is my niece, Stella.
translation.zh: 这是我的侄女，斯特拉。

translation.en: She's just turned one and started to walk.
translation.zh: 她刚满一岁并开始学走路了。

translation.en: And she's walking in that really cool way that one-year-olds do,  a kind of teetering, my-body's-moving- too-fast-for-my-legs kind of way.
translation.zh: 她正在用一岁的小孩通常使用的非常酷的方式走路， 那种摇摇晃晃、身体比腿移动得快得多的方式。

translation.en: It is absolutely gorgeous.
translation.zh: 这真的很有意思。

translation.en: And one of her favorite things to do at the moment  is to stare at herself in the mirror.
translation.zh: 她最喜欢做的事情之一 就是盯着镜子里的自己。

translation.en: She absolutely loves her reflection.
translation.zh: 她非常喜欢自己在镜子里的影像。

translation.en: She giggles and squeals, and gives herself these big, wet kisses.
translation.zh: 她边笑边叫，然后给了镜子中的自己一些大大的、湿湿的吻。

translation.en: It is beautiful.
translation.zh: 很漂亮。

translation.en: Apparently, all of her friends do this and my mom tells me that I used to do this,  and it got me thinking:  When did I stop doing this?
translation.zh: 很显然，她所有的朋友都这样做，然后我妈说我小时候也是这样的， 这让我想到一个问题： 我是什么时候停止这样做的？

translation.en: When is it suddenly not okay to love the way that we look?
translation.zh: 从什么时候开始，突然间我们不再喜欢自己的长相了？

translation.en: Because apparently we don't.
translation.zh: 因为很显然我们不再那样做。

translation.en: Ten thousand people every month google,  "Am I ugly?"
translation.zh: 每个月都有一万人在谷歌上搜索 “我丑吗?“

translation.en: This is Faye. Faye is 13 and she lives in Denver.
translation.zh: 这是法耶，她13岁，住在丹佛。

translation.en: And like any teenager, she just wants to be liked and to fit in.
translation.zh: 就像所有的青少年一样，她也想被别人喜欢并与人相处融洽。

translation.en: It's Sunday night.
translation.zh: 这是星期天晚上。

translation.en: She's getting ready for the week ahead at school.
translation.zh: 她正在为下周的学校生活做准备。

translation.en: And she's slightly dreading it, and she's a bit confused because  despite her mom telling her all the time  that she's beautiful,  every day at school, someone tells her that she's ugly.
translation.zh: 她有些害怕，并且有一点困惑，因为 尽管她妈妈一直告诉她说 她很漂亮， 但是每天在学校都会有人说她长得难看。

translation.en: Because of the difference between what her mom tells her and what her friends  at school, or her peers at school are telling her,  she doesn't know who to believe.
translation.zh: 因为她妈妈告诉她的和她在学校的朋友 或同龄人告诉她的是不同的， 所以她不知道该相信谁。

translation.en: So, she takes a video of herself. She posts it to YouTube  and she asks people to please leave a comment:  "Am I pretty or am I ugly?"
translation.zh: 因此，她为自己拍摄了一个视频并放到了YouTube上， 然后她让大家来评论： “我长得漂亮还是难看？”

translation.en: Well, so far, Faye has received over 13,000 comments.
translation.zh: 截止目前，法耶共收到了超过13000个评论。

translation.en: Some of them are so nasty, they don't bear thinking about.
translation.zh: 它们中的一些很下流，不值一提。

translation.en: This is an average, healthy-looking teenage girl receiving this feedback  at one of the most emotionally vulnerable times in her life.
translation.zh: 这是一个普通的、看起来很健康的少女 在她生命中情感最脆弱的时光收到的回复。

translation.en: Thousands of people are posting videos like this,  mostly teenage girls, reaching out in this way.
translation.zh: 有成千上万的人们上传这样的视频， 他们中大部分都是十几岁的女孩，用这种方式来接触外界。

translation.en: But what's leading them to do this?
translation.zh: 然而是什么导致他们这样做的呢？

translation.en: Well, today's teenagers are rarely alone.
translation.zh: 今天的青少年很少独处。

translation.en: They're under pressure to be online and available at all times,  talking, messaging, liking, commenting, sharing, posting —  it never ends.
translation.zh: 他们被迫上网并随时保持在线， 聊天、发信息、点赞、评论、分享、上传—— 无休无止。

translation.en: Never before have we been so connected,  so continuously, so instantaneously, so young.
translation.zh: 我们之前从来没有如此被紧密地联系， 而且是如此地无休无止、如此快速，如此年轻。

translation.en: And as one mom told me, it's like there's a party in their bedroom every night.
translation.zh: 正如一位妈妈跟我说的，似乎每天晚上他们的卧室里都有聚会。

translation.en: There's simply no privacy.
translation.zh: 简直毫无隐私。

translation.en: And the social pressures that go along with that are relentless.
translation.zh: 而由此伴随而来的社会压力也是残酷的。

translation.en: This always-on environment is training our kids to value themselves  based on the number of likes they get  and the types of comments that they receive.
translation.zh: 这种永远在线的环境将我们的孩子训练成 要靠通过他们获得的点赞数量 和收到的评论来肯定自己的价值。

translation.en: There's no separation between online and offline life.
translation.zh: 没有线上和线下之分，

translation.en: What's real or what isn't is really hard to tell the difference between.
translation.zh: 很难区分什么是真实的什么不是真实的，

translation.en: And it's also really hard to tell the difference between what's authentic  and what's digitally manipulated.
translation.zh: 也很难区分现实 和虚拟世界。

translation.en: What's a highlight in someone's life versus what's normal in the context of everyday.
translation.zh: 也分不清日常生活和精彩时光。

translation.en: And where are they looking to for inspiration?
translation.zh: 那他们又从哪里去获得灵感呢？

translation.en: Well, you can see the kinds of images that are covering the newsfeeds  of girls today.
translation.zh: 你可以看看那些今天出现在各种新闻中 女孩的形象。

translation.en: Size zero models still dominate our catwalks.
translation.zh: “零号尺寸”模特仍然统治着T形台。

translation.en: Airbrushing is now routine.
translation.zh: 修饰照片现在也很常见。

translation.en: And trends like #thinspiration, #thighgap,  #bikinibridge and #proana.
translation.zh: 现在的趋势是#励瘦、#大腿间距、 #比基尼桥和#安娜运动。

translation.en: For those who don't know, #proana means pro-anorexia.
translation.zh: 要跟那些不明白这些的人提一下，#安娜运动的意思是支持厌食。

translation.en: These trends are teamed with the stereotyping and flagrant objectification  of women in today's popular culture.
translation.zh: 这些趋势与今天的流行文化中对女性的刻板印象 和公然物化结合在一起。

translation.en: It is not hard to see what girls are benchmarking themselves against.
translation.zh: 从中不难看出女孩子们是怎样定位自己的。

translation.en: But boys are not immune to this either.
translation.zh: 但是男孩子们对此也不能幸免。

translation.en: Aspiring to the chiseled jaw lines and ripped six packs of superhero-like sports stars  and playboy music artists.
translation.zh: 他们渴望拥有轮廓分明的下巴线条和像英雄般的体育明星 以及花花公子音乐艺术家所拥有的六块腹肌。

translation.en: But, what's the problem with all of this?
translation.zh: 但是, 所有的这些表现的问题是什么呢?

translation.en: Well, surely we want our kids to grow up as healthy, well balanced individuals.
translation.zh: 我们当然希望我们的孩子成长为一个健康、均衡发展的个人。

translation.en: But in an image-obsessed culture, we are training our kids  to spend more time and mental effort on their appearance  at the expense of all of the other aspects of their identities.
translation.zh: 但是在这样一个对相貌着迷的文化中，我们正将我们的孩子训练成 将更多的时间和精力花在外貌上， 而对于其他方面的身份认同关注更少的人。

translation.en: So, things like their relationships, the development of their physical abilities,  and their studies and so on begin to suffer.
translation.zh: 因此，他们会在人际关系、体能发展 和学习等方面开始受挫。

translation.en: Six out of 10 girls are now choosing not to do something because they don't  think they look good enough.
translation.zh: 现在10个女孩中有6个会因为她们觉得自己不够好看 而不去做某事。

translation.en: These are not trivial activities.
translation.zh: 这些都不是琐事。

translation.en: These are fundamental activities to their development as humans and as contributors to society and to the workforce.
translation.zh: 作为人类以及社会和职场的参与者的发展来说，

translation.en: Thirty-one percent, nearly one in three teenagers, are withdrawing  from classroom debate. They're failing  to engage in classroom debate because  they don't want to draw attention to the way that they look.
translation.zh: 这些都是基本的。 有31%，也就是说将近三分之一的青少年 会从课堂辩论中退出。 他们退出是因为 不想让别人注意到他们的长相。

translation.en: One in five are not showing up to class at all  on days when they don't feel good about it.
translation.zh: 有五分之一的青少年在感觉不是很好的时候 甚至都不会在班级里露面。

translation.en: And when it comes to exams,  if you don't think you look good enough,  specifically if you don't think you are thin enough,  you will score a lower grade point average  than your peers who are not concerned with this.
translation.zh: 考试的时候， 如果你觉得自己不够好看， 特别是如果你觉得自己不够苗条的话， 那么跟那些不关心这些的同学比起来 你可能得到的平均分数要比他们低。

translation.en: And this is consistent across Finland, the U.S.
translation.zh: 这一点不管是在芬兰、美国

translation.en: and China, and is true regardless of how much you actually weigh.
translation.zh: 还是中国都是一致的，而且不管你真实的体重是多少。

translation.en: So to be super clear, we're talking about the  way you think you look, not how you actually look.
translation.zh: 所以非常清楚，我们是在讨论 你所认为的自己的长相，而不是你的真实长相。

translation.en: Low body confidence is undermining academic achievement.
translation.zh: 对身体的信心不足会削弱学业成绩。

translation.en: But it's also damaging health.
translation.zh: 而且也会有损健康。

translation.en: Teenagers with low body confidence do less physical activity,  eat less fruits and vegetables,  partake in more unhealthy weight control practices  that can lead to eating disorders.
translation.zh: 那些对自己身体信心不足的青少年会更少参加体育活动， 吃更少的水果和蔬菜， 而会更多参加那些不健康的可能导致饮食失调的 体重控制训练。

translation.en: They have lower self-esteem.
translation.zh: 他们的自尊心也会更低。

translation.en: They're more easily influenced by people around them  and they're at greater risk of depression.
translation.zh: 他们更容易受到周围人的影响， 并且有更高的抑郁的风险。

translation.en: And we think it's for all of these reasons that they take more risks  with things like alcohol and drug use;  crash dieting; cosmetic surgery; unprotected, earlier sex;  and self-harm.
translation.zh: 基于以上理由，我们认为他们有更高的风险去做 那些像酗酒、吸毒、 快速减肥、整容、无防护措施以及过早的性交 和自残这样的事情。

translation.en: The pursuit of the perfect body is putting pressure on our healthcare systems  and costing our governments billions of dollars every year.
translation.zh: 对完美身材的追求正使医保系统饱受压力 并且每年要花费政府数十亿美元。

translation.en: And we don't grow out of it.
translation.zh: 而且我们并不会因为长大而放弃追求完美身材。

translation.en: Women who think they're overweight — again,  regardless of whether they are or are not —  have higher rates of absenteeism.
translation.zh: 那些认为自己超重的妇女——不管她们 是否真的超重—— 会有更高的缺勤率。

translation.en: Seventeen percent of women would  not show up to a job interview on  a day when they weren't feeling confident about the way that they look.
translation.zh: 17%的女性会因为 某天感觉对自己的长相不自信 而不去参加那天的面试。

translation.en: Have a think about what this is doing  to our economy.
translation.zh: 想一下这对我们的经济 会有什么影响。

translation.en: If we could overcome this, what that  opportunity looks like.
translation.zh: 如果我们能克服这些，将会带来 哪些机会。

translation.en: Unlocking this potential is in the interest  of every single one of us.
translation.zh: 释放这个潜能将有益于 我们每一个人。

translation.en: But how do we do that?
translation.zh: 但是我们该如何去做呢？

translation.en: Well, talking, on its own, only gets you so far.
translation.zh: 单独的空谈，也就只能到此为止了。

translation.en: It's not enough by itself.
translation.zh: 它本身是不够的。

translation.en: If you actually want to make a difference,  you have to do something.
translation.zh: 如果你真的想有所改变， 你得去做点什么。

translation.en: And we've learned there are three key ways:  The first is we have to educate for body confidence.
translation.zh: 而我们了解到这里有三个关键的方法： 首先我们得培养自己对身体充满信心。

translation.en: We have to help our teenagers develop  strategies to overcome image-related pressures  and build their self-esteem.
translation.zh: 我们得帮助青少年想出 策略去克服跟形象有关的压力 并且建立他们的自尊心。

translation.en: Now, the good news is that there are  many programs out there available to do this.
translation.zh: 好消息是现在已经有 许多这样的项目。

translation.en: The bad news is that most of them don't work.
translation.zh: 坏消息是大多数这样的项目没有效。

translation.en: I was shocked to learn that many well-meaning  programs are inadvertently actually  making the situation worse.
translation.zh: 我很震惊地了解到许多善意的 项目却无意中 使得情况更糟糕了。

translation.en: So we need to make damn sure that  the programs that our kids are receiving  are not only having a positive impact,  but having a lasting impact as well.
translation.zh: 因此我们要确保 我们的孩子们正在接受的项目 不仅是对他们有积极影响的， 而且还要有持续的影响。

translation.en: And the research shows that the best programs  address six key areas:  The first is the influence of family, friends and relationships.
translation.zh: 研究表明最好的项目 跟六个关键领域有关： 首先是家人和亲朋好友的影响。

translation.en: The second is media and celebrity culture,  then how to handle teasing and bullying,  the way we compete and compare with one another  talking about appearance — some people  call this "body talk" or "fat talk" —  and finally, the foundations of respecting  and looking after yourself.
translation.zh: 其次是媒体和名人文化， 然后是如何处理调侃和欺凌， 同其他人基于长相的 竞争和比较的方式， 对相貌的讨论——有些人 称之为"身材谈话“或”肥胖谈话“—— 最后一点，是你尊重 和看待自己的基础。

translation.en: These six things are crucial starting points  for anyone serious about delivering  body-confidence education that works.
translation.zh: 这六件事对于那些 真正想要实现有效的身体信心教育的人来说 是至关重要的起点。

translation.en: An education is critical,  but tackling this problem is going  to require each and everyone of us  to step up and be better role models  for the women and girls in our own lives.
translation.zh: 教育是很重要的， 但是解决这个问题需要 我们所有人 提升自己并且成为 我们生活中的妇女和女孩们更好的榜样。

translation.en: Challenging the status quo of how  women are seen and talked about in our own circles.
translation.zh: 挑战我们在圈子中 如何看待和谈论女性的现状。

translation.en: It is not okay that we judge the contribution  of our politicians by their haircuts  or the size of their breasts,  or to infer that the determination or the success of an Olympian is down to her not being a looker.
translation.zh: 我们不能仅凭 政治家的发型和胸围 去判断她的贡献大小， 或者因为长相不佳而推断 一个奥运会运动员不会成功。

translation.en: We need to start judging people by what they do,  not what they look like.
translation.zh: 我们需要根据人们的所做所为去评判一个人， 而不是他们的长相。

translation.en: We can all start by taking responsibility for the types of pictures  and comments that we post  on our own social networks.
translation.zh: 我们可以从对我们 发布在社交网络上的图片和评论 担起责任开始做起。

translation.en: We can compliment people based on their effort  and their actions  and not on their appearance.
translation.zh: 我们可以基于人们的努力 和行动去赞美他们 而不是他们的相貌。

translation.en: And let me ask you,  when was the last time that you  kissed a mirror?
translation.zh: 让我来问问你， 你上一次对着镜子亲吻 是什么时候？

translation.en: Ultimately, we need to work together  as communities, as governments  and as businesses to really change this culture of ours  so that our kids grow up valuing their whole selves,  valuing individuality, diversity, inclusion.
translation.zh: 最终，我们需要跟 社区、政府 和企业一起努力去改变我们的这些文化， 这样我们的孩子才能在成长中获得完整的自我， 重视个性、多元和包容。

translation.en: We need to put the people that are making a real difference  on our pedestals, making a difference  in the real world.
translation.zh: 我们要让那些正在改变 我们的现状的人去改变 真实的世界。

translation.en: Giving them the airtime, because only then  will we create a different world.
translation.zh: 给他们时间，因为只有这样 我们才能创造一个不同的世界，

translation.en: A world where our kids are free to become  the best versions of themselves,  where the way they think they look  never holds them back from being who they are  or achieving what they want in life.
translation.zh: 一个我们的孩子可以自由地成为 最好的自己的世界， 一个他们不会因自己的长相 而阻碍他们成为自己想要成为的人 或者获得想要的东西的世界。

translation.en: Think about what this might mean for someone in your life.
translation.zh: 想一下这对你生命中的某个人可能意味着什么。

translation.en: Who have you got in mind?
translation.zh: 你脑海中出现了谁？

translation.en: Is it your wife?
translation.zh: 你的妻子？

translation.en: Your sister?
translation.zh: 你妹妹？

translation.en: Your daughter?
translation.zh: 你女儿？

translation.en: Your niece?
translation.zh: 你侄女？

translation.en: Your friend? It could just be the woman a couple of seats away  from you today.
translation.zh: 还是你的某个朋友？也可能只是今天 跟你隔着几个座位的某个女性。

translation.en: What would it mean for her  if she were freed from that voice  of her inner critic, nagging her to have  longer legs, thinner thighs, smaller stomach,  shorter feet?
translation.zh: 这将对她意味着什么呢? 如果她能摆脱内心挑剔的声音 唠叨她要有 更长更细的大腿,更瘦的肚子 和更短的脚。

translation.en: What could it mean for her if we overcame this  and unlocked her potential in that way?
translation.zh: 如果我们能克服这些并打开 她在那方面的潜力，那对她来说又将意味着什么？

translation.en: Right now, our culture's obsession  with image is holding us all back.
translation.zh: 现在，我们的文化中对形象的痴迷 阻碍了我们所有人。

translation.en: But let's show our kids the truth.
translation.zh: 但是让我们向孩子们展示真相。

translation.en: Let's show them that the way you look  is just one part of your identity  and that the truth is we love them  for who they are  and what they do  and how they make us feel.
translation.zh: 让我们向他们表明长相 只是身份的一部分， 而事实是我们爱他们是因为 他们是谁 和他们的所做所为 以及他们给我们的感觉。

translation.en: Let's build self-esteem into our school curriculums.
translation.zh: 让我们在学校的课程中设置自尊心科目。

translation.en: Let's each and every one of us change the way  we talk and compare ourselves to other people.
translation.zh: 让我们每一个人改变 我们谈论自己和跟他人比较的方式。

translation.en: And let's work together as communities,  from grassroots to governments,  so that the happy little one-year-olds  of today become the confident  changemakers of tomorrow.
translation.zh: 让我们作为团体一起努力， 从基层到政府， 以便这些今天一岁大的快乐的孩子 成为 明天自信的变革者。

translation.en: Let's do this.
translation.zh: 让我们这样做吧。

translation.en: On November 5th, 1990,  a man named El-Sayyid Nosair walked  into a hotel in Manhattan  and assassinated Rabbi Meir Kahane,  the leader of the Jewish Defense League.
translation.zh: 1990 年 11 月 5 日， 一位名叫埃尔·塞伊德·诺塞尔的男子 走入曼哈顿的一间宾馆 刺杀了拉比梅厄‧卡赫纳， 犹太防卫联盟的首领。

translation.en: Nosair was initially found not guilty of the murder,  but while serving time on lesser charges,  he and other men began planning attacks  on a dozen New York City landmarks,  including tunnels, synagogues  and the United Nations headquarters.
translation.zh: 诺塞尔一开始并未被指认参与谋杀， 但当他因小事入狱服刑期间， 他和一些人开始计划袭击 纽约市的一些地标， 包括隧道，犹太教会堂 和联合国总部。

translation.en: Thankfully, those plans were foiled  by an FBI informant.
translation.zh: 谢天谢地，这些计划被 美国联邦调查局的线人挫败了。

translation.en: Sadly, the 1993 bombing  of the World Trade Center was not.
translation.zh: 不幸的是，1993 年 世贸中心的那场爆炸袭击却发生了。

translation.en: Nosair would eventually be convicted  for his involvement in the plot.
translation.zh: 诺塞尔最终被指控 参与这场犯罪谋划。

translation.en: El-Sayyid Nosair is my father.
translation.zh: 埃尔·塞伊德·诺塞尔是我的父亲。

translation.en: I was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania  in 1983 to him, an Egyptian engineer,  and a loving American mother and grade school teacher,  who together tried their best  to create a happy childhood for me.
translation.zh: 我 1983 年出生在 宾夕法尼亚州的匹兹堡， 我的父亲是一位 埃及裔工程师， 我有个爱我的美国母亲， 她是一名小学老师， 他们尽最大的努力 为给我创造出欢乐的童年。

translation.en: It wasn't until I was seven years old  that our family dynamic started to change.
translation.zh: 直到我 7 岁的时候 家庭氛围开始出现了变化。

translation.en: My father exposed me to a side of Islam  that few people, including the majority of Muslims,  get to see.
translation.zh: 我的父亲让我接触伊斯兰的一支 很少人见过，包括大部分的穆斯林， 都没见过的一个派别。

translation.en: It's been my experience that when people  take the time to interact with one another,  it doesn't take long to realize that for the most part,  we all want the same things out of life.
translation.zh: 我的人生经验告诉我 人们与彼此相处， 很快就意识到，很大程度上 人们对生活有着相同的追求。

translation.en: However, in every religion, in every population,  you'll find a small percentage of people  who hold so fervently to their beliefs  that they feel they must use any means necessary  to make others live as they do.
translation.zh: 然而，所有宗教，所有群体， 你总能看到一小部分人 对他们的信仰太过狂热 以至于认为他们应该用各种方法 让其他人和他们过同样的生活。

translation.en: A few months prior to his arrest,  he sat me down and explained that  for the past few weekends, he and some friends  had been going to a shooting range on Long Island  for target practice.
translation.zh: 在他被捕前的几个月， 他和我坐着聊天解释到 在过去的几个周末， 他和他的一些朋友 在长岛 进行目标射击训练。

translation.en: He told me I'd be going with him the next morning.
