translation.zh: 他让我第二天一早和他一起去。

translation.en: We arrived at Calverton Shooting Range,  which unbeknownst to our group was being watched  by the FBI.
translation.zh: 我们来到凯佛顿射击场， 我们并不知道自己已经 被联邦调查局监视了。

translation.en: When it was my turn to shoot,  my father helped me hold the rifle to my shoulder  and explained how to aim at the target  about 30 yards off.
translation.zh: 轮到我射击的时候， 我的父亲帮我扶住 肩膀上的来福枪， 并教导我如何瞄准 30 码处的目标。

translation.en: That day, the last bullet I shot  hit the small orange light that sat on top of the target  and to everyone's surprise, especially mine,  the entire target burst into flames.
translation.zh: 那天，我射出的最后一颗子弹 打中了目标顶上的橙色亮光， 所有人都惊呆了，尤其是我， 整个目标版燃烧了。

translation.en: My uncle turned to the other men,  and in Arabic said, "Ibn abuh."
translation.zh: 我的叔叔转向旁边的人， 用阿拉伯语说到，“Ibn abuh”——

translation.en: Like father, like son.
translation.zh: 虎父无犬子。

translation.en: They all seemed to get a really big laugh out of that comment,  but it wasn't until a few years later  that I fully understood what they thought was so funny.
translation.zh: 他们当场开怀大笑起来， 几年后 我才了解他们大笑的原因，

translation.en: They thought they saw in me the same destruction  my father was capable of.
translation.zh: 他们以为我和我的父亲有着 同样的摧毁能力。

translation.en: Those men would eventually be convicted  of placing a van filled with 1,500 pounds of explosives  into the sub-level parking lot of the World Trade Center's North Tower,  causing an explosion that killed six people  and injured over 1,000 others.
translation.zh: 这群男人最终被指控 将满载 1500 磅重的 炸弹的厢式货车 停在世界贸易中心北塔的 地下停车场， 爆炸造成 6 人死亡， 同时致使超过 1000 人受伤。

translation.en: These were the men I looked up to.
translation.zh: 这些是我曾经敬仰的人。

translation.en: These were the men I called ammu, which means uncle.
translation.zh: 这些是我曾经称呼其为 ammu， 意为叔叔的人。

translation.en: By the time I turned 19,  I had already moved 20 times in my life,  and that instability during my childhood  didn't really provide an opportunity  to make many friends.
translation.zh: 当我 19 岁的时候， 我已经搬超过 20 次家了， 童年所经历的不稳定 并未给我 结交朋友的机会。

translation.en: Each time I would begin to feel comfortable around someone,  it was time to pack up and move to the next town.
translation.zh: 每当我感到和附近人相熟时， 就是我要收拾行囊 去下一个地方的时候。

translation.en: Being the perpetual new face in class,  I was frequently the target of bullies.
translation.zh: 作为永远的班级新生， 我常是同学们欺负的对象。

translation.en: I kept my identity a secret from my classmates  to avoid being targeted,  but as it turns out, being the quiet, chubby new kid in class  was more than enough ammunition.
translation.zh: 为了不被同班同学欺负， 我将自己的身份保密， 但结果是，作为 安静又胖乎乎的新同学 很轻易就成为被欺负的对象。

translation.en: So for the most part, I spent my time at home  reading books and watching TV  or playing video games.
translation.zh: 所以更多的时候， 我待在家里 看书看电视 或者是打电动。

translation.en: For those reasons, my social skills were lacking,  to say the least,  and growing up in a bigoted household,  I wasn't prepared for the real world.
translation.zh: 正因为这样，我的社交能力有所缺失， 简单地说， 成长在固执的家庭， 我没有准备好应对现实世界。

translation.en: I'd been raised to judge people  based on arbitrary measurements,  like a person's race or religion.
translation.zh: 我被教育成用武断的方式， 依据人们的脸或宗教， 来评断他人。

translation.en: So what opened my eyes?
translation.zh: 什么让我开了眼界呢？

translation.en: One of my first experiences  that challenged this way of thinking  was during the 2000 presidential elections.
translation.zh: 某次经历 挑战了我思考的方式 发生于 2000 年美国总统竞选期间。

translation.en: Through a college prep program,  I was able to take part  in the National Youth Convention in Philadelphia.
translation.zh: 在预科期间， 我参与了 在费城举办的全国青年大会。

translation.en: My particular group's focus was on youth violence,  and having been the victim of bullying for most of my life,  this was a subject in which I felt particularly passionate.
translation.zh: 我这组的话题是关于青少年暴力， 作为倍受欺负的受害者， 这个话题我很感兴趣。

translation.en: The members of our group came from many different walks of life.
translation.zh: 组员都有着不同的生活轨迹。

translation.en: One day toward the end of the convention,  I found out that one of the kids I had befriended  was Jewish.
translation.zh: 大会临近结束的某天， 我发现我的某个朋友 是犹太人。

translation.en: Now, it had taken several days  for this detail to come to light,  and I realized that there was no natural animosity  between the two of us.
translation.zh: 我也是过了几天 才知晓这件事情， 我认识到，我们之间 并没有与生俱来的仇恨。

translation.en: I had never had a Jewish friend before,  and frankly I felt a sense of pride  in having been able to overcome a barrier  that for most of my life I had been led to believe  was insurmountable.
translation.zh: 我从未有过犹太朋友， 坦白地说，我为此感到骄傲， 能够跨越 我人生绝大部分时间 认为是不可能逾越的障碍。

translation.en: Another major turning point came when  I found a summer job at Busch Gardens,  an amusement park.
translation.zh: 另一个转折点是， 某年暑假，我在布希花园 这个主题乐园打工。

translation.en: There, I was exposed to people from all sorts of faiths and cultures,  and that experience proved to be fundamental  to the development of my character.
translation.zh: 我见识到有着不同信仰， 来自不同文化的人们， 这样的经验 对我的人格发展 是至关重要的。

translation.en: Most of my life, I'd been taught  that homosexuality was a sin, and by extension,  that all gay people were a negative influence.
translation.zh: 因为在过去的日子， 我接收到的教育是， 同性恋是罪恶的， 据此推断， 所有的同性恋者都有着 消极的影响。

translation.en: As chance would have it, I had the opportunity  to work with some of the gay performers  at a show there,  and soon found that many were the kindest,  least judgmental people I had ever met.
translation.zh: 在我打暑期工的时间里， 我有机会和同性恋演员 一起合作， 我很快发现，很多同性恋者 是我所见过最善良， 最自由开放尊重他人的人。

translation.en: Being bullied as a kid  created a sense of empathy in me  toward the suffering of others,  and it comes very unnaturally to me  to treat people who are kind  in any other way than how I would want to be treated.
translation.zh: 在儿童时期被欺负的经历 教给我要对他人的遭遇 感到同情和怜悯， 对我来说， 我会善待那些 对我好的人。

translation.en: Because of that feeling, I was able  with real life experience and interaction.
translation.zh: 因为这样的感受，我能够 用真实生活和交际经历来

translation.en: I don't know what it's like to be gay,  but I'm well acquainted with being judged  for something that's beyond my control.
translation.zh: 我不知道作为同性恋者的感受， 但我熟知那种被 无法掌控的事物所评断的感受。

translation.en: Then there was "The Daily Show."
translation.zh: 接着，有个“每日秀”的节目出现了。

translation.en: On a nightly basis, Jon Stewart forced me  to be intellectually honest with myself about my own bigotry  and helped me to realize that a person's race,  religion or sexual orientation  had nothing to do with the quality of one's character.
translation.zh: 每一晚，乔恩·斯图尔特催促我 诚实面对自己的偏见， 帮助我认识到一个人的种族， 信仰和性取向 对这个人的人格没有任何关系。

translation.en: He was in many ways a father figure to me  when I was in desperate need of one.
translation.zh: 某种程度上说， 每当我迫切需要一个父亲的时候， 他就在那里。

translation.en: Inspiration can often come from an unexpected place,  and the fact that a Jewish comedian had done more  to positively influence my worldview  than my own extremist father  is not lost on me.
translation.zh: 鼓舞人心之事 往往来自你无法预知的地方， 事实上，一个犹太裔喜剧明星 积极地影响我的世界观， 比我那极端的亲生父亲 多得多。

translation.en: One day, I had a conversation with my mother  about how my worldview was starting to change,  and she said something to me  that I will hold dear to my heart  for as long as I live.
translation.zh: 某天，我和母亲谈到 我的世界观正在改变， 她对我说， 我将在生命里 一直带着尊重的心。

translation.en: She looked at me with the weary eyes  of someone who had experienced  enough dogmatism to last a lifetime, and said,  "I'm tired of hating people."
translation.zh: 她用疲倦的眼神看着我， 她受够了 被教条主义侵占的人生， 说到：“我不愿憎恨他人了。”

translation.en: In that instant, I realized how much negative energy  it takes to hold that hatred inside of you.
translation.zh: 瞬间，我意识到，在内心里承受憎恨 需要多么巨大的负能量。

translation.en: Zak Ebrahim is not my real name.
translation.zh: 扎克‧伊博黑姆不是我的本名。

translation.en: I changed it when my family decided  to end our connection with my father  and start a new life.
translation.zh: 当我的家人决定 和我父亲断绝关系时 我改了这个名字 以开始新的生活。

translation.en: So why would I out myself  and potentially put myself in danger?
translation.zh: 那么，我为什么要 出现在公众视线前 将自己置于可能的危险境地呢？

translation.en: Well, that's simple.
translation.zh: 嗯，这很容易解释。

translation.en: I do it in the hopes that perhaps someone someday  who is compelled to use violence  may hear my story and realize  that there is a better way,  that although I had been subjected  to this violent, intolerant ideology,  that I did not become fanaticized.
translation.zh: 我这样做是希望也许某人某天 当他决定使用武力 反抗社会的时候 可能会听到我的故事，并意识到 有比动武更好的方法， 尽管我曾被灌输 这样的暴力思维， 偏狭的意识， 我并没有为其所动。

translation.en: Instead, I choose to use my experience  to fight back against terrorism,  against the bigotry.
translation.zh: 而是选择通过自己的经验 来抵抗恐怖主义， 来反对偏见。

translation.en: I do it for the victims of terrorism  and their loved ones,  for the terrible pain and loss  that terrorism has forced upon their lives.
translation.zh: 我为了那些恐怖袭击的受害者 以及他们的亲人而这样做， 为了那些被恐怖主义活动所造成的 生命的苦痛和损失而这样做。

translation.en: For the victims of terrorism, I will speak out  against these senseless acts  and condemn my father's actions.
translation.zh: 为了那些遭受恐怖袭击的 受害者，我站出来 反对这些毫无意义的袭击行动， 谴责我父亲的行为。

translation.en: And with that simple fact, I stand here as proof  that violence isn't inherent in one's religion or race,  and the son does not have to follow  the ways of his father.
translation.zh: 就是这样简单的原因， 我站在这里证明 暴力不是宗教或种族与生俱来的， 儿子并不需要走上 和父亲相同的道路。

translation.en: I am not my father.
translation.zh: 我不是我的父亲。

translation.en: Thank you.   Thank you, everybody.   Thank you all.   Thanks a lot.
translation.zh: 谢谢。 谢谢各位。 谢谢大家。 非常感谢。

translation.en: Right now  you have a movie playing inside your head.
translation.zh: 此时此刻 正有一部电影在你脑海中放映。

translation.en: It's an amazing multi-track movie.
translation.zh: 这是一部奇妙的多轨道电影。

translation.en: It has 3D vision and surround sound  for what you're seeing and hearing right now,  but that's just the start of it.
translation.zh: 这部围绕着你正看到和听到的电影 拥有三维视觉和环绕立体声， 但这仅仅是个开始。

translation.en: Your movie has smell and taste and touch.
translation.zh: 你的电影有嗅觉、味觉和触觉。

translation.en: It has a sense of your body,  pain, hunger, orgasms.
translation.zh: 它拥有你的身体所拥有的感觉， 痛苦，饥饿，高潮。

translation.en: It has emotions,  anger and happiness.
translation.zh: 它拥有情绪， 愤怒和快乐。

translation.en: It has memories, like scenes from your childhood  playing before you.
translation.zh: 它拥有记忆，就像你的童年 正在你的面前放映。

translation.en: And it has this constant voiceover narrative  in your stream of conscious thinking.
translation.zh: 并且它在你的有意识的思维流中 拥有恒定的旁白。

translation.en: At the heart of this movie is you  experiencing all this directly.
translation.zh: 这部电影的核心 是你直接体验这一切。

translation.en: This movie is your stream of consciousness,  the subject of experience  of the mind and the world.
translation.zh: 这部电影是你的意识流， 它是一部关于 对思想和世界的体验为主题的影片。

translation.en: Consciousness is one of the fundamental facts  of human existence.
translation.zh: 意识是人类之所以存在 的基本事实之一。

translation.en: Each of us is conscious.
translation.zh: 我们每个人都是有意识的。

translation.en: We all have our own inner movie,  you and you and you.
translation.zh: 我们都有自己的内心电影， 包括你、你、还有你。

translation.en: There's nothing we know about more directly.
translation.zh: 没有什么是我们能直接了解的。

translation.en: At least, I know about my consciousness directly.
translation.zh: 至少，我能直接了解我的意识。

translation.en: I can't be certain that you guys are conscious.
translation.zh: 我不确定你们是否也能意识到这点。

translation.en: Consciousness also is what makes life worth living.
translation.zh: 意识也是一种让生命值得活下去的东西。

translation.en: If we weren't conscious, nothing in our lives  would have meaning or value.
translation.zh: 如果我们没有意识，那么我们生命中的任何事情 都失去了意义和价值。

translation.en: But at the same time, it's the most  mysterious phenomenon in the universe.
translation.zh: 同时，意识也是 最宇宙中最神秘的现象。

translation.en: Why are we conscious?
translation.zh: 为什么我们会有意识？

translation.en: Why do we have these inner movies?
translation.zh: 为什么我们会有这些内心电影？

translation.en: Why aren't we just robots  who process all this input,  produce all that output,  without experiencing the inner movie at all?
translation.zh: 为什么我们不只是那种 处理输入 再输出结果 而不会体验任何内心电影的机器人？

translation.en: Right now, nobody knows the answers  to those questions.
translation.zh: 目前为止，没有人知道这个问题 的答案。

translation.en: I'm going to suggest that to integrate consciousness  into science, some radical ideas may be needed.
translation.zh: 我想说如果要将意识整合 到科学中去，一些激进的想法也许是需要的。

translation.en: Some people say a science of consciousness  is impossible.
translation.zh: 有人说意识科学 是不可能存在的。

translation.en: Science, by its nature, is objective.
translation.zh: 科学，从它的本质上来看，是客观的。

translation.en: Consciousness, by its nature, is subjective.
translation.zh: 意识，从它的本质上来看，是主观的。

translation.en: So there can never be a science of consciousness.
translation.zh: 所以，不可能会有意识科学。

translation.en: For much of the 20th century, that view held sway.
translation.zh: 在20世纪的大部分时间里，这种观点占据统治地位。

translation.en: Psychologists studied behavior objectively,  neuroscientists studied the brain objectively,  and nobody even mentioned consciousness.
translation.zh: 心理学家客观地研究行为举止， 神经科学家客观地研究大脑， 但是没有人哪怕是提到意识。

translation.en: Even 30 years ago, when TED got started,  there was very little scientific work  on consciousness.
translation.zh: 即使30年前，当TED刚开始时， 也很少见到关于意识方面 的科学研究。

translation.en: Now, about 20 years ago,  all that began to change.
translation.zh: 大约在20年前， 所有这些都开始改变了。

translation.en: Neuroscientists like Francis Crick  and physicists like Roger Penrose  said now is the time for science  to attack consciousness.
translation.zh: 像弗朗西斯·克里克这样的神经科学家 以及像罗杰·彭罗斯这样的物理学家 都说现在正是科学向意识方面进攻 的时候。

translation.en: And since then, there's been a real explosion,  a flowering of scientific work  on consciousness.
translation.zh: 从那以来， 关于意识方面的科学研究 遍地开花。

translation.en: And this work has been wonderful. It's been great.
translation.zh: 这项研究很奇妙，很了不起。

translation.en: But it also has some fundamental  limitations so far.
translation.zh: 但是迄今为止它也还有一些 根本的局限性。

translation.en: The centerpiece  of the science of consciousness in recent years  has been the search for correlations,  correlations between certain areas of the brain  and certain states of consciousness.
translation.zh: 近几年 意识科学研究的核心 是寻找相关性， 关于大脑的特定区域 和特定的意识状态之间的相关性。

translation.en: We saw some of this kind of work  from Nancy Kanwisher and the wonderful work  she presented just a few minutes ago.
translation.zh: 我们看了南希·坎维舍 做的一些这方面的研究以及几分钟之前 她刚刚提交的精彩工作。

translation.en: Now we understand much better, for example,  the kinds of brain areas that go along with  the conscious experience of seeing faces  or of feeling pain  or of feeling happy.
translation.zh: 现在我们有了更好的理解，例如， 不同的大脑区域对应着不同 的意识体验：人脸识别 或者感受痛苦 或者感受快乐。

translation.en: But this is still a science of correlations.
translation.zh: 但这仍然是关于相关性的科学。

translation.en: It's not a science of explanations.
translation.zh: 这不是意识科学。

translation.en: We know that these brain areas  go along with certain kinds of conscious experience,  but we don't know why they do.
translation.zh: 我们知道这些大脑区域 对应着特定的意识体验， 但是我们不知道为什么会这样。

translation.en: I like to put this by saying  that this kind of work from neuroscience  is answering some of the questions  we want answered about consciousness,  the questions about what certain brain areas do  and what they correlate with.
translation.zh: 我想说的是， 神经科学方面的这种研究 正回答着那些 我们想要回答的关于意识、 关于某些特定大脑区域做些什么 以及对应哪种的问题。

translation.en: But in a certain sense, those are the easy problems.
translation.zh: 但是从某种意义上来说，这些都是简单的问题。

translation.en: No knock on the neuroscientists.
translation.zh: 都不是神经科学家想要研究的。

translation.en: There are no truly easy problems with consciousness.
translation.zh: 没有真正的关于意识的简单问题。

translation.en: But it doesn't address the real mystery  at the core of this subject:  why is it that all that physical processing in a brain  should be accompanied by consciousness at all?
translation.zh: 它没能解开关于这个课题的核心 的真正谜团： 为什么大脑中所有的物理过程 必须伴随着意识？

translation.en: Why is there this inner subjective movie?
translation.zh: 为什么会有这种内心的主观电影的存在？

translation.en: Right now, we don't really have a bead on that.
translation.zh: 目前为止，我们对此还没有一点头绪。

translation.en: And you might say,  let's just give neuroscience a few years.
translation.zh: 也许你会说， 让我们再给神经科学几年时间。

translation.en: It'll turn out to be another emergent phenomenon  like traffic jams, like hurricanes,  like life, and we'll figure it out.
translation.zh: 它会被证明是另一种涌现现象， 就像塞车、就像飓风、 就像生命一样，并且我们会弄明白它。

translation.en: The classical cases of emergence  are all cases of emergent behavior,  how a traffic jam behaves,  how a hurricane functions,  how a living organism reproduces  and adapts and metabolizes,  all questions about objective functioning.
translation.zh: 所有涌现现象的经典案例 都是应急行为的表现， 塞车是如何行成的， 飓风是如何作用的， 生物体是如何繁殖、 适应环境和新陈代谢的， 所有这些问题都是关于客观机能的。

translation.en: You could apply that to the human brain  in explaining some of the behaviors  and the functions of the human brain  as emergent phenomena:  how we walk, how we talk, how we play chess,  all these questions about behavior.
translation.zh: 你可以把它应用到人类的大脑上 去解释为什么人类大脑的某些行为 和功能 跟涌现现象很像： 我们如何走路，如何谈话，如何下象棋， 所有这些问题都是关于行为的。

translation.en: But when it comes to consciousness,  questions about behavior  are among the easy problems.
translation.zh: 但是当谈到意识时， 关于行为的问题 只是一个简单的问题。

translation.en: When it comes to the hard problem,  that's the question of why is it  that all this behavior  is accompanied by subjective experience?
translation.zh: 当涉及到困难问题时， 问题就变成了为什么 所有的这些行为 都伴随着主观体验。

translation.en: And here, the standard paradigm  of emergence,  even the standard paradigms of neuroscience,  don't really, so far, have that much to say.
translation.zh: 对此，涌现现象 的标准范例， 甚至神经科学的标准范例， 到目前为止都没有太多可以说的。

translation.en: Now, I'm a scientific materialist at heart.
translation.zh: 现在，我本质上是一个科学唯物主义者。

translation.en: I want a scientific theory of consciousness  that works,  and for a long time, I banged my head  against the wall  looking for a theory of consciousness  in purely physical terms  that would work.
translation.zh: 我希望某种关于意识的科学理论 能够奏效， 在过去很长一段时间里， 我埋头苦干， 努力寻找一种有效的 单从物理的角度去解释的 关于意识的理论。

translation.en: But I eventually came to the conclusion  that that just didn't work for systematic reasons.
translation.zh: 但我最终得出一个结论， 那就是它不起作用只是因为系统性的原因。

translation.en: It's a long story,  but the core idea is just that what you get  from purely reductionist explanations in physical terms, in brain-based terms,  is stories about the functioning of a system,  its structure, its dynamics,  the behavior it produces,  great for solving the easy problems —  how we behave, how we function —  but when it comes to subjective experience —  why does all this feel like something from the inside? —
translation.zh: 说来话长， 但是这个故事的核心就是 你从在物理方面，在基于大脑方面的 纯粹的还原论者的解释中得到的东西， 是关于一个系统的功能、 它的结构、它的动力、 以及它所产生的行为的， 它可以很好地解决简单问题—— 比如说我们如何表现，我们如何活动—— 但是当它涉及到主观体验时—— 比如说为什么所有这些都感觉像是来自内心的某些东西？——

translation.en: that's something fundamentally new,  and it's always a further question.
translation.zh: 这是一些全新的东西， 并且它总会成为一个更深层次的问题。

translation.en: So I think we're at a kind of impasse here.
translation.zh: 因此我想我们进入了僵局。

translation.en: We've got this wonderful, great chain of explanation,  we're used to it, where physics explains chemistry,  chemistry explains biology,  biology explains parts of psychology.
translation.zh: 我们已经有了一套美妙的、伟大的解释链， 我们已经习惯了它，那就是用用物理解释化学， 用化学解释生物， 用生物解释部分心理学。

translation.en: But consciousness  doesn't seem to fit into this picture.
translation.zh: 但是意识 似乎并不符合这种情形。

translation.en: On the one hand, it's a datum  that we're conscious.
translation.zh: 一方面，它是一个已知数 即我们是有意识的。

translation.en: On the other hand, we don't know how  to accommodate it into our scientific view of the world.
translation.zh: 另一方面，我们却并不知道 如何使它与我们的科学的世界观相适应。

translation.en: So I think consciousness right now  is a kind of anomaly,  one that we need to integrate  into our view of the world, but we don't yet see how.
translation.zh: 所以我认为就目前而言意识 是一种反常事物， 是一种需要我们将它整合到 我们的世界观中，而我们却还不知道如何整合的事物。

translation.en: Faced with an anomaly like this,  radical ideas may be needed,  and I think that we may need one or two ideas  that initially seem crazy  before we can come to grips with consciousness  scientifically. Now, there are a few candidates  for what those crazy ideas might be.
translation.zh: 面对这样的反常事物， 我们可能需要一些激进的想法， 并且我认为我们可能需要一两个 在我们可以科学地 面对意识之前 看起来很疯狂的想法。 现在，对于这些疯狂的想法可能是什么

translation.en: My friend Dan Dennett, who's here today, has one.
translation.zh: 已经有了一些候选项。 我的朋友丹·丹尼特就有一个这样的想法，他今天也在这里。

translation.en: His crazy idea is that there is no hard problem  of consciousness.
translation.zh: 他的疯狂想法是关于意识 的困难问题并不存在。

translation.en: The whole idea of the inner subjective movie  involves a kind of illusion or confusion.
translation.zh: 整个内心主观电影的想法 涉及一种幻觉或困惑。

translation.en: Actually, all we've got to do is explain  the objective functions, the behaviors of the brain,  and then we've explained everything  that needs to be explained.
translation.zh: 事实上，我们现在要做的就是解释 客观功能和大脑行为， 然后自然地我们就解释了 所有需要被解释的。

translation.en: Well I say, more power to him.
translation.zh: 我想说，给他更多的能量。

translation.en: That's the kind of radical idea that we need to explore  if you want to have a purely reductionist  brain-based theory of consciousness.
translation.zh: 这就是那种我们需要去探索的 激进想法， 如果你想获得关于意识的 纯还原论者的基于大脑的理论的话。

translation.en: At the same time, for me and for many other people,  that view is a bit too close to simply  denying the datum of consciousness  to be satisfactory.
translation.zh: 同时，对于我和其他很多人来说， 这个观点有一点太接近于简单地 否认关于意识的已知资料 而不能令人满意。

translation.en: So I go in a different direction.
translation.zh: 因此我选择了另一个不同的方向。

translation.en: In the time remaining,  I want to explore two crazy ideas  that I think may have some promise.
translation.zh: 在余下的时间里， 我想探讨两个我认为可能有希望的 疯狂想法。

translation.en: The first crazy idea  is that consciousness is fundamental.
translation.zh: 第一种疯狂想法是 意识是一种基本概念。

translation.en: Physicists sometimes take some aspects of the universe  as fundamental building blocks:  space and time and mass.
translation.zh: 物理学家有时候会把宇宙中的某些方面 作为基本概念，如： 空间、时间和质量。

translation.en: They postulate fundamental laws governing them,  like the laws of gravity or of quantum mechanics.
translation.zh: 他们设定了一些基本定律去管理它们， 例如重力定律和量子力学定律。

translation.en: These fundamental properties and laws  aren't explained in terms of anything more basic.
translation.zh: 这些基本性质和定律 不能解释一些更基础的东西。

translation.en: Rather, they're taken as primitive,  and you build up the world from there.
translation.zh: 这相当于以它们为根本， 然后你在它们的基础上建立这个世界。

translation.en: Now sometimes, the list of fundamentals expands.
translation.zh: 现在，这张基本定律名单会不时扩大。

translation.en: In the 19th century, Maxwell figured out  that you can't explain electromagnetic phenomena in terms of the existing fundamentals —  space, time, mass, Newton's laws —  so he postulated fundamental laws  of electromagnetism  and postulated electric charge  as a fundamental element  that those laws govern.
translation.zh: 在19世纪，麦克斯韦断定 你无法用当时存在的基本概念—— 空间、时间、质量、牛顿定律—— 去解释电磁现象， 因此他设定了电磁学的 基本定律， 并且设定了电荷 作为这些定律的 基本元素。

translation.en: I think that's the situation we're in  with consciousness.
translation.zh: 我认为这与我们在研究意识上的 情形是一样的。

translation.en: If you can't explain consciousness in terms of the existing fundamentals —  space, time, mass, charge —  then as a matter of logic, you need to expand the list.
translation.zh: 如果我们不能用现存的基本概念—— 时间、空间、质量、电荷—— 去解释意识， 那么从逻辑上而言，你需要去扩充这张名单。

translation.en: The natural thing to do is to postulate  consciousness itself as something fundamental,  a fundamental building block of nature.
translation.zh: 接下来将意识本身设定为 某种根本性的东西， 作为自然界的基本概念就是一件自然而然的事。

translation.en: This doesn't mean you suddenly can't do science with it.
translation.zh: 这并不意味着突然间你不能用它来研究科学了。

translation.en: This opens up the way for you to do science with it.
translation.zh: 这反而是为你开僻了一条用它来研究科学的道路。

translation.en: What we then need is to study  the fundamental laws governing consciousness,  the laws that connect consciousness  to other fundamentals: space, time, mass,  physical processes.
translation.zh: 然后我们需要做的就是研究 那些掌控着意识的基本定律， 那些将意识与其它基本概念—— 空间、时间、质量、物理过程—— 联系在一起的定律。

translation.en: Physicists sometimes say  that we want fundamental laws so simple  that we could write them on the front of a t-shirt.
translation.zh: 物理学家有时候说 我们希望那些基本定律可以简单到 能够把它们写在T恤上。

translation.en: Well I think something like that is the situation  we're in with consciousness.
translation.zh: 我想我们在对意识的研究上 也应该这样。

translation.en: We want to find fundamental laws so simple  we could write them on the front of a t-shirt.
translation.zh: 我希望我们发现的关于意识的基本定律也可以简单到 能够把它们写在T恤上。

translation.en: We don't know what those laws are yet,  but that's what we're after.
translation.zh: 我们现在还不知道这些定律是什么， 但这是我们正在寻找的。

translation.en: The second crazy idea  is that consciousness might be universal.
translation.zh: 第二个疯狂的想法 是意识也许是普通存在的。

translation.en: Every system might have some degree  of consciousness.
translation.zh: 也许每个系统都有某种程度的 意识。

translation.en: This view is sometimes called panpsychism:  pan for all, psych for mind,  every system is conscious,  not just humans, dogs, mice, flies,  but even Rob Knight's microbes,  elementary particles.
translation.zh: 这种观点有时被称作泛心论： 万物皆有精神或心理活动， 每个系统都具有意识， 不仅是人类、狗、老鼠、苍蝇， 甚至连罗伯·奈特的微生物、 基本粒子都具有意识。

translation.en: Even a photon has some degree of consciousness.
translation.zh: 甚至连一个光子都有某种程度的意识。

translation.en: The idea is not that photons are intelligent  or thinking.
translation.zh: 这个观点不是说光子是智能的 或者能思考的。

translation.en: It's not that a photon  is wracked with angst  because it's thinking, "Aww, I'm always buzzing around near the speed of light.
translation.zh: 不是说一个光子 会由于焦虑而被破坏， 而这种焦虑是因为它想着“哦，我总是以接近光速的速度

translation.en: I never get to slow down and smell the roses."
translation.zh: 紧张地跑来跑去，从来没有放慢速度来闻一闻玫瑰花香“。

translation.en: No, not like that.
translation.zh: 不，事情不是这样子的。

translation.en: But the thought is maybe photons might have  some element of raw, subjective feeling,  some primitive precursor to consciousness.
translation.zh: 这种观点想要表达的是也许光子可能会有 一些原始的、主观的体验， 一些原始的意识的前兆。

translation.en: This may sound a bit kooky to you.
translation.zh: 对你来说，这听起来可能有点怪。

translation.en: I mean, why would anyone think such a crazy thing?
translation.zh: 我的意思是，为什么不可以有人思考这样疯狂的事呢？

translation.en: Some motivation comes from the first crazy idea,  that consciousness is fundamental.
translation.zh: 有一些动机来自第一个疯狂想法， 即意识是基本概念。

translation.en: If it's fundamental, like space and time and mass,  it's natural to suppose that it might be universal too,  the way they are.
translation.zh: 如果它是基本概念，就像空间、时间和质量一样， 那么很自然地可以假定它也可能具有普遍性， 就像其它的基本概念一样。

translation.en: It's also worth noting that although the idea  seems counterintuitive to us,  it's much less counterintuitive to people  from different cultures,  where the human mind is seen as much more  continuous with nature.
translation.zh: 还有一点值得注意的是虽然这个想法 对我们来说是违反直觉的， 但对来自其他文化的人来说 可能就不是那么违反直觉了， 那些人的心灵 跟自然联系在一起的时间更长。

translation.en: A deeper motivation comes from the idea that  perhaps the most simple and powerful way  to find fundamental laws connecting consciousness  to physical processing  is to link consciousness to information.
translation.zh: 从这个想法中得到的一个更深的动机是 也许找出将意识与物理过程 联系在一起的 最简单和最有力的方式 就是将意识与信息相结合。

translation.en: Wherever there's information processing,  there's consciousness.
translation.zh: 有信息处理的地方 就有意识。

translation.en: Complex information processing, like in a human,  complex consciousness.
translation.zh: 复杂的信息处理，比如说人类的信息处理， 伴随着复杂的意识。

translation.en: Simple information processing,  simple consciousness.
translation.zh: 简单的信息处理， 伴随着简单的意识。

translation.en: A really exciting thing is in recent years  a neuroscientist, Giulio Tononi,  has taken this kind of theory  and developed it rigorously  with a mathematical theory.
translation.zh: 一件令人很兴奋的事是最近几年 有一个神经科学家，朱利奥·托诺尼 采用了这种理论 并且严格按照数学理论 的方式发展了它。

translation.en: He has a mathematical measure  of information integration  which he calls phi,  measuring the amount of information  integrated in a system.
translation.zh: 他有一个关于信息整合 的数学测量， 他称之为phi， 他用它来测量 一个系统中的信息整合的量。

translation.en: And he supposes that phi goes along  with consciousness.
translation.zh: 他推断phi 是与意识相关的。

translation.en: So in a human brain,  incredibly large amount of information integration,  high degree of phi,  a whole lot of consciousness.
translation.zh: 所以在人类的大脑中， 有着令人难以置信的信息整合量， 高度的phi值， 一大堆的意识。

translation.en: In a mouse, medium degree of information integration,  still pretty significant,  pretty serious amount of consciousness.
translation.zh: 在老鼠的大脑中，有中度的信息整合量， 但仍然数目庞大， 仍然具有大量的意识。

translation.en: But as you go down to worms,  microbes, particles,  the amount of phi falls off.
translation.zh: 但是当你将研究目标降至蠕虫、 微生物、粒子， phi的值就会跌落。

translation.en: The amount of information integration falls off,  but it's still non-zero.
translation.zh: 信息整合量会跌落， 但不会为零。

translation.en: On Tononi's theory,  there's still going to be a non-zero degree  of consciousness.
translation.zh: 在托诺尼的理论中， 意识程度 也不会降为零。

translation.en: In effect, he's proposing a fundamental law  of consciousness: high phi, high consciousness.
translation.zh: 事实上，他正在提出这样一个关于意识的 基本定律：phi值越高，意识度也越高。

translation.en: Now, I don't know if this theory is right,  but it's actually perhaps the leading theory right now  in the science of consciousness,  and it's been used to integrate a whole range  of scientific data,  and it does have a nice property that it is in fact simple enough  you can write it on the front of a t-shirt.
translation.zh: 现在，我不知道这个理论是否正确， 但是实际上或许它正处于 意识科学的理论前沿， 并且它已经被用于整合 各方面的科学数据， 它还有一个很好的属性就是它足够简单， 简单到你可以将它写在T恤上。

translation.en: Another final motivation is that  panpsychism might help us to integrate  consciousness into the physical world.
translation.zh: 另外一个最终动机就是 泛心论可以帮助我们 将意识和物理世界相结合。

translation.en: Physicists and philosophers have often observed  that physics is curiously abstract.
translation.zh: 物理学家和哲学家经常注意到 物理学是深奥抽象的。

translation.en: It describes the structure of reality  using a bunch of equations,  but it doesn't tell us about the reality  that underlies it.
translation.zh: 它用一连串的方程式 去描述现实结构， 但是它又不告诉我们 构成它的现实基础。

translation.en: As Stephen Hawking puts it,  what puts the fire into the equations?
translation.zh: 正如史蒂芬·霍金所说， 是什么将火放进方程式的？

translation.en: Well, on the panpsychist view,  you can leave the equations of physics as they are,  but you can take them to be describing  the flux of consciousness.
translation.zh: 而在泛心论者看来， 物理方程可以是它现在的样子， 但是你也可以用它来描述 意识的量。

translation.en: That's what physics really is ultimately doing,  describing the flux of consciousness.
translation.zh: 这是物理学最终要做的， 描述意识的量。

translation.en: On this view, it's consciousness  that puts the fire into the equations.
translation.zh: 用这种观点看来，是意识 将火放到了方程中。

translation.en: On that view, consciousness doesn't dangle  outside the physical world  as some kind of extra.
translation.zh: 在那种观点看来，意识 不是晃荡在物质世界之外 的特别的东西。

translation.en: It's there right at its heart.
translation.zh: 它存在于物质世界的核心。

translation.en: This view, I think, the panpsychist view,  has the potential to transfigure our relationship  to nature,  and it may have some pretty serious social  and ethical consequences.
translation.zh: 我认为，这种泛心论者的观点， 有那种使我们对我们与自然的关系产生改观 的潜能， 并且它可能产生一些相当严重的 社会和伦理方面的后果。

translation.en: Some of these may be counterintuitive.
translation.zh: 它们当中的一些可能是违反直觉的。

translation.en: I used to think I shouldn't eat anything  which is conscious,  so therefore I should be vegetarian.
translation.zh: 我曾经想我不可以 吃任何有意识的东西， 因此我要做一个素食主义者。

translation.en: Now, if you're a panpsychist and you take that view,  you're going to go very hungry.
translation.zh: 但是现，如果你是一个泛心论者并且采用这种观点， 你只能挨饿。

translation.en: So I think when you think about it,  this tends to transfigure your views,  whereas what matters for ethical purposes  and moral considerations,  not so much the fact of consciousness,  but the degree and the complexity of consciousness.
translation.zh: 因此我想当你思考它的时候， 这将会使你有改变观点的倾向， 然而对于伦理目标 和道德考量来说 最重要的不是关于意识的事实， 而是意识的程度和复杂性。

translation.en: It's also natural to ask about consciousness in other systems, like computers.
translation.zh: 探讨其它系统，比如说电脑中的意识

translation.en: What about the artificially intelligent system  in the movie "Her," Samantha?
translation.zh: 也是一件很自然的事情。 比如说电影《她》中的 人工智能系统萨曼莎是什么情况？

translation.en: Is she conscious?
translation.zh: 她有意识吗？

translation.en: Well, if you take the informational,  panpsychist view,  she certainly has complicated information processing  and integration,  so the answer is very likely yes, she is conscious.
translation.zh: 如果你用这种信息性的， 泛心论者的角度来看， 她的确能进行复杂的信息处理 和整合， 所以答案很有可能是“是”，她是有意识的。

translation.en: If that's right, it raises pretty serious  ethical issues about both the ethics of developing intelligent computer systems  and the ethics of turning them off.
translation.zh: 如果这个答案正确的话， 那么不管是开发智能计算机系统 或者关闭他们 都会引起严重的伦理问题。

translation.en: Finally, you might ask about the consciousness  of whole groups,  the planet.
translation.zh: 最后，你可能会询问 集体意识、 行星的意识。

translation.en: Does Canada have its own consciousness?
translation.zh: 加拿大有它自己的意识吗？

translation.en: Or at a more local level,  like the audience at a TED conference,  are we right now having a collective TED consciousness,  for this collective TED group  which is distinct from the inner movies  of each of our parts?
translation.zh: 或者在一个更地方的层面来说， 一个由一场TED大会的听众 所组成的集体 拥有集体的TED意识吗， 这个TED集体 的内在电影 是与我们每个人自己 的内在电影不同吗？

translation.en: I don't know the answer to that question,  but I think it's at least one  worth taking seriously.
translation.zh: 我不知道这个问题的答案， 但我觉得至少它 值得重视。

translation.en: Okay, so this panpsychist vision,  it is a radical one,  and I don't know that it's correct.
translation.zh: 好了，这就是泛心论者的观点， 它是一个激进的想法， 而我不知道它是否正确。

translation.en: I'm actually more confident about the first crazy idea,  that consciousness is fundamental,  than about the second one,  that it's universal.
translation.zh: 事实上我对第一个疯狂想法 即意识是一种基本概念， 要比对第二个疯狂想法 即意识是普遍存在的 要更有把握。

translation.en: I mean, the view raises any number of questions,  has any number of challenges,  like how do those little bits  of consciousness add up  to the kind of complex consciousness  If we can answer those questions,  then I think we're going to be well on our way  to a serious theory of consciousness.
translation.zh: 我的意思是，这个观点引起了很多问题， 拥有很多挑战， 比如说那些小的意识 是如何添加到 我们了解和喜爱 的复杂意识中去的。 如果我们能够回答这些问题， 那么我想我们就会在通往 关于意识的严肃理论的道路上顺利走下去。

translation.en: If not, well, this is the hardest problem perhaps  in science and philosophy.
translation.zh: 如果不能，那么这可能成为 科学上和哲学上最难解的问题。

translation.en: We can't expect to solve it overnight.
translation.zh: 我们不能期盼一个晚上就能解决这个问题。

translation.en: But I do think we're going to figure it out eventually.
translation.zh: 但是我相信我们终将弄明白它。

translation.en: Understanding consciousness is a real key, I think,  both to understanding the universe  and to understanding ourselves.
translation.zh: 我想，理解意识是 我们理解宇宙 和理解我们自己的一个关键。

translation.en: It may just take the right crazy idea.
translation.zh: 而做到这一点也许只需要我们采用正确的疯狂想法。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: I grew up in a very small country town  I had a very normal, low-key kind of upbringing.
translation.zh: 我在维多利亚的 一个小乡镇长大。 我受的教育平凡而普通。

translation.en: I went to school, I hung out with my friends,  I fought with my younger sisters.
translation.zh: 我上学，跟朋友一起玩， 跟妹妹们吵架。

translation.en: It was all very normal.
translation.zh: 一切都再普通不过了。

translation.en: And when I was 15, a member of my local community  approached my parents  and wanted to nominate me  for a community achievement award.
translation.zh: 在我15岁的时候，一名社区的工作人员 找到我的父母， 想要提名我 一个社区成就奖。

translation.en: And my parents said, "Hm, that's really nice,  but there's kind of one glaring problem with that.
translation.zh: 我的父母说：“嗯，这是件好事儿， 不过有个比较明显的问题。

translation.en: She hasn't actually achieved anything."   And they were right, you know.
translation.zh: 她从来也没取得什么成就啊。“ 他们说的对。

translation.en: I went to school, I got good marks,  I had a very low-key after school job  in my mum's hairdressing salon,  and I spent a lot of time watching  "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" and "Dawson's Creek."
translation.zh: 我上学，成绩还不错。 毕业之后在妈妈的 发型设计沙龙有个很普通的工作， 我还花很多时间看各种肥皂剧， 比如”吸血鬼猎人巴菲“和”恋爱时代“。

translation.en: Yeah, I know. What a contradiction.
translation.zh: 没错，是有点矛盾。

translation.en: But they were right, you know.
translation.zh: 不过他们说得对，

translation.en: I wasn't doing anything that was out of the ordinary  at all.
translation.zh: 我压根儿也没有过任何 不寻常的作为。

translation.en: I wasn't doing anything that could be considered an achievement  if you took disability out of the equation.
translation.zh: 我从来也没做过任何可以被当做是成就的事情， 如果不考虑身体有缺陷这一点的话。

translation.en: Years later, I was on my second teaching round  in a Melbourne high school,  and I was about 20 minutes into a year 11 legal studies class  when this boy put up his hand and said,  "Hey miss, when are you going to start doing your speech?"
translation.zh: 几年以后，我再次回到 一个墨尔本高中的教书， 当我在11年级的一堂法律课上刚讲了大概20分钟时， 一个男孩举手问道： “女士，你什么时候才能开始演讲？”

translation.en: And I said, "What speech?"
translation.zh: 我说：”什么演讲？“

translation.en: You know, I'd been talking them  about defamation law for a good 20 minutes.
translation.zh: 事实上，我已经就诽谤法 讲了二十多分钟了。

translation.en: And he said, "You know, like,  your motivational speaking.
translation.zh: 然后他说：”比方说 励志演说什么的。

translation.en: You know, when people in wheelchairs come to school,  they usually say, like, inspirational stuff?"
translation.zh: 当坐着轮椅的人来到学校， 他们一般都会说一些鼓舞人心的故事，是吧？“

translation.en: "It's usually in the big hall."
translation.zh: ”不过这种演讲一般都是在大报告厅里进行的呀。“

translation.en: And that's when it dawned on me:  This kid had only ever experienced disabled people  as objects of inspiration.
translation.zh: 就是在那个时候我开始意识到： 这孩子一直把残障人士当做 一种励志对象。

translation.en: We are not, to this kid --  and it's not his fault, I mean,  that's true for many of us.
translation.zh: 对这个孩子来说，我们并不是什么激励对象， 这也不是他的错， 很多人都有这种想法。

translation.en: For lots of us, disabled people are not our teachers  or our doctors or our manicurists.
translation.zh: 对很多人来说，残障人士并不是老师， 医生或者美甲师。

translation.en: We're not real people. We are there to inspire.
translation.zh: 我们不是真实的人，我们的存在只是为了激励别人。

translation.en: And in fact, I am sitting on this stage  looking like I do in this wheelchair,  and you are probably kind of expecting me  to inspire you. Right?   Yeah.
translation.zh: 现在，我在这个讲台上， 坐着轮椅演讲， 你们可能多少也会期待我 能对你们有所激励，对吧？（观众笑声） 我说的没错吧。

translation.en: Well, ladies and gentlemen, I'm afraid  I'm going to disappoint you dramatically.
translation.zh: 不过，女士们先生们，恐怕 我要让你们非常失望了。

translation.en: I am not here to inspire you.
translation.zh: 我在这里不是为了激励你们。

translation.en: I am here to tell you that we have been lied to  about disability.
translation.zh: 我来这儿是想告诉你们 我们对残疾有错误的认识。

translation.en: Yeah, we've been sold the lie  that disability is a Bad Thing, capital B, capital T.
translation.zh: 没错，我们一直被错误的灌输 残疾是件坏事，很——糟——糕的事。

translation.en: It's a bad thing, and to live with a disability  makes you exceptional.
translation.zh: 这是件坏事，带着残缺生活 会让你与众不同。

translation.en: It's not a bad thing, and it doesn't  make you exceptional.
translation.zh: 其实，这并不是件坏事， 也不会让你变得多出众。

translation.en: And in the past few years, we've been able  to propagate this lie even further  via social media.
translation.zh: 在过去的几年，这个谎言 通过社交媒体 被传的更广了。

translation.en: You may have seen images like this one:  "The only disability in life is a bad attitude."
translation.zh: 你们可能看过这样的图片： ”生活中唯一的残缺就是消极的态度。“

translation.en: Or this one: "Your excuse is invalid." Indeed.
translation.zh: 或者这个：”你的理由不成立。”

translation.en: Or this one: "Before you quit, try!"
translation.zh: 亦或者：“不要轻易放弃，继续尝试！”

translation.en: These are just a couple of examples,  but there are a lot of these images out there.
translation.zh: 这只是其中的几个例子， 这样的图片还有很多。

translation.en: You know, you might have seen the one,  the little girl with no hands  drawing a picture with a pencil held in her mouth.
translation.zh: 你们还可能看到过这个， 一个没有手臂的小女孩儿 把笔刁在嘴里画画。

translation.en: You might have seen a child running  on carbon fiber prosthetic legs.
translation.zh: 你们可能也见过一个孩子借助 碳纤维义肢奔跑。

translation.en: And these images,  there are lots of them out there,  they are what we call inspiration porn.
translation.zh: 类似这样的图片， 太多了， 我们管这些叫励志情色片。

translation.en: And I use the term porn deliberately,  because they objectify one group of people  for the benefit of another group of people.
translation.zh: （观众笑声） 我故意用“情色片”这个词的， 因为他们为了另一群人的利益， 而把一群人物化。

translation.en: So in this case, we're objectifying disabled people  for the benefit of nondisabled people.
translation.zh: 现在，我们正在物化残障人士， 以满足非残障人士的利益。

translation.en: The purpose of these images  is to inspire you, to motivate you,  so that we can look at them  and think, "Well, however bad my life is,  it could be worse.
translation.zh: 这些图片是 想要鼓舞你们，激励你们， 这样我们看到这些残疾人的时候 就会想：“哦，我的生活再糟， 也还是有比我更糟的。

translation.en: I could be that person."
translation.zh: 还好我不是那个人。”

translation.en: But what if you are that person?
translation.zh: 但如果你就是那个人呢？

translation.en: I've lost count of the number of times that I've  been approached by strangers  wanting to tell me that they think I'm brave  or inspirational,  and this was long before my work  had any kind of public profile.
translation.zh: 我已经记不清有几次， 有陌生人向我走过来， 想要告诉我他们认为我很勇敢， 很励志， 这还是在我没有 成为公众人物之前的事。

translation.en: They were just kind of congratulating me  for managing to get up in the morning  and remember my own name.   And it is objectifying.
translation.zh: 他们只是因为我早上能够正常起床， 还能记着我自己的名字 而祝贺我。（观众笑声） 这就是物化。

translation.en: These images, those images  objectify disabled people  for the benefit of nondisabled people.
translation.zh: 这些图片 物化了残障人士，好让他们 能够激励非残障人士。

translation.en: They are there so that you can look at them  and think that things aren't so bad for you,  to put your worries into perspective.
translation.zh: 他们的存在，就在于能够让你们 庆幸自己过的还不坏， 把担心抛在脑后。

translation.en: And life as a disabled person  is actually somewhat difficult.
translation.zh: 不过残障人士的生活 的确有些挑战。

translation.en: We do overcome some things.
translation.zh: 我们确实需要克服一些困难。

translation.en: But the things that we're overcoming  are not the things that you think they are.
translation.zh: 不过我们需要克服的那些事 跟你们想像的不一样。

translation.en: They are not things to do with our bodies.
translation.zh: 这些事跟我们身体本身的缺陷没什么关系。

translation.en: I use the term "disabled people" quite deliberately,  because I subscribe to what's called the social model of disability,  which tells us that we are more disabled  by the society that we live in  than by our bodies and our diagnoses.
translation.zh: 我刻意使用“残疾人”这个词， 因为我可以接受这种社会普遍认同的残疾， 这让我们认识到，相比较我们身体本身的 缺陷和病症，我们所居住的社会 让我们更觉得自己是残疾人。

translation.en: So I have lived in this body a long time.
translation.zh: 其实我像现在这样已经相当久了。

translation.en: I'm quite fond of it.
translation.zh: 感觉还挺不错的。

translation.en: It does the things that I need it to do,  and I've learned to use it to the best of its capacity  just as you have,  and that's the thing about those kids in those pictures as well.
translation.zh: 我想做什么都能做， 而且我也知道怎么做那些力所能及的事儿， 就跟你们一样， 图片里的那些孩子也是这样。

translation.en: They're not doing anything out of the ordinary.
translation.zh: 他们并没做什么不同寻常的事儿。

translation.en: They are just using their bodies  to the best of their capacity.
translation.zh: 他们只是最大程度的 让自己的身体发挥功能。

translation.en: So is it really fair to objectify them  in the way that we do,  to share those images?
translation.zh: 那么通过传播这些图片 来物化他们 真的公平吗？

translation.en: People, when they say, "You're an inspiration,"  they mean it as a compliment.
translation.zh: 当人们说：”你真励志，” 他们以为这是一种赞美。

translation.en: And I know why it happens.
translation.zh: 我知道大家为什么这么做。

translation.en: It's because of the lie, it's because we've been sold  this lie that disability makes you exceptional.
translation.zh: 是因为我们一直以来都被灌输一种错误的思想： 残缺可以让你变得出色。

translation.en: And it honestly doesn't.
translation.zh: 其实不是。

translation.en: And I know what you're thinking.
translation.zh: 我知道你们在想什么。

translation.en: You know, I'm up here bagging out inspiration,  and you're thinking, "Jeez, Stella,  aren't you inspired sometimes by some things?"
translation.zh: 我在讲台上否认这种激励作用， 你们就会想：“天呐，史黛拉， 难道你就不会受其他事物的激励吗？”

translation.en: And the thing is, I am.
translation.zh: 事实是，我会。

translation.en: I learn from other disabled people all the time.
translation.zh: 我无时无刻不在从其他残障人士身上学习。

translation.en: I'm learning not that I am luckier than them, though.
translation.zh: 不过我学习，并不是我比他们幸运多少。

translation.en: I am learning that it's a genius idea  to use a pair of barbecue tongs  to pick up things that you dropped.   I'm learning that nifty trick where you can charge  your mobile phone battery from your chair battery.
translation.zh: 我学到的是，用烧烤棍 把你掉的东西捡起来 是个相当不错的主意。（观众笑声） 我觉得用电动轮椅的电池给手机充电 也是个绝妙的点子。

translation.en: Genius.
translation.zh: 太有才了！

translation.en: We are learning from each others' strength and endurance,  not against our bodies and our diagnoses,  but against a world that exceptionalizes  and objectifies us.
translation.zh: 我们互相学习彼此的坚强和隐忍， 不是对抗身体缺陷和疾病的坚强， 而是对抗整个社会区别对待我们， 物化我们的这种风气。

translation.en: I really think that this lie that we've been sold  about disability is the greatest injustice.
translation.zh: 我真心认为这种针对我们残障人士的谎言 就是最大的不公。

translation.en: It makes life hard for us.
translation.zh: 这让我们的生活变得很困难。

translation.en: And that quote, "The only disability in life  is a bad attitude,"  the reason that that's bullshit  is because it's just not true,  because of the social model of disability.
translation.zh: 还有那句名言：”生活中唯一的残疾 就是消极的态度“， 这简直就是胡说八道， 因为事实根本不是这样 这只是社会认同的残疾。

translation.en: No amount of smiling at a flight of stairs  has ever made it turn into a ramp.
translation.zh: 笑的再多也不会让你费力攀爬的楼梯 变成可以通过轮椅的斜坡。

translation.en: Never.    Smiling at a television screen  isn't going to make closed captions appear  for people who are deaf.
translation.zh: 永远都不会。（观众笑声） 对着电视机屏幕笑， 也不能让聋哑人听懂 没有字幕的节目。

translation.en: No amount of standing in the middle of a bookshop  and radiating a positive attitude  is going to turn all those books into braille.
translation.zh: 在书店里呆的再久， 释放再积极的正能量， 也不能把这些书变成盲文。

translation.en: It's just not going to happen.
translation.zh: 这都是不可能的事情。

translation.en: I really want to live in a world  where disability is not the exception, but the norm.
translation.zh: 我真心期待能活在这样一个世界里， 残疾不再是当成一种特殊， 仅仅是普通现象。

translation.en: sitting in her bedroom  watching "Buffy the Vampire Slayer"  isn't referred to as achieving anything  because she's doing it sitting down.
translation.zh: 一个坐在卧室里 看”吸血鬼猎人巴菲” 的15岁女孩， 不会因为她能正常坐着 就被提名什么成就奖。

translation.en: I want to live in a world  where we don't have such low expectations  of disabled people  that we are congratulated for getting out of bed and remembering our own names in the morning.
translation.zh: 在我期望的社会里， 人们不放低他们对 残障人士的期待， 不会因为他们早上能正常起床， 记得自己的名字

translation.en: I want to live in a world where we value genuine achievement  for disabled people,  and I want to live in a world  where a kid in year 11 in a Melbourne high school  is not one bit surprised that his new teacher is a wheelchair user.
translation.zh: 就对他们大加赞赏。 我期待的社会，人们会认可残障人士 真正的成就， 我期待的社会里， 一个墨尔本高中11岁的孩子 不会因为他的新老师需要轮椅代步

translation.en: Disability doesn't make you exceptional,  but questioning what you think you know about it does.
translation.zh: 残障不会让你变得出色， 但质疑你原本自以为了解的事物，可以让你进步。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家。

translation.en: What do augmented reality  and professional football  have to do with empathy?
translation.zh: 扩增实境 职业橄榄球 这二者和同理心有何关系？

translation.en: And what is the air speed velocity  of an unladen swallow?
translation.zh: 未负重的燕子 飞行的空速是多少？

translation.en: Now unfortunately, I'm only going to answer  one of those questions today,  so please, try and contain your disappointment.
translation.zh: 遗憾的是 今天我只会回答其中一个问题 所以请不要感到沮丧

translation.en: When most people think about augmented reality,  they think about "Minority Report" and Tom Cruise  waving his hands in the air,  but augmented reality is not science fiction.
translation.zh: 当大多数人想到扩增实境时 他们会想到电影“少数派报告“ 以及汤姆·克鲁斯 在空中挥舞着双手的场景 但扩增实境并不是科幻小说

translation.en: Augmented reality is something that will happen  in our lifetime, and it will happen  because we have the tools to make it happen,  and people need to be aware of that,  because augmented reality will change our lives  just as much as the Internet and the cell phone.
translation.zh: 这项技术 会在我们有生之年成为现实 因为我们有办法去实现它 大家需要意识到这点 扩增实境将改变我们的生活 如同互联网和手机那样

translation.en: Now how do we get to augmented reality?
translation.zh: 那么我们怎么才能实现扩增实境呢？

translation.en: Step one is the step I'm wearing right now,  Google Glass.
translation.zh: 首先就是戴上我现在用的这个东西 谷歌眼镜

translation.en: I'm sure many of you are familiar with Google Glass.
translation.zh: 相信在场有很多人都对它不陌生

translation.en: What you may not be familiar with  is that Google Glass is a device  that will allow you to see what I see.
translation.zh: 但你可能并不知道 谷歌眼镜还可以 让你看到我所看到的一切

translation.en: It will allow you to experience what it is like  to be a professional athlete on the field.
translation.zh: 它能让你体会到 身为职业运动员在赛场上的感受

translation.en: Right now, the only way you can be on the field  is for me to try and describe it to you.
translation.zh: 而现在，要想体会这种感受的唯一方式 就是听我试图去向你描述

translation.en: I have to use words.
translation.zh: 我必须要借助语言

translation.en: I have to create a framework that you then fill in  with your imagination.
translation.zh: 来建立起一个框架 然后你运用想像力去充实它

translation.en: With Google Glass, we can put that  underneath a helmet,  and we can get a sense of what it's like  to be running down the field at 100 miles an hour,  your blood pounding in your ears.
translation.zh: 而有了谷歌眼镜 我们可以把它放在橄榄球头盔下 这样我们就能体会到 以100英里／小时的速度 在球场上奔跑的感受 你能听到血液在耳中 怦怦搏动的声音

translation.en: You can get a sense of what it's like  to have a 250-pound man  sprinting at you  trying to decapitate you  with every ounce of his being.
translation.zh: 还能体会到 一个250磅重的人 向你飞奔而来的感受 他竭尽全力 要把你放倒 我就曾被放倒过

translation.en: and it doesn't feel very good.
translation.zh: 那感觉可不怎么样

translation.en: Now, I have some footage to show you of what it's like  to wear Google Glass underneath the helmet  to give you a taste of that.
translation.zh: 下面这段视频将展示 头盔下的谷歌眼镜所记录的片段 让你体验一把

translation.en: Unfortunately, it's not NFL practice footage  because the NFL thinks emergent technology  is what happens when a submarine surfaces,  but —  — we do what we can.
translation.zh: 遗憾的是这并不是 橄榄球联盟的训练视频 因为他们觉得新兴技术 是在潜水艇浮出水时才会发生的事儿  但是我们尽力而为

translation.en: So let's pull up some video.
translation.zh: 让我们来看看这段视频

translation.en: Chris Kluwe: Go.
translation.zh: 克里斯·柯鲁威：走你

translation.en: Ugh, getting tackled sucks.
translation.zh: 我了个去，被拦阻太不爽了

translation.en: Hold on, let's get a little closer.
translation.zh: 稍等，等我走近点儿

translation.en: All right, ready?
translation.zh: 准备好了吗？

translation.en: Go!
translation.zh: 走你！

translation.en: Chris Kluwe: So as you can see,  small taste of what it's like to get tackled  on the football field  from the perspective of the tacklee.
translation.zh: 克瑞斯·柯鲁威：就像你看到的 这段视频让你体会到 在球场上被拦阻的感受 是从被拦阻者的角度去体验

translation.en: Now, you may have noticed there are  some people missing there:  the rest of the team.
translation.zh: 现在你可能注意到 球场上少了些什么人 少了球队的其他成员

translation.en: We have some video of that  courtesy of the University of Washington.
translation.zh: 还有段视频 由华盛顿大学提供

translation.en: Quarterback: Hey, Mice 54! Mice 54!
translation.zh: 四分卫：嘿！ Mice 54! Mice 54!

translation.en: Blue 8! Blue 8! Go!
translation.zh: 蓝色球衣8号! 蓝色球衣8号! 走起！

translation.en: Oh!
translation.zh: 啊！

translation.en: CK: So again, this takes you a little bit closer  to what it's like to be on that field,  but this is nowhere what it's like  to be on the NFL.
translation.zh: 克里斯 柯鲁威：这又让你更近距离地 去体验在球场的感受 但这和橄榄球联盟比赛相比 完全不是同一种感觉

translation.en: Fans want that experience.
translation.zh: 粉丝想要体验身处那种比赛中的感觉

translation.en: Fans want to be on that field.
translation.zh: 他们想要体会在球场上的感觉

translation.en: They want to be their favorite players,  and they've already talked to me on YouTube,  they've talked to me on Twitter, saying,  "Hey, can you get this on a quarterback?
translation.zh: 他们想要变身为他们最喜欢的球员 粉丝们已经在YouTube上和我谈起了这点 还在推特上跟我说起这事儿 “嗨，你能不能让个四分卫戴上这眼镜？“

translation.en: Can you get this on a running back?
translation.zh: “让跑卫也戴上它？“

translation.en: We want that experience."
translation.zh: “我们也想感受一把。”

translation.en: Well, once we have that experience with GoPro  and Google Glass,  how do we make it more immersive?
translation.zh: 当我们有了GoPro摄像机 还有谷歌眼镜后 我们怎么才能提供更仿真式的体验呢？

translation.en: How do we take that next step?
translation.zh: 下一步该做些什么呢？

translation.en: Well, we take that step  by going to something called the Oculus Rift,  which I'm sure many of you are also familiar with.
translation.zh: 接下来 就是利用头戴式显示器， 相信你们大多数人对它也很熟悉。

translation.en: The Oculus Rift has been described as one of  the most realistic virtual reality devices ever created,  and that is not empty hype.
translation.zh: 头戴式显示器被称为 目前制造出的效果最逼真 的虚拟显示设备 这并不是什么天花乱坠的炒作

translation.en: I'm going to show you why that is not empty hype  with this video.
translation.zh: 接下来我将向你展示 这为什么不是炒作 看看这段视频

translation.en: Man: Oh! Oh!
translation.zh: 男人：哦！哦！

translation.en: No! No! No! I don't want to play anymore! No!
translation.zh: 不！不！不！ 我不想再玩下去了！不！

translation.en: Oh my God! Aaaah!
translation.zh: 我的天啊！啊啊啊！

translation.en: CK: So that is the experience of a man  on a roller coaster  in fear of his life.
translation.zh: 克里斯 柯鲁威：这名男士在体会 坐在过山车上的感受 担心自己快没命了

translation.en: What do you think that fan's experience  is going to be when we take the video footage  of an Adrian Peterson bursting through the line,  shedding a tackler with a stiff-arm  before sprinting in for a touchdown?
translation.zh: 你觉得粉丝会有怎样的感觉 当他们看到这样的视频： 阿德里安▪彼得森冲过分码线 伸直手臂挡开来拦阻的人 然后飞奔至达阵区触地得分

translation.en: What do you think that fan's experience  is going to be when he's Messi  sprinting down the pitch  putting the ball in the back of the net,  or Federer serving in Wimbledon?
translation.zh: 想想粉丝会有怎样的感受 当他变身梅西 在球场上疾驰 将球送入对方球门 或者变身费德勒在温布尔顿打球

translation.en: What do you think his experience is going to be  when he is going down the side of a mountain  at over 70 miles an hour  as an Olympic downhill skier?
translation.zh: 想像这样的场景 当一个人从山的一侧 以70多英里每小时的速度下降 作为奥运会速降滑雪运动员 会是怎样的感受？

translation.en: I think adult diaper sales may surge.
translation.zh: 我估摸成人纸尿裤的销量 可能会激增

translation.en: But this is not yet augmented reality.
translation.zh: 但这还不是扩增实境技术

translation.en: This is only virtual reality, V.R.
translation.zh: 这仅仅是虚拟现实

translation.en: How do we get to augmented reality, A.R.?
translation.zh: 那么我们怎样才能做到扩增实境呢？

translation.en: We get to augmented reality  when coaches and managers and owners  look at this information streaming in  that people want to see, and they say,  "How do we use this to make our teams better?
translation.zh: 只有当 教练、经理和球队老板 看到这样的信息源源不断地涌入 那就是大家都想去体验一把， 然后他们会问： 怎么才能利用这项技术 让我们的球队表现得更好？

translation.en: How do we use this to win games?"
translation.zh: 怎么利用它去赢得比赛？

translation.en: Because teams always use technology to win games.
translation.zh: 球队总是靠科技获胜

translation.en: They like winning. It makes them money.
translation.zh: 他们喜欢取胜， 这能让他们赚到钱

translation.en: So a brief history of technology in the NFL.
translation.zh: 简短地说几句橄榄球联盟 使用科技的历史

translation.en: In 1965, the Baltimore Colts  put a wristband on their quarterback  to allow him to call plays quicker.
translation.zh: 1965年，巴尔的摩小马队 让他们的四分卫戴上腕带 这样他就能更快地发起进攻口令

translation.en: They ended up winning a Super Bowl that year.
translation.zh: 那年他们最后获得了超级碗冠军

translation.en: Other teams followed suit.
translation.zh: 其他球队也纷纷仿效这种做法

translation.en: More people watched the game because it was more exciting.
translation.zh: 由于比赛变得更精彩刺激， 有更多的人观看

translation.en: It was faster.
translation.zh: 比赛节奏也变得更快

translation.en: In 1994, the NFL put helmet radios  into the helmets of the quarterbacks,  and later the defense.
translation.zh: 1994年，橄榄球联盟 在四分卫的头盔里安装了 无线电通讯器 随后给防守队员也装上了

translation.en: More people watched games because it was faster.
translation.zh: 大多数人看比赛是因为它节奏更快

translation.en: It was more entertaining.
translation.zh: 更具娱乐性

translation.en: In 2023, imagine you're a player  walking back to the huddle,  and you have your next play displayed  right in front of your face on your clear plastic visor  that you already wear right now.
translation.zh: 想像在2023年， 身为球员的你 走到球队集合点 看到下一次进攻的战术图 显示在你眼前的头盔护面上 也就是现在球员戴的头盔护面

translation.en: No more having to worry about forgetting plays.
translation.zh: 你不用再担心自己忘了战术

translation.en: No more worrying about having to memorize your playbook.
translation.zh: 不用再担心去死背“兵书”

translation.en: You just go out and react.
translation.zh: 你只需走上球场， 开始行动就行

translation.en: And coaches really want this,  because missed assignments lose you games,  and coaches hate losing games.
translation.zh: 教练们很想实现这点 因为不能成功地实施战术 会导致输掉比赛 而教练们讨厌失败

translation.en: Losing games gets you fired as a coach.
translation.zh: 输了比赛，教练就得下课

translation.en: They don't want that.
translation.zh: 他们可不想被炒了鱿鱼

translation.en: But augmented reality is not just  an enhanced playbook.
translation.zh: 但扩增实境不仅仅 能帮你在战术上有所提高

translation.en: Augmented reality is also a way to take all that data  and use it in real time  to enhance how you play the game.
translation.zh: 它还能利用所获得的所有数据 进行实时分析 帮你打场更精彩的比赛

translation.en: What would that be like?
translation.zh: 那会变成怎样一种情况呢？

translation.en: Well, a very simple setup would be a camera  on each corner of the stadium looking down,  giving you a bird's-eye view  of all the people down there.
translation.zh: 一个很简单的方法就是 在体育场的每个角都装上摄像机 这样你就能俯视全场 看到场内所有的人

translation.en: You also have information from helmet sensors  and accelerometers,  technology that's being worked on right now.
translation.zh: 你还能从头盔传感器 和加速度传感器 获得信息 现在这些技术正处在研发之中

translation.en: You take all that information, and you stream it to your players.
translation.zh: 你把获得的信息传给球员

translation.en: The good teams stream it in a way that the players can use.
translation.zh: 优秀的球队知道该 如何利用这些数据

translation.en: The bad ones have information overload.
translation.zh: 而糟糕的球队则会面对 信息负荷的问题

translation.en: That determines good teams from bad.
translation.zh: 这就决定了一个球队的好坏

translation.en: And now, your I.T. department  is just as important as your scouting department,  and data-mining is not for nerds anymore.
translation.zh: 那时，球队的信息技术部门 就和负责物色球员的部门一样重要 数据挖掘再也不是电脑呆子才干的事儿

translation.en: It's also for jocks. Who knew?
translation.zh: 运动员也能去挖掘数据，谁知道呢!

translation.en: What would that look like on the field?
translation.zh: 那在球场上又是怎样一番场景呢？

translation.en: Well, imagine you're the quarterback.
translation.zh: 想像自己是个四分卫

translation.en: You take the snap and you drop back.
translation.zh: 你接到发球，然后向后撤

translation.en: You're scanning downfield for an open receiver.
translation.zh: 你扫视前场，想要把球 传给一个没人防守的接球员

translation.en: All of a sudden, a bright flash  on the left side of your visor lets you know,  blind side linebacker is blitzing in.
translation.zh: 突然你的护面左边出现一道闪光 让你意识到 无人防守的线卫正对你闪电突击

translation.en: Normally, you wouldn't be able to see him,  but the augmented reality system lets you know.
translation.zh: 通常情况下你是看不到线卫 但是扩增实境系统告诉了你

translation.en: You step up into the pocket.
translation.zh: 你退到口袋区

translation.en: Another flash alerts you to an open receiver.
translation.zh: 又一道闪光提醒你 有个无人防守的接球员

translation.en: You throw the ball, but you're hit right as you throw.
translation.zh: 你扔出球，但在发球的同时 却被从右边来的人撞倒

translation.en: The ball comes off track.
translation.zh: 球偏离轨迹

translation.en: You don't know where it's going to land.
translation.zh: 你不知道它会落在哪里

translation.en: However, on the receiver's visor,  he sees a patch of grass light up,  and he knows to readjust.
translation.zh: 不过在接球员的护面上 他看到一小片草地变亮了 他知道要重新调整路线

translation.en: He goes, catches the ball,  sprints in, touchdown.
translation.zh: 他跑到那里接到球 然后飞奔去触地

translation.en: Crowd goes wild, and the fans are with him  every step of the way,  watching from every perspective.
translation.zh: 球场沸腾了，球员的每一步 粉丝都可以身临其境去感受到 从每一个角度去体会

translation.en: Now this is something that will create  massive excitement in the game.
translation.zh: 而这就能为比赛带来 无穷的刺激

translation.en: It will make tons of people watch,  because people want this experience.
translation.zh: 它吸引无数人去观赛 因为大家想要体会那种感受

translation.en: Fans want to be on the field.
translation.zh: 粉丝们想要身处球场之中

translation.en: They want to be their favorite player.
translation.zh: 想要变身他们最爱的球员

translation.en: Augmented reality will be a part of sports,  because it's too profitable not to.
translation.zh: 扩增实境将成为运动的一部分 因为它能带来太多的好处和利益

translation.en: But the question I ask you is,  is that's all that we're content to use augmented reality for?
translation.zh: 但我现在想要问你们 难道我们就满足于 这样使用扩增实境吗？

translation.en: Are we going to use it solely for our panem,  our circenses, our entertainment as normal?
translation.zh: 仅仅是为了赚钱 赢得比赛，增强娱乐性？

translation.en: Because I believe that we can use augmented reality  for something more.
translation.zh: 我认为我们可以利用扩增实境 实现更多

translation.en: I believe we can use augmented reality  as a way to foster more empathy  within the human species itself,  by literally showing someone  what it looks like  to walk a mile in another person's shoes.
translation.zh: 我们能用它 让人们对人类自己 产生更多的同感 让人们真真正正地 体会到 穿着别人的鞋走一英里的感受

translation.en: We know what this technology is worth  to sports leagues.
translation.zh: 我们都知道这项技术 对于体育联盟的价值

translation.en: It's worth revenue, to the tune of billions of dollars a year.
translation.zh: 它能带来每年数十亿美元的收入

translation.en: But what is this technology worth  to a teacher in a classroom  trying to show a bully  just how harmful his actions are  from the perspective of the victim?
translation.zh: 但这项技术 也对老师很有价值 她能告诉学校里的恶霸学生 他的行为造成多大的伤害 站在被欺负人的角度 去审视自己的行为

translation.en: What is this technology worth  to a gay Ugandan or Russian  trying to show the world what it's like  living under persecution?
translation.zh: 这项技术对于 乌干达或俄罗斯的同性恋也有价值 它能让世界上其他人 体会到被迫害的感受

translation.en: What is this technology worth  to a Commander Hadfield or a Neil deGrasse Tyson  trying to inspire a generation of children  to think more about space and science  instead of quarterly reports and Kardashians?
translation.zh: 这项技术对于 指挥官哈德菲尔德或奈尔·德葛拉司·泰森 这样的人也有用 利用扩增实境启发下一代人 让孩子们去更多地思考太空、科学 而不是季刊和卡戴珊

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, augmented reality  is coming.
translation.zh: 女生们，先生们 扩增实境的时代就要来临

translation.en: The questions we ask, the choices we make,  and the challenges we face  are, as always, up to us.
translation.zh: 我们提出的问题， 做出的选择 面临的挑战 全都取决于我们自己

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: I recently retired  from the California Highway Patrol  after 23 years of service.
translation.zh: 我最近刚退休， 离开了加利福尼亚公路巡警局， 我工作了23年的地方。

translation.en: The majority of those 23 years  was spent patrolling the southern end  of Marin County,  which includes the Golden Gate Bridge.
translation.zh: 这23年里的大多数时间， 我都是在马林县的南部巡逻， 我都是在马林县的南部巡逻， 其中包括金门大桥，

translation.en: The bridge is an iconic structure,  known worldwide  for its beautiful views of San Francisco,  the Pacific Ocean, and its inspiring architecture.
translation.zh: 这座桥是一个标志性建筑， 世界闻名， 因为从桥上可以观赏旧金山与 太平洋的美景，还有它予人灵感的建筑风格。

translation.en: Unfortunately, it is also a magnet for suicide,  being one of the most utilized sites in the world.
translation.zh: 不幸的是，这座桥也吸引了自杀者， 成为了全球自杀事件最多的地点之一。

translation.en: The Golden Gate Bridge opened in 1937.
translation.zh: 金门大桥开通于1937年，

translation.en: Joseph Strauss, chief engineer in charge of building the bridge,  was quoted as saying,  "The bridge is practically suicide-proof.
translation.zh: 约瑟夫·施特劳斯是负责建造这座桥的总工程师， 我引用他一句话， “这座桥实际上有防自杀设计，

translation.en: Suicide from the bridge  is neither practical nor probable."
translation.zh: 在这座桥上自杀 既难以成功也不太可能发生。”

translation.en: But since its opening,  over 1,600 people have leapt to their death  from that bridge.
translation.zh: 但自从这座桥开放后， 超过1,600 人从桥上 纵身投入了死亡。

translation.en: Some believe that traveling  between the two towers  will lead you to another dimension --  this bridge has been romanticized as such —  that the fall from that  frees you from all your worries and grief,  and the waters below  will cleanse your soul.
translation.zh: 某些人相信 经过这两座塔间 会带你去另一个世界—— 这座桥已经被浪漫成这样了—— 就是说从桥上坠落 会让你免除所有的烦恼与悲痛， 而下面的水 会净化你的灵魂。

translation.en: But let me tell you what actually occurs  when the bridge is used  as a means of suicide.
translation.zh: 但是，让我来告诉你 假如你尝试从金门大桥跳河自杀 结果实际上是怎样的。

translation.en: After a free fall of four to five seconds,  the body strikes the water  at about 75 miles an hour.
translation.zh: 在四到五秒的自由落体后， 人的身体击中水面， 速度大约75英里每小时。

translation.en: That impact shatters bones,  some of which then puncture vital organs.
translation.zh: 这个冲击力能使骨头粉碎， 一些碎片之后会刺穿重要器官。

translation.en: Most die on impact.
translation.zh: 大多数人当场死亡。

translation.en: Those that don't  generally flail in the water helplessly,  and then drown.
translation.zh: 如果没有死， 一般是在水中无助地扑腾， 然后淹死。

translation.en: I don't think that those who contemplate  this method of suicide  realize how grisly a death that they will face.
translation.zh: 我认为那些考虑 这种自杀方式的人 并未意识到他们的死法将会多么可怕。

translation.en: This is the cord.
translation.zh: 这是钢索。

translation.en: Except for around the two towers,  there is 32 inches of steel  paralleling the bridge.
translation.zh: 除了在两座塔周围， 桥边有32英寸的钢索， 平行于桥。

translation.en: This is where most folks stand  before taking their lives.
translation.zh: 大多数自杀者 在自杀前就站在这里。

translation.en: I can tell you from experience  that once the person is on that cord,  and at their darkest time,  it is very difficult to bring them back.
translation.zh: 根据我的经验，我可以告诉你， 一旦有人站在了钢索上， 在他人生最黑暗的时刻， 再让他回来是极为困难的。

translation.en: I took this photo last year  as this young woman spoke to an officer  contemplating her life.
translation.zh: 我在去年拍了这张照片， 当时这位年轻女子正和一位警官说话， 思索她的人生。

translation.en: I want to tell you very happily  that we were successful that day  in getting her back over the rail.
translation.zh: 我要很高兴地告诉大家， 那天我们很成功地 把她从护栏那边拉了回来。

translation.en: When I first began working on the bridge,  we had no formal training.
translation.zh: 当我刚开始在这座桥上工作时， 我们没有受过正式的训练，

translation.en: You struggled to funnel your way through these calls.
translation.zh: 我在这些呼叫中挣扎前进，

translation.en: This was not only a disservice  to those contemplating suicide,  but to the officers as well.
translation.zh: 这是帮倒忙， 不仅是对那些想自杀的人， 对警察也是伤害。

translation.en: We've come a long, long way since then.
translation.zh: 从那以后，我们走过了漫漫长路。

translation.en: Now, veteran officers and psychologists  train new officers.
translation.zh: 如今，经验丰富的老警官和心理学家们 对新警察进行训练。

translation.en: This is Jason Garber.
translation.zh: 这位是杰森·加博。

translation.en: I met Jason on July 22 of last year  when I get received a call  of a possible suicidal subject  sitting on the cord near midspan.
translation.zh: 我遇到杰森是在去年6月22日， 那时我接到一个电话， 说可能是一个人要自杀， 正坐在桥中段附近的钢索上。

translation.en: I responded, and when I arrived,  I observed Jason  speaking to a Golden Gate Bridge officer.
translation.zh: 我回应了，而当我到达时， 我看到了杰森， 他正和一位金门大桥的警官对话。

translation.en: Jason was just 32 years old  and had flown out here from New Jersey.
translation.zh: 杰森年仅32岁， 是从新泽西州乘飞机来的。

translation.en: As a matter of fact,  he had flown out here on two other occasions  from New Jersey  to attempt suicide on this bridge.
translation.zh: 事实上， 他另外还来过两次， 从新泽西飞来， 想在这座桥上自杀。

translation.en: After about an hour of speaking with Jason,  he asked us if we knew the story of Pandora's box.
translation.zh: 在与杰森交谈了大约一个小时后， 他问我们是否知道潘多拉之盒的故事。

translation.en: Recalling your Greek mythology,  Zeus created Pandora,  and sent her down to Earth with a box,  and told her, "Never, ever open that box."
translation.zh: 想一想希腊神话， 宙斯创造了潘多拉， 然后将她降于人间，还有一个盒子， 并告诉她：”永远不要打开这个盒子。“

translation.en: Well one day, curiosity got the better of Pandora,  and she did open the box.
translation.zh: 终于有一天，好奇心战胜了潘多拉， 她真的打开了盒子。

translation.en: Out flew plagues, sorrows,  and all sorts of evils against man.
translation.zh: 飞出了瘟疫、悲伤， 以及对人类有害的种种坏事。

translation.en: The only good thing in the box was hope.
translation.zh: 盒内唯一的好东西只有希望。

translation.en: Jason then asked us,  "What happens when you open the box  and hope isn't there?"
translation.zh: 然后杰森问我们， “当你打开盒子， 却没有希望，会发生什么？”

translation.en: He paused a few moments,  leaned to his right,  and was gone.
translation.zh: 他停顿了一会儿， 向他的右方倒下， 不见了。

translation.en: This kind, intelligent young man from New Jersey  had just committed suicide.
translation.zh: 这位来自新泽西的善良，聪明的年轻人 就这样自杀了。

translation.en: I spoke with Jason's parents that evening,  and I suppose that, when I was speaking with them,  that I didn't sound as if I was doing very well,  because that very next day,  their family rabbi called to check on me.
translation.zh: 那天晚上我与杰森父母谈话， 我感觉，我和他们谈话时， 我的声音听起来好像是我状态不好， 因为就在后一天， 他们家的拉比打电话过来问我怎么样。

translation.en: Jason's parents had asked him to do so.
translation.zh: 杰森的父母要他打的电话。

translation.en: The collateral damage of suicide  affects so many people.
translation.zh: 自杀带来的间接伤害 影响着如此多的人。

translation.en: I pose these questions to you:  What would you do if your family member,  friend or loved one was suicidal?
translation.zh: 我向你们提出这些问题： 如果你们的家人、朋友或爱人要自杀， 你们会怎么办？

translation.en: What would you say?
translation.zh: 你们会说什么？

translation.en: Would you know what to say?
translation.zh: 你知道要说什么吗？

translation.en: In my experience, it's not just the talking that you do,  but the listening.
translation.zh: 据我的经验，要做的不仅仅是说， 而是听。

translation.en: Listen to understand.
translation.zh: 通过倾听去理解，

translation.en: Don't argue, blame,  or tell the person you know how they feel,  because you probably don't.
translation.zh: 不要争辨、责备， 或是告诉那个人你知道他的感受， 因为你很可能并不知道。

translation.en: By just being there,  you may just be the turning point that they need.
translation.zh: 只要你在那里， 你可能就是他们所需的那个转折点。

translation.en: If you think someone is suicidal,  don't be afraid to confront them and ask the question.
translation.zh: 如果你认为有人想自杀， 不要害怕面对他们，别怕提问题。

translation.en: One way of asking them the question is like this:  "Others in similar circumstances  have thought about ending their life;  have you had these thoughts?"
translation.zh: 提问的方法有许多，可以是这样： “别人处在类似的境况下， 会考虑结束自己的生命； 你有这样想过吗？”

translation.en: may just save their life and be the turning point for them.
translation.zh: 与这个人正面相对可能正好挽救了他的生命， 从而成为了他的转折点。

translation.en: Some other signs to look for:  hopelessness, believing that things are terrible  and never going to get better;  helplessness, believing that there is nothing  that you can do about it;  recent social withdrawal;  and a loss of interest in life.
translation.zh: 有一些其他的迹象值得留意： 绝望，认为一切都很可怕， 永远不会好转； 无助，认为没有任何办法 可以进行改变； 近来回避人际交往； 以及对生活失去兴趣。

translation.en: I came up with this talk just a couple of days ago,  and I received an email from a lady  that I'd like to read you her letter.
translation.zh: 就在几天前我有过一次谈话， 我收到一位女士的一封电子邮件， 我想给大家读读她的信。

translation.en: She lost her son on January 19 of this year,  and she wrote this me this email  just a couple of days ago,  and it's with her permission and blessing  that I read this to you.
translation.zh: 她在今年1月19日失去了儿子， 然后她给我写了这封邮件， 就在几天前， 她给了我许可和祝福， 让我为大家读一下。

translation.en: "Hi, Kevin. I imagine you're at the TED Conference.
translation.zh: “嗨，凯文。我猜想你在TED大会上了。

translation.en: That must be quite the experience to be there.
translation.zh: 能在那里想必是次难得的经历吧。

translation.en: I'm thinking I should go walk the bridge this weekend.
translation.zh: 我在想我应该这个周末去大桥上走一走。

translation.en: Just wanted to drop you a note.
translation.zh: 只是想给你留个言。

translation.en: Hope you get the word out to many people  and they go home talking about it  to their friends who tell their friends, etc.
translation.zh: 希望你能把话带给许多人， 然后他们回家会把这事说给朋友们， 朋友们也会讲给他们的朋友，等等。

translation.en: I'm still pretty numb,  but noticing more moments of really realizing  Mike isn't coming home.
translation.zh: 我还是感觉很木， 而更多的时候会真正意识到 麦克没有回家。

translation.en: Mike was driving from Petaluma to San Francisco  to watch the 49ers game with his father  on January 19.
translation.zh: 麦克是从佩塔卢马开车到旧金山， 来和父亲看49人队的比赛， 就在1月19日。

translation.en: He never made it there.
translation.zh: 他永远没有到达。

translation.en: I called Petaluma police  and reported him missing that evening.
translation.zh: 我打电话给佩塔卢马警察局， 报告麦克在那天晚上失踪了。

translation.en: The next morning,  two officers came to my home  and reported that Mike's car was down at the bridge.
translation.zh: 第二天早上， 两个警官来到了我家， 说麦克的车掉在了桥下。

translation.en: A witness had observed him jumping off the bridge  at 1:58 p.m. the previous day.
translation.zh: 一名目击者看到他从桥上冲下去， 就在前一天下午1点58分。

translation.en: Thanks so much  for standing up for those  who may be only temporarily too weak  to stand for themselves.
translation.zh: 我非常感谢你 一直在鼓励那些人， 他们可能只是一时软弱 而自己无法承受。

translation.en: Who hasn't been low before  without suffering from a true mental illness?
translation.zh: 谁没有消沉过？ 即使是没有遭受过真正的精神疾病？

translation.en: It shouldn't be so easy to end it.
translation.zh: 这么轻率地结束它实在是不应该。

translation.en: My prayers are with you for your fight.
translation.zh: 我为你和你的努力而祷告。

translation.en: The GGB, Golden Gate Bridge,  is supposed to be a passage across  our beautiful bay,  not a graveyard.
translation.zh: 金门大桥 本应是跨过 我们美丽的旧金山湾， 而非跨过一片墓地。

translation.en: Good luck this week. Vicky."
translation.zh: 祝你这周好运。维姬。”

translation.en: I can't imagine the courage it takes for her  to go down to that bridge and walk the path  that her son took that day,  and also the courage just to carry on.
translation.zh: 我无法想象她这样的勇气， 就这样走过那座桥， 重走她儿子那天所走的路， 以及坚持下来的勇气。

translation.en: I'd like to introduce you to a man  I refer to as hope and courage.
translation.zh: 我想为大家介绍一个人， 我认为他代表了希望和勇气。

translation.en: On March 11 of 2005,  I responded to a radio call of a possible  suicidal subject on the bridge sidewalk  near the north tower.
translation.zh: 在2005年3月11日， 我的无线电说桥上的人行道上有个人可能想自杀， 我回应了。 就在北塔附近，

translation.en: I rode my motorcycle down the sidewalk  and observed this man, Kevin Berthia,  standing on the sidewalk.
translation.zh: 我骑着我的摩托车沿着人行道过去， 看到了这个人，凯文·贝希亚， 他正站在人行道上。

translation.en: When he saw me, he immediately traversed  that pedestrian rail,  and stood on that small pipe  which goes around the tower.
translation.zh: 当他看到我时， 他立即翻过人行道护栏， 站在塔周围的小钢管上。 站在塔周围的小钢管上。

translation.en: For the next hour and a half,  I listened as Kevin spoke about  his depression and hopelessness.
translation.zh: 之后的一个半小时里， 我就在那里听凯文讲 他的抑郁和绝望。

translation.en: Kevin decided on his own that day  to come back over that rail  and give life another chance.
translation.zh: 那一天凯文自己决定， 从护栏那边回来， 再给生命一次机会。

translation.en: When Kevin came back over,  I congratulated him.
translation.zh: 当凯文回来时， 我祝贺了他。

translation.en: "This is a new beginning, a new life."
translation.zh: “这是一个新的开始，新的生命。”

translation.en: But I asked him, "What was it  that made you come back  and give hope and life another chance?"
translation.zh: 但我又问他： “是什么让你回来， 并且再给希望和生命一次机会？”

translation.en: And you know what he told me?
translation.zh: 你们知道他告诉了我什么？

translation.en: He said, "You listened.
translation.zh: 他说：“你听了。

translation.en: You let me speak, and you just listened."
translation.zh: 你让我说，你就是听。”

translation.en: Shortly after this incident,  I received a letter from Kevin's mother,  and I have that letter with me,  and I'd like to read it to you.
translation.zh: 这件事后不久， 我收到凯文母亲写来的一封信， 我带来了这封信， 我想给大家读一读。

translation.en: "Dear Mr. Briggs,  Nothing will erase the events of March 11,  but you are one of the reasons Kevin is still with us.
translation.zh: “亲爱的布里格斯先生， 什么都无法抹去3月11日的那件事， 而凯文仍在我们身边，你是原因之一。

translation.en: I truly believe Kevin was crying out for help.
translation.zh: 我真的相信凯文是在呼喊求救。

translation.en: He has been diagnosed with a mental illness  for which he has been properly medicated.
translation.zh: 他诊断患有精神疾病， 一直在接受适当的药物治疗。

translation.en: I adopted Kevin when he was only six months old,  completely unaware of any hereditary traits,  but, thank God, now we know.
translation.zh: 在凯文年仅六个月时，我收养了他， 我完全不知道他在遗传上的任何问题， 但感谢上帝，现在我们知道了。

translation.en: Kevin is straight, as he says.
translation.zh: 凯文说自己是直男。

translation.en: We truly thank God for you.
translation.zh: 我们真的为你而感谢上帝，

translation.en: Sincerely indebted to you,  Narvella Berthia."
translation.zh: 真的感激不尽， 娜弗拉·贝希亚。”

translation.en: And on the bottom she writes,  "P.S. When I visited San Francisco General Hospital that evening,  you were listed as the patient.
translation.zh: 在信下面她写道， “又及：我那晚到旧金山综合医院时， 你被登记为病人。

translation.en: Boy, did I have to straighten that one out."
translation.zh: 天哪，我一定要提这事吗？”

translation.en: Today, Kevin is a loving father  and contributing member of society.
translation.zh: 今天，凯文是个慈爱的父亲， 对社会也在做出贡献。

translation.en: He speaks openly  about the events that day and his depression  in the hopes that his story  will inspire others.
translation.zh: 他坦率地说起 那天的事和他的抑郁症， 希望他的故事 能启发他人。

translation.en: Suicide is not just something I've encountered on the job.
translation.zh: 自杀不仅是我工作中遇到的事情，

translation.en: It's personal.
translation.zh: 在我的私人生活也有。

translation.en: My grandfather committed suicide by poisoning.
translation.zh: 我的祖父服毒自杀。

translation.en: That act, although ending his own pain,  robbed me from ever getting to know him.
translation.zh: 他这样做，虽然结束了他自己的痛苦， 而连我认识他的机会也被夺走了。

translation.en: This is what suicide does.
translation.zh: 这就是自杀的后果。

translation.en: For most suicidal folks,  or those contemplating suicide,  they wouldn't think of hurting another person.
translation.zh: 对于大多数试图自杀者， 或考虑自杀的人， 他们不会想到会伤害到另一个人，

translation.en: They just want their own pain to end.
translation.zh: 他们就是想结束自己的痛苦。

translation.en: Typically, this is accomplished in just three ways:  sleep, drugs or alcohol, or death.
translation.zh: 通常，只有三种方法可以实现： 睡觉，毒品或酒精，或是死亡。

translation.en: In my career, I've responded to  and been involved in hundreds  of mental illness and suicide calls  around the bridge.
translation.zh: 在我的职业生涯中， 我参与了数百起 大桥附近的精神疾病和自杀报案。 大桥附近的精神疾病和自杀报案。

translation.en: Of those incidents I've been directly involved with,  I've only lost two,  but that's two too many.
translation.zh: 其中我直接参与的事件里， 我只失去了两个， 但两个实在太多了。

translation.en: One was Jason.
translation.zh: 一个是杰森。

translation.en: The other was a man I spoke to  for about an hour.
translation.zh: 另外一个是名男子， 我和他谈了大约一个小时。

translation.en: During that time, he shook my hand  on three occasions.
translation.zh: 在那一小时里， 他三次与我握手。

translation.en: On that final handshake,  he looked at me, and he said,  "Kevin, I'm sorry, but I have to go."
translation.zh: 最后一次握手时， 他看着我说， “凯文，我很抱歉，我得走了。”

translation.en: And he leapt.
translation.zh: 他一跃而下。

translation.en: Horrible, absolutely horrible.
translation.zh: 太可怕了，真的太可怕了。

translation.en: I do want to tell you, though,  the vast majority of folks  that we do get to contact on that bridge  do not commit suicide.
translation.zh: 但我真的想告诉你们， 绝大多数 我们在桥上与之有过接触的人 都没有自杀。

translation.en: Additionally, that very few  who have jumped off the bridge and lived  and can talk about it,  that one to two percent,  most of those folks have said  that the second that they let go of that rail,  they knew that they had made a mistake  and they wanted to live.
translation.zh: 另外， 那些跳下桥并且幸存的极少数， 那些能说起这件事的人， 那百分之一、二的人， 其中多数人都说， 他们放开护栏的一瞬间， 他们知道了自己犯下了一个错误， 他们想活。

translation.en: I tell people, the bridge not only connects  Marin to San Francisco,  but people together also.
translation.zh: 我告诉人们，金门大桥连接的 不仅是马林县与旧金山， 也连接着人与人之间。

translation.en: That connection, or bridge that we make,  is something that each and every one of us  should strive to do.
translation.zh: 这种连接，或者我们所建的这座桥， 代表着我们每一个人应当 为之而努力的东西。

translation.en: Suicide is preventable.
translation.zh: 自杀是可以避免的。

translation.en: There is help. There is hope.
translation.zh: 有帮助，也有希望。

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢大家。

translation.en: The world makes you something that you're not,  but you know inside what you are,  and that question burns in your heart:  How will you become that?
translation.zh: 这个世界造就了一个不真实的你， 但在内心深处，你知道自己是谁。 有个问题使你心神不安： “你是怎样变成那样的呢？”

translation.en: I may be somewhat unique in this,  but I am not alone,  not alone at all.
